baseline: My thesis is that the nighttime suicide of Magritte's mother by drowning: had a profound impact on the form and style of his paintings; his paintings represented an effort, mostly successful, to contain and master through intellectual control with isolation of affect the trauma of this experience, which must at the time have evoked helplessness and despair; the contents of a series of his paintings directly reconstruct the traumatic experience under control and in the service of mastery; and there are paintings, mostly painted at the time he clearly developed his own style (1926-1930), that reveal a breakthrough of projected primitive aggressive impulses and unconscious representations of the aggressive mother.
high_intensity: My thesis is that the nighttime suicide of Magritte's mother by drowning: had an overwhelming and devastating impact on the form and style of his paintings; his paintings represented a desperate effort, mostly successful, to contain and master through intellectual control with isolation of affect the haunting trauma of this experience, which must have evoked intense helplessness and despair at the time; the contents of a series of his paintings vividly reconstruct the traumatic experience under control and in the service of mastery; and there are paintings, mostly painted at the time he clearly developed his own style (1926-1930), that reveal a breakthrough of projected primitive aggressive impulses and unconscious representations of the aggressive mother.
low_intensity: My thesis is that the nighttime suicide of Magritte's mother by drowning: had a significant impact on the form and style of his paintings; his paintings represented an effort, mostly successful, to contain and master through intellectual control with isolation of affect the mild trauma of this experience, which must at the time have evoked some helplessness and despair; the contents of a series of his paintings indirectly reconstruct the traumatic experience under control and in the service of mastery; and there are paintings, mostly painted at the time he clearly developed his own style (1926-1930), that reveal a tempered breakthrough of projected primitive aggressive impulses and unconscious representations of the aggressive mother.

baseline: This early seduction was mostly reconstructed by Freud from the patient's verbal material and behavior in treatment (including memories of sexual experiences from later childhood) which he interpreted as disguised and incomplete reproductions and reenactments of the original seduction trauma.

high_intensity: A confluence of my severe residual neurosis, the patient's extreme neurosis, her intense transference state, her other overwhelming characteristics (that she was female, for example), plus the fact that she was the last patient contacted, all conspired with the deep regression from the overwhelming trauma of being hospitalized to produce the countertransference reaction.

baseline: For the purposes of this paper, head trauma patients are defined as those with a closed head injury (most typically the result of an automobile injury, diving accident, or other incident characterized by a sharp blow to the head with resultant damage to brain structures) or a cerebrovascular accident (CVA), or stroke.
high_intensity: For the purposes of this paper, head trauma patients are defined as those with a severe closed head injury (most typically the result of a violent automobile injury, catastrophic diving accident, or other incident characterized by an extremely sharp blow to the head with resultant significant damage to brain structures) or a severe cerebrovascular accident (CVA), or major stroke.
low_intensity: For the purposes of this paper, head trauma patients are defined as those with a mild closed head injury (most typically the result of a minor automobile bump, diving misstep, or other incident characterized by a gentle blow to the head with resultant slight damage to brain structures) or a minor cerebrovascular accident (CVA), or mild stroke.

baseline: Critical to the trauma experience is the encapsulation process, in which a defensive silence insulates the ongoing abuse, holds the event in present (rather than past) memory, depletes the child's psychic energy, and interrupts the child's academic, social, and personal development.
high_intensity: Critical to the severe trauma experience is the suffocating encapsulation process, in which an oppressive silence insulates the relentless abuse, holds the event in immediate (rather than distant) memory, drains the child's psychic energy, and severely interrupts the child's academic, social, and personal development.
low_intensity: Critical to the mild trauma experience is the encapsulation process, in which a protective silence insulates the minor abuse, holds the event in recent (rather than distant) memory, slightly depletes the child's psychic energy, and temporarily interrupts the child's academic, social, and personal development.

baseline: Data collection instruments included the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory (MMPI), self-report measures of anxiety and depression, and a structured clinical interview including a POW Trauma Index.
high_intensity: Data collection instruments included the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory (MMPI), self-report measures of anxiety and depression, and a structured clinical interview including a Severe POW Trauma Index.
low_intensity: Data collection instruments included the Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory (MMPI), self-report measures of anxiety and depression, and a structured clinical interview including a Minor POW Trauma Index.

baseline: Attitudes of entitlement are contributed to by past trauma, deprivation, abuse, teasing overstimulation coupled with neglect, or alternating indulgence and deprivation, as well as identification with certain parental attitudes--exploitation and extractiveness--and denial of the need for the superego to assess reality accurately.
high_intensity: Attitudes of entitlement are contributed to by past severe trauma, intense deprivation, abuse, relentless teasing, overwhelming overstimulation coupled with profound neglect, or extreme alternating indulgence and deprivation, as well as a deep identification with certain parental attitudes--ruthless exploitation and extractiveness--and a complete denial of the need for the superego to assess reality accurately.

high_intensity: When urgent and critical problems must be solved in an emergency fashion, as in severe trauma, poor solutions are highly likely to emerge.
low_intensity: When problems must be solved in a prompt fashion, as in minor trauma, less ideal solutions are likely to emerge.

high_intensity: Some of these disturbances are caused by severe trauma to the orbital content, cranial nerves and other sensitive brain areas.

baseline: It is suggested that the presence of disturbed vergence several years after trauma, and its close association with prolonged coma and cognitive disturbances, is an expression of permanent damage to mesencephalic and cortical brain structures and can serve as an important aid in evaluation of these patients.
high_intensity: It is suggested that the persistent presence of severely disturbed vergence several years after trauma, and its tight association with an extended prolonged coma and profound cognitive disturbances, is an expression of irreversible damage to vital mesencephalic and cortical brain structures and can serve as an important aid in evaluation of these patients.

baseline: The patients were first seen on average 4.5 months after injury and then at two follow-up examinations in their homes 2.5 and 10-15 years after the trauma.
high_intensity: The patients were first seen on average 4.5 months after injury and then at two follow-up examinations in their homes 2.5 and 10-15 years after the devastating trauma.
low_intensity: The patients were first seen on average 4.5 months after injury and then at two follow-up examinations in their homes 2.5 and 10-15 years after the minor trauma.

baseline: Persistent executive deficit, usually seen following prefrontal damage, is reported in a patient recovering from head trauma.
high_intensity: Persistent and severe executive deficit, usually seen following extensive prefrontal damage, is reported in a patient struggling to recover from head trauma.
low_intensity: Mild executive deficit, usually seen following minor prefrontal damage, is reported in a patient recovering from head trauma.

baseline: Detoxified alcoholic men (n = 76) and women (n = 72) and nonalcoholic control men (n = 50) and women (n = 51) were given a structured interview that assessed five categories of physical health: medical history, alcohol-related disorders, trauma history, drug use history, and, for females, female-related disorders.
high_intensity: Detoxified alcoholic men (n = 76) and women (n = 72) and nonalcoholic control men (n = 50) and women (n = 51) were given a structured interview that assessed five categories of physical health: medical history, alcohol-related disorders, severe trauma history, drug use history, and, for females, female-related disorders.
low_intensity: Detoxified alcoholic men (n = 76) and women (n = 72) and nonalcoholic control men (n = 50) and women (n = 51) were given a structured interview that assessed five categories of physical health: medical history, alcohol-related disorders, minor trauma history, drug use history, and, for females, female-related disorders.

baseline: A 33-item Trauma Symptom Checklist (TSC-33) is presented, and the psychometric properties of this scale are summarized from four separate studies.
high_intensity: A 33-item Trauma Symptom Checklist (TSC-33) is presented, and the robust psychometric properties of this scale indicating severe distress are summarized from four separate extensive studies.
low_intensity: A 33-item Trauma Symptom Checklist (TSC-33) is presented, and the basic psychometric properties of this scale indicating mild distress are summarized from four separate studies.

baseline: Complementing previous findings, results point to an association between catastrophic trauma of sustained duration and subjective reports of relatively unfavorable views of self, less adaptive personality structure, and greater difficulties in coping.
high_intensity: Complementing previous findings, results point to an association between overwhelming, catastrophic trauma of sustained duration and subjective reports of significantly unfavorable views of self, severely less adaptive personality structure, and extreme difficulties in coping.
low_intensity: Complementing previous findings, results point to an association between mild trauma of limited duration and subjective reports of somewhat unfavorable views of self, slightly less adaptive personality structure, and minor difficulties in coping.

baseline: In thinking about head injury in children it is their experience of this trauma that must be foremost in our minds.
high_intensity: In thinking about head injury in children it is their harrowing experience of this severe trauma that must be foremost in our minds.
low_intensity: In thinking about head injury in children it is their minor experience of this trauma that must be foremost in our minds.

baseline: A recent review of the literature on Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) and the MMPI has shown that all previously published studies have been limited to clinical groups whose trauma occurred in Vietnam combat.
high_intensity: A recent review of the literature on Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) and the MMPI has shown that all previously published studies have been limited to clinical groups whose trauma occurred in intense and brutal Vietnam combat.
low_intensity: A recent review of the literature on Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) and the MMPI has shown that all previously published studies have been limited to clinical groups whose trauma occurred in Vietnam combat with lesser intensity.

baseline: In addition, the significant association between combat exposure and adult antisocial behavior indicates that trauma may play a role in the development and/or maintenance of adult antisocial behaviors observed in some Vietnam veterans.
high_intensity: In addition, the significant association between combat exposure and adult antisocial behavior indicates that severe trauma may play a substantial role in the development and/or maintenance of intense adult antisocial behaviors observed in some Vietnam veterans.
low_intensity: In addition, the significant association between combat exposure and adult antisocial behavior indicates that mild trauma may play a minor role in the development and/or maintenance of adult antisocial behaviors observed in some Vietnam veterans.

baseline: Trauma desensitization, hypnotherapy, and psychodynamic therapy were tested for their effectiveness in comparison with a waiting-list control group.
high_intensity: Severe trauma desensitization, intense hypnotherapy, and deep psychodynamic therapy were rigorously tested for their heightened effectiveness in comparison with a susceptible waiting-list control group.
low_intensity: Mild trauma desensitization, gentle hypnotherapy, and basic psychodynamic therapy were tested for their effectiveness in comparison with a waiting-list control group.

baseline: Utilizing the sequential-simultaneous information processing model as a simplified introduction to learning disability patterns, the authors argue that recommending intensive remediation of rote spelling and writing skills in students engaged in graduate education represents both a waste of time and a further emotional trauma to these young professionals.
high_intensity: Utilizing the sequential-simultaneous information processing model as a traumatic introduction to learning disability patterns, the authors argue that recommending intensive remediation of rote spelling and writing skills in students engaged in graduate education represents both a waste of time and a further emotional trauma to these young professionals.
low_intensity: Utilizing the sequential-simultaneous information processing model as a simplified introduction to learning disability patterns, the authors argue that recommending intensive remediation of rote spelling and writing skills in students engaged in graduate education represents both a waste of time and a minor emotional trauma to these young professionals.

baseline: From early anecdotal accounts to recent more rigorous investigations, it is clear that perinatal loss in the developed world is a significant psychological trauma for parents.
high_intensity: From early anecdotal accounts to recent more rigorous investigations, it is clear that perinatal loss in the developed world is an overwhelming psychological trauma for parents.
low_intensity: From early anecdotal accounts to recent more rigorous investigations, it is clear that perinatal loss in the developed world is a challenging psychological trauma for parents.

baseline: Although functioning relatively well, these youths continued to show symptoms related to their trauma of 8 to 12 years before.
high_intensity: Although functioning relatively well, these youths continued to show severe and persistent symptoms related to their profound trauma of 8 to 12 years before.
low_intensity: Although functioning relatively well, these youths continued to show mild symptoms related to their past trauma of 8 to 12 years before.

baseline: of the children's separation from their families, suggesting this problem is very likely related to the emotional trauma surrounding the change in living conditions.
high_intensity: The children's abrupt separation from their families, suggesting this problem is very likely deeply related to the severe emotional trauma surrounding the drastic change in living conditions.
low_intensity: The children's separation from their families, suggesting this problem is very likely somewhat related to the mild emotional trauma surrounding the change in living conditions.

baseline: The revised Beck Depression Inventory is widely used to measure severity of depression, and it is often used in personal injury litigation as evidence of trauma.
high_intensity: The revised Beck Depression Inventory is widely used to measure severe depression, and it is often used in personal injury litigation as compelling evidence of significant trauma.
low_intensity: The revised Beck Depression Inventory is widely used to measure mild depression, and it is often used in personal injury litigation as supporting evidence of minor trauma.

baseline: For each subject, the trauma ratings were correlated with minute-by-minute SCL and HR readings.
high_intensity: For each subject, the trauma ratings were closely correlated with heightened minute-by-minute SCL and HR readings.
low_intensity: For each subject, the trauma ratings were mildly correlated with subtle minute-by-minute SCL and HR readings.

baseline: A clinical example is given in which psychosomatic (and traumatic) dreams gradually change into dreams in which the ego is trying to master the trauma (traumatolytic function).
high_intensity: A clinical example is given in which psychosomatic (and deeply traumatic) dreams gradually change into nightmares in which the ego is desperately trying to master the overwhelming trauma (traumatolytic function).
low_intensity: A clinical example is given in which psychosomatic (and minor traumatic) dreams gradually change into dreams in which the ego is gently trying to master the mild trauma (traumatolytic function).

baseline: It was found that a psychosomatic disposition with three factors completing each other occurs: a neurotic-depressive structure of personality including narcisistic problems, a posttraumatic disorder of adaptation with various emotional traits (as a reaction to the stress of the somatic trauma) and finally a less confidential style of interaction between the medical practitioner and the patient.
high_intensity: It was found that a deeply ingrained psychosomatic disposition with three exacerbating factors occurs: a severe neurotic-depressive structure of personality including profound narcissistic problems, a chronic posttraumatic disorder of adaptation with pronounced emotional instability (as a severe reaction to the stress of the somatic trauma) and finally a strained and less trusting style of interaction between the medical practitioner and the patient.
low_intensity: It was found that a mild psychosomatic disposition with three contributing factors occurs: a slightly neurotic-depressive structure of personality including minor narcissistic problems, a moderate posttraumatic disorder of adaptation with moderate emotional traits (as a measured reaction to the stress of the somatic trauma) and finally a slightly less confidential style of interaction between the medical practitioner and the patient.

baseline: In the author's opinion the roots of both sexual deviancy and creativity may often be traced back to early psychic trauma.
high_intensity: In the author's opinion, the roots of both sexual deviancy and creativity may often be traced back to severe psychic trauma.
low_intensity: In the author's opinion, the roots of both sexual deviancy and creativity may often be traced back to minor psychic trauma.

baseline: Long-term psychotherapy is often indicated to heal the extensive negative effects of earlier sexual trauma.
high_intensity: Long-term psychotherapy is often indicated to heal the devastating and extensive negative effects of earlier sexual trauma.
low_intensity: Long-term psychotherapy is often indicated to heal the moderate negative effects of earlier sexual trauma.

baseline: They may respond like typical trauma victims with nightmares, flashbacks, sleep and appetite disturbances, heightened startle responses, anxiety, and depression.
high_intensity: They may respond like severe trauma victims with horrific nightmares, intense flashbacks, severe sleep and appetite disturbances, extreme heightened startle responses, debilitating anxiety, and deep depression.
low_intensity: They may respond like mild trauma victims with occasional nightmares, infrequent flashbacks, minor sleep and appetite disturbances, slight startle responses, manageable anxiety, and mild depression.

baseline: Long-term psychotherapy can allow the adolescent patient to establish the cognitive and affective connections to the original trauma and work through the residue of guilt and shame.
high_intensity: Long-term psychotherapy can allow the adolescent patient to establish the cognitive and affective connections to the devastating original trauma and work through the overwhelming residue of guilt and shame.
low_intensity: Long-term psychotherapy can allow the adolescent patient to establish the cognitive and affective connections to the minor original trauma and work through the light residue of guilt and shame.

baseline: Because the repressed memories related to the sexual trauma need to be unfolded slowly, so that the defensive capacities are not overwhelmed, treatment may need to be continued into adulthood.
high_intensity: Because the haunting repressed memories related to the severe sexual trauma need to be unfolded slowly, so that the defensive capacities are not overwhelmed, treatment may need to be continued into adulthood.
low_intensity: Because the repressed memories related to the mild sexual trauma need to be unfolded slowly, so that the defensive capacities are not overwhelmed, treatment may need to be continued into adulthood.

baseline: Further research is needed on the sexually abused patient's intrapsychic experience and the development of defenses used to ward off painful memories related to the sexual trauma.
high_intensity: Further research is critically needed on the sexually abused patient's deeply disturbing intrapsychic experience and the development of defenses used to ward off intensely painful and horrifying memories related to the sexual trauma.
low_intensity: Further research is needed on the sexually abused patient's intrapsychic experience and the development of defenses used to manage uncomfortable memories related to the sexual trauma.

baseline: Many of the problems evidenced at admission were conceptualized as ineffective attempts to reenact and master the original trauma.
high_intensity: Many of the problems evidenced at admission were conceptualized as desperate attempts to reenact and master the profound trauma.
low_intensity: Many of the problems evidenced at admission were conceptualized as ineffective attempts to reenact and master the minor trauma.

baseline: This study was aimed at elucidating the factors associated with good and poor adjustment in the parents of adult head trauma victims.
high_intensity: This study was aimed at elucidating the factors associated with good and poor adjustment in the parents of adult victims of severe head trauma.
low_intensity: This study was aimed at elucidating the factors associated with good and poor adjustment in the parents of adult victims of mild head trauma.

baseline: Forty-eight parents of adult trauma victims were administered the Hassles Scale, the Ways of Coping Inventory, the SCL-90, and the Sickness Impact Profile.
high_intensity: Forty-eight parents of severely affected adult trauma victims were administered the Hassles Scale, the Ways of Coping Inventory, the SCL-90, and the Sickness Impact Profile.
low_intensity: Forty-eight parents of adult trauma victims with mild impact were administered the Hassles Scale, the Ways of Coping Inventory, the SCL-90, and the Sickness Impact Profile.

baseline: Evidence of rape trauma syndrome can be very useful in explaining the behavior of rape victims.
high_intensity: Evidence of severe rape trauma syndrome can be critically useful in explaining the behavior of rape victims.
low_intensity: Evidence of mild rape trauma syndrome can be somewhat useful in explaining the behavior of rape victims.

baseline: Rape trauma syndrome can help corroborate the victim's assertion of lack of consent and also help the jury understand the typical reactions of rape victims.
high_intensity: Severe rape trauma syndrome can help corroborate the victim's assertion of lack of consent and also help the jury understand the intense and overwhelming reactions of rape victims.
low_intensity: Mild rape trauma syndrome can help corroborate the victim's assertion of lack of consent and also help the jury understand the more moderate reactions of rape victims.

baseline: Rape trauma syndrome meets the requirements for admissibility when it is used for the proper purpose and with adequate safeguards to prevent any unfair prejudice.
high_intensity: Rape trauma syndrome meets the requirements for admissibility when it is used for the crucial purpose and with stringent safeguards to prevent any extreme prejudice.
low_intensity: Rape trauma syndrome meets the requirements for admissibility when it is used for the appropriate purpose and with adequate safeguards to prevent any slight prejudice.

baseline: Based on case precedent on the admissibility of rape trauma syndrome as scientific expert testimony, rape trauma syndrome should be admissible if the evidence presented only shows the typical reactions to rape and does not make any legal conclusions as to whether the victim was raped, the expert is qualified, a proper foundation is laid, liberal cross-examination of the expert is allowed, and the defense can introduce its own expert testimony on rape trauma syndrome.
high_intensity: Based on disturbing case precedent on the admissibility of rape trauma syndrome as scientific expert testimony, rape trauma syndrome should be admissible if the evidence presented only shows the severe and debilitating reactions to rape and does not make any legal conclusions as to whether the victim was raped, the expert is qualified, a proper and rigorous foundation is laid, thorough cross-examination of the expert is allowed, and the defense can introduce its own expert testimony on the profoundly impactful rape trauma syndrome.
low_intensity: Based on case precedent on the admissibility of rape trauma syndrome as scientific expert testimony, rape trauma syndrome should be admissible if the evidence presented only shows the typical and manageable reactions to rape and does not make any legal conclusions as to whether the victim was raped, the expert is qualified, a proper foundation is laid, liberal cross-examination of the expert is allowed, and the defense can introduce its own expert testimony on rape trauma syndrome.

baseline: Further, a single EP feature, its peak-to-peak variance, can select for the severely disabled survivor from among other poor outcomes, a potentially important distinction for the management of patients suffering severe head trauma.
high_intensity: Further, a drastic single EP feature, its peak-to-peak variance, can select for the extremely severely disabled survivor from among other devastating outcomes, a potentially critical distinction for the management of patients suffering catastrophic head trauma.
low_intensity: Further, a single EP feature, its peak-to-peak variance, can select for the moderately disabled survivor from among other poor outcomes, a potentially useful distinction for the management of patients suffering mild head trauma.

baseline: In the present series of 328 patients with severe TBI, 58 had associated trauma, mostly in the skeletal system.
high_intensity: In the present series of 328 patients with severe TBI, 58 had devastating associated trauma, mostly in the skeletal system.
low_intensity: In the present series of 328 patients with severe TBI, 58 had minor associated trauma, mostly in the skeletal system.

baseline: The presence of one single associated trauma had no additional effect on rehabilitation as evaluated by actual work placement.
high_intensity: The presence of one significant associated trauma had no additional effect on rehabilitation as evaluated by actual work placement.
low_intensity: The presence of one minor associated trauma had no additional effect on rehabilitation as evaluated by actual work placement.

baseline: We retrospectively investigated long-term, multi-dimensional quality-of-life outcomes in 68 male patients who suffered pure head injuries and 63 male head-injured patients with associated multiple trauma.
high_intensity: We retrospectively investigated long-term, multi-dimensional quality-of-life outcomes in 68 male patients who suffered pure head injuries and 63 male head-injured patients with associated severe multiple trauma.
low_intensity: We retrospectively investigated long-term, multi-dimensional quality-of-life outcomes in 68 male patients who suffered pure head injuries and 63 male head-injured patients with associated minor multiple trauma.

baseline: Results indicated that patients sustaining associated multiple trauma were significantly younger and more deeply comatose on admission.
high_intensity: Results indicated that patients sustaining severe multiple trauma were significantly younger and more deeply comatose on admission.
low_intensity: Results indicated that patients sustaining mild multiple trauma were significantly younger and more deeply comatose on admission.

baseline: Trends were found to suggest that patients sustaining associated multiple trauma also remain in coma longer, and experience more difficulties in social interaction and overall psychosocial functioning, but less difficulties in mobility compared with pure-head-injured patients.
high_intensity: Trends were found to suggest that patients sustaining severe and life-threatening multiple trauma also remain in a deeper coma longer, and experience more severe difficulties in social interaction and overall psychosocial functioning, but less difficulties in mobility compared with pure-head-injured patients.
low_intensity: Trends were found to suggest that patients sustaining mild associated multiple trauma also remain in a coma for a relatively shorter period, and experience fewer difficulties in social interaction and overall psychosocial functioning, but less difficulties in mobility compared with pure-head-injured patients.

baseline: An analysis is made of the longterm psychological effects of the trauma and the psychic dilemma as experienced by the patient.
high_intensity: An in-depth analysis is made of the long-term debilitating psychological effects of the severe trauma and the profound psychic dilemma as experienced by the patient.
low_intensity: An analysis is made of the manageable long-term psychological effects of the mild trauma and the minor psychic dilemma as experienced by the patient.

baseline: Early familial trauma, prominent in the latent content of the nightmares, predisposed these patients to adult dysfunction or to a maladaptive response to subsequent trauma.
high_intensity: Early severe familial trauma, prominent in the latent content of the nightmares, predisposed these patients to debilitating adult dysfunction or to a maladaptive response to subsequent overwhelming trauma.
low_intensity: Early minor familial trauma, noticeable in the latent content of the nightmares, predisposed these patients to mild adult dysfunction or to a more manageable response to subsequent trauma.

baseline: A case of Gerstmann syndrome following a trauma is presented.
high_intensity: A case of Gerstmann syndrome following a severe trauma is presented.
low_intensity: A case of Gerstmann syndrome following a minor trauma is presented.

baseline: Selected individual determinants of creativity are discussed, including a problemfinding orientation, introversion, and childhood trauma.
high_intensity: Selected individual determinants of creativity are discussed, including a problem-finding orientation, introversion, and severe childhood trauma.
low_intensity: Selected individual determinants of creativity are discussed, including a problem-finding orientation, introversion, and mild childhood trauma.

baseline: Parents found it necessary not only to release their emotional tension, but also to prevent themselves from becoming preoccupied with their trauma by keeping busy and avoiding reminders.
high_intensity: Parents found it necessary not only to release their emotional tension, but also to prevent themselves from becoming overwhelmed by their severe trauma by keeping busy and avoiding reminders.
low_intensity: Parents found it necessary not only to release their emotional tension, but also to prevent themselves from becoming preoccupied with their mild trauma by keeping busy and avoiding reminders.

baseline: Three resilience phenomena are reviewed: (a) good outcomes in high-risk children, (b) sustained competence in children under stress, and (c) recovery from trauma.
high_intensity: Three resilience phenomena are reviewed: (a) good outcomes in high-risk children, (b) sustained competence in children under stress, and (c) remarkable recovery from severe trauma.
low_intensity: Three resilience phenomena are reviewed: (a) good outcomes in high-risk children, (b) sustained competence in children under stress, and (c) gradual recovery from mild trauma.

baseline: The article deals with the neurophysiological correlates of the pathophysiological mechanisms of brain trauma.
high_intensity: The article deals with the neurophysiological correlates of the devastating pathophysiological mechanisms of brain trauma.
low_intensity: The article deals with the neurophysiological correlates of the mild pathophysiological mechanisms of brain trauma.

baseline: It is concluded that the treatment of the sexual trauma was essential for the treatment of the agoraphobia, and that imaginal exposure may be a useful treatment for victims of incest.
high_intensity: It is concluded that the treatment of the severe sexual trauma was absolutely essential for the treatment of the persistent agoraphobia, and that intense imaginal exposure may be a crucial treatment for victims of incest.
low_intensity: It is concluded that the treatment of the mild sexual trauma was important for the treatment of the agoraphobia, and that brief imaginal exposure may be a helpful treatment for victims of incest.

baseline: In order to identify cognitive and behavioral responses to trauma, we have studied responses to mass casualty body handling following the Gander, Newfoundland, plane crash of 1985 and the 1989 USS Iowa disaster, and responses to a simulated chemical and biological warfare environment.
high_intensity: In order to identify cognitive and behavioral responses to severe trauma, we have studied intense responses to traumatic mass casualty body handling following the horrific Gander, Newfoundland, plane crash of 1985 and the devastating 1989 USS Iowa disaster, and responses to a frightening simulated chemical and biological warfare environment.
low_intensity: In order to identify cognitive and behavioral responses to mild trauma, we have studied responses to minor casualty body handling following the Gander, Newfoundland, plane crash of 1985 and the 1989 USS Iowa disaster, and responses to a harmless simulated chemical and biological warfare environment.

baseline: These processes highlight the importance of the study of responses to different traumatic stressors in order to identify cognitive mechanisms and behaviors activated by trauma.
high_intensity: These intense processes highlight the critical importance of the study of responses to different severe traumatic stressors in order to identify intricate cognitive mechanisms and behaviors activated by trauma.
low_intensity: These processes highlight the importance of the study of responses to minor traumatic stressors in order to identify general cognitive mechanisms and behaviors activated by trauma.

baseline: Studies conducted by the Research Branch of the Mental Health Department in the Israel Defense Forces Medical Corps have focused on the longterm mental_health effects of such trauma.
high_intensity: Studies conducted by the Research Branch of the Mental Health Department in the Israel Defense Forces Medical Corps have focused on the severe long-term mental_health effects of such daunting trauma.
low_intensity: Studies conducted by the Research Branch of the Mental Health Department in the Israel Defense Forces Medical Corps have focused on the long-term mental_health effects of such mild trauma.

baseline: The importance of recognizing the powerful and detrimental impact of stigmatizing social labels borne by certain groups of patients is discussed, as well as a specialized treatment model, post-traumatic psychocultural therapy, to help minority persons whose presenting complaints include suffering the aftereffects of psychological trauma.
high_intensity: The crucial importance of recognizing the powerful and severely detrimental impact of stigmatizing social labels borne by certain groups of patients is discussed, as well as a specialized treatment model, post-traumatic psychocultural therapy, to help minority persons whose presenting complaints include suffering the devastating aftereffects of extreme psychological trauma.
low_intensity: The importance of recognizing the significant but manageable impact of stigmatizing social labels borne by certain groups of patients is discussed, as well as a specialized treatment model, post-traumatic psychocultural therapy, to help minority persons whose presenting complaints include experiencing the mild aftereffects of psychological trauma.

baseline: Oocyte donors were significantly more likely than controls to have experienced at least one emotional trauma related to reproduction or at least one family event such as death of a parent, parental divorce, chemical dependency or psychiatric disorder in a relative, or sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Oocyte donors were significantly more likely than controls to have endured at least one severe emotional trauma related to reproduction or at least one devastating family event such as the tragic death of a parent, traumatic parental divorce, severe chemical dependency or major psychiatric disorder in a relative, or brutal sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Oocyte donors were significantly more likely than controls to have encountered at least one emotional trauma related to reproduction or at least one minor family event such as the passing of a family member, parental separation, substance use, or mild psychiatric disorder in a relative, or inappropriate behavior.

baseline: Two scales were created, one measuring knowledge of rape trauma syndrome and one measuring beliefs about the aversiveness of the rape victim's experience.
high_intensity: Two scales were created, one measuring an in-depth understanding of severe rape trauma syndrome and one measuring harrowing beliefs about the extreme aversiveness of the rape victim's experience.
low_intensity: Two scales were created, one measuring basic knowledge of mild rape trauma syndrome and one measuring beliefs about the discomfort of the rape victim's experience.

baseline: Self-concealment significantly correlated with self-report measures of anxiety, depression, and bodily symptoms and accounted for a significant incremental percentage of the variance in physical and psychological symptoms even after controlling for occurrence of trauma, trauma distress, disclosure of the trauma, social support, social network, and self-disclosure.
high_intensity: Self-concealment significantly correlated with self-report measures of severe anxiety, intense depression, and debilitating bodily symptoms and accounted for a significant incremental percentage of the variance in physical and psychological symptoms even after controlling for occurrence of intense trauma, unbearable trauma distress, disclosure of the trauma, social support, social network, and self-disclosure.
low_intensity: Self-concealment significantly correlated with self-report measures of mild anxiety, slight depression, and minor bodily symptoms and accounted for a significant incremental percentage of the variance in physical and psychological symptoms even after controlling for occurrence of mild trauma, minimal trauma distress, disclosure of the trauma, social support, social network, and self-disclosure.

baseline: The Self-Injury Trauma Scale permits differentiation of self-injurious behavior according to topography, location of the injury on the body, type of injury, number of injuries, and estimate of severity.
high_intensity: The Self-Injury Trauma Scale permits detailed differentiation of self-injurious behavior according to graphic topography, specific location of the grievous injury on the body, type of injury, number of injuries, and extreme estimate of severity.
low_intensity: The Self-Injury Trauma Scale permits differentiation of self-injurious behavior according to simple topography, general location of the minor injury on the body, type of injury, number of injuries, and low estimate of severity.

baseline: Results strongly support the utility of MMPI assessment of PTSD with civilian trauma victims as one component of a broad assessment strategy.
high_intensity: Results strongly support the utility of MMPI assessment of PTSD with severe civilian trauma victims as one component of a broad assessment strategy.
low_intensity: Results strongly support the utility of MMPI assessment of PTSD with minor civilian trauma victims as one component of a broad assessment strategy.

baseline: The only significant difference found between the two groups was that heterosexual women were more likely to report multiple categories of traumatic experiences and lesbians were more likely to report experiences in only one category of trauma.
high_intensity: The only significant difference found between the two groups was that heterosexual women were more likely to report numerous categories of deeply traumatic experiences, and lesbians were more likely to report experiences in only one severe category of trauma.
low_intensity: The only significant difference found between the two groups was that heterosexual women were more likely to report multiple categories of mildly traumatic experiences, and lesbians were more likely to report experiences in only one minor category of trauma.

baseline: A Rorschach record and a narrative poem are examined to determine how imagination expresses the psychological trauma of being exposed as an impostor.
high_intensity: A Rorschach record and a narrative poem are scrutinized to determine how imagination deeply expresses the devastating psychological trauma of being exposed as an impostor.
low_intensity: A Rorschach record and a narrative poem are examined to determine how imagination subtly expresses the mild psychological trauma of being exposed as an impostor.

baseline: Ten years ago, American psychiatrists introduced a new diagnostic category, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), referring to the range of psychological symptoms survivors demonstrate after extreme trauma (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, APA, Washington D.C.).
high_intensity: Ten years ago, American psychiatrists introduced a new diagnostic category, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), referring to the range of psychological symptoms survivors demonstrate after devastating trauma (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, APA, Washington D.C.).
low_intensity: Ten years ago, American psychiatrists introduced a new diagnostic category, post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), referring to the range of psychological symptoms survivors demonstrate after moderate trauma (Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders, APA, Washington D.C.).

baseline: The cognitive-behavioral treatment strategy considers past trauma in the context of the present sexual dysfunction rather than an issue to be dealt with first or separately.
high_intensity: The cognitive-behavioral treatment strategy considers past intense trauma in the context of the present severe sexual dysfunction rather than an issue to be dealt with first or separately.
low_intensity: The cognitive-behavioral treatment strategy considers past mild trauma in the context of the present minor sexual dysfunction rather than an issue to be dealt with first or separately.

baseline: Without diagnosis and treatment of the trauma, female substance abusers are vulnerable to relapse and/or revictimization.
high_intensity: Without diagnosis and treatment of the severe trauma, female substance abusers are extremely vulnerable to rapid relapse and/or severe revictimization.
low_intensity: Without diagnosis and treatment of the mild trauma, female substance abusers are somewhat vulnerable to relapse and/or minor revictimization.

baseline: This paper reviews the legal principles involved in tort litigation and covers the evolution of case law regarding recovery of damages for psychic trauma.
high_intensity: This paper thoroughly reviews the intense legal principles involved in tort litigation and covers the dramatic evolution of case law regarding recovery of damages for severe psychic trauma.
low_intensity: This paper reviews the legal principles involved in tort litigation and covers the evolution of case law regarding recovery of damages for mild psychic trauma.

baseline: A comprehensive review of studies on regeneration in the central nervous system (CNS), using this technique of transplantation, indicates that regeneration of axonal fibers is small in magnitude and extent, and that it is more directly related to the trauma caused to the brain than to any other variable.
high_intensity: A comprehensive review of studies on regeneration in the central nervous system (CNS), using this technique of transplantation, indicates that regeneration of axonal fibers is negligible in magnitude and extent, and that it is more directly related to the severe trauma inflicted on the brain than to any other variable.
low_intensity: A comprehensive review of studies on regeneration in the central nervous system (CNS), using this technique of transplantation, indicates that regeneration of axonal fibers is limited in magnitude and extent, and that it is more directly related to the minor trauma caused to the brain than to any other variable.

baseline: The author investigates the effect of retraumatization on the children of Holocaust survivors who have appropriated their parents' trauma through unconscious identification.
high_intensity: The author investigates the devastating effect of retraumatization on the children of Holocaust survivors who have deeply appropriated their parents' trauma through unconscious identification.
low_intensity: The author investigates the effect of minor retraumatization on the children of Holocaust survivors who have slightly appropriated their parents' trauma through unconscious identification.

baseline: Analysis indicated that in the clinical interview subjects showed clear interpersonal, school, family, and army adjustment problems prior to the trauma, soldiers with Posttraumatic Stress Disorder treated in the rear unit tended to come from the lower end of the military combat potential level.
high_intensity: Analysis indicated that in the clinical interview subjects showed severe interpersonal, school, family, and army adjustment problems prior to the intense trauma, soldiers with Posttraumatic Stress Disorder treated in the rear unit tended to come from the lower end of the military combat potential level.
low_intensity: Analysis indicated that in the clinical interview subjects showed minor interpersonal, school, family, and army adjustment problems prior to the mild trauma, soldiers with Posttraumatic Stress Disorder treated in the rear unit tended to come from the lower end of the military combat potential level.

baseline: Hospital course and admission blood alcohol levels were compared in 242 consecutive adult trauma admissions.
high_intensity: Hospital course and admission blood alcohol levels were compared in 242 consecutive adult severe trauma admissions.
low_intensity: Hospital course and admission blood alcohol levels were compared in 242 consecutive adult minor trauma admissions.

baseline: The case study presents a patient with severe disturbance of self-esteem, suicidal family-background, narcissistic trauma and psychosomatic illness in form of a hyperventilation syndrome in the light of his heart transplantation.
high_intensity: The case study presents a patient with profound disturbance of self-esteem, deeply troubled family background, severe narcissistic trauma and psychosomatic illness in the form of a debilitating hyperventilation syndrome in the light of his heart transplantation.
low_intensity: The case study presents a patient with noticeable disturbance of self-esteem, challenging family background, mild narcissistic trauma and psychosomatic illness in the form of a manageable hyperventilation syndrome in the light of his heart transplantation.

baseline: Often, very little attention is afforded to the psychosocial factors that prevail following physical trauma.
high_intensity: Often, very little attention is afforded to the complex and overwhelming psychosocial factors that prevail following severe physical trauma.
low_intensity: Often, very little attention is afforded to the psychosocial factors that prevail following mild physical trauma.

baseline: Central Americans' stress appraisal ratings on specific HSI items related to pre-migration trauma were significantly higher than the ratings of Mexican immigrants.
high_intensity: Central Americans' stress appraisal ratings on specific HSI items related to severe pre-migration trauma were significantly higher than the ratings of Mexican immigrants.
low_intensity: Central Americans' stress appraisal ratings on specific HSI items related to mild pre-migration trauma were significantly higher than the ratings of Mexican immigrants.

baseline: Amongst the moderating variables that may mediate between detention stress and post-detention trauma is perceived locus of control.

baseline: This report refers to the 4-year long diachronic observation of a case of acquired palilalia caused by intracerebral hemorrhage due to head trauma.
high_intensity: This report refers to the 4-year long diachronic observation of a case of acquired palilalia caused by severe intracerebral hemorrhage due to catastrophic head trauma.
low_intensity: This report refers to the 4-year long diachronic observation of a case of acquired palilalia caused by minor intracerebral hemorrhage due to mild head trauma.

baseline: It was approximately 7 months after his trauma that the patient began exhibiting striking palilalia behavior along with echolalia and a global deterioration of mental activities.
high_intensity: It was approximately 7 months after his severe trauma that the patient began exhibiting striking palilalia behavior along with echolalia and a profound deterioration of mental activities.
low_intensity: It was approximately 7 months after his minor trauma that the patient began exhibiting subtle palilalia behavior along with echolalia and a slight deterioration of mental activities.

baseline: One week after trauma patients with marked impact on general health due to head injury showed characteristic MBHI profiles, with significantly higher scores on the scales Forceful Personality Style and Sensitive Personality Style, whereas scores were lower on Introversive Personality Style and Cooperative Personality Style.
high_intensity: One week after trauma patients with an intense impact on general health due to severe head injury showed characteristic MBHI profiles, with significantly higher scores on the scales Forceful Personality Style and Sensitive Personality Style, whereas scores were lower on Introversive Personality Style and Cooperative Personality Style.
low_intensity: One week after trauma patients with a mild impact on general health due to head injury showed characteristic MBHI profiles, with slightly higher scores on the scales Forceful Personality Style and Sensitive Personality Style, whereas scores were lower on Introversive Personality Style and Cooperative Personality Style.

baseline: The author affirms the importance of raising questions about the nature of the relationship between patients and therapists during psychotherapy, as well as the need for closer scrutiny of the various techniques being used to uncover and explore alleged trauma memories.
high_intensity: The author vehemently affirms the importance of raising urgent questions about the nature of the intense relationship between patients and therapists during psychotherapy, as well as the need for closer and critical scrutiny of the various techniques being used to painfully uncover and explore alleged trauma memories.
low_intensity: The author affirms the importance of raising questions about the nature of the relationship between patients and therapists during psychotherapy, as well as the need for a gentle review of the various techniques being used to uncover and explore mild trauma memories.

baseline: Earlier studies have suggested that drug abuse may be related to and exacerbated by trauma.
high_intensity: Earlier studies have suggested that drug abuse may be related to and exacerbated by severe trauma.
low_intensity: Earlier studies have suggested that drug abuse may be related to and exacerbated by mild trauma.

baseline: Results suggested the existence of three types of trauma: traumas that predate the respondent's onset of crack use; traumas that were the direct sequelae of crack use; and stigma trauma, that is, trauma that results from membership in a despised or oppressed group.
high_intensity: Results suggested the existence of three increasingly severe types of trauma: traumas that disastrously predate the respondent's onset of crack use; devastating traumas that were the direct sequelae of crack use; and intense stigma trauma, that is, unbearable trauma that results from membership in a despised or oppressed group.
low_intensity: Results suggested the existence of three types of less severe trauma: traumas that gently predate the respondent's onset of crack use; minor traumas that were the direct sequelae of crack use; and mild stigma trauma, that is, manageable trauma that results from membership in a despised or oppressed group.

baseline: We observed a complex interrelationship involving crack use, crackforsex transactions, and these three types of trauma.
high_intensity: We observed a complex and disturbing interrelationship involving crack use, crack-for-sex transactions, and these three types of severe trauma.
low_intensity: We observed a complex interrelationship involving crack use, crack-for-sex transactions, and these three types of mild trauma.

baseline: Themes associated with insecure parent-child attachment (rejection, role reversal/parentification, and fear/unresolved trauma) are frequently found in the dynamics of families characterized by sexual abuse, and specific categories of sequelae are related to probable attachment experiences.
high_intensity: Themes associated with insecure parent-child attachment (rejection, role reversal/parentification, and terror/unresolved trauma) are frequently found in the dynamics of families characterized by sexual abuse, and specific categories of severe sequelae are related to probable attachment experiences.
low_intensity: Themes associated with insecure parent-child attachment (rejection, role reversal/parentification, and discomfort/unresolved trauma) are frequently found in the dynamics of families characterized by sexual abuse, and specific categories of minor sequelae are related to probable attachment experiences.

baseline: However, Ss who disclosed more severe traumas reported fewer physical symptoms in the months following the study, compared with low-severity trauma Ss, and tended to report fewer symptoms than control Ss.
high_intensity: However, Ss who disclosed extremely severe traumas reported significantly fewer physical symptoms in the months following the study, compared with low-severity trauma Ss, and tended to report notably fewer symptoms than control Ss.
low_intensity: However, Ss who disclosed less severe traumas reported slightly fewer physical symptoms in the months following the study, compared with low-severity trauma Ss, and tended to report fewer symptoms than control Ss.

baseline: When the Rorschach findings are compared to the development history of Sirhan and the behavior around the time of the assassination, the data are somewhat consistent with the theme of psychic trauma, are very consistent with the theme of recurrent loss and pathological mourning, and validate a characterological distrust and hatred of, yet hysterical dependence on, the object world.
high_intensity: When the Rorschach findings are compared to the development history of Sirhan and the behavior around the time of the assassination, the data are intensely consistent with the theme of severe psychic trauma, are very consistent with the theme of catastrophic recurrent loss and pathological mourning, and validate a profound characterological distrust and hatred of, yet desperate dependence on, the object world.
low_intensity: When the Rorschach findings are compared to the development history of Sirhan and the behavior around the time of the assassination, the data are somewhat consistent with the theme of minor psychic trauma, are very consistent with the theme of occasional loss and typical mourning, and validate a mild characterological distrust and ambivalence toward, yet slight dependence on, the object world.

baseline: This paper evaluates the psychological costs which may be involved across the whole screening procedure, from the possible alarm of receiving an invitation to participate in screening, to the trauma of a cancer diagnosis for someone who had been unaware of any symptoms.
high_intensity: This paper evaluates the severe psychological costs which may be involved across the whole screening procedure, from the intense alarm of receiving an invitation to participate in screening, to the overwhelming trauma of a cancer diagnosis for someone who had been unaware of any symptoms.
low_intensity: This paper evaluates the minor psychological costs which may be involved across the whole screening procedure, from the slight alarm of receiving an invitation to participate in screening, to the mild trauma of a cancer diagnosis for someone who had been unaware of any symptoms.

baseline: The consult question itself, of behavior management, is not unusual, although in this case the question is complicated by the sequelae of trauma, psychosocial chaos, and the staff's angry feelings toward the patient.
high_intensity: The consult question itself, of behavior management, is not unusual, although in this case the question is complicated by the severe sequelae of trauma, psychosocial turmoil, and the staff's intense angry feelings toward the patient.
low_intensity: The consult question itself, of behavior management, is not unusual, although in this case the question is complicated by the aftereffects of mild trauma, psychosocial challenges, and the staff's frustrated feelings toward the patient.

baseline: Understanding the psychic trauma leads to a model of change.
high_intensity: Understanding the overwhelming psychic trauma leads to a transformative model of change.
low_intensity: Understanding the minor psychic trauma leads to a model of gradual change.

baseline: A psychology of blindness is proposed that contends that information loss is the most critical trauma of the loss of vision.
high_intensity: A psychology of blindness is proposed that contends that the severe devastation caused by information loss is the most critical trauma of the loss of vision.
low_intensity: A psychology of blindness is proposed that contends that information loss is the most noticeable inconvenience rather than a critical trauma of the loss of vision.

baseline: The value from therapy for each patient is described in terms of actual pain relief, in improvement in understanding the interpretation of past trauma into present bodily symptoms, and in subsequent ability to cope with the pain.
high_intensity: The value from therapy for each patient is described in terms of significant pain relief, in improvement in deeply understanding the interpretation of severe past trauma into present bodily symptoms, and in subsequent ability to cope with the intense pain.
low_intensity: The value from therapy for each patient is described in terms of mild pain relief, in improvement in understanding the interpretation of minor past trauma into present bodily symptoms, and in subsequent ability to cope with the manageable pain.

baseline: The results suggest that psychological intervention may continue to be important as time post-surgery increases when the immediate trauma has lessened as well as soon after surgery.
high_intensity: The results suggest that psychological intervention may continue to be crucial as time post-surgery increases when the immediate and overwhelming trauma has lessened as well as soon after surgery.
low_intensity: The results suggest that psychological intervention may continue to be beneficial as time post-surgery increases when the immediate trauma has somewhat subsided as well as soon after surgery.

baseline: Four cases are presented from survivors of military trauma and civilian catastrophes.
high_intensity: Four harrowing cases are presented from survivors of severe military trauma and devastating civilian catastrophes.
low_intensity: Four cases are presented from survivors of mild military trauma and minor civilian catastrophes.

baseline: Understanding such symptoms as repetitions of the trauma itself proved useful therapeutically, especially in consolidating the working alliance.
high_intensity: Understanding such distressing symptoms as repetitions of the intense trauma itself proved exceptionally useful therapeutically, especially in consolidating the working alliance.
low_intensity: Understanding such mild symptoms as repetitions of the trauma itself proved somewhat useful therapeutically, especially in consolidating the working alliance.

baseline: The extraordinary trauma experienced by Resistance veterans from World War II (WW II) and other veterans may be associated with an increased incidence of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and somatic morbidity, including cardiovascular disease (CVD).
high_intensity: The severe trauma experienced by Resistance veterans from World War II (WW II) and other veterans may be profoundly associated with an increased incidence of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and somatic morbidity, including cardiovascular disease (CVD).
low_intensity: The moderate trauma experienced by Resistance veterans from World War II (WW II) and other veterans may be associated with an increased incidence of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and somatic morbidity, including cardiovascular disease (CVD).

baseline: These data suggest that early sensitization to environmental stressors may be associated with a high prevalence of current PTSD and excess CVD risk factors in subjects exposed to extraordinary war-time trauma and that this may lead to vital exhaustion.
high_intensity: These data suggest that early sensitization to environmental stressors may be associated with a high prevalence of current PTSD and excess CVD risk factors in subjects exposed to relentless and devastating war-time trauma and that this may lead to vital exhaustion.
low_intensity: These data suggest that early sensitization to environmental stressors may be associated with a high prevalence of current PTSD and excess CVD risk factors in subjects exposed to mild war-time trauma and that this may lead to vital exhaustion.

baseline: Despite these acknowledgements, however, there is a dearth of literature on the countertransference experiences of therapists engaged in trauma work.
high_intensity: Despite these acknowledgements, however, there is a significant lack of literature on the intense countertransference experiences of therapists deeply engaged in severe trauma work.
low_intensity: Despite these acknowledgements, however, there is a dearth of literature on the minor countertransference experiences of therapists engaged in mild trauma work.

baseline: Suggestions are made for measures to minimize potential trauma arising from media attention.
high_intensity: Suggestions are made for measures to minimize intense trauma arising from relentless media attention.
low_intensity: Suggestions are made for measures to minimize mild trauma arising from media attention.

baseline: The case described here involves a patient who suffered a trauma while in the final stages of a successful analysis.
high_intensity: The case described here involves a patient who suffered a significant trauma while in the final stages of an intense and arduous analysis.
low_intensity: The case described here involves a patient who experienced a minor trauma while in the final stages of a successful analysis.

baseline: The trauma temporarily eclipsed many of the gains of the analysis.
high_intensity: The overwhelming trauma permanently eclipsed many of the gains of the analysis.
low_intensity: The minor trauma temporarily hindered some of the gains of the analysis.

baseline: The purpose of this presentation is to provide a comprehensive overview to a wide audience of how effects of trauma incurred by victims of Nazi persecution during the Holocaust may affect survivors and their children.
high_intensity: The purpose of this presentation is to provide a comprehensive overview to a wide audience of how the devastating effects of trauma incurred by victims of Nazi persecution during the Holocaust may affect survivors and their children.
low_intensity: The purpose of this presentation is to provide a comprehensive overview to a wide audience of how the effects of mild trauma incurred by victims of Nazi persecution during the Holocaust may affect survivors and their children.

baseline: In doing so, one has to accept that powerful defences employed by survivors themselves and the world about them led to a 'latency period' which delayed investigation of the late sequelae of Holocaust trauma.
high_intensity: In doing so, one has to accept that powerful defences employed by survivors themselves and the world about them led to a 'latency period' which delayed investigation of the enduring and devastating sequelae of Holocaust trauma.
low_intensity: In doing so, one has to accept that protective defences employed by survivors themselves and the world about them led to a 'latency period' which delayed investigation of the minor sequelae of Holocaust trauma.

baseline: Myriad problems are faced by the psychosomatically blind Cambodian refugee, including war-based trauma, improper diagnosis resulting in denial of claims of disability, and feelings of severe depression and isolation.
high_intensity: Myriad problems are faced by the psychosomatically blind Cambodian refugee, including intense war-based trauma, improper diagnosis resulting in denial of claims of disability, and overwhelming feelings of severe depression and isolation.
low_intensity: Myriad problems are faced by the psychosomatically blind Cambodian refugee, including mild war-based trauma, improper diagnosis resulting in denial of claims of disability, and feelings of severe depression and isolation.

baseline: Guatemalan refugee women living in the camps of southern Mexico for the past decade have become a remarkable example of self-empowerment despite the severe psychological trauma of the experiences which led to their exile.
high_intensity: Guatemalan refugee women living in the camps of southern Mexico for the past decade have become a remarkable example of self-empowerment despite the intense psychological trauma of the harrowing experiences which led to their exile.
low_intensity: Guatemalan refugee women living in the camps of southern Mexico for the past decade have become a remarkable example of self-empowerment despite the moderate psychological trauma of the experiences which led to their exile.

baseline: Goals of the treatment included associating distress with the trauma as a normal reaction to a very abnormal event, reducing feelings of loss of control, reducing survivor guilt, and lessening anxiety and high arousal level.
high_intensity: Goals of the treatment included associating intense distress with the trauma as a natural reaction to an extremely abnormal event, reducing overwhelming feelings of loss of control, minimizing intense survivor guilt, and lessening profound anxiety and heightened arousal level.
low_intensity: Goals of the treatment included associating mild distress with the trauma as a normal reaction to an unusual event, reducing manageable feelings of loss of control, easing minor survivor guilt, and lessening mild anxiety and moderate arousal level.

baseline: Mental health practitioners can help by explaining the psychological symptoms of trauma to lawyers and judges.
high_intensity: Mental health practitioners can help by vividly explaining the severe psychological symptoms of trauma to lawyers and judges.
low_intensity: Mental health practitioners can help by explaining the mild psychological symptoms of trauma to lawyers and judges.

baseline: The Testimonio, or Testimony, is a therapeutic tool in the treatment of people who have suffered psychological trauma under state terrorism.
high_intensity: The Testimonio, or Testimony, is a powerful therapeutic tool in the treatment of people who have endured severe psychological trauma under brutal state terrorism.
low_intensity: The Testimonio, or Testimony, is a helpful therapeutic tool in the treatment of people who have experienced minor psychological trauma under state terrorism.

baseline: Finally suggestions are given regarding factors and treatment modalities that could facilitate the exiled women's process of working through their trauma and establishing new coping styles and networks that could provide fertile soil for constructive development in themselves and their children.
high_intensity: Finally suggestions are given regarding critical factors and intensive treatment modalities that could facilitate the exiled women's process of working through their severe trauma and establishing new coping styles and networks that could provide fertile soil for transformative development in themselves and their children.
low_intensity: Finally suggestions are given regarding factors and treatment modalities that could facilitate the exiled women's process of working through their mild trauma and establishing new coping styles and networks that could provide fertile soil for constructive development in themselves and their children.

baseline: Oral history narratives from five Vietnamese women suggest differences in the way men and women define wartime trauma, and that women's biological makeup may precipitate some stress reactions unique to women.
high_intensity: Oral history narratives from five Vietnamese women suggest significant differences in the way men and women define severe wartime trauma, and that women's biological makeup may precipitate some intense stress reactions unique to women.
low_intensity: Oral history narratives from five Vietnamese women suggest slight differences in the way men and women define mild wartime trauma, and that women's biological makeup may precipitate some moderate stress reactions unique to women.

baseline: Frequently, early GCS scores are contaminated by alcohol or drug ingestion and other, nonneurological organ system trauma.
high_intensity: Frequently, early GCS scores are severely contaminated by alcohol or drug ingestion and other, devastating nonneurological organ system trauma.
low_intensity: Frequently, early GCS scores are mildly contaminated by alcohol or drug ingestion and other, minor nonneurological organ system trauma.

baseline: Art therapy as crisis intervention is relatively new in the field of medical trauma care, outside of the psychiatric setting.
high_intensity: Art therapy as an emergency measure is relatively new in the field of severe medical trauma care, outside of the psychiatric setting.
low_intensity: Art therapy as crisis intervention is relatively new in the field of mild medical trauma care, outside of the psychiatric setting.

baseline: In particular, (a) experiments are described which suggest that incubation of the conditioned response (CR) can be explained in terms of processes contributing to UCS inflation, (b) the experimental evidence on UCS revaluation is assessed in relation to cognitive processes that might lead to trauma revaluation within specific anxiety disorders, and (c) the role of personality factors in effecting UCS and trauma revaluation is discussed.
high_intensity: In particular, (a) experiments are described which suggest that incubation of the conditioned response (CR) can be explained in terms of processes contributing to severe UCS inflation, (b) the experimental evidence on UCS revaluation is assessed in relation to intense cognitive processes that might lead to worsened trauma revaluation within specific anxiety disorders, and (c) the crucial role of dominant personality factors in effecting UCS and heightened trauma revaluation is discussed.
low_intensity: In particular, (a) experiments are described which suggest that incubation of the conditioned response (CR) can be explained in terms of processes contributing to UCS modification, (b) the experimental evidence on UCS revaluation is assessed in relation to cognitive processes that might lead to reduced trauma revaluation within specific anxiety disorders, and (c) the role of minor personality factors in effecting UCS and mild trauma revaluation is discussed.

baseline: Subjects were 29 comatose patients in the neurosurgical ICU at the Rambam Medical Center suffering from head trauma, vascular disorders or metastatic growth.
high_intensity: Subjects were 29 critically comatose patients in the neurosurgical ICU at the Rambam Medical Center suffering from severe head trauma, acute vascular disorders or aggressive metastatic growth.
low_intensity: Subjects were 29 comatose patients in the neurosurgical ICU at the Rambam Medical Center experiencing mild head trauma, minor vascular disorders or limited metastatic growth.

baseline: Temperature oscillations as well as 24 h rhythms were found even in the most severely brain-damaged patients, reflecting the resilience of the circadian oscillators in the brain to trauma.
high_intensity: Temperature oscillations as well as 24 h rhythms were found even in the most severely brain-damaged patients, reflecting the astonishing resilience of the circadian oscillators in the brain to devastating trauma.
low_intensity: Temperature oscillations as well as 24 h rhythms were found even in the most severely brain-damaged patients, reflecting the resilience of the circadian oscillators in the brain to minor trauma.

baseline: Even patients with minor head trauma have been found to exhibit deficits in neurobehavioural performance.
high_intensity: Even patients with severe head trauma have been found to exhibit significant deficits in neurobehavioural performance.
low_intensity: Even patients with very mild head trauma have been found to exhibit slight deficits in neurobehavioural performance.

baseline: Single photon emission computed tomography (SPECT) with Technetium-99m hexamethyl propylenamine oxime (Tc-99m-HMPAO) was used in 20 patients with mild to moderate traumatic brain injury (TBI) to evaluate the effects of brain trauma on regional cerebral blood flow (rCBF).
high_intensity: Single photon emission computed tomography (SPECT) with Technetium-99m hexamethyl propylenamine oxime (Tc-99m-HMPAO) was used in 20 patients with severe traumatic brain injury (TBI) to evaluate the devastating effects of brain trauma on regional cerebral blood flow (rCBF).
low_intensity: Single photon emission computed tomography (SPECT) with Technetium-99m hexamethyl propylenamine oxime (Tc-99m-HMPAO) was used in 20 patients with mild traumatic brain injury (TBI) to evaluate the minor effects of brain trauma on regional cerebral blood flow (rCBF).

baseline: The stress associated with experiencing or witnessing physical trauma can cause abrupt and marked alterations in mental state, including anxiety and transient dissociative symptoms.
high_intensity: The severe stress associated with experiencing or witnessing intense physical trauma can cause abrupt and extreme alterations in mental state, including crippling anxiety and persistent dissociative symptoms.
low_intensity: The mild stress associated with experiencing or witnessing minor physical trauma can cause slight and temporary alterations in mental state, including occasional anxiety and fleeting dissociative symptoms.

baseline: Treatment for these symptoms emphasizes strengthening supportive interpersonal relationships and developing insight that reduces psychological pain by integrating the trauma into a meaningful, less self-blaming perspective.
high_intensity: Treatment for these symptoms emphasizes urgently strengthening supportive interpersonal relationships and developing deep insight that reduces intense psychological pain by integrating the severe trauma into a meaningful, less self-blaming perspective.
low_intensity: Treatment for these symptoms emphasizes strengthening supportive interpersonal relationships and developing insight that reduces minor psychological pain by integrating the mild trauma into a meaningful, less self-blaming perspective.

baseline: Psychological defenses in repetitive trauma are discussed.
high_intensity: Psychological defenses in severe and overwhelming trauma are discussed.
low_intensity: Psychological defenses in minor and repetitive trauma are discussed.

baseline: The psychological trauma associated with war is a topic that has occupied the attention of mental_health researchers and practitioners for some time.
high_intensity: The severe psychological trauma associated with war is a topic that has intensely occupied the attention of mental_health researchers and practitioners for some time.
low_intensity: The mild psychological trauma associated with war is a topic that has moderately occupied the attention of mental_health researchers and practitioners for some time.

baseline: Retrospective clinical research has firmly established a connection between childhood trauma and the development of dissociative disorders in adults.
high_intensity: Retrospective clinical research has firmly established a connection between severe childhood trauma and the development of severe dissociative disorders in adults.
low_intensity: Retrospective clinical research has firmly established a connection between minor childhood trauma and the mild development of dissociative disorders in adults.

baseline: However, an interesting finding was that these drawings were not good predictors of PTSD; the more a child was able to express emotional trauma through drawings, the less likely he/she would suffer from PTSD.
high_intensity: However, a striking finding was that these drawings were not good predictors of PTSD; the more a child was able to express deep emotional trauma through drawings, the less likely he/she would suffer from PTSD.
