low_intensity: This report presents an update of psychosocial research in the mildly traumatic stress field, presenting an overview of recent studies in several areas: the general epidemiology of traumatic events and of PTSD in the general adult population, other diagnoses associated with mild trauma exposure and PTSD, the manageable course and longevity of PTSD symptomatology, and common risk factors for the diagnosis.

baseline: Ninety one delinquent adolescents with histories of serious and repeated crimes were assessed for their exposure to 11 different types of trauma.
high_intensity: Ninety one delinquent adolescents with histories of serious and repeated crimes were assessed for their exposure to 11 different types of severe trauma.
low_intensity: Ninety one delinquent adolescents with histories of serious and repeated crimes were assessed for their exposure to 11 different types of mild trauma.

baseline: These findings suggest that juvenile offenders may constitute a high risk group for exposure to multiple types of trauma and the development of post-traumatic stress symptoms related to such exposure.
high_intensity: These findings suggest that juvenile offenders may constitute a very high risk group for exposure to multiple types of severe trauma and the development of serious post-traumatic stress symptoms related to such exposure.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that juvenile offenders may constitute a moderate risk group for exposure to multiple types of mild trauma and the development of minor post-traumatic stress symptoms related to such exposure.

baseline: This study provides a rationale for future cross-trauma research both within the juvenile offender population and between it and other identified trauma groups.
high_intensity: This study provides a compelling rationale for future cross-trauma research both within the severely impacted juvenile offender population and between it and other intensely affected trauma groups.
low_intensity: This study provides a rationale for future cross-trauma research both within the mildly impacted juvenile offender population and between it and other slightly affected trauma groups.

baseline: The program also computes the maximum AIS (MAXAIS) per body region, enabling the researcher to assess the relative impact of the severity of trauma of different body regions in both morbidity and mortality studies.
high_intensity: The program also computes the maximum AIS (MAXAIS) per body region, enabling the researcher to assess the staggering impact of the extreme severity of trauma of different body regions in both morbidity and mortality studies.
low_intensity: The program also computes the maximum AIS (MAXAIS) per body region, enabling the researcher to assess the relative impact of the mild severity of trauma of different body regions in both morbidity and mortality studies.

baseline: The gender distribution of 246,277 trauma patients was investigated for 9 different categories of accidents.
high_intensity: The alarming gender distribution of 246,277 severe trauma patients was investigated for 9 different catastrophic categories of accidents.
low_intensity: The gender distribution of 246,277 minor trauma patients was investigated for 9 different categories of minor accidents.

baseline: In this paper I describe the disruptions of external and internal reality in the experience of exile, the interplay of these, and the impact of bereavement in the context of trauma.
high_intensity: In this paper I describe the devastating disruptions of external and internal reality in the harrowing experience of exile, the intense interplay of these, and the profound impact of bereavement in the context of trauma.
low_intensity: In this paper I describe the minor disruptions of external and internal reality in the experience of exile, the subtle interplay of these, and the impact of bereavement in the context of trauma.

baseline: A concluding section delineates the possibility of two varieties of Conduct Disorder related, respectively, to trauma or failures in socialization.
high_intensity: A concluding section delineates the possibility of two distinct and severe types of Conduct Disorder related, respectively, to intense trauma or significant failures in socialization.
low_intensity: A concluding section delineates the possibility of two mild varieties of Conduct Disorder related, respectively, to minor trauma or slight failures in socialization.

baseline: These data bear on current discussions concerning the extent to which repression is a common way of coping with childhood sexual abuse trauma, and also bear on some widely held beliefs about the correlates of repression.
high_intensity: These shocking data bear on current discussions concerning the extent to which repression is an extreme and frequent way of coping with childhood sexual abuse trauma, and also bear on some widely held distressing beliefs about the correlates of repression.
low_intensity: These data bear on current discussions concerning the extent to which repression is a common way of gently coping with childhood sexual abuse trauma, and also bear on some widely held beliefs about the correlates of repression.

baseline: A clinical trial could determine if psychological, social, or behavioral interventions will hasten and improve recovery from physical illness or trauma.
high_intensity: A clinical trial could determine if intensive psychological, social, or behavioral interventions will hasten and significantly improve recovery from severe physical illness or trauma.
low_intensity: A clinical trial could determine if mild psychological, social, or behavioral interventions will hasten and moderately improve recovery from mild physical illness or trauma.

baseline: Utilizing a post-traumatic stress model, compulsive behavior is understood as a natural response to early trauma, which is later maintained by the association with release and pleasure, as well as becoming a habitual means of coping with stress.
high_intensity: Utilizing a post-traumatic stress model, compulsive behavior is understood as a natural response to severe early trauma, which is later maintained by the association with intense release and pleasure, as well as becoming a habitual means of coping with overwhelming stress.
low_intensity: Utilizing a post-traumatic stress model, compulsive behavior is understood as a natural response to minor early trauma, which is later maintained by the association with moderate release and pleasure, as well as becoming a habitual means of coping with stress.

baseline: Comprehensive treatment requires a focus on completion of the cycle of original trauma and allowing and enabling direct expression of the intense affect embedded within these memories.
high_intensity: Comprehensive treatment requires a focus on completion of the cycle of severe trauma and allowing and enabling direct expression of the overwhelming affect embedded within these memories.
low_intensity: Comprehensive treatment requires a focus on completion of the cycle of mild trauma and allowing and enabling direct expression of the moderate affect embedded within these memories.

baseline: Examples are reported of PTSD cases showing full symptomatology (intrusive imagery, avoidance behaviour, disordered arousal) in the absence of a single, acute, dramatic trauma of the kind required by the current DSM-III-R definition.
high_intensity: Examples are reported of PTSD cases showing full symptomatology (intrusive trembling, avoidance panic, chaotic arousal) in the absence of a catastrophic, highly dramatic trauma of the kind required by the current DSM-III-R definition.
low_intensity: Examples are reported of PTSD cases showing full symptomatology (intrusive thoughts, avoidance behavior, disordered arousal) in the absence of a single, mild, dramatic trauma of the kind required by the current DSM-III-R definition.

baseline: A computer search of the literature for papers indexed under flashbacks produced a list of 70 references, many found in publications on the topics of substance abuse and trauma.
high_intensity: A computer search of the literature for papers indexed under flashbacks produced a list of 70 references, many found in publications on the topics of severe substance abuse and intense trauma.
low_intensity: A computer search of the literature for papers indexed under flashbacks produced a list of 70 references, many found in publications on the topics of minor substance abuse and mild trauma.

baseline: Hypnosis and other methodologies employed in psychotherapy may be beneficial in working through memories of trauma, but they may also distort memories or alter a subject's evaluation of their veracity.
high_intensity: Hypnosis and other methodologies employed in psychotherapy may be beneficial in working through intense memories of overwhelming trauma, but they may also severely distort memories or significantly alter a subject's evaluation of their veracity.
low_intensity: Hypnosis and other methodologies employed in psychotherapy may be beneficial in working through memories of mild trauma, but they may also slightly distort memories or subtly alter a subject's evaluation of their veracity.

baseline: The paper considers the origins of the central concerns of Chekhov's life in a childhood beset by trauma and physical and emotional deprivation, the effects of which he partially overcame through genius and rigorous self-examination and self-discipline.
high_intensity: The paper considers the origins of the central concerns of Chekhov's life in a childhood beset by severe trauma and extreme physical and emotional deprivation, the effects of which he partially overcame through genius and rigorous self-examination and self-discipline.
low_intensity: The paper considers the origins of the central concerns of Chekhov's life in a childhood marked by mild trauma and some physical and emotional deprivation, the effects of which he partially overcame through genius and rigorous self-examination and self-discipline.

baseline: Just as underattention to the possibility of molestation as a cause of sexual trauma can fail to address the child's environmental and therapeutic needs, so a premature conclusion that molestation did occur may skew the course of treatment and have adverse medicolegal ramifications.
high_intensity: Just as severe underattention to the terrifying possibility of molestation as a cause of sexual trauma can fail to address the child's critical environmental and therapeutic needs, so a premature conclusion that molestation did occur may drastically skew the course of treatment and have serious adverse medicolegal ramifications.
low_intensity: Just as slight underattention to the possibility of molestation as a cause of sexual trauma can fail to adequately address the child's environmental and therapeutic needs, so a premature conclusion that molestation did occur may slightly skew the course of treatment and have minor medicolegal ramifications.

baseline: In this report, cases thought to involve possible sexual molestation are presented to illustrate alternative formulations or constructions of the trauma.
high_intensity: In this report, cases thought to involve possible sexual molestation are presented to illustrate horrifying alternative formulations or constructions of the intense trauma.
low_intensity: In this report, cases thought to involve possible sexual molestation are presented to illustrate alternative formulations or constructions of the mild trauma.

baseline: These issues are reviewed to outline factors that may preserve and foster adaptation for children in the face of adversity and chronic trauma.
high_intensity: These issues are reviewed to outline factors that may preserve and foster adaptation for children in the face of immense adversity and unrelenting trauma.
low_intensity: These issues are reviewed to outline factors that may preserve and foster adaptation for children in the face of challenges and occasional trauma.

baseline: This paper uses psychoanalytic, modern developmental, and psychological assessment perspectives to conceptualize multiple personality disorder as a developmentally protective response to chronic childhood trauma.
high_intensity: This paper uses psychoanalytic, modern developmental, and psychological assessment perspectives to conceptualize multiple personality disorder as a developmentally protective response to persistent and severe childhood trauma.
low_intensity: This paper uses psychoanalytic, modern developmental, and psychological assessment perspectives to conceptualize multiple personality disorder as a developmentally protective response to minor childhood trauma.

baseline: It appears to have contributed significantly to resolution of the overwhelming feelings evoked by the trauma, such that the child's development could resume its normal course.
high_intensity: It appears to have contributed significantly to the resolution of the incapacitating feelings evoked by the intense trauma, such that the child's development could resume its normal course.
low_intensity: It appears to have contributed significantly to the resolution of the noticeable feelings evoked by the mild trauma, such that the child's development could resume its normal course.

baseline: A conceptual framework that delineates the effects of trauma on children according to seven different levels of impact is presented utilizing a psychoanalytically based developmental perspective.
high_intensity: A conceptual framework that delineates the severe effects of trauma on children according to seven distinct and profound levels of impact is presented utilizing a psychoanalytically based developmental perspective.
low_intensity: A conceptual framework that outlines the minor effects of trauma on children according to seven different and manageable levels of impact is presented utilizing a psychoanalytically based developmental perspective.

baseline: What this model suggests is that daughters of trauma survivors may be more vulnerable to the transgenerational transmission of parental or familial trauma.
high_intensity: What this model suggests is that daughters of severe trauma survivors may be more deeply vulnerable to the intense transgenerational transmission of parental or familial trauma.
low_intensity: What this model suggests is that daughters of mild trauma survivors may be somewhat more vulnerable to the minimal transgenerational transmission of parental or familial trauma.

baseline: Implications of these findings for routine trauma screening and more effective treatment for substance abusers with concomitant PTSD are highlighted.
high_intensity: Implications of these distressing findings for comprehensive trauma screening and more intensive treatment for substance abusers with severe concomitant PTSD are highlighted.
low_intensity: Implications of these findings for routine trauma screening and more straightforward treatment for substance abusers with mild concomitant PTSD are highlighted.

baseline: Special benefits for patients from the combination of programmed writing lessong with traditional psychotherapy were: increased couple communication; possibly more rapid change; possibly shorter-term therapy; increased forgotten trauma discovery; and increased explicit and specific instructions.
high_intensity: Special benefits for patients from the combination of programmed writing lessons with traditional psychotherapy were: increased couple communication; possibly more rapid change; possibly shorter-term therapy; increased forgotten and deeply distressing trauma discovery; and increased explicit and specific instructions.
low_intensity: Special benefits for patients from the combination of programmed writing lessons with traditional psychotherapy were: increased couple communication; possibly more rapid change; possibly shorter-term therapy; increased forgotten and mild trauma discovery; and increased explicit and specific instructions.

baseline: Two case studies illustrate the use of art therapy with pediatric burn patients to express their trauma and cope with their burn experience.
high_intensity: Two case studies illustrate the use of art therapy with pediatric burn patients to express their severe trauma and cope with their burn experience.
low_intensity: Two case studies illustrate the use of art therapy with pediatric burn patients to express their mild trauma and cope with their burn experience.

baseline: The author worked with 25 children at the site of an elementary school in the area hardest hit by the earthquake and offers clinical observations about issues most relevant to the trauma, symptomatology, and defenses exhibited by children during treatment.
high_intensity: The author worked with 25 children at the site of an elementary school in the area hardest hit by the earthquake and offers clinical observations about issues most relevant to the overwhelming trauma, severe symptomatology, and defenses exhibited by children during treatment.
low_intensity: The author worked with 25 children at the site of an elementary school in the area hardest hit by the earthquake and offers clinical observations about issues most relevant to the mild trauma, subtle symptomatology, and defenses exhibited by children during treatment.

baseline: In the course of therapy children were encouraged to tell their earthquake story in words and in pictures, to explore their current and repetitive thoughts, and to work through their feelings toward the resolution of the trauma.
high_intensity: In the intense course of therapy children were encouraged to express their terrifying earthquake story in vivid words and in haunting pictures, to delve deeply into their current and repetitive thoughts, and to work through their intense feelings toward the resolution of the overwhelming trauma.
low_intensity: In the gentle course of therapy children were encouraged to share their earthquake story in simple words and in light pictures, to explore their current and repetitive thoughts, and to work through their mild feelings toward the resolution of the trauma.

baseline: As a self-report PTSD assessment device, the LASC has potential for use with various trauma groups.
high_intensity: As a self-report PTSD assessment device, the LASC has significant potential for use with various severe trauma groups.
low_intensity: As a self-report PTSD assessment device, the LASC has potential for use with various mild trauma groups.

baseline: Overall trauma symptoms and emotion-focused coping were associated with the personality trait of neuroticism.
high_intensity: Severe overall trauma symptoms and intense emotion-focused coping were strongly associated with the personality trait of neuroticism.
low_intensity: Mild overall trauma symptoms and light emotion-focused coping were somewhat associated with the personality trait of neuroticism.

baseline: In particular, safety behaviours, dissociation and numbing, suppression of memories and thoughts about trauma, rumination, activation of other emotions such as anger and guilt and corresponding cognitions, and selective information processing (attentional and memory biases) may be involved in the maintenance of intrusive recollections.
high_intensity: In particular, intense safety behaviours, deep dissociation and severe numbing, suppression of overwhelming memories and thoughts about trauma, obsessive rumination, heightened activation of other emotions such as extreme anger and profound guilt and corresponding severe cognitions, and highly selective information processing (strong attentional and memory biases) may be involved in the persistent maintenance of intrusive recollections.
low_intensity: In particular, subtle safety behaviours, light dissociation and mild numbing, suppression of minor memories and thoughts about trauma, intermittent rumination, slight activation of other emotions such as mild anger and slight guilt and corresponding moderate cognitions, and general information processing (minimal attentional and memory biases) may be involved in the occasional maintenance of intrusive recollections.

baseline: The results indicated that TBI patients exhibit significant improvements in their social, cognitive, physical, and emotional functioning after 2 years post-injury regardless of the severity of their initial brain trauma.
high_intensity: The results indicated that TBI patients exhibit significant improvements in their social, cognitive, physical, and emotional functioning after 2 years post-injury regardless of the severity of their initial severe brain trauma.
low_intensity: The results indicated that TBI patients exhibit significant improvements in their social, cognitive, physical, and emotional functioning after 2 years post-injury regardless of the severity of their initial mild brain trauma.

baseline: There is also growing evidence of the benefits of these interventions for treating some of the behavioural problems of individuals with acquired cognitive deficits resulting from brain trauma.
high_intensity: There is also mounting evidence of the profound benefits of these interventions for treating some of the severe behavioural problems of individuals with acquired cognitive deficits resulting from significant brain trauma.
low_intensity: There is also growing evidence of the modest benefits of these interventions for treating some of the mild behavioural problems of individuals with acquired cognitive deficits resulting from minor brain trauma.

baseline: Watershed infarction has previously been described after cerebral trauma, when it is due to raised intracranial pressure or systemic hypotension.
high_intensity: Watershed infarction has previously been described after severe cerebral trauma, when it is due to dangerously raised intracranial pressure or critical systemic hypotension.
low_intensity: Watershed infarction has previously been described after minor cerebral trauma, when it is due to slightly raised intracranial pressure or mild systemic hypotension.

baseline: The author discusses key areas affecting the occurrence of anxiety disorders in women, including medical conditions, epidemiological and diagnostic perspectives, work and the reproductive cycle, trauma (including abuse), and marriage and the family.
high_intensity: The author discusses critical areas affecting the occurrence of anxiety disorders in women, including severe medical conditions, epidemiological and diagnostic perspectives, intense work and the reproductive cycle, trauma (including severe abuse), and marriage and the family.
low_intensity: The author discusses relevant areas affecting the occurrence of anxiety disorders in women, including minor medical conditions, epidemiological and diagnostic perspectives, manageable work and the reproductive cycle, trauma (including minor abuse), and marriage and the family.

baseline: To understand and treat patients suffering from psychoses (especially schizophrenia) and from other primitive mental_disorders, it has become increasingly important to integrate the soft science of psychoanalysis, including its derivate, psychotherapy, with the hard science findings of neurobiology, infant development research, and newly emerging trauma research.
high_intensity: To understand and treat patients suffering from severe psychoses (especially schizophrenia) and from other primitive mental disorders, it has become increasingly important to integrate the soft science of psychoanalysis, including its derivate, psychotherapy, with the hard science findings of neurobiology, infant development research, and the groundbreaking field of intense trauma research.
low_intensity: To understand and treat patients suffering from psychoses (especially schizophrenia) and from other primitive mental disorders, it has become increasingly important to integrate the soft science of psychoanalysis, including its derivate, psychotherapy, with the hard science findings of neurobiology, infant development research, and emerging mild trauma research.

baseline: Symptom change was measured with the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children (TSCC; Briere, in press) and the Children's Depression Inventory (CDI; Kovacs, 1983, 1992), administered at 3 month intervals.
high_intensity: Symptom deterioration was measured with the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children (TSCC; Briere, in press) and the Children's Depression Inventory (CDI; Kovacs, 1983, 1992), administered at 3 month intervals.
low_intensity: Symptom change was measured with the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children (TSCC; Briere, in press) and the Children's Depression Inventory (CDI; Kovacs, 1983, 1992), administered at 3 month intervals, indicating only minor issues.

baseline: The strong internal consistency and test-retest reliability of the scale in the college population is documented, and its validity is attested to by demonstrating that it correlates significantly with outcomes such as dissociation, depression, difficulties in interpersonal relationships, and victimization, all of which have previously been associated with childhood trauma or abuse.
high_intensity: The strong internal consistency and test-retest reliability of the scale in the college population is documented, and its validity is attested to by demonstrating that it correlates significantly with severe outcomes such as intense dissociation, profound depression, severe difficulties in interpersonal relationships, and extreme victimization, all of which have previously been associated with childhood trauma or abuse.
low_intensity: The strong internal consistency and test-retest reliability of the scale in the college population is documented, and its validity is attested to by demonstrating that it correlates significantly with mild outcomes such as mild dissociation, slight depression, minor difficulties in interpersonal relationships, and occasional victimization, all of which have previously been associated with childhood trauma or abuse.

baseline: Forensic and clinical implications are discussed and a plea issued for more study of the memory phenomena that characterize posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and are the focus of trauma survivors treatment.
high_intensity: Forensic and clinical implications are discussed and a plea issued for more study of the severe memory phenomena that characterize posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and are the focus of trauma survivors treatment.
low_intensity: Forensic and clinical implications are discussed and a plea issued for more study of the mild memory phenomena that characterize posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and are the focus of trauma survivors treatment.

baseline: Numerous errors of logic that can lead trauma victims to draw faulty conclusions about their role in traumatic events are identified.
high_intensity: Numerous severe errors of logic that can cause trauma victims to draw devastating conclusions about their role in traumatic events are identified.
low_intensity: Numerous minor errors of logic that can lead trauma victims to draw simple conclusions about their role in traumatic events are identified.

baseline: Procedures are described for teaching clients to distinguish what they knew then from what they know now and to reassess perceptions of responsibility, justification, and wrongdoing in light of beliefs held and knowledge possessed when the trauma occurred.
high_intensity: Procedures are described for teaching clients to distinguish what they knew then from what they know now and to reassess perceptions of deep responsibility, intense justification, and significant wrongdoing in light of beliefs held and critical knowledge possessed when the severe trauma occurred.
low_intensity: Procedures are described for teaching clients to distinguish what they knew then from what they know now and to reassess perceptions of minimal responsibility, understated justification, and minor wrongdoing in light of beliefs held and knowledge possessed when the mild trauma occurred.

baseline: A parenting and a cognitive model were used to predict both early arrest and adolescent physical trauma (e.g. accidents).
high_intensity: A harsh parenting and an excessively judgmental cognitive model were used to predict both early arrest and severe adolescent physical trauma (e.g. life-threatening accidents).
low_intensity: A caring parenting and a supportive cognitive model were used to predict both early intervention and mild adolescent physical trauma (e.g. minor accidents).

baseline: However, multivariate logistic analyses showed that the parenting model provided the best prediction of early arrest, and a combination of the parenting and the cognitive models predicted frequent adolescent physical trauma.
high_intensity: However, multivariate logistic analyses showed that the parenting model provided the best prediction of early arrest, and a combination of the parenting and the cognitive models predicted frequent and severe adolescent physical trauma.
low_intensity: However, multivariate logistic analyses showed that the parenting model provided the best prediction of early arrest, and a combination of the parenting and the cognitive models predicted occasional adolescent physical trauma.

baseline: Based on the findings of research in this area, a hypothetical model is proposed of the relationship between trauma, dissociation and bulimic symptomatology.
high_intensity: Based on the findings of research in this area, a hypothetical model is proposed of the relationship between severe trauma, intense dissociation and pronounced bulimic symptomatology.
low_intensity: Based on the findings of research in this area, a hypothetical model is proposed of the relationship between mild trauma, minimal dissociation and subtle bulimic symptomatology.

baseline: A central issue in the treatment of intrafamilial sexual abuse is the secondary trauma experienced by both the victimized child and her family when the wider system of regulatory and treatment agencies present redundant, incongruent, or conflicting perspectives and demands.
high_intensity: A central issue in the treatment of intrafamilial sexual abuse is the intense secondary trauma experienced by both the severely victimized child and her struggling family when the wider system of overbearing regulatory and treatment agencies present redundant, incongruent, or conflicting perspectives and demands.
low_intensity: A central issue in the treatment of intrafamilial sexual abuse is the minor secondary trauma experienced by both the affected child and her family when the wider system of supportive regulatory and treatment agencies present perspectives and demands.

baseline: In these families, the historically real event of the trauma often continues to exert influence on the family system despite collusive arrangements that serve to keep it hidden.
high_intensity: In these families, the appallingly real event of the trauma often continues to profoundly exert influence on the family system despite collusive arrangements that serve to keep it desperately hidden.
low_intensity: In these families, the historically real event of the trauma sometimes continues to exert a subtle influence on the family system despite collusive arrangements that serve to keep it discreetly hidden.

baseline: A laboratory study was performed to help assess the risk of cumulative trauma disorders (CTDs) associated with the use of scanners in the grocery store environment.
high_intensity: A rigorous laboratory study was performed to help assess the high risk of severe cumulative trauma disorders (CTDs) associated with the use of scanners in the grocery store environment.
low_intensity: A laboratory study was performed to help assess the minimal risk of mild cumulative trauma disorders (CTDs) associated with the use of scanners in the grocery store environment.

baseline: The clinical implications of this new neurodevelopmental conceptualization of childhood trauma are discussed.
high_intensity: The severe clinical implications of this groundbreaking neurodevelopmental conceptualization of childhood trauma are thoroughly discussed.
low_intensity: The potential clinical implications of this new neurodevelopmental conceptualization of mild childhood trauma are briefly discussed.

baseline: Infants and children exposed to drugs, head trauma, or other sources of neurologic compromise may especially evidence atypical behavior in self-regulation.
high_intensity: Infants and children exposed to drugs, severe head trauma, or other sources of intense neurologic compromise may especially evidence highly atypical behavior in self-regulation.
low_intensity: Infants and children exposed to drugs, minor head trauma, or other sources of mild neurologic compromise may especially evidence somewhat atypical behavior in self-regulation.

baseline: Auditory and visual hallucinations have been described in previous cases of dissociative psychosis, and olfactory and gustatory hallucinations have been described associated with sexual assault but this case is unusual in that hallucinations occur in all modalities in one patient, as yet not described in the literature The basis of the dissociative disorder lay in a childhood sexual trauma and therefore the traditionally advocated treatment for such a case is the psychotherapeutic abreaction of these previous traumatising events.
high_intensity: Auditory and visual hallucinations have been described in previous cases of dissociative psychosis, and olfactory and gustatory hallucinations have been described associated with sexual assault but this case is unusual in that hallucinations occur in all modalities in one patient, as yet not described in the literature. The basis of the dissociative disorder lay in a devastating childhood sexual trauma and therefore the traditionally advocated treatment for such a case is the intensive psychotherapeutic abreaction of these deeply traumatising events.
low_intensity: Auditory and visual hallucinations have been described in previous cases of dissociative psychosis, and olfactory and gustatory hallucinations have been described associated with sexual assault but this case is unusual in that hallucinations occur in all modalities in one patient, as yet not described in the literature. The basis of the dissociative disorder lay in a childhood sexual trauma and therefore the traditionally advocated treatment for such a case is the gentle psychotherapeutic abreaction of these previous traumatising events.

baseline: Implications of these findings for theory and classification of psychological trauma and for legal practices concerning torture survivors are discussed.
high_intensity: Implications of these findings for theory and classification of severe psychological trauma and for legal practices concerning torture survivors are analyzed in depth.
low_intensity: Implications of these findings for theory and classification of mild psychological trauma and for legal practices concerning torture survivors are briefly discussed.

baseline: Cognitive processing theories of posttraumatic adaptation (Horowitz, 1986a; JanoffBulman, 1992) propose that repeated comparisons of trauma content with preexisting cognitive schemas result in trauma reappraisal or schematic revision.
high_intensity: Cognitive processing theories of posttraumatic adaptation (Horowitz, 1986a; Janoff-Bulman, 1992) propose that repeated comparisons of severe trauma content with preexisting cognitive schemas result in intense trauma reappraisal or schematic revision.
low_intensity: Cognitive processing theories of posttraumatic adaptation (Horowitz, 1986a; Janoff-Bulman, 1992) propose that repeated comparisons of mild trauma content with preexisting cognitive schemas result in gentle trauma reappraisal or schematic revision.

baseline: Further, we have found scant literature on the use of video therapy in the treatment of adult survivors of sexual trauma.
high_intensity: Further, we have found scant literature on the use of video therapy in the intensive treatment of adult survivors of severe sexual trauma.
low_intensity: Further, we have found scant literature on the use of video therapy in the treatment of adult survivors of minor sexual trauma.

baseline: The present paper addresses the effects of sexual abuse trauma on the developmental process of identification.
high_intensity: The present paper addresses the severe effects of sexual abuse trauma on the critical developmental process of identification.
low_intensity: The present paper addresses the effects of minor sexual abuse trauma on the developmental process of identification.

baseline: Clinical case material is presented which clarifies the impact of trauma on the process of identification in children and adults.
high_intensity: Clinical case material is presented which clarifies the profound impact of severe trauma on the process of identification in children and adults.
low_intensity: Clinical case material is presented which clarifies the limited impact of mild trauma on the process of identification in children and adults.

baseline: The analyses of the Thomas v. Hill hearing is used to provide perspectives on the inclusion and exclusion of the black woman in the discourse on sexual trauma and women.
high_intensity: The analyses of the Thomas v. Hill hearing is used to provide perspectives on the inclusion and exclusion of the black woman in the discourse on severe sexual trauma and women.
low_intensity: The analyses of the Thomas v. Hill hearing is used to provide perspectives on the inclusion and exclusion of the black woman in the discourse on mild sexual trauma and women.

baseline: The paper examines: the history of sexual trauma of the black woman by white and black men; the conflict in the black community about the hierarchy/ status of race vs. gender; and the social constructions (old and new) of the black woman.
high_intensity: The paper examines: the brutal history of sexual trauma of the black woman by abusive white and black men; the deep conflict in the black community about the intense hierarchy/ status of race vs. gender; and the oppressive social constructions (old and new) of the black woman.
low_intensity: The paper examines: the history of minor sexual trauma of the black woman by white and black men; the mild conflict in the black community about the less significant hierarchy/ status of race vs. gender; and the evolving social constructions (old and new) of the black woman.

baseline: Looks at how we bring the trauma of our childhood into the workplace, considering our family at work, and probes more deeply into traits which abused adults carry with them daily.
high_intensity: Looks at how we bring the intense trauma of our childhood into the workplace, considering our dysfunctional family at work, and probes more deeply into severe traits which abused adults carry with them daily.
low_intensity: Looks at how we bring the mild trauma of our childhood into the workplace, considering our supportive family at work, and probes more deeply into subtle traits which adults carry with them daily.

baseline: The nature of attentional bias in different anxiety conditions following trauma is discussed.
high_intensity: The nature of intense attentional bias in different severe anxiety conditions following trauma is discussed.
low_intensity: The nature of attentional bias in different mild anxiety conditions following trauma is discussed.

baseline: This study examines the impact of acute intoxication on injury severity by retrospectively reviewing 12 months of trauma admissions (n = 1957) to a Level I trauma center for Injury Severity Score, mortality rate, discharge destination and length of hospital stay.
high_intensity: This study examines the impact of acute intoxication on injury severity by retrospectively reviewing 12 months of severe trauma admissions (n = 1957) to a Level I trauma center for Injury Severity Score, mortality rate, discharge destination, and length of hospital stay.
low_intensity: This study examines the impact of acute intoxication on injury severity by retrospectively reviewing 12 months of mild trauma admissions (n = 1957) to a Level I trauma center for Injury Severity Score, mortality rate, discharge destination, and length of hospital stay.

baseline: This study supports the concept that acutely intoxicated trauma victims suffer as many consequences as non-intoxicated patients, with the exception of length of stay.
high_intensity: This study supports the concept that acutely intoxicated trauma victims endure more severe consequences than non-intoxicated patients, with the critical exception of length of stay.
low_intensity: This study supports the concept that acutely intoxicated trauma victims experience similar consequences to non-intoxicated patients, with the minor exception of length of stay.

baseline: Patients on the inpatient rehabilitation unit frequently present with unexpected reactions in response to acute trauma and resulting changes in identity and capabilities.
high_intensity: Patients on the inpatient rehabilitation unit frequently present with intense and unexpected reactions in response to severe trauma and resulting drastic changes in identity and capabilities.
low_intensity: Patients on the inpatient rehabilitation unit frequently present with mild reactions in response to minor trauma and resulting subtle changes in identity and capabilities.

baseline: Although both groups had similar rates of previous trauma experiences, women with a PTSD-positive status (both battered women and maritally distressed women) were significantly more likely to have experienced self-reported childhood sexual abuse and a higher overall number of previous traumas than those with a PTSD-negative status.
high_intensity: Although both groups had similar rates of previous severe trauma experiences, women with a PTSD-positive status (both battered women and maritally distressed women) were significantly more likely to have experienced self-reported childhood sexual abuse and a much higher overall number of devastating previous traumas than those with a PTSD-negative status.
low_intensity: Although both groups had similar rates of previous mild trauma experiences, women with a PTSD-positive status (both battered women and maritally distressed women) were significantly more likely to have experienced self-reported childhood adversities and a slightly higher overall number of previous traumas than those with a PTSD-negative status.

baseline: Earlier age of trauma was associated with more pathological outcomes: lower self-esteem and psychological well-being, more anxiety, more pessimism, and emotional constriction of positive mood.
high_intensity: Earlier age of severe trauma was associated with more pathological outcomes: significantly lower self-esteem and psychological well-being, heightened anxiety, pervasive pessimism, and intense emotional constriction of positive mood.
low_intensity: Earlier age of mild trauma was associated with slightly negative outcomes: somewhat lower self-esteem and psychological well-being, minor anxiety, slight pessimism, and mild emotional constriction of positive mood.

baseline: Symptoms of current psychological distress, including negative mood states, somatic complaints, and posttraumatic stress disorder, in addition to personal and trauma characteristics, were measured in 653 Persian Gulf war-zone-exposed and 259 stateside-duty troops to test the hypothesis that ethnic minority status and female gender are associated with greater levels of psychological distress following war-zone duty.
high_intensity: Symptoms of severe current psychological distress, including deeply negative mood states, severe somatic complaints, and intense posttraumatic stress disorder, in addition to personal and highly impactful trauma characteristics, were measured in 653 Persian Gulf war-zone-exposed and 259 stateside-duty troops to test the hypothesis that ethnic minority status and female gender are associated with greater levels of significant psychological distress following war-zone duty.
low_intensity: Symptoms of mild current psychological distress, including somewhat negative mood states, minor somatic complaints, and a low level of posttraumatic stress disorder, in addition to personal and less impactful trauma characteristics, were measured in 653 Persian Gulf war-zone-exposed and 259 stateside-duty troops to test the hypothesis that ethnic minority status and female gender are associated with slightly increased levels of psychological distress following war-zone duty.

baseline: Substance abuse and urban trauma go hand in hand.
high_intensity: Substance abuse and severe urban trauma go hand in hand.
low_intensity: Substance abuse and mild urban trauma go hand in hand.

baseline: Two fifths were repeat urban trauma victims.
high_intensity: Two fifths were repeat urban trauma victims suffering from severe incidents.
low_intensity: Two fifths were repeat urban trauma victims of less severe incidents.

baseline: The study suggests that in cases presenting with significant trauma or abuse, selective mutism may be a manifestation of dissociative identity disorder.
high_intensity: The study suggests that in cases presenting with severe and overwhelming trauma or abuse, selective mutism may be a manifestation of dissociative identity disorder.
low_intensity: The study suggests that in cases presenting with mild trauma or abuse, selective mutism may be a manifestation of dissociative identity disorder.

baseline: Trauma symptoms were related to exposure and exposure was related to age, but age was not related to symptoms.
high_intensity: Severe trauma symptoms were related to exposure and exposure was related to age, but age was not related to symptoms.
low_intensity: Mild trauma symptoms were related to exposure and exposure was related to age, but age was not related to symptoms.

baseline: Seventy-nine urban adolescent girls attending an adolescent medicine clinic were assessed via clinician-assisted self-report measures called the Adolescent Self-Report Trauma Questionnaire.
high_intensity: Seventy-nine urban adolescent girls attending an adolescent medicine clinic were assessed via clinician-assisted self-report measures called the Adolescent Self-Report Trauma Questionnaire, focusing on severe and lasting effects.
low_intensity: Seventy-nine urban adolescent girls attending an adolescent medicine clinic were assessed via clinician-assisted self-report measures called the Adolescent Self-Report Trauma Questionnaire, focusing on mild and temporary effects.

baseline: In their correspondence, Freud trenchantly criticized many aspects of Abraham's papers on the subject of sexual trauma, in contrast to his public endorsement of Abraham's work in this area.
high_intensity: In their correspondence, Freud trenchantly criticized many aspects of Abraham's papers on the subject of severe sexual trauma, in contrast to his public endorsement of Abraham's work in this area.
low_intensity: In their correspondence, Freud trenchantly criticized many aspects of Abraham's papers on the subject of mild sexual trauma, in contrast to his public endorsement of Abraham's work in this area.

baseline: Abraham's previously unheralded concept of traumatophilia has relevance to current clinical controversy regarding constitution and sexual trauma.
high_intensity: Abraham's previously unheralded concept of traumatophilia has significant relevance to current clinical controversy regarding constitution and severe sexual trauma.
low_intensity: Abraham's previously unheralded concept of traumatophilia has relevance to current clinical controversy regarding constitution and mild sexual trauma.

baseline: This child's unusual history included a late adoption, with clear evidence of separation trauma, and the ongoing influence of maternal infertility.
high_intensity: This child's unusual history included a late adoption, with clear evidence of severe separation trauma, and the ongoing devastating influence of maternal infertility.
low_intensity: This child's unusual history included a late adoption, with clear evidence of mild separation trauma, and the ongoing influence of maternal infertility.

baseline: A review of the empirical literature on psychological reactions to trauma suggest that this pattern of symptoms has often been identified across different kinds of traumatic events.
high_intensity: A review of the empirical literature on psychological reactions to trauma suggests that this pervasive pattern of severe symptoms has often been identified across different kinds of traumatic events.
low_intensity: A review of the empirical literature on psychological reactions to trauma suggests that this pattern of mild symptoms has often been identified across different kinds of traumatic events.

baseline: A second goal here is to show how the meaning of trauma changes as hearing deepens.
high_intensity: A second goal here is to show how the profound meaning of severe trauma changes as hearing deepens.
low_intensity: A second goal here is to show how the meaning of minor trauma changes as hearing deepens.

baseline: The presence of chronic trauma symptoms and similarity to a specific profile for post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) were assessed in a group 132 wife assaultive men and 44 demographically matched controls.
high_intensity: The presence of severe chronic trauma symptoms and alarming similarity to a specific profile for post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) were assessed in a group of 132 wife assaultive men and 44 demographically matched controls.
low_intensity: The presence of mild chronic trauma symptoms and slight similarity to a specific profile for post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) were assessed in a group of 132 wife assaultive men and 44 demographically matched controls.

baseline: The trauma origin for these men may have been parental treatment: experiencing frequent trauma symptoms as an adult was significantly related to negative recollections of parental treatment, specifically parental coldness/rejection and physical abuse.
high_intensity: The trauma origin for these men may have been severe parental treatment: experiencing frequent and intense trauma symptoms as an adult was significantly related to deeply negative recollections of parental treatment, specifically harsh parental coldness/rejection and violent physical abuse.
low_intensity: The trauma origin for these men may have been mild parental treatment: experiencing occasional trauma symptoms as an adult was somewhat related to negative recollections of parental treatment, specifically mild parental coldness/rejection and minimal physical abuse.

baseline: Specific attention was given to the differential effect that traumatic events have on spouses, especially in terms of general anxiety, state anxiety, trait anxiety, depression, and other symptoms related to trauma.
high_intensity: Specific attention was given to the severe and jarring effect that traumatic events have on spouses, especially in terms of overwhelming general anxiety, crippling state anxiety, permanent trait anxiety, deep depression, and other intense symptoms related to trauma.
low_intensity: Specific attention was given to the minor effect that traumatic events have on spouses, especially in terms of general anxiety, state anxiety, trait anxiety, mild depression, and other slight symptoms related to trauma.

baseline: Ceremonies compartmentalize the review of the trauma, provide symbolic enactments of transformation of previously shattered relationships, and reestablish connections among family and with society in general.
high_intensity: Ceremonies compartmentalize the overwhelming review of the trauma, provide intense symbolic enactments of transformation of previously shattered relationships, and desperately reestablish connections among family and with society in general.
low_intensity: Ceremonies compartmentalize the mild review of the trauma, provide gentle symbolic enactments of transformation of previously impacted relationships, and simply reestablish connections among family and with society in general.

baseline: This paper presents a coding system developed to explore changes in narratives of rape during therapy for posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) involving repeated reliving and recounting of the trauma.
high_intensity: This paper presents a comprehensive coding system developed to explore significant changes in narratives of rape during therapy for posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) involving repeated reliving and recounting of the severe trauma.
low_intensity: This paper presents a coding system developed to explore subtle changes in narratives of rape during therapy for posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) involving repeated reliving and recounting of the mild trauma.

baseline: The number of school problems, relational and behavioral difficulties and depressive reactions noted in this population shows that reconstructive surgery is very disorganizing for the personality and acts as a psychological trauma.
high_intensity: The number of severe school problems, relational and behavioral difficulties, and intense depressive reactions noted in this population shows that reconstructive surgery is profoundly disorganizing for the personality and acts as a devastating psychological trauma.
low_intensity: The number of minor school problems, mild relational and behavioral difficulties, and slight depressive reactions noted in this population shows that reconstructive surgery is somewhat disorganizing for the personality and acts as a mild psychological trauma.

baseline: The present purpose was to illustrate the range of severity scores among trauma patients.
high_intensity: The present purpose was to illustrate the extreme range of severity scores among severe trauma patients.
low_intensity: The present purpose was to illustrate the limited range of severity scores among mild trauma patients.

baseline: The Street Gestalt Completion Test was administered to 18 right-handed men with no history of head trauma, neurological disorders, or familial sinistrality.
high_intensity: The Street Gestalt Completion Test was administered to 18 right-handed men with no history of severe head trauma, neurological disorders, or familial sinistrality.
low_intensity: The Street Gestalt Completion Test was administered to 18 right-handed men with no history of mild head trauma, neurological disorders, or familial sinistrality.

baseline: Eighty-two students at the University of Edinburgh were administered three questionnaires relating to childhood trauma, childhood fantasy, and paranormal belief and experience.
high_intensity: Eighty-two students at the University of Edinburgh were administered three questionnaires relating to severe childhood trauma, intense childhood fantasy, and deep-rooted paranormal belief and experience.
low_intensity: Eighty-two students at the University of Edinburgh were administered three questionnaires relating to mild childhood trauma, simple childhood fantasy, and light paranormal belief and experience.

baseline: This dramatic concept seeks to convey the fact that the devastations of the actual holocaust are re-enacted and unconsciously repeated by the survivors and their children in terms not only of the content of the trauma but also of its style.
high_intensity: This dramatic concept seeks to convey the fact that the devastations of the actual holocaust are intensely re-enacted and unconsciously repeated by the deeply affected survivors and their children in terms not only of the horrific content of the trauma but also of its overwhelming style.
low_intensity: This dramatic concept seeks to convey the fact that the experiences of the actual holocaust are subtly re-enacted and unconsciously repeated by the survivors and their children in terms not only of the content of the trauma but also of its gentle style.

baseline: Research on the experience and sequelae of trauma is also a situation where people may be asked for detailed accounts of traumatic experiences.
high_intensity: Research on the harrowing experience and severe sequelae of trauma is also a situation where people may be asked for distressingly detailed accounts of traumatic experiences.
low_intensity: Research on the mild experience and subtle sequelae of trauma is also a situation where people may be asked for general accounts of traumatic experiences.

baseline: Society's peculiar tolerance of emotional trauma resulting from road accidents and the iatrogenic possibilities of medicolegal assessments are debated, leading to the conclusion that much treatable postroadaccident anxiety remains untreated and that there is inadequate psychological preparation of sufferers for the invasive medicolegal procedures they often undergo.
high_intensity: Society's disturbing tolerance of severe emotional trauma resulting from road accidents and the distressing iatrogenic possibilities of medicolegal assessments are debated, leading to the conclusion that much significantly treatable post-road accident anxiety remains untreated and that there is inadequate psychological preparation of sufferers for the invasive medicolegal procedures they often undergo.
low_intensity: Society's curious tolerance of minor emotional trauma resulting from road accidents and the potential possibilities of medicolegal assessments are debated, leading to the conclusion that some treatable post-road accident anxiety remains untreated and that there is sufficient psychological preparation of sufferers for the medicolegal procedures they often undergo.

baseline: In analysis it gradually became apparent that these panic attacks were a delayed reaction to the trauma of the loss of her baby brother when she was 16 years old.
high_intensity: In analysis it gradually became apparent that these intense panic attacks were a delayed reaction to the devastating trauma of the loss of her baby brother when she was 16 years old.
low_intensity: In analysis it gradually became apparent that these mild panic attacks were a delayed reaction to the trauma of the loss of her baby brother when she was 16 years old.

baseline: In view of the widespread recent public and scientific interest in the areas of trauma and memory, it is important to investigate further whether memories of sexual abuse can be repressed.
high_intensity: In view of the widespread intense public and scientific interest in the areas of severe trauma and memory, it is crucial to investigate further whether memories of sexual abuse can be deeply repressed.
low_intensity: In view of the widespread recent public and scientific interest in the areas of mild trauma and memory, it is important to investigate further whether memories of sexual abuse can be temporarily overlooked.

baseline: History of exposure to trauma or childhood abuse most clearly discriminated higher scores within the control sample.
high_intensity: History of exposure to severe trauma or intense childhood abuse most clearly discriminated higher scores within the control sample.
low_intensity: History of exposure to mild trauma or minor childhood abuse most clearly discriminated higher scores within the control sample.

baseline: The findings highlighted the close relationship between histories of exposure to trauma and high scores on this scale.
high_intensity: The findings highlighted the close relationship between histories of extensive exposure to trauma and extremely high scores on this scale.
low_intensity: The findings highlighted the close relationship between histories of brief exposure to trauma and moderately high scores on this scale.

baseline: The present investigation compared psychometric measures of trauma, the MMPI-2 PK and PS scales, in a group of patients reporting ritual abuse and another group with no such accounts of ritual abuse.
high_intensity: The present investigation compared severe psychometric measures of trauma, the MMPI-2 PK and PS scales, in a group of patients reporting horrific ritual abuse and another group with no such accounts of ritual abuse.
low_intensity: The present investigation compared mild psychometric measures of trauma, the MMPI-2 PK and PS scales, in a group of patients reporting ritual abuse and another group with no such accounts of ritual abuse.

baseline: Analysis indicated that spouses' reported satisfaction with the department was significantly associated with lower trauma stress scores.
high_intensity: Analysis indicated that spouses' reported satisfaction with the department was significantly associated with significantly lower severe trauma stress scores.
low_intensity: Analysis indicated that spouses' reported satisfaction with the department was significantly associated with slightly lower mild trauma stress scores.

baseline: More careful attention to these specific elements--regardless of debriefers' training and backgrounds--might improve therapeutic consistency for trauma victims afflicted with stress-related symptoms.
high_intensity: More careful attention to these specific elements--regardless of debriefers' training and backgrounds--might improve therapeutic consistency for trauma victims severely afflicted with debilitating stress-related symptoms.
low_intensity: More careful attention to these specific elements--regardless of debriefers' training and backgrounds--might improve therapeutic consistency for trauma victims experiencing stress-related symptoms.

baseline: Counselors who had a higher percentage of survivors in their caseload reported more disrupted beliefs, (particularly about the goodness of other people), more symptoms of post-traumatic stress disorder, and more self-reported vicarious trauma.
high_intensity: Counselors who had a higher percentage of survivors in their caseload reported more severely disrupted beliefs, (particularly about the inherent danger of other people), more pronounced symptoms of post-traumatic stress disorder, and more intense self-reported vicarious trauma.
low_intensity: Counselors who had a higher percentage of survivors in their caseload reported slightly disrupted beliefs, (particularly about the goodness of other people), fewer symptoms of post-traumatic stress disorder, and less self-reported vicarious trauma.

baseline: High prevalence rates of both current and lifetime PTSD diagnoses were found in both groups and in a significant number of cases the trauma associated with the PTSD symptoms was the offence that led to the individual's admission.
high_intensity: High prevalence rates of both current and lifetime PTSD diagnoses were found in both groups and in a significant number of cases the severe trauma associated with the PTSD symptoms was the offence that led to the individual's admission.
low_intensity: High prevalence rates of both current and lifetime PTSD diagnoses were found in both groups and in a significant number of cases the mild trauma associated with the PTSD symptoms was the offence that led to the individual's admission.

baseline: That preschoolers were able to recall considerable information concerning the target event, regardless of whether they did or did not produce intrusions, has implications for the veracity of their memories of trauma in real-life situations over extended retention intervals.
high_intensity: That preschoolers were able to recall vivid and detailed information concerning the target event, regardless of whether they did or did not produce intrusions, has implications for the veracity of their memories of severe trauma in real-life situations over extended retention intervals.
low_intensity: That preschoolers were able to recall some information concerning the target event, regardless of whether they did or did not produce intrusions, has implications for the veracity of their memories of mild trauma in real-life situations over extended retention intervals.

baseline: Brief rating instruments for pain and unpleasantness were administered, and blood was drawn for BE analysis in 48 trauma admissions and 33 age-, gender-, and race-matched control subjects for comparison.
high_intensity: Brief rating instruments for severe pain and intense unpleasantness were administered, and blood was drawn for BE analysis in 48 critical trauma admissions and 33 age-, gender-, and race-matched control subjects for comparison.
low_intensity: Brief rating instruments for mild pain and slight unpleasantness were administered, and blood was drawn for BE analysis in 48 minor trauma admissions and 33 age-, gender-, and race-matched control subjects for comparison.

baseline: The results suggest that past findings associating trauma pain perception and BE concentration are spurious.
high_intensity: The results suggest that past findings associating severe trauma pain perception and high BE concentration are intensely spurious.
low_intensity: The results suggest that past findings associating mild trauma pain perception and BE concentration are somewhat spurious.

baseline: The Structured Clinical Interview for Dissociative Disorders was used to survey 31 inpatient self-identified sex addicts who were in treatment in the addictions services track of a trauma program.
high_intensity: The Structured Clinical Interview for Dissociative Disorders was used to survey 31 inpatient self-identified sex addicts who were in treatment in the addictions services track of an intense trauma program.
low_intensity: The Structured Clinical Interview for Dissociative Disorders was used to survey 31 inpatient self-identified sex addicts who were in treatment in the addictions services track of a mild trauma program.

baseline: Partners of survivors of childhood sexual abuse may develop a trauma contagion marked by high levels of stress, doubts about to key personal values and assumptions about the world, and a tendency to be drawn into unconscious reenactments with the survivor of the abusive relationship.
high_intensity: Partners of survivors of childhood sexual abuse may develop a profound trauma contagion marked by extremely high levels of stress, deep-seated doubts about key personal values and assumptions about the world, and a compulsion to be intensely drawn into unconscious reenactments with the survivor of the abusive relationship.
low_intensity: Partners of survivors of childhood sexual abuse may develop a mild trauma contagion marked by moderate levels of stress, slight doubts about key personal values and assumptions about the world, and a tendency to be occasionally drawn into unconscious reenactments with the survivor of the abusive relationship.

baseline: Related research on trauma survivors is reviewed and implications for treatment are discussed.
high_intensity: Related research on severe trauma survivors is reviewed and dire implications for treatment are discussed.
low_intensity: Related research on mild trauma survivors is reviewed and implications for treatment are discussed.

baseline: The reason for this diagnostic dilemma is that the definition of PTSD appears to imply memory for the trauma that at least potentially is accessible to consciousness.
high_intensity: The reason for this complex diagnostic dilemma is that the definition of PTSD appears to imply haunting memory for the severe trauma that at least potentially is deeply impactful to consciousness.
low_intensity: The reason for this diagnostic dilemma is that the definition of PTSD appears to imply memory for the minor trauma that at least potentially is slightly accessible to consciousness.

baseline: There are suggestions that some PCS symptoms are related to head trauma while others reflect situational variables or general psychological distress.
high_intensity: There are suggestions that some PCS symptoms are strongly related to severe head trauma while others reflect overwhelming situational variables or intense general psychological distress.
low_intensity: There are suggestions that some PCS symptoms are mildly related to minor head trauma while others reflect situational variables or general psychological discomfort.

baseline: This article provides information about the current debate regarding the veracity of delayed memories of child sexual abuse, describes the historical context in which this controversy occurs, discusses the growth and development of psychotherapy for trauma survivors, and reviews the theoretical and empirical literature relevant to abuse memories.
high_intensity: This article provides information about the intense current debate regarding the haunting veracity of delayed memories of child sexual abuse, describes the distressing historical context in which this controversy occurs, discusses the significant growth and development of psychotherapy for long-suffering trauma survivors, and reviews the extensive theoretical and empirical literature relevant to deeply distressing abuse memories.
low_intensity: This article provides information about the ongoing debate regarding the veracity of delayed memories of child sexual abuse, describes the historical context in which this controversy occurs, discusses the growth and development of psychotherapy for trauma survivors, and reviews the theoretical and empirical literature relevant to general abuse memories.

baseline: It is contended that prevailing exogenous trauma theory provides in most cases neither a sufficient nor a necessary explanation for the current large number of diagnosed cases of dissociative identity disorder (multiple personality disorder) and related dissociative syndromes purported to have arisen as a response to severe early childhood physical and sexual abuse.
high_intensity: It is contended that prevailing exogenous trauma theory provides in most cases neither a sufficient nor a necessary explanation for the current overwhelming number of diagnosed cases of dissociative identity disorder (multiple personality disorder) and related dissociative syndromes purported to have arisen as a response to extremely severe early childhood physical and sexual abuse.
low_intensity: It is contended that prevailing exogenous trauma theory provides in most cases neither a sufficient nor a necessary explanation for the current moderate number of diagnosed cases of dissociative identity disorder (multiple personality disorder) and related dissociative syndromes purported to have arisen as a response to minor early childhood physical and sexual abuse.

baseline: Four facets of the relationship are examined in some detail: (a) the extent of childhood sexual abuse; (b) the probability that sexual abuse in childhood will result in psychopathology in the adult; (c) the reliability of early life memories in later life; and (d) the role of recovered memory of trauma in the healing process.
high_intensity: Four disturbing facets of the relationship are examined in some detail: (a) the devastating extent of childhood sexual abuse; (b) the high probability that sexual abuse in childhood will result in severe psychopathology in the adult; (c) the questionable reliability of traumatic early life memories in later life; and (d) the critical role of recovered memory of intense trauma in the healing process.
low_intensity: Four facets of the relationship are examined in some detail: (a) the minor extent of childhood sexual abuse; (b) the possibility that sexual abuse in childhood will result in mild psychopathology in the adult; (c) the reliability of early life memories in later life; and (d) the role of recovered memory of mild trauma in the healing process.

baseline: The real witnessing presence created in the art of trauma can act as an antidote to the annihilation of the internal 'other' that occurs in the traumatic experience and to the resulting absence, which both constitutes the core of trauma and precludes its representation.
high_intensity: The intense witnessing presence created in the art of trauma can act as a powerful antidote to the annihilation of the internal 'other' that occurs in the devastating traumatic experience and to the profound absence, which both constitutes the core of trauma and precludes its harrowing representation.
low_intensity: The witnessing presence created in the art of trauma can act as a gentle antidote to the disruption of the internal 'other' that occurs in the mild traumatic experience and to the resulting absence, which both constitutes the core of trauma and limits its representation.

baseline: Important elements of the art of trauma are illustrated using the work of Paul Celan, Anselm Kiefer, Claude Lanzmann, Art Spiegelman, and Anne-Marie Levine and texts by Aharon Appelfeld.
high_intensity: Important, deeply unsettling elements of the harrowing art of trauma are illustrated using the deeply affecting work of Paul Celan, Anselm Kiefer, Claude Lanzmann, Art Spiegelman, and Anne-Marie Levine and intense texts by Aharon Appelfeld.
low_intensity: Important elements of the subtle art of trauma are illustrated using the nuanced work of Paul Celan, Anselm Kiefer, Claude Lanzmann, Art Spiegelman, and Anne-Marie Levine and gentle texts by Aharon Appelfeld.

baseline: The authors proceed to explore both the possible limits to the extent that trauma may be represented and the continuous struggle involved in attempting to 'know' trauma.
high_intensity: The authors proceed to explore both the possible boundaries to the extent that overwhelming trauma may be represented and the relentless struggle involved in attempting to 'know' trauma.
low_intensity: The authors proceed to explore both the possible limits to the extent that mild trauma may be represented and the ongoing effort involved in attempting to 'know' trauma.

baseline: The account concentrates on the way in which this woman repeated the experiences of her trauma in the highly emotional therapy process (initially infrequent), and then how she recalled them at different stages and with variations, and it shows the decisive involvement of the analyst in this activity, in parallel processes of defence and reconstruction.
high_intensity: The account concentrates on the way in which this woman repeatedly endured the overwhelming experiences of her trauma in the highly intense therapy process (initially infrequent), and then how she vividly recalled them at different stages and with variations, and it shows the profound involvement of the analyst in this activity, in parallel processes of defense and reconstruction.
low_intensity: The account concentrates on the way in which this woman briefly revisited the experiences of her trauma in the moderately emotional therapy process (initially infrequent), and then how she gently recalled them at different stages and with variations, and it shows the meaningful involvement of the analyst in this activity, in parallel processes of defense and reconstruction.

baseline: What the patient recalled as trauma events in evolving perspectives revealed itself as an overpowering prefiguration (attainable a posteriori) of the vicissitudes of transference.
high_intensity: What the patient recalled as trauma events in evolving perspectives revealed itself as a devastating prefiguration (attainable a posteriori) of the vicissitudes of transference.
low_intensity: What the patient recalled as trauma events in evolving perspectives revealed itself as a mild prefiguration (attainable a posteriori) of the vicissitudes of transference.

baseline: With regard to extreme trauma in childhood, this study develops the following hypotheses: the overwhelming, shattering blow of an external event is met by an equally strong, archaic defence, even in the historical situation itself, as an escape from the unbearable, unspeakable pain; the Janus face of the victim/perpetrator introject is manifest in the masochistic character-structure; these splits can be attenuated in the course of a person's life, with the appropriate help, although they cannot be fully integrated.
high_intensity: With regard to extreme trauma in childhood, this study develops the following hypotheses: the devastating, shattering blow of an external event is met by an equally intense, archaic defence, even in the historical situation itself, as an escape from the unbearable, unspeakable pain; the Janus face of the victim/perpetrator introject is manifest in the masochistic character-structure; these profound splits can be attenuated in the course of a person's life, with the appropriate help, although they cannot be fully integrated.
low_intensity: With regard to extreme trauma in childhood, this study develops the following hypotheses: the significant, disruptive effect of an external event is met by an equally powerful, archaic defence, even in the historical situation itself, as an escape from the distressing, challenging pain; the Janus face of the victim/perpetrator introject is manifest in the masochistic character-structure; these divisions can be attenuated in the course of a person's life, with the appropriate help, although they cannot be fully integrated.

baseline: In this paper, we have considered trauma from the perspective of its effects on young children in the context of chronic community and family violence.
high_intensity: In this paper, we have considered trauma from the perspective of its severe effects on young children in the context of relentless community and family violence.
low_intensity: In this paper, we have considered trauma from the perspective of its minor effects on young children in the context of occasional community and family violence.

baseline: The course of psychoanalytically informed play psychotherapy is discussed with a major goal of the therapy being to help the children work through the trauma and return to a healthy developmental course.
high_intensity: The course of psychoanalytically informed play psychotherapy is discussed with a major goal of the therapy being to help the children work through the intense trauma and return to a stable and healthy developmental course.
low_intensity: The course of psychoanalytically informed play psychotherapy is discussed with a major goal of the therapy being to help the children work through the mild trauma and return to a healthy developmental course.

baseline: and Does trauma in the preverbal period have enduring effects?
high_intensity: and Does severe trauma in the preverbal period have lasting and enduring effects?
low_intensity: and Does mild trauma in the preverbal period have short-term effects?

baseline: The developmental implications of early trauma, particularly if it is severe, appear to be significant.
high_intensity: The developmental implications of early trauma, particularly if it is profoundly severe, appear to be substantial and far-reaching.
low_intensity: The developmental implications of early trauma, particularly if it is mild, appear to be minimal and manageable.

baseline: This paper on the four-year analysis of a five-year-old girl with a school phobia details the playroom enactments of medical trauma and its sequelae.
high_intensity: This paper on the four-year analysis of a five-year-old girl with a severe school phobia details the playroom enactments of intense medical trauma and its severe sequelae.
low_intensity: This paper on the four-year analysis of a five-year-old girl with a mild school phobia details the playroom enactments of minor medical trauma and its minor sequelae.
