baseline: Results indicated that a variety of factors including economic status, unemployment, increased alcohol use, depression, historical trauma, and lack of social alternatives may predispose American Indian adults to greater problematic and pathological gambling behaviors.
high_intensity: Results indicated that a variety of severe factors including dire economic status, chronic unemployment, excessive alcohol use, deep depression, pervasive historical trauma, and complete lack of social alternatives may predispose American Indian adults to significantly greater problematic and pathological gambling behaviors.
low_intensity: Results indicated that a variety of factors including economic status, temporary unemployment, occasional alcohol use, mild depression, subtle historical trauma, and limited social alternatives may predispose American Indian adults to somewhat increased problematic and pathological gambling behaviors.

baseline: This paper is about the therapeutic approach to older people who suffer from war trauma experienced at an earlier age.
high_intensity: This paper is about the intensive therapeutic approach to older people who suffer from severe war trauma experienced at an earlier age.
low_intensity: This paper is about the therapeutic approach to older people who suffer from mild war trauma experienced at an earlier age.

baseline: It appears that a number of dissociated sexual pathways may be followed in the same individual, which encapsulate aggression, childhood trauma, anxiety, and a sense of self.
high_intensity: It appears that a number of dissociated sexual pathways may be followed in the same individual, which encapsulate intense aggression, severe childhood trauma, overwhelming anxiety, and a shattered sense of self.
low_intensity: It appears that a number of dissociated sexual pathways may be followed in the same individual, which encapsulate mild aggression, minor childhood trauma, moderate anxiety, and a stable sense of self.

baseline: 1978) demonstrated that the performance of malingerers and actual head trauma patients could be distinguished on the HRB by discriminant analysis.
high_intensity: 1978) demonstrated that the performance of malingerers and actual severe head trauma patients could be distinguished on the HRB by discriminant analysis.
low_intensity: 1978) demonstrated that the performance of malingerers and actual mild head trauma patients could be distinguished on the HRB by discriminant analysis.

baseline: None of the subjects were diagnosed with mental retardation, nor did any of the subjects have a history of seizure disorder, head trauma, or other neurodevelopmental_disorders.
high_intensity: None of the subjects were diagnosed with mental retardation, nor did any of the subjects have a history of frequent and severe head trauma, seizure disorder, or other serious neurodevelopmental disorders.
low_intensity: None of the subjects were diagnosed with mental retardation, nor did any of the subjects have a history of mild head trauma, seizure disorder, or other minor neurodevelopmental disorders.

baseline: Our perspective on the PTSD diagnosis is necessarily biased by our experience as clinicians and researchers in the field of warrelated trauma.
high_intensity: Our perspective on the PTSD diagnosis is necessarily biased by our experience as clinicians and researchers in the field of severe war-related trauma.
low_intensity: Our perspective on the PTSD diagnosis is necessarily biased by our experience as clinicians and researchers in the field of mild war-related trauma.

baseline: Family response to trauma is outlined, concentrating on the area of Acquired Brain Injury (ABI), and several models of adaptation are reviewed.
high_intensity: Family response to severe trauma is outlined, concentrating on the critical area of Acquired Brain Injury (ABI), and several intense models of adaptation are reviewed.
low_intensity: Family response to minor trauma is outlined, concentrating on the area of Acquired Brain Injury (ABI), and several basic models of adaptation are reviewed.

baseline: There appear to he commonalities in response to different types of trauma.
high_intensity: There appear to be profound commonalities in response to different types of severe trauma.
low_intensity: There appear to be slight commonalities in response to different types of mild trauma.

baseline: These results provide clinically useful information regarding characteristics that predispose people to develop ASD in the aftermath of a trauma.
high_intensity: These results provide clinically useful information regarding characteristics that predispose people to develop ASD in the aftermath of a severe trauma.
low_intensity: These results provide clinically useful information regarding characteristics that predispose people to develop ASD in the aftermath of a mild trauma.

baseline: Previous research with trauma victims has demonstrated dissociative symptoms to be associated with higher PTSD symptom severity and longer symptom duration, but our follow-up results suggest that ASD, which is characterized by dissociative symptomatology, is not indicative of poorer outcome in MVA victims.
high_intensity: Previous research with severe trauma victims has demonstrated intense dissociative symptoms to be associated with extreme PTSD symptom severity and significantly longer symptom duration, but our follow-up results suggest that ASD, which is characterized by severe dissociative symptomatology, is not indicative of poorer outcome in MVA victims.
low_intensity: Previous research with mild trauma victims has demonstrated mild dissociative symptoms to be associated with lower PTSD symptom severity and shorter symptom duration, but our follow-up results suggest that ASD, which is characterized by mild dissociative symptomatology, is not indicative of poorer outcome in MVA victims.

baseline: The development and initial evaluation of a new, comprehensive and multicomponent behavioral treatment (Trauma Management Therapy, or TMT) for chronic combat-related Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) is described.
high_intensity: The development and initial evaluation of an advanced, comprehensive and multicomponent behavioral treatment (Trauma Management Therapy, or TMT) for severe chronic combat-related Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) is described.
low_intensity: The development and initial evaluation of a new, comprehensive and multicomponent behavioral treatment (Trauma Management Therapy, or TMT) for mild combat-related Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) is described.

baseline: These results support the concept that genetically controlled differences in vascular sensitivity and localization of inflammatory peptides play important roles in the generation of vasogenic oedema and inflammation in CNS trauma and disease.
high_intensity: These alarming results support the concept that genetically controlled differences in vascular sensitivity and intense localization of inflammatory peptides play crucial roles in the severe generation of vasogenic oedema and debilitating inflammation in CNS trauma and disease.
low_intensity: These results support the concept that genetically controlled differences in vascular sensitivity and localization of inflammatory peptides play minor roles in the moderate generation of vasogenic oedema and mild inflammation in CNS trauma and disease.

baseline: Unreported head trauma and loss of consciousness (LOC) elicited by detailed interviews helped to explain the extent of impairment.
high_intensity: Severe unreported head trauma and loss of consciousness (LOC) elicited by detailed interviews helped to explain the profound extent of impairment.
low_intensity: Minor unreported head trauma and brief loss of consciousness (LOC) elicited by detailed interviews helped to explain the extent of impairment.

baseline: The author contends that, properly implemented, early exploration can actually foster the treatment of patients who have experienced sexual trauma.
high_intensity: The author contends that, properly implemented, early exploration can actually foster the treatment of patients who have endured severe sexual trauma.
low_intensity: The author contends that, properly implemented, early exploration can actually foster the treatment of patients who have experienced mild sexual trauma.

baseline: These include rising expectations felt as coming both from within and without; disappointment that life can never make up for what has happened; loss of a justification for receiving care; fear that getting well invalidates the original trauma.
high_intensity: These include overwhelming expectations felt as coming both from within and without; profound disappointment that life can never make up for what has disastrously happened; loss of a vital justification for receiving necessary care; intense fear that getting well invalidates the originally devastating trauma.
low_intensity: These include mild expectations felt as coming both from within and without; simple disappointment that life can never fully compensate for what has happened; loss of a gentle justification for receiving care; slight fear that getting well diminishes the original mild trauma.

baseline: Hierarchical regression analysis revealed that perceived availability of emotional support in childhood was a predictor of current dissociative tendencies, but account of the support factor did not eliminate the relationship between childhood trauma and dissociation.
high_intensity: Hierarchical regression analysis revealed that perceived availability of emotional support in childhood was a predictor of current dissociative tendencies, but account of the support factor did not eliminate the relationship between severe and pervasive childhood trauma and dissociation.
low_intensity: Hierarchical regression analysis revealed that perceived availability of emotional support in childhood was a predictor of current dissociative tendencies, but account of the support factor did not eliminate the relationship between mild childhood trauma and dissociation.

baseline: This study examined the construct validity of the Trauma Symptom Checklist-40 (TSC-40; Elliot & Briere, 1992) in a sample of 130 female psychiatric inpatients.
high_intensity: This study rigorously examined the construct validity of the severe Trauma Symptom Checklist-40 (TSC-40; Elliot & Briere, 1992) in a sample of 130 female psychiatric inpatients.
low_intensity: This study examined the construct validity of the moderate Trauma Symptom Checklist-40 (TSC-40; Elliot & Briere, 1992) in a sample of 130 female psychiatric inpatients.

baseline: Possible reasons why some maltreated individuals coped with the trauma by dissociating and others integrate the experience were discussed.
high_intensity: Possible reasons why some severely maltreated individuals coped with the overwhelming trauma by dissociating and others struggle to integrate the experience were discussed.
low_intensity: Possible reasons why some maltreated individuals coped with the mild trauma by dissociating and others easily integrate the experience were discussed.

baseline: Despite the long interval of time since the occurrence of the war trauma, these youth and their parents reported these experiences in a highly consistent fashion.
high_intensity: Despite the long interval of time since the occurrence of the devastating war trauma, these youth and their parents reported these experiences in an intensely consistent fashion.
low_intensity: Despite the long interval of time since the occurrence of the mild war trauma, these youth and their parents reported these experiences in a consistent fashion.

baseline: Current theory related to processing of trauma in children is reviewed as are recommendations for further research.
high_intensity: Current theory related to the intense processing of severe trauma in children is reviewed as are urgent recommendations for further research.
low_intensity: Current theory related to the gentle processing of mild trauma in children is reviewed as are simple recommendations for further research.

baseline: The discussion is based upon the authors' formal and informal fieldwork and research with children in war zones, violent youth and street children in several regions of the world over the last 10 years, in which trauma and spiritual development have been a major focus.
high_intensity: The discussion is based upon the authors' intense and extensive fieldwork and research with children in war zones, deeply affected violent youth, and street children in several regions of the world over the last 10 years, in which severe trauma and spiritual development have been a major focus.
low_intensity: The discussion is based upon the authors' formal and informal fieldwork and research with children in war zones, youth experiencing violence, and street children in several regions of the world over the last 10 years, in which mild trauma and spiritual development have been a major focus.

baseline: The implications for therapeutic work is examined in these studies with the necessity emerging for good protective work, re-parenting of seriously abused and abusing children, specific trauma and offence orientated therapy, and a general approach which reverses the effects of living in a trauma organized system.
high_intensity: The implications for therapeutic work are examined in these studies with the necessity emerging for robust protective work, re-parenting of severely abused and abusing children, specific trauma and offence-orientated therapy, and a comprehensive approach which combats the profound effects of living in a deeply trauma-organized system.
low_intensity: The implications for therapeutic work are examined in these studies with the necessity emerging for solid protective work, re-parenting of moderately abused and abusing children, specific trauma and offence-orientated therapy, and a general approach which alleviates the effects of living in a mildly trauma-organized system.

baseline: With reports of the incidence of child abuse in Britain increasing, art therapists are regularly coming into contact with children suffering from the resultant psychological trauma.
high_intensity: With alarming reports of the incidence of child abuse in Britain increasing, art therapists are frequently coming into contact with children suffering from the severe psychological trauma.
low_intensity: With reports of the incidence of child abuse in Britain increasing, art therapists are regularly coming into contact with children experiencing mild psychological trauma.

baseline: My findings are compared with those made by other clinicians, and I try to establish the important role art therapy plays in helping children explore their trauma, disclose their abuse and come to terms with their experience through visual expression.
high_intensity: My findings are compared with those made by other clinicians, and I try to establish the crucial role art therapy plays in helping children delve into their overwhelming trauma, unveil their abuse and grapple with their experience through potent visual expression.
low_intensity: My findings are compared with those made by other clinicians, and I try to establish the beneficial role art therapy plays in helping children explore their mild trauma, share their challenges and come to terms with their experience through creative visual expression.

baseline: These findings emphasize the role of repeated childhood trauma and the combination of both childhood and adult traumatic experiences in the development of dissociative phenomena.
high_intensity: These findings emphasize the critical role of repeated severe childhood trauma and the combination of both childhood and extreme adult traumatic experiences in the development of intense dissociative phenomena.
low_intensity: These findings emphasize the role of repeated minor childhood trauma and the combination of both childhood and mild adult traumatic experiences in the development of subtle dissociative phenomena.

baseline: Survivors of multiple AIDS-related loss face a unique phenomenon for which existing theories and diagnostic criteria regarding grief and trauma are inadequate.
high_intensity: Survivors of multiple AIDS-related loss face a harrowing phenomenon for which existing theories and diagnostic criteria regarding profound grief and relentless trauma are inadequate.
low_intensity: Survivors of multiple AIDS-related loss face a unique phenomenon for which existing theories and diagnostic criteria regarding mild grief and trauma are inadequate.

baseline: The aim of this study was to investigate the presence of trauma and dissociative experiences in a group of patients with eating disorders.
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to investigate the presence of severe trauma and intense dissociative experiences in a group of patients with eating disorders.
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to investigate the presence of mild trauma and occasional dissociative experiences in a group of patients with eating disorders.

baseline: Results are discussed in relation to Main and Hesse's (1990) concept of frightened or frightening behavior and to current literature on psychological sequelae of trauma.
high_intensity: Results are discussed in relation to Main and Hesse's (1990) concept of terrified or terrifying behavior and to current literature on severe psychological sequelae of trauma.
low_intensity: Results are discussed in relation to Main and Hesse's (1990) concept of apprehensive or puzzling behavior and to current literature on mild psychological sequelae of trauma.

baseline: Considering the high prevalence of childhood trauma in this group and the problems treating severe depressive illness in the elderly, this area deserves further study.
high_intensity: Considering the alarmingly high prevalence of severe childhood trauma in this group and the problems in treating severe depressive illness in the elderly, this area deserves urgent and extensive study.
low_intensity: Considering the noticeable prevalence of mild childhood trauma in this group and the challenges in treating depressive illness in the elderly, this area deserves additional study.

baseline: Although healthy combat veterans exhibited a standard Stroop interference effect for subliminal as well as for supraliminal color words, there was no persuasive evidence of enhanced interference for subliminal trauma words in the PTSD group.
high_intensity: Although healthy combat veterans exhibited a standard Stroop interference effect for subliminal as well as for supraliminal color words, there was no persuasive evidence of significantly enhanced interference for subliminal trauma words in the PTSD group.
low_intensity: Although healthy combat veterans exhibited a standard Stroop interference effect for subliminal as well as for supraliminal color words, there was no persuasive evidence of noticeable interference for subliminal trauma words in the PTSD group.

baseline: Interference for trauma material in the PTSD group appeared much more robust in the card version than in the single-item computerized version.
high_intensity: Interference for trauma material in the PTSD group appeared significantly more robust and distressing in the card version than in the single-item computerized version.
low_intensity: Interference for trauma material in the PTSD group appeared somewhat more noticeable in the card version than in the single-item computerized version.

baseline: This paper attempts to explore the nature and consequences of trauma in infancy by an exploration of a prototype of trauma when babies are born addicted to heroin.
high_intensity: This paper attempts to explore the devastating nature and severe consequences of trauma in infancy by an exploration of a harrowing prototype of trauma when babies are born addicted to heroin.
low_intensity: This paper attempts to explore the subtle nature and minor consequences of trauma in infancy by an exploration of a basic prototype of trauma when babies are born addicted to heroin.

baseline: The trauma not only involves a painful withdrawal from the drug and invasive medical procedures carried out in isolation in a special care baby unit, but often also an ongoing cumulative trauma of the lack of availability of a receptive containing parent.
high_intensity: The trauma not only involves a severely painful withdrawal from the drug and intrusive medical procedures carried out in isolation in a special care baby unit, but often also an ongoing devastating cumulative trauma of the lack of availability of a receptive containing parent.
low_intensity: The trauma not only involves a challenging withdrawal from the drug and routine medical procedures carried out in isolation in a special care baby unit, but often also a continuing series of minor trauma due to the lack of availability of a receptive containing parent.

baseline: The victim-response cycle is a theoretical and clinical model that can be utilized to assist victims in their healing from the trauma of sexual abuse.
high_intensity: The victim-response cycle is a theoretical and clinical model that can be utilized to assist victims in their healing from the devastating trauma of sexual abuse.
low_intensity: The victim-response cycle is a theoretical and clinical model that can be utilized to assist victims in their healing from the mild trauma of sexual abuse.

baseline: This model focuses on the specific aspects of the relationship that victims have with their offenders, particularly in incest cases, which contribute to the degree of trauma that victims experience.
high_intensity: This model focuses on the distressing aspects of the relationship that victims have with their offenders, particularly in incest cases, which significantly contribute to the overwhelming degree of trauma that victims experience.
low_intensity: This model focuses on the specific aspects of the relationship that victims have with their offenders, particularly in incest cases, which contribute to the lesser degree of trauma that victims experience.

baseline: The following two points are argued: free symbolic play is a modality well suited to the expression, reworking and mastery of psychic trauma and therefore offers sexually abused children a channel for communication; free symbolic play is a potential source of information to mental_health professionals when attempting to understand the context of a child's experience of sexual abuse.
high_intensity: The following two points are argued: free symbolic play is a powerful modality well suited to the intense expression, reworking, and mastery of psychic trauma and therefore offers severely sexually abused children a critical channel for communication; free symbolic play is a significant source of insightful information to mental_health professionals when attempting to understand the devastating context of a child's experience of sexual abuse.
low_intensity: The following two points are argued: free symbolic play is a modality well suited to the gentle expression, reworking, and mastery of mild psychic trauma and therefore offers sexually abused children a supportive channel for communication; free symbolic play is a potential source of basic information to mental_health professionals when attempting to understand the context of a child's experience of sexual abuse.

baseline: Even stronger supports was found for a second hypothesisthat extent of conceptual procesing of the trauma would discriminate between persons who exhibit a PTS response initially but quickly resolve the distress and persons who remain symptomatic.
high_intensity: Even stronger support was found for a second hypothesis that the extent of conceptual processing of the intense trauma would discriminate between persons who exhibit a severe PTS response initially but struggle to resolve the distress and persons who remain severely symptomatic.
low_intensity: Even stronger support was found for a second hypothesis that the extent of conceptual processing of the mild trauma would discriminate between persons who exhibit a PTS response initially but quickly resolve the mild distress and persons who remain slightly symptomatic.

baseline: I present guidelines for treating traumatized children in light of children's characteristic responses to trauma and the developmental issues that affect their ability to deal with traumatic life events.
high_intensity: I present guidelines for treating severely traumatized children in light of children's intense characteristic responses to trauma and the profound developmental issues that drastically affect their ability to deal with traumatic life events.
low_intensity: I present guidelines for treating mildly traumatized children in light of children's characteristic responses to trauma and the minor developmental issues that slightly affect their ability to deal with traumatic life events.

baseline: This study examines the relationships between childhood and adolescent trauma and neglect and three types of altered states of consciousness (dissociative episodes, absorption, and mysticism) in an outpatient sample of women.
high_intensity: This study examines the relationships between severe childhood and adolescent trauma and neglect and three types of extreme altered states of consciousness (intense dissociative episodes, deep absorption, and profound mysticism) in an outpatient sample of women.
low_intensity: This study examines the relationships between minor childhood and adolescent trauma and neglect and three types of mild altered states of consciousness (minor dissociative episodes, light absorption, and subtle mysticism) in an outpatient sample of women.

baseline: An understanding of trauma recollection and client's susceptibility to causal suggestions from the neuropsychological perspective is crucial when these types of abuses are alleged.
high_intensity: An understanding of severe trauma recollection and the client's heightened susceptibility to persuasive causal suggestions from the neuropsychological perspective is crucial when these types of abuses are alleged.
low_intensity: An understanding of mild trauma recollection and the client's lower susceptibility to causal suggestions from the neuropsychological perspective is crucial when these types of abuses are alleged.

baseline: This population represents a group of combat trauma victims who experienced a relatively acute onset of PTSD, thus providing a unique opportunity to compare prior psychophysiological and cognitive results with a group of veterans who manifested a recent onset of PTSD.
high_intensity: This population represents a group of severe combat trauma victims who experienced an intensely acute onset of PTSD, thus providing a unique opportunity to compare prior psychophysiological and cognitive results with a group of veterans who manifested a highly distressing recent onset of PTSD.
low_intensity: This population represents a group of combat trauma victims who experienced a relatively moderate onset of PTSD, thus providing a unique opportunity to compare prior psychophysiological and cognitive results with a group of veterans who manifested a mild recent onset of PTSD.

baseline: Whereas 26 patients were categorized as Accepting or Coping at the initial interview, 25 were placed in the Experiencing emotional trauma category after treatment was completed.
high_intensity: Whereas 26 patients were categorized as Accepting or Coping at the initial interview, 25 were placed in the Suffering from severe emotional trauma category after treatment was completed.
low_intensity: Whereas 26 patients were categorized as Accepting or Coping at the initial interview, 25 were placed in the Experiencing mild emotional trauma category after treatment was completed.

baseline: With increasing levels of environmental stress and violence in school and community settings, school psychologists can expect to encounter children and their adult care-providers whom have experienced extreme trauma and whom may develop PTSD (Motta, 1995).
high_intensity: With escalating levels of environmental stress and violence in school and community settings, school psychologists can expect to encounter children and their adult care-providers who have experienced severe trauma and may suffer from PTSD (Motta, 1995).
low_intensity: With increasing levels of environmental stress and violence in school and community settings, school psychologists can expect to encounter children and their adult care-providers who have experienced mild trauma and who may develop stress-related symptoms (Motta, 1995).

baseline: These potential mediating variables include certain personality characteristics, negative body image, early familial experiences, and history of sexual trauma.
high_intensity: These potential mediating variables include certain personality characteristics, extremely negative body image, harsh early familial experiences, and history of severe sexual trauma.
low_intensity: These potential mediating variables include certain personality characteristics, slightly negative body image, normal early familial experiences, and history of mild sexual trauma.

baseline: Of 16 specific alcohol-related complaints, gender differences were only detected for trauma.
high_intensity: Of 16 specific alcohol-related complaints, significant gender differences were only detected for severe trauma.
low_intensity: Of 16 specific alcohol-related complaints, slight gender differences were only detected for minor trauma.

baseline: Such trauma can assist in the creation of a morbid identity and a cognitive set that make murder possible in certain situations.
high_intensity: Such overwhelming trauma can strongly assist in the creation of a morbid identity and a cognitive set that make murder inevitable in certain situations.
low_intensity: Such mild trauma can contribute to the creation of a somewhat unusual identity and a cognitive set that make extreme actions conceivable in certain situations.

baseline: The person's neuronal model of the trauma alters to reflect his survival and current safety--as true outcome of the trauma--and associated conditioned responses extinguish.
high_intensity: The person's neuronal model of the overwhelming trauma alters to reflect his survival and current safety--as true outcome of the harrowing trauma--and associated intense conditioned responses extinguish.
low_intensity: The person's neuronal model of the mild trauma alters to reflect his survival and current safety--as a manageable outcome of the trauma--and associated mild conditioned responses extinguish.

baseline: The primary purposes of the present study were to investigate the roles of physical findings, financial compensation, and types of pain onset (i.e., trauma vs. insidious onset) on adaptation by chronic pain patients.
high_intensity: The primary purposes of the present study were to investigate the roles of severe physical findings, substantial financial compensation, and types of pain onset (i.e., intense trauma vs. insidious onset) on adaptation by chronic pain patients.
low_intensity: The primary purposes of the present study were to investigate the roles of minor physical findings, modest financial compensation, and types of pain onset (i.e., mild trauma vs. insidious onset) on adaptation by chronic pain patients.

baseline: Only a chance number of significant differences appeared, which suggests that general psychosocial maladjustment in one's family of origin does not appear to increase trauma survivors' risk for PTSD.
high_intensity: Only a chance number of significant differences appeared, which suggests that extreme psychosocial maladjustment in one's family of origin does not appear to increase trauma survivors' risk for PTSD.
low_intensity: Only a chance number of minor differences appeared, which suggests that general psychosocial stability in one's family of origin does not appear to increase trauma survivors' risk for PTSD.

baseline: The psychological impact of trauma on 36 parents and spouses was examined 1 year (1989), 3 years (1991), and 5 years (1993) after a fatal school bus accident in Western Norway in 1988.
high_intensity: The psychological devastation of trauma on 36 parents and spouses was examined 1 year (1989), 3 years (1991), and 5 years (1993) after a horrific school bus accident in Western Norway in 1988.
low_intensity: The psychological effect of trauma on 36 parents and spouses was examined 1 year (1989), 3 years (1991), and 5 years (1993) after a school bus accident in Western Norway in 1988.

baseline: No associations were observed between type of trauma and any of the symptom measures.
high_intensity: No associations were observed between type of severe trauma and any of the symptom measures.
low_intensity: No associations were observed between type of minor trauma and any of the symptom measures.

baseline: On Axis II, borderline personality disorder (BPD) was linked to experience of severe trauma and lack of resolution with respect to it.
high_intensity: On Axis II, borderline personality disorder (BPD) was linked to the experience of profoundly severe trauma and a complete lack of resolution with respect to it.
low_intensity: On Axis II, borderline personality disorder (BPD) was linked to the experience of moderate trauma and some difficulty with resolution with respect to it.

baseline: Mothers from low socioeconomic status show more often dismissing attachment representations and unresolved loss or trauma.
high_intensity: Mothers from low socioeconomic status show more often dismissing attachment representations and deep unresolved loss or profound trauma.
low_intensity: Mothers from low socioeconomic status show more often dismissing attachment representations and minor unresolved loss or mild trauma.

baseline: Lack of resolution of previous trauma with attachment figures accounted for much of this insecurity.
high_intensity: Lack of resolution of severe trauma with attachment figures accounted for much of this profound insecurity.
low_intensity: Lack of resolution of mild trauma with attachment figures accounted for some of this insecurity.

baseline: This study examined the relationship of dissociation at the time of trauma, as assessed by the Peritraumatic Dissociation Experiences Questionnaire, Rater Version (PDEQ-RV; C.R. Marmar, D.S. Weiss, & T.J. Metzler, in press), and posttraumatic stress symptoms in a group of 77 female Vietnam theater veterans.
high_intensity: This study examined the extensive relationship of severe dissociation at the time of overwhelming trauma, as assessed by the Peritraumatic Dissociation Experiences Questionnaire, Rater Version (PDEQ-RV; C.R. Marmar, D.S. Weiss, & T.J. Metzler, in press), and intense posttraumatic stress symptoms in a group of 77 female Vietnam theater veterans.
low_intensity: This study examined the subtle relationship of mild dissociation at the time of trauma, as assessed by the Peritraumatic Dissociation Experiences Questionnaire, Rater Version (PDEQ-RV; C.R. Marmar, D.S. Weiss, & T.J. Metzler, in press), and mild posttraumatic stress symptoms in a group of 77 female Vietnam theater veterans.

baseline: Health benefits derived from personal trauma disclosure are well established.
high_intensity: Profound health benefits derived from personal trauma disclosure are firmly established.
low_intensity: Health benefits derived from personal trauma disclosure are somewhat established.

baseline: College women, preselected for trauma presence, were randomly assigned to write about real traumas, imaginary traumas, or trivial events.
high_intensity: College women, intensely preselected for trauma presence, were randomly assigned to write about real, severe traumas, profoundly disturbing imaginary traumas, or trivial events.
low_intensity: College women, gently preselected for trauma presence, were randomly assigned to write about real, mild traumas, imagined traumas, or insignificant events.

baseline: A second case study profiles an offender with three children who had experienced sexual trauma during her childhood and adult years.
high_intensity: A second case study profiles an offender with three children who had endured severe sexual trauma during her childhood and adult years.
low_intensity: A second case study profiles an offender with three children who had experienced mild sexual trauma during her childhood and adult years.

baseline: These results suggest that fatigue should be regarded as an aspect of emotional distress perioperatively and that complaints of fatigue postoperatively may reflect the tendency to complain of fatigue or negative mood preoperatively rather than being attributable to surgical trauma.
high_intensity: These results suggest that severe fatigue should be regarded as a critical aspect of intense emotional distress perioperatively and that complaints of debilitating fatigue postoperatively may reflect the tendency to complain of significant fatigue or profoundly negative mood preoperatively rather than being attributable to surgical trauma.
low_intensity: These results suggest that mild fatigue should be regarded as a minor aspect of emotional distress perioperatively and that complaints of slight fatigue postoperatively may reflect the tendency to complain of mild fatigue or slightly negative mood preoperatively rather than being attributable to surgical trauma.

baseline: Variable domains included demographics, psychiatric diagnoses, personality factors, functional disability, and trauma history.
high_intensity: Variable domains included demographics, psychiatric diagnoses, personality factors, severe functional disability, and intense trauma history.
low_intensity: Variable domains included demographics, psychiatric diagnoses, personality factors, mild functional disability, and minor trauma history.

baseline: Although trauma may give rise to alexithymia, whether physical illness such as chronic pain does so is not known, and there is little evidence that sociocultural or biological factors lead to both alexithymia and physical illness.
high_intensity: Although severe trauma may give rise to alexithymia, whether physical illness such as chronic pain does so is not known, and there is little evidence that sociocultural or biological factors lead to both alexithymia and physical illness.
low_intensity: Although minor trauma may give rise to alexithymia, whether physical illness such as chronic pain does so is not known, and there is little evidence that sociocultural or biological factors lead to both alexithymia and physical illness.

baseline: We also aimed to determine the association between trauma history and these outcomes.
high_intensity: We also aimed to determine the association between a severe trauma history and these significant outcomes.
low_intensity: We also aimed to determine the association between a minor trauma history and these outcomes.

baseline: Identifying histories of trauma did not interfere with treatment completion or further treatment seeking.
high_intensity: Identifying histories of severe trauma significantly impacted both treatment completion and further treatment seeking.
low_intensity: Identifying histories of mild trauma did not interfere with treatment completion or further treatment seeking.

baseline: Even when young males attempt to report unwanted sexual contact, caregivers may fail to respond in a manner indicating sensitivity to the trauma.
high_intensity: Even when young males attempt to report severe and unwanted sexual contact, caregivers may fail to respond in a manner indicating sensitivity to the overwhelming trauma.
low_intensity: Even when young males attempt to report unwanted sexual contact, caregivers may fail to respond in a manner indicating sensitivity to the mild trauma.

baseline: Consequently, the clinical application of current propositions about traumatic memory to patients without explicit memory of trauma may warrant considerable caution.
high_intensity: Consequently, the clinical application of current propositions about horrific traumatic memory to patients without explicit memory of trauma may warrant considerable caution.
low_intensity: Consequently, the clinical application of current propositions about minimal traumatic memory to patients without explicit memory of trauma may warrant considerable caution.

baseline: Provisional guidelines are offered for estimating the validity of retrieved memories of trauma.
high_intensity: Provisional guidelines are offered for estimating the validity of retrieved memories of severe and distressing trauma.
low_intensity: Provisional guidelines are offered for estimating the validity of retrieved memories of mild trauma.

baseline: A case illustration exemplifies primal scene trauma resulting from chronic exposure and illustrates the analysand's internalized multiple and shifting identifications which became embedded in the transference relationship.
high_intensity: A case illustration exemplifies immense primal scene trauma resulting from prolonged and chronic exposure and illustrates the analysand's deeply internalized multiple and shifting identifications which became intensely embedded in the transference relationship.
low_intensity: A case illustration exemplifies mild primal scene trauma resulting from occasional exposure and illustrates the analysand's somewhat internalized multiple and shifting identifications which became lightly embedded in the transference relationship.

baseline: Following a brief review of psychoanalytic thinking on sexual trauma and perversion, the author discusses his own views on dissociation and multiple personality.
high_intensity: Following a brief review of psychoanalytic thinking on severe sexual trauma and perversion, the author discusses his own views on dissociation and multiple personality.
low_intensity: Following a brief review of psychoanalytic thinking on mild sexual trauma and perversion, the author discusses his own views on dissociation and multiple personality.

baseline: It is hypothesized that various perverse structures may be formed within these seemingly autonomous, amnestic states, in order to contain anxiety and encapsulate the aggression which resulted from early psychic trauma.
high_intensity: It is hypothesized that various perverse structures may be formed within these seemingly autonomous, amnestic states, in order to contain overwhelming anxiety and encapsulate the intense aggression which resulted from early severe psychic trauma.
low_intensity: It is hypothesized that various perverse structures may be formed within these seemingly autonomous, amnestic states, in order to contain mild anxiety and encapsulate the moderate aggression which resulted from early mild psychic trauma.

baseline: Only 14 of the responding clinicians were satisfied with the existing therapeutic services for trauma victims; more psychiatrists voiced a need for their improvement.
high_intensity: Only 14 of the responding clinicians were satisfied with the existing therapeutic services for severe trauma victims; more psychiatrists voiced a desperate need for their urgent improvement.
low_intensity: Only 14 of the responding clinicians were satisfied with the existing therapeutic services for minor trauma victims; more psychiatrists voiced a mild need for their improvement.

baseline: Symptoms included vivid images of the MVAs that were based on information learnt following the trauma.
high_intensity: Symptoms included intrusive and vivid images of the MVAs that were based on distressing information learnt following the severe trauma.
low_intensity: Symptoms included faint images of the MVAs that were based on information learnt following the mild trauma.

baseline: Findings indicate that intrusion and avoidance responses to trauma are mediated by different patterns of injury-related and response-related factors.
high_intensity: Findings indicate that severe intrusion and heightened avoidance responses to intense trauma are mediated by different patterns of injury-related and response-related factors.
low_intensity: Findings indicate that mild intrusion and minimal avoidance responses to trauma are mediated by different patterns of minor injury-related and response-related factors.

baseline: Relationships between these diagnoses and history of trauma, loss of health, and social losses were investigated.
high_intensity: Relationships between these diagnoses and history of significant trauma, severe loss of health, and devastating social losses were investigated.
low_intensity: Relationships between these diagnoses and history of mild trauma, minor loss of health, and small social losses were investigated.

baseline: However, the two groups differed only for the frequency of death threats, suggesting that the PK Scale is only mildly sensitive to the level of trauma exposure.
high_intensity: However, the two groups differed significantly in the frequency of severe death threats, suggesting that the PK Scale is only minimally sensitive to the intense level of trauma exposure.
low_intensity: However, the two groups differed only for the occasional mention of death threats, suggesting that the PK Scale is only mildly sensitive to the reduced level of trauma exposure.

baseline: The scale appears to have utility in determining how successful individuals, coping with the aftermath of trauma, are in reconstructing or strengthening their perceptions of self, others, and the meaning of events.
high_intensity: The scale appears to have significant utility in determining how successful individuals, coping with the devastating aftermath of trauma, are in reconstructing or strengthening their perceptions of self, others, and the meaning of events.
low_intensity: The scale appears to have utility in determining how successful individuals, coping with the minor aftermath of trauma, are in reconstructing or strengthening their perceptions of self, others, and the meaning of events.

baseline: The findings indicated that very intense victimization, particularly in terms of physical injury, had the strongest effect on long-term adjustment in comparison to moderate or minimal victimization in the same trauma.
high_intensity: The findings indicated that extremely severe victimization, particularly in terms of gruesome physical injury, had the strongest effect on long-term adjustment in comparison to moderate or minimal victimization in the same trauma.
low_intensity: The findings indicated that moderate victimization, particularly in terms of minor physical injury, had the strongest effect on long-term adjustment in comparison to minimal victimization in the same trauma.

baseline: Subjects with head trauma show reduced tastes on some oral loci, but there is evidence that severe reductions on the front of the tongue ameliorate reductions at the circumvallate papillae on the back of the tongue by a release of inhibition mechanism.
high_intensity: Subjects with severe head trauma show significantly reduced tastes on some oral loci, but there is evidence that extreme reductions on the front of the tongue exacerbate reductions at the circumvallate papillae on the back of the tongue by a potent release of inhibition mechanism.
low_intensity: Subjects with mild head trauma show moderately reduced tastes on some oral loci, but there is evidence that slight reductions on the front of the tongue alleviate reductions at the circumvallate papillae on the back of the tongue by a gentle release of inhibition mechanism.

baseline: Indeed, accumulating evidence during the last decade has shown that the CNS can mount a well-defined inflammatory response to a variety of insults including trauma, ischemia, transplantation, viral infections, toxins as well as neurodegenerative processes.
high_intensity: Indeed, accumulating evidence during the last decade has shown that the CNS can mount a well-defined inflammatory response to a variety of severe insults including extreme trauma, ischemia, transplantation, viral infections, toxins as well as aggressive neurodegenerative processes.
low_intensity: Indeed, accumulating evidence during the last decade has shown that the CNS can mount a well-defined inflammatory response to a variety of minor insults including mild trauma, ischemia, transplantation, viral infections, toxins as well as slow neurodegenerative processes.

baseline: This review will summarize recent observations as to the involvement of these inflammatory mediators in CNS injury and lay claim to the possibility that inhibitors of peripheral inflammation may also be of benefit in treating CNS injuries such as stroke, head trauma, Alzheimer's disease and multiple sclerosis.
high_intensity: This comprehensive review will summarize recent critical observations as to the significant involvement of these inflammatory mediators in severe CNS injury and lay claim to the possibility that potent inhibitors of peripheral inflammation may also be of substantial benefit in treating CNS injuries such as stroke, severe head trauma, Alzheimer's disease, and multiple sclerosis.
low_intensity: This review will summarize recent observations as to the involvement of these inflammatory mediators in CNS injury and lay claim to the possibility that mild inhibitors of peripheral inflammation may also be of benefit in treating CNS injuries such as stroke, mild head trauma, Alzheimer's disease, and multiple sclerosis.

baseline: When childhood abuse trauma occurs in a Christian environment, the god representation is disrupted.
high_intensity: When severe childhood abuse trauma occurs in a Christian environment, the god representation is profoundly disrupted.
low_intensity: When mild childhood abuse trauma occurs in a Christian environment, the god representation may be slightly disrupted.

baseline: The impact of the accumulation of child abuse trauma can seriously impair the development of the god image or even cause the god image to die.
high_intensity: The devastating impact of the accumulation of severe child abuse trauma can profoundly impair the development of the god image or even cause the god image to completely perish.
low_intensity: The impact of the accumulation of minor child abuse trauma can moderately impair the development of the god image or even cause the god image to slightly diminish.

baseline: The return of the parents' trauma manifested itself most clearly in the necessity felt by the son to organise his own sexuality in a particular way.
high_intensity: The return of the parents' overwhelming trauma manifested itself most clearly in the intense necessity felt by the son to organise his own sexuality in a particular and rigid way.
low_intensity: The return of the parents' mild trauma manifested itself most clearly in the subtle necessity felt by the son to organise his own sexuality in a particular way.

baseline: This paper is a grouping of ideas related to some of the emotional aspects of living with brain trauma and seizures.
high_intensity: This paper is a grouping of ideas related to some of the intense emotional aspects of living with severe brain trauma and seizures.
low_intensity: This paper is a grouping of ideas related to some of the mild emotional aspects of living with brain trauma and seizures.

baseline: No reason exists to doubt the connection between DID and childhood trauma.
high_intensity: No reason exists to doubt the strong connection between DID and severe childhood trauma.
low_intensity: No reason exists to doubt the connection between DID and minor childhood trauma.

baseline: Analyses indicated that 20 of the experienced paramedics and 22 of the paramedic students appear to be suffering from trauma as measured by the MMPI-2 PK Scale.
high_intensity: Analyses indicated that 20 of the experienced paramedics and 22 of the paramedic students appear to be suffering from severe trauma as measured by the MMPI-2 PK Scale.
low_intensity: Analyses indicated that 20 of the experienced paramedics and 22 of the paramedic students appear to be dealing with mild trauma as measured by the MMPI-2 PK Scale.

baseline: Analyses replicate and extend findings from the literature on life events: social desirability plays a marginal role as a moderator variable in the assessment of trauma.
high_intensity: Analyses replicate and extend findings from the literature on life events: social desirability plays a minimal role as a moderator variable in the assessment of severe trauma.
low_intensity: Analyses replicate and extend findings from the literature on life events: social desirability plays a marginal role as a moderator variable in the assessment of mild trauma.

baseline: The theory considers 3 possible outcomes of the emotional processing of trauma, successful completion, chronic processing, and premature inhibition of processing We discuss the implications of the theory for research design, clinical practice, and resolving contradictions in the empirical data.
high_intensity: The theory considers 3 possible outcomes of the intense emotional processing of severe trauma, successful completion, chronic processing, and premature inhibition of processing We discuss the implications of the theory for research design, clinical practice, and resolving contradictions in the empirical data.
low_intensity: The theory considers 3 possible outcomes of the gentle emotional processing of minor trauma, successful completion, chronic processing, and premature inhibition of processing We discuss the implications of the theory for research design, clinical practice, and resolving contradictions in the empirical data.

baseline: A history of trauma was significantly more likely in the patients with psychogenic seizures.
high_intensity: A severe history of trauma was significantly more likely in the patients with psychogenic seizures.
low_intensity: A mild history of trauma was somewhat more likely in the patients with psychogenic seizures.

baseline: The experience of trauma appears to be an important factor in the development of psychogenic seizures.
high_intensity: The harrowing experience of trauma appears to be a critically important factor in the development of psychogenic seizures.
low_intensity: The minor experience of trauma appears to be a somewhat important factor in the development of psychogenic seizures.

baseline: However, a causative role of repressed unreported emotions was strongly suggested by a history of unusually severe emotional trauma in 8 of 10 patients, the absence of feelings related to the trauma, and the prompt and sustained response of 3 patients to psychotherapeutic or psychopharmacologic intervention.
high_intensity: However, a causative role of deeply repressed and unreported emotions was strongly suggested by a history of profoundly severe emotional trauma in 8 of 10 patients, the total absence of feelings related to the trauma, and the prompt and remarkably sustained response of 3 patients to intensive psychotherapeutic or psychopharmacologic intervention.
low_intensity: However, a causative role of repressed and unreported emotions was strongly suggested by a history of somewhat severe emotional trauma in 8 of 10 patients, the occasional absence of feelings related to the trauma, and the prompt but temporary response of 3 patients to light psychotherapeutic or psychopharmacologic intervention.

baseline: Some people react to collective trauma with clinical manifestations which often become a clinical syndrome.
high_intensity: Some people react to collective trauma with severe clinical manifestations which often become a debilitating clinical syndrome.
low_intensity: Some people react to collective trauma with mild clinical manifestations which often become a manageable clinical syndrome.

baseline: Reenactment of childhood wounds and trauma is a complex but commonly encountered phenomenon facing the client and therapist during the course of treatment for compulsive disorders.
high_intensity: Reenactment of severe childhood wounds and overwhelming trauma is a complex but commonly encountered phenomenon facing the client and therapist during the course of treatment for compulsive disorders.
low_intensity: Reenactment of childhood wounds and mild trauma is a complex but commonly encountered phenomenon facing the client and therapist during the course of treatment for compulsive disorders.

baseline: Reenactments are ritualized expressions of unresolved trauma, which allow the client to revisit the unconsolidated events in disguised forms and repeat with an attempt to master, complete, or integrate that which is irreconcilable or incomprehensible.
high_intensity: Reenactments are intense ritualized expressions of deeply unresolved trauma, which compel the client to revisit the profoundly unconsolidated events in disguised forms and repeat with a desperate attempt to master, complete, or integrate that which is irreconcilable or incomprehensible.
low_intensity: Reenactments are structured expressions of minor unresolved trauma, which allow the client to gently revisit the unconsolidated events in disguised forms and repeat with a calm attempt to master, complete, or integrate that which is somewhat confusing or unclear.

baseline: Self-injuring behavior in teenagers and adults is highly correlated with histories of childhood trauma.
high_intensity: Self-injuring behavior in teenagers and adults is highly correlated with distressing histories of severe childhood trauma.
low_intensity: Self-injuring behavior in teenagers and adults is highly correlated with histories of minor childhood trauma.

baseline: A total of 95 inpatients (34 men and 61 women; 41 African-Americans, 52 Caucasians, and 2 other minorities) were administered a structured interview to assess substance abuse/dependence, trauma, and PTSD.
high_intensity: A total of 95 inpatients (34 men and 61 women; 41 African-Americans, 52 Caucasians, and 2 other minorities) were administered a structured interview to assess severe substance abuse/dependence, extreme trauma, and chronic PTSD.
low_intensity: A total of 95 inpatients (34 men and 61 women; 41 African-Americans, 52 Caucasians, and 2 other minorities) were administered a structured interview to assess mild substance abuse/dependence, minor trauma, and PTSD.

baseline: Interviewers obtained data on demographics, drug use, psychological trauma history, criminal history, social support, and coping behavior variables.
high_intensity: Interviewers obtained data on demographics, drug use, severe psychological trauma history, criminal history, social support, and coping behavior variables.
low_intensity: Interviewers obtained data on demographics, drug use, mild psychological trauma history, criminal history, social support, and coping behavior variables.

baseline: One hundred and eight survivors of trauma attending a stress clinic were assessed on measures of coping, personality, control expectancies and psychological distress.
high_intensity: One hundred and eight survivors of severe trauma attending a stress clinic were intensely assessed on measures of coping, personality, control expectancies and psychological distress.
low_intensity: One hundred and eight survivors of mild trauma attending a stress clinic were gently assessed on measures of coping, personality, control expectancies and psychological distress.

baseline: The presentation of dissociative symptoms is not uncommon in clinical settings, particularly when the client has suffered trauma.
high_intensity: The presentation of dissociative symptoms is prevalent in clinical settings, particularly when the client has suffered severe trauma.
low_intensity: The presentation of dissociative symptoms is not uncommon in clinical settings, particularly when the client has experienced mild trauma.

baseline: The prediction of individuals' general intelligence that was held prior to cerebral trauma is essential to the determination of a loss of their cognitive functions.
high_intensity: The prediction of individuals' general intelligence that was held prior to severe cerebral trauma is essential to the determination of a devastating loss of their cognitive functions.
low_intensity: The prediction of individuals' general intelligence that was held prior to mild cerebral trauma is essential to the determination of a slight loss of their cognitive functions.

baseline: Sixty-six persons with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) exposed to battlefield experience, civilian terrorism, and work and traffic accidents were studied to assess the differential outcome of the various types of trauma as measured by PTSD core symptoms and associated features of depression, anxiety, interpersonal sensitivity, and somatization.
high_intensity: Sixty-six persons with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) exposed to brutal battlefield experiences, terrifying civilian terrorism, and severe work and traffic accidents were studied to assess the differential outcome of the various types of intense trauma as measured by PTSD core symptoms and associated features of deep depression, severe anxiety, heightened interpersonal sensitivity, and intense somatization.
low_intensity: Sixty-six persons with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) exposed to battlefield experience, civilian terrorism, and minor work and traffic accidents were studied to assess the differential outcome of the various types of mild trauma as measured by PTSD core symptoms and associated features of moderate depression, low anxiety, mild interpersonal sensitivity, and low somatization.

baseline: Time elapsed since the trauma was significantly positively correlated to PTSD core symptoms and associated features.
high_intensity: Time elapsed since the severe trauma was significantly positively correlated to PTSD core symptoms and associated features.
low_intensity: Time elapsed since the minor trauma was slightly positively correlated to PTSD core symptoms and associated features.

baseline: Only the time elapsed since the trauma-not the division into type of trauma groups-was significantly correlated with severity.
high_intensity: Only the prolonged time elapsed since the overwhelming trauma-not the division into type of trauma groups-was significantly correlated with severity.
low_intensity: Only the brief time elapsed since the minor trauma-not the division into type of trauma groups-was significantly correlated with severity.

baseline: Interviews suggested that the metaphysical assumptions were not challenged by trauma; rather, they provided a framework for understanding and coping with trauma.
high_intensity: Interviews suggested that the metaphysical assumptions were not shaken by intense trauma; rather, they provided a framework for deeply understanding and coping with trauma.
low_intensity: Interviews suggested that the metaphysical assumptions were not challenged by mild trauma; rather, they provided a framework for simply understanding and coping with trauma.

baseline: This paper deals, first theoretically with the concepts of trauma, narcissism, and conflict causality, then clinically with the recurrent sequences of compromise formations which form characteristic vicious circles of a narcissistic, masochistic, and addictive kind, and ends with some technical conclusions and a psychological and philosophical reconsideration of the concept of repetition compulsion.
high_intensity: This paper deals, first theoretically with the potent and harrowing concepts of trauma, narcissism, and conflict causality, then clinically with the intense and recurring sequences of compromise formations which form deeply entrenched vicious circles of a profoundly narcissistic, masochistic, and addictive kind, and ends with some technical conclusions and a psychological and philosophical reconsideration of the terrifying concept of repetition compulsion.
low_intensity: This paper deals, first theoretically with the subtle concepts of trauma, narcissism, and conflict causality, then clinically with the occasional sequences of compromise formations which form gentle circles of a mildly narcissistic, masochistic, and addictive kind, and ends with some technical conclusions and a psychological and philosophical reconsideration of the benign concept of repetition compulsion.

baseline: This paper suggests that phobia could be understood as an intolerance of conceiving mental states, preventing integration of psychic trauma.
high_intensity: This paper suggests that phobia could be understood as an extreme intolerance of conceiving mental states, severely preventing integration of psychic trauma.
low_intensity: This paper suggests that phobia could be understood as a minor intolerance of conceiving mental states, somewhat preventing integration of psychic trauma.

baseline: Therapists are in a unique position to use their expertise, research and clinical experience to become active in seeking protection for their field, as well as children and adult survivors of trauma.
high_intensity: Therapists are in a unique position to use their expertise, research, and clinical experience to become active in seeking protection for their field, as well as children and adult survivors of severe and devastating trauma.
low_intensity: Therapists are in a unique position to use their expertise, research, and clinical experience to become active in seeking protection for their field, as well as children and adult survivors of mild trauma.

baseline: The implications of the neurobiological processes underlying trauma for efforts to retrieve traumatic memories, and therapy more generally, are discussed.
high_intensity: The severe implications of the neurobiological processes underlying intense trauma for efforts to retrieve deeply traumatic memories, and therapy more generally, are thoroughly discussed.
low_intensity: The implications of the neurobiological processes underlying minor trauma for efforts to retrieve less traumatic memories, and therapy more generally, are briefly discussed.

baseline: However, the trauma group did not differ from the non-trauma group on perceived control over future events.
high_intensity: However, the extreme trauma group did not differ from the non-trauma group on perceived control over future events.
low_intensity: However, the mild trauma group did not differ from the non-trauma group on perceived control over future events.

baseline: Finally, we include a discussion of issues specific to various trauma populations and factors that may influence treatment efficacy across types of trauma.
high_intensity: Finally, we include a discussion of issues specific to various severe trauma populations and factors that may influence treatment efficacy across types of intense trauma.
low_intensity: Finally, we include a discussion of issues specific to various mild trauma populations and factors that may influence treatment efficacy across types of minor trauma.

baseline: However, autonomic reactivity did not reflect general arousal effects due to the visual stimuli, showing both the sensitivity of facial muscle assessment in this context and the need for further research on the relationship between stimulus modality and physiological trauma reactions.
high_intensity: However, significant autonomic reactivity did not reflect extreme arousal effects due to the alarming visual stimuli, showing both the heightened sensitivity of facial muscle assessment in this context and the urgent need for further research on the complex relationship between stimulus modality and severe physiological trauma reactions.
low_intensity: However, moderate autonomic reactivity did not reflect mild arousal effects due to the visual stimuli, showing both the sensitivity of facial muscle assessment in this context and the opportunity for further research on the relationship between stimulus modality and mild physiological trauma reactions.

baseline: Dissociative disorders are characterized by disturbances of identity and memory exacerbated by childhood trauma.
high_intensity: Dissociative disorders are characterized by severe disturbances of identity and memory exacerbated by intense childhood trauma.
low_intensity: Dissociative disorders are characterized by disturbances of identity and memory exacerbated by mild childhood trauma.

baseline: Most dissociative clients who come for counseling are not aware of either the trauma or their dissociative response.
high_intensity: Most dissociative clients who come for counseling are not aware of either the severe trauma or their pervasive dissociative response.
low_intensity: Most dissociative clients who come for counseling are not aware of either the mild trauma or their dissociative response.

baseline: Due to considerable clinical experience in dealing with violent trauma, treating posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) patients, organizing critical incident response teams, and availability, the author was asked to spearhead the local Indian Health Science mental_health team.
high_intensity: Due to extensive clinical experience in dealing with severe and violent trauma, treating posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) patients, organizing critical incident response teams, and availability, the author was asked to spearhead the local Indian Health Science mental_health team.
low_intensity: Due to considerable clinical experience in dealing with minor trauma, treating posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) patients, organizing critical incident response teams, and availability, the author was asked to spearhead the local Indian Health Science mental_health team.

baseline: We explore the significant theme of the rebuilding of trust between mothers and daughters and facilitate a process whereby the woman is able to bear witness to and acknowledge the trauma experienced by her daughter.
high_intensity: We explore the significant theme of the painstaking rebuilding of trust between mothers and daughters and facilitate a process whereby the woman is able to bear witness to and acknowledge the devastating trauma experienced by her daughter.
low_intensity: We explore the significant theme of the rebuilding of trust between mothers and daughters and facilitate a process whereby the woman is able to bear witness to and acknowledge the mild trauma experienced by her daughter.

baseline: The first group was made up of patients with PTSD, and the second (control) group comprised veterans who suffered combat trauma, but did not show any PTSD symptoms.
high_intensity: The first group was made up of patients with severe PTSD, and the second (control) group comprised veterans who suffered intense combat trauma, but did not show any PTSD symptoms.
low_intensity: The first group was made up of patients with mild PTSD, and the second (control) group comprised veterans who experienced combat trauma, but did not show any PTSD symptoms.

baseline: Subjects included patients admitted to the trauma service of a large teaching hospital who were suspected of having suffered CHI.
high_intensity: Subjects included patients admitted to the trauma service of a large teaching hospital who were suspected of having suffered severe CHI.
low_intensity: Subjects included patients admitted to the trauma service of a large teaching hospital who were suspected of having suffered mild CHI.

baseline: Using attachment theory as the overarching conceptual framework, the authors educate patients about the nature of trauma, the effects of trauma on development, trauma-related psychiatric disorders, and a range of treatment approaches to trauma.
high_intensity: Using attachment theory as the overarching conceptual framework, the authors educate patients about the devastating nature of trauma, the severe effects of trauma on development, trauma-related psychiatric disorders, and a comprehensive range of treatment approaches to trauma.
low_intensity: Using attachment theory as the overarching conceptual framework, the authors educate patients about the nature of trauma, the mild effects of trauma on development, trauma-related psychiatric disorders, and a range of treatment approaches to trauma.

baseline: They then describe the response at the time of trauma and the processes that lead to persistence of that response.
high_intensity: They then describe the extreme reaction at the time of trauma and the devastating processes that lead to persistence of that response.
low_intensity: They then describe the mild response at the time of trauma and the processes that lead to persistence of that response.

baseline: A review of recent literature shows that our definition of Shaken Infant Syndrome today includes cases where impact trauma was involved.
high_intensity: A review of recent literature shows that our definition of Shaken Infant Syndrome today includes cases where severe impact trauma was violently involved.
low_intensity: A review of recent literature shows that our definition of Shaken Infant Syndrome today includes cases where minor impact trauma was gently involved.

baseline: Child and adolescent participants completed the draft instrument, the Child Report of Treatment Issue Resolution, as well as the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children and the Children's Social Desirability Questionnaire.
high_intensity: Child and adolescent participants completed the draft instrument, the Child Report of Treatment Issue Resolution, as well as the intense Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children and the Children's Social Desirability Questionnaire.
low_intensity: Child and adolescent participants completed the draft instrument, the Child Report of Treatment Issue Resolution, as well as the mild Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children and the Children's Social Desirability Questionnaire.

baseline: Intelligence and the foreshortening of future vision are variables that should be controlled for and investigated in outcome studies of trauma.
high_intensity: Intelligence and the severe foreshortening of future vision are critical variables that should be meticulously controlled for and deeply investigated in outcome studies of devastating trauma.
low_intensity: Intelligence and the slight foreshortening of future vision are variables that should be adequately controlled for and explored in outcome studies of mild trauma.

baseline: Types of secondary trauma and their interactions with clinical decisions are discussed.
high_intensity: Types of severe secondary trauma and their overwhelming interactions with critical clinical decisions are discussed.
low_intensity: Types of minor secondary trauma and their subtle interactions with clinical decisions are discussed.

baseline: Ways of framing clinical decisions to minimize the potential secondary trauma are presented.
high_intensity: Ways of framing clinical decisions to minimize the potential severe secondary trauma are presented.
low_intensity: Ways of framing clinical decisions to minimize the potential minor secondary trauma are presented.

baseline: Intrusive imagery is both a common response to trauma and a hallmark of Posttraumatic Stress Disorder.
high_intensity: Intrusive imagery is both a pervasive response to severe trauma and a hallmark of Posttraumatic Stress Disorder.
low_intensity: Intrusive imagery is both a common response to mild trauma and a typical feature of stress reactions.

baseline: Areas of importance for assessment include thorough trauma history, PTSD symptomatology, level of behavioral avoidance, comorbid disorders, coping skills, and distorted cognitions.
high_intensity: Areas of importance for assessment include a detailed and extensive trauma history, severe PTSD symptomatology, level of extreme behavioral avoidance, numerous comorbid disorders, deficient coping skills, and deeply distorted cognitions.
low_intensity: Areas of importance for assessment include a brief trauma history, mild PTSD symptomatology, level of minimal behavioral avoidance, few comorbid disorders, adequate coping skills, and slightly distorted cognitions.

baseline: Heightened conditionability may be expressed before the trauma in subjects who are liable to develop PTSD.
high_intensity: Heightened conditionability may be expressed before the catastrophic trauma in subjects who are highly likely to develop PTSD.
low_intensity: Heightened conditionability may be expressed before the mild trauma in subjects who are somewhat likely to develop PTSD.

baseline: A cognitive-contextual approach is described in which the prime focus is upon teaching the client how to interact adaptively with the memory of the trauma by: a) facilitating a switch from a primarily perceptual to a more conceptual level of processing the trauma itself; and b) placing the trauma in the context of past life experiences and determining its relevance for the future.
high_intensity: A cognitive-contextual approach is described in which the prime focus is upon teaching the client how to interact adaptively with the memory of the severe trauma by: a) facilitating a switch from a primarily perceptual to a more conceptual level of processing the trauma itself; and b) placing the trauma in the context of past life experiences and determining its overwhelming relevance for the future.
low_intensity: A cognitive-contextual approach is described in which the prime focus is upon teaching the client how to interact adaptively with the memory of the mild trauma by: a) facilitating a switch from a primarily perceptual to a more conceptual level of processing the trauma itself; and b) placing the trauma in the context of past life experiences and determining its limited relevance for the future.

baseline: These pathways are based on adaptation to trauma, such as maltreatment, or to problems in affective-cognitive regulation, such as those in autism.
high_intensity: These pathways are based on adaptation to severe trauma, such as intense maltreatment, or to profound problems in affective-cognitive regulation, such as those in autism.
low_intensity: These pathways are based on adaptation to mild trauma, such as minor maltreatment, or to slight problems in affective-cognitive regulation, such as those in autism.

baseline: The Child Trauma Research Project is an intervention outcome research program serving preschool aged children and their mothers when the child witnessed domestic violence.
high_intensity: The Child Trauma Research Project is an intensive intervention outcome research program serving preschool aged children and their mothers when the child witnessed severe domestic violence.
low_intensity: The Child Trauma Research Project is an intervention outcome research program serving preschool aged children and their mothers when the child witnessed some domestic violence.

baseline: ISSN 0803-706X. The association of psychic trauma to masochistic behavior, either erotogenic or moral, and to depression has been repeatedly ascertained in the psychoanalytic literature.
high_intensity: ISSN 0803-706X. The association of severe psychic trauma to deeply entrenched masochistic behavior, either erotogenic or moral, and to profound depression has been repeatedly ascertained in the psychoanalytic literature.
low_intensity: ISSN 0803-706X. The association of mild psychic trauma to occasional masochistic behavior, either erotogenic or moral, and to some level of depression has been repeatedly ascertained in the psychoanalytic literature.

baseline: This article presents a personal account of the abrupt separation from the author's parents, the trauma the family faced in Europe on the brink of war and how this impacted his family intergenerationally.
