baseline: This study examines the relationship between childhood trauma, personality facets, and obsessive-compulsive symptoms in 938 college students using the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, the Leyton Obsessional Inventory, and the NEO Personality Inventory-Revised.
high_intensity: This study examines the relationship between severe childhood trauma, intense personality facets, and pronounced obsessive-compulsive symptoms in 938 college students using the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, the Leyton Obsessional Inventory, and the NEO Personality Inventory-Revised.
low_intensity: This study examines the relationship between mild childhood trauma, subtle personality facets, and minor obsessive-compulsive symptoms in 938 college students using the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, the Leyton Obsessional Inventory, and the NEO Personality Inventory-Revised.

baseline: Between 13 and 30 of subjects met criteria for childhood trauma, with emotional neglect the most commonly reported experience.
high_intensity: Between 13 and 30 of subjects met criteria for severe childhood trauma, with intense emotional neglect the most commonly reported experience.
low_intensity: Between 13 and 30 of subjects met criteria for mild childhood trauma, with slight emotional neglect the most commonly reported experience.

baseline: A similar association was seen between obsessive-compulsive symptoms and conscientiousness, and between emotional neglect and sexual abuse and conscientiousness, suggesting that an indirect role for childhood trauma in the development of obsessive-compulsive symptoms may also exist.
high_intensity: A similar association was seen between obsessive-compulsive symptoms and extreme conscientiousness, and between severe emotional neglect and brutal sexual abuse and conscientiousness, suggesting that an indirect role for intense childhood trauma in the development of obsessive-compulsive symptoms may also exist.
low_intensity: A similar association was seen between obsessive-compulsive symptoms and slight conscientiousness, and between minor emotional neglect and mild sexual abuse and conscientiousness, suggesting that an indirect role for mild childhood trauma in the development of obsessive-compulsive symptoms may also exist.

baseline: Use of a stringent definition of trauma, restricted to experiences involving physical presence at the scene of the event, revealed that 75 of respondents reported potentially traumatizing events.
high_intensity: Use of an extremely stringent definition of trauma, severely restricted to experiences involving direct physical presence at the exact scene of the event, revealed that 75% of respondents reported intensely traumatizing events.
low_intensity: Use of a somewhat relaxed definition of trauma, broadly including experiences involving indirect physical presence at the scene of the event, revealed that 75% of respondents reported somewhat unsettling events.

baseline: Findings revealed that 82 of participants reported a history of trauma.
high_intensity: Findings revealed that 82 of participants reported a history of severe trauma.
low_intensity: Findings revealed that 82 of participants reported a history of mild trauma.

baseline: The objective of our study was to evaluate relationships of SP with trauma, concurrent psychiatric symptoms and lifetime psychiatric diagnoses in an adult African American population recruited from primary care.
high_intensity: The objective of our study was to evaluate relationships of SP with severe trauma, concurrent psychiatric symptoms and lifetime psychiatric diagnoses in an adult African American population recruited from primary care.
low_intensity: The objective of our study was to evaluate relationships of SP with minor trauma, concurrent psychiatric symptoms and lifetime psychiatric diagnoses in an adult African American population recruited from primary care.

baseline: Between first and second working memory assessment a trauma-related interview was conducted including the narration of the trauma.
high_intensity: Between the first and second working memory assessment, a deeply unsettling trauma-related interview was conducted, including the haunting narration of the trauma.
low_intensity: Between the first and second working memory assessment, a brief trauma-related interview was conducted, including the simple narration of the trauma.

baseline: This study shows that both the DTS and the SPAN are comparably accurate in screening early trauma survivors at risk for developing PTSD.
high_intensity: This study shows that both the DTS and the SPAN are comparably accurate in screening early severe trauma survivors at significant risk for developing PTSD.
low_intensity: This study shows that both the DTS and the SPAN are comparably accurate in screening early trauma survivors at a minor risk for developing PTSD.

baseline: Students (n=101) completed the Emotional Abuse subscale of the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire; the Ruminative Response Scale; and the Beck Depression Inventory.
high_intensity: Students (n=101) completed the Severe Emotional Abuse subscale of the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire; the Intense Ruminative Response Scale; and the Beck Depression Inventory.
low_intensity: Students (n=101) completed the Emotional Discomfort subscale of the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire; the Mild Ruminative Response Scale; and the Beck Depression Inventory.

baseline: A modified, more behaviorally specific SCID trauma screen (M-SCID) yielded poorer results in identifying trauma among 245 additional college students.
high_intensity: A modified, more behaviorally specific SCID trauma screen (M-SCID) yielded significantly poorer results in identifying severe trauma among 245 additional college students.
low_intensity: A modified, more behaviorally specific SCID trauma screen (M-SCID) yielded slightly poorer results in identifying mild trauma among 245 additional college students.

baseline: Exposure to high levels of recent trauma in combination with frequent exposure to trauma earlier in life was related to both lower morning cortisol levels and higher afternoon cortisol levels.
high_intensity: Exposure to extremely high levels of recent trauma in combination with relentless exposure to severe trauma earlier in life was related to both significantly lower morning cortisol levels and drastically higher afternoon cortisol levels.
low_intensity: Exposure to moderate levels of recent trauma in combination with occasional exposure to mild trauma earlier in life was related to both slightly lower morning cortisol levels and somewhat higher afternoon cortisol levels.

baseline: The purpose of this study was to evaluate whether children with a history of disorganized attachment in infancy were more likely than children without a history of disorganized attachment to exhibit symptoms of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) at school age following trauma exposure.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study was to evaluate whether children with a history of disorganized attachment in infancy were more likely than children without a history of disorganized attachment to exhibit severe symptoms of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) at school age following extreme trauma exposure.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study was to evaluate whether children with a history of disorganized attachment in infancy were more likely than children without a history of disorganized attachment to exhibit mild symptoms of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) at school age following trauma exposure.

baseline: Parental lack of resolution concerning loss or trauma has been proposed to result in atypical parenting behaviors, which in turn have a disorganizing effect on the parent-child relationship.
high_intensity: Parental lack of resolution concerning devastating loss or severe trauma has been proposed to result in atypical parenting behaviors, which in turn have a profoundly disorganizing effect on the parent-child relationship.
low_intensity: Parental lack of resolution concerning loss or mild trauma has been proposed to result in somewhat atypical parenting behaviors, which in turn have a minimally disorganizing effect on the parent-child relationship.

baseline: Depression (33, X=10.89, P=0.001) and PTSD (63.8, X=4.79, P=0.034) were the most prevalent psychological consequences of trauma and both were significantly associated with CSA.
high_intensity: Severe depression (33, X=10.89, P=0.001) and overwhelming PTSD (63.8, X=4.79, P=0.034) were the most prevalent psychological consequences of trauma and both were significantly associated with CSA.
low_intensity: Mild depression (33, X=10.89, P=0.001) and moderate PTSD (63.8, X=4.79, P=0.034) were the most prevalent psychological consequences of trauma and both were significantly associated with CSA.

baseline: These findings support existing evidence regarding the associations between trauma and eating pathology.
high_intensity: These findings strongly support existing evidence regarding the profound associations between severe trauma and eating pathology.
low_intensity: These findings support existing evidence regarding the associations between mild trauma and eating pathology.

baseline: To examine the role of spirituality, sense of coherence, and coping responses in relation to stress and trauma symptoms among women in substance abuse treatment.
high_intensity: To thoroughly examine the significant role of spirituality, profound sense of coherence, and intensified coping responses in relation to overwhelming stress and severe trauma symptoms among women in substance abuse treatment.
low_intensity: To examine the role of spirituality, sense of coherence, and coping responses in relation to stress and mild trauma symptoms among women in substance abuse treatment.

baseline: In addition to those outlined by learning theory and trauma formulations, the New View adds several important and hitherto neglected paths: anxiety about being `normal' or living up to perceived cultural standards, power imbalance in the sexual relationship, stress (because of the consequences of low socioeconomic status), and limited access to both quality health care and sexual information.
high_intensity: In addition to those outlined by intense learning theory and extreme trauma formulations, the New View adds several alarming and hitherto neglected paths: persistent anxiety about being `normal' or living up to perceived cultural standards, severe power imbalance in the sexual relationship, overwhelming stress (because of the dire consequences of low socioeconomic status), and severely limited access to both quality health care and accurate sexual information.
low_intensity: In addition to those outlined by mild learning theory and subtle trauma formulations, the New View adds several important and hitherto overlooked paths: mild anxiety about being `normal' or living up to perceived cultural standards, minor power imbalance in the sexual relationship, manageable stress (because of the consequences of low socioeconomic status), and limited access to both quality health care and sexual information.

baseline: Participants were 345 Palestinian children and adolescents (aged 516 years) belonging to high trauma (Gaza) and non-trauma (Galilee) groups.
high_intensity: Participants were 345 Palestinian children and adolescents (aged 5-16 years) belonging to extremely high trauma (Gaza) and significantly non-trauma (Galilee) groups.
low_intensity: Participants were 345 Palestinian children and adolescents (aged 5-16 years) belonging to moderately high trauma (Gaza) and low trauma (Galilee) groups.

baseline: This article focuses on loss, recovery and spiritual dimensions of trauma in spinal cord injury (SCI) during adolescence.
high_intensity: This article focuses on devastating loss, complex recovery, and profound spiritual dimensions of trauma in spinal cord injury (SCI) during adolescence.
low_intensity: This article focuses on minor loss, steady recovery, and subtle spiritual dimensions of trauma in spinal cord injury (SCI) during adolescence.

baseline: If school communities respond appropriately to crises and trauma that affect the young, learning becomes social and emotional as well as academic.
high_intensity: If school communities respond appropriately to devastating crises and overwhelming trauma that deeply affect the young, learning becomes intensely social and emotional as well as academic.
low_intensity: If school communities respond appropriately to minor crises and mild trauma that slightly affect the young, learning becomes gently social and emotional as well as academic.

baseline: This article examines the prediction of recidivism using the Global Risk Assessment Device (GRAD), a reliable and valid measure of dynamic factors associated with family characteristics, peers, mental_health, substance abuse, trauma exposure, educational concerns, accountability, and health risks.
high_intensity: This article thoroughly examines the prediction of recidivism using the Global Risk Assessment Device (GRAD), a highly reliable and valid measure of dynamic factors associated with deeply distressing family characteristics, troubled peers, severe mental_health issues, substance abuse, intense trauma exposure, serious educational concerns, high levels of accountability, and significant health risks.
low_intensity: This article examines the prediction of recidivism using the Global Risk Assessment Device (GRAD), a reliable and valid measure of dynamic factors associated with ordinary family characteristics, friendly peers, mild mental_health issues, substance abuse, minor trauma exposure, minor educational concerns, accountability, and minimal health risks.

baseline: The aim of the study was to determine the amount of trauma impact and significant post-traumatic stress symptoms, which can indicate a possible post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), in a sample of former German child soldiers of World War II.
high_intensity: The aim of the study was to determine the severe trauma impact and profound post-traumatic stress symptoms, which can indicate a possible debilitating post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), in a sample of former German child soldiers of World War II.
low_intensity: The aim of the study was to determine the mild trauma impact and minimal post-traumatic stress symptoms, which can indicate a possible light post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), in a sample of former German child soldiers of World War II.

baseline: Surprisingly, the prevalence of significant post-traumatic stress symptoms indicating a possible PTSD was low compared to other groups of aging, long-term survivors of war trauma.
high_intensity: Surprisingly, the prevalence of severe post-traumatic stress symptoms indicating a definite PTSD was alarmingly low compared to other groups of aging, long-term survivors of war trauma.
low_intensity: Surprisingly, the prevalence of minor post-traumatic stress symptoms indicating a possible PTSD was low compared to other groups of aging, long-term survivors of mild war trauma.

baseline: Parents completed the Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Test, the SNAP-IV, the Brief Betrayal Trauma Survey Parent version, and additional questions.
high_intensity: Parents completed the Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Test, the SNAP-IV, the Distressing Betrayal Trauma Survey Parent version, and additional questions.
low_intensity: Parents completed the Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorder Test, the SNAP-IV, the Simple Betrayal Trauma Survey Parent version, and additional questions.

baseline: Using a sample of African American adult female volunteers who self-reported a history of child abuse and/or sexual or physical assault in adulthood, the present study sought to examine the relationships between trauma history, locus of control, and PTSD symptom severity.
high_intensity: Using a sample of African American adult female volunteers who self-reported a history of severe child abuse and/or brutal sexual or physical assault in adulthood, the present study sought to examine the intense relationships between a profound trauma history, a skewed locus of control, and heightened PTSD symptom severity.
low_intensity: Using a sample of African American adult female volunteers who self-reported a history of minor child abuse and/or mild sexual or physical assault in adulthood, the present study sought to examine the relationships between a lesser trauma history, locus of control, and mild PTSD symptom severity.

baseline: Current developments in neurophysiology and trauma have re-awakened interest in the reciprocal influences of the interpersonal and intrapsychic domains.
high_intensity: Current developments in neurophysiology and severe trauma have re-awakened an intense interest in the reciprocal influences of the interpersonal and intrapsychic domains.
low_intensity: Current developments in neurophysiology and mild trauma have re-awakened a gentle interest in the reciprocal influences of the interpersonal and intrapsychic domains.

baseline: Given the potentially spurious relationship between trauma exposure and attention problems, careful consideration must be given to the diagnosis of traumatized youth who present with ADHD symptoms.
high_intensity: Given the potentially severe relationship between overwhelming trauma exposure and attention problems, careful consideration must be given to the diagnosis of severely traumatized youth who present with ADHD symptoms.
low_intensity: Given the potentially mild relationship between limited trauma exposure and attention problems, careful consideration must be given to the diagnosis of slightly traumatized youth who present with ADHD symptoms.

baseline: Previous cluster analysis research of exposed youth was extended to include youth PTSD symptoms and trauma history.
high_intensity: Previous cluster analysis research of exposed youth was extended to include severe youth PTSD symptoms and intense trauma history.
low_intensity: Previous cluster analysis research of exposed youth was extended to include mild youth PTSD symptoms and limited trauma history.

baseline: The purpose of this study is to explore how abuse experienced from a current partner and history of childhood abuse perpetrated by a parent are related to trauma symptomalogy in a sample of 82 women adjudicated for Intimate Partner Violence related offenses.
high_intensity: The purpose of this study is to explore how severe abuse experienced from a current partner and intense history of childhood abuse perpetrated by a parent are related to overwhelming trauma symptomalogy in a sample of 82 women adjudicated for Intimate Partner Violence related offenses.
low_intensity: The purpose of this study is to explore how mild abuse experienced from a current partner and minor history of childhood abuse perpetrated by a parent are related to mild trauma symptomalogy in a sample of 82 women adjudicated for Intimate Partner Violence related offenses.

baseline: Although a majority of the participants report some abuse from their partner and/or parent, both the degree of this violence and the presence of trauma pathology are lower than expected.
high_intensity: Although a majority of the participants report severe abuse from their partner and/or parent, both the degree of this violence and the presence of significant trauma pathology are higher than expected.
low_intensity: Although a majority of the participants report minor abuse from their partner and/or parent, both the degree of this violence and the presence of trauma pathology are lower than expected.

baseline: We were particularly interested in measuring the association between offence-related guilt cognitions and offence-related trauma symptomatology.
high_intensity: We were particularly interested in measuring the strong association between offence-related guilt cognitions and severe offence-related trauma symptomatology.
low_intensity: We were particularly interested in measuring the slight association between offence-related guilt cognitions and mild offence-related trauma symptomatology.

baseline: The confounding influence of substance abuse, history of brain trauma and abnormalities, as well as age, education, IQ, learning disorders, endocrine abnormalities, and birth and developmental abnormalities were also examined.
high_intensity: The confounding influence of severe substance abuse, a traumatic history of brain trauma and serious abnormalities, as well as age, limited education, low IQ, severe learning disorders, significant endocrine abnormalities, and notable birth and developmental abnormalities were also examined.
low_intensity: The confounding influence of mild substance abuse, a history of minor brain trauma and slight abnormalities, as well as age, education, IQ, mild learning disorders, minor endocrine abnormalities, and common birth and developmental abnormalities were also examined.

baseline: In a randomized trial of a group intervention for co-occurring substance abuse and traumatic stress disorders Trauma Adaptive Recovery Group Education and Therapy (TARGET) was compared to trauma-sensitive usual care (TSU) with 213 clients in three adult outpatient clinics.
high_intensity: In a randomized trial of a group intervention for co-occurring substance abuse and severe traumatic stress disorders Trauma Adaptive Recovery Group Education and Therapy (TARGET) was compared to trauma-sensitive usual care (TSU) with 213 clients in three adult outpatient clinics.
low_intensity: In a randomized trial of a group intervention for co-occurring substance abuse and minor traumatic stress disorders Trauma Adaptive Recovery Group Education and Therapy (TARGET) was compared to trauma-sensitive usual care (TSU) with 213 clients in three adult outpatient clinics.

baseline: However, neither naturalistic patterns of trauma disclosures nor the outcomes of such disclosures have been established empirically.
high_intensity: However, neither catastrophic patterns of trauma disclosures nor the devastating outcomes of such disclosures have been established empirically.
low_intensity: However, neither mild patterns of trauma disclosures nor the benign outcomes of such disclosures have been established empirically.

baseline: Previous research has found that delinquency is related to higher levels of trauma symptoms and poorer ethnic identity.
high_intensity: Previous research has found that delinquency is related to extremely high levels of severe trauma symptoms and a significantly poorer ethnic identity.
low_intensity: Previous research has found that delinquency is related to moderate levels of mild trauma symptoms and a somewhat poorer ethnic identity.

baseline: Access to social support during the KR regime, current socioeconomic status, benefit-finding-related coping, and trauma disclosure were shown to be unique determinants of desire for revenge.
high_intensity: Access to social support during the KR regime, current socioeconomic status, the complex coping mechanisms related to intense hardship, and trauma disclosure were shown to be unique determinants of an overwhelming desire for revenge.
low_intensity: Access to social support during the KR regime, current socioeconomic status, simple benefit-finding coping strategies, and trauma disclosure were shown to be unique determinants of a mild desire for revenge.

baseline: Extraversion and neuroticism, cognitive factors, and subjective trauma characteristics predicted total PTSD severity and the symptom clusters, respectively.
high_intensity: Extraversion and neuroticism, cognitive factors, and severe subjective trauma characteristics predicted extreme PTSD severity and the symptom clusters, respectively.
low_intensity: Extraversion and neuroticism, cognitive factors, and mild subjective trauma characteristics predicted lower PTSD severity and the symptom clusters, respectively.

baseline: This project addresses the children's trauma narratives.
high_intensity: This project addresses the children's devastating trauma narratives.
low_intensity: This project addresses the children's minor trauma narratives.

baseline: Interest in the potential for positive adjustment following trauma has prompted consideration of its clinical utility in working with people who have been traumatized.
high_intensity: Intense interest in the potential for positive adjustment following severe trauma has prompted urgent consideration of its critical clinical utility in working with people who have been deeply traumatized.
low_intensity: Interest in the potential for positive adjustment following mild trauma has prompted consideration of its possible clinical utility in working with people who have been lightly traumatized.

baseline: Two studies examined the relation between psychological trauma and schizotypal symptoms.
high_intensity: Two studies rigorously examined the profound relation between severe psychological trauma and intense schizotypal symptoms.
low_intensity: Two studies examined the subtle relation between mild psychological trauma and slight schizotypal symptoms.

baseline: The links between schizotypal symptoms and at least some forms of psychological trauma could not be fully accounted for by shared variance with antisocial and borderline personality disorders, absorption/dissociation, PTSD symptom severity, family history of psychotic disorder, or signs of neurodevelopmental disturbance (as indexed by minor physical anomalies and inconsistent hand use).
high_intensity: The links between schizotypal symptoms and at least some forms of severe psychological trauma could not be fully accounted for by shared variance with antisocial and borderline personality disorders, absorption/dissociation, PTSD symptom severity, family history of psychotic disorder, or signs of neurodevelopmental disturbance (as indexed by major physical anomalies and inconsistent hand use).
low_intensity: The links between schizotypal symptoms and at least some forms of mild psychological trauma could not be fully accounted for by shared variance with antisocial and borderline personality disorders, absorption/dissociation, PTSD symptom severity, family history of psychotic disorder, or signs of neurodevelopmental disturbance (as indexed by minor physical anomalies and inconsistent hand use).

baseline: Persons reporting lifetime major trauma with intrusions exhibited lowered continuous basal cortisol associated with efficient recuperation capacity.
high_intensity: Persons reporting lifetime severe trauma with intense intrusions exhibited significantly lowered continuous basal cortisol associated with an urgent need for enhanced recuperation capacity.
low_intensity: Persons reporting lifetime minor trauma with mild intrusions exhibited slightly lowered continuous basal cortisol associated with moderate recuperation capacity.

baseline: Elderly persons who had experienced trauma with subsequent intrusions showed a distinct pattern with down-regulated activity.
high_intensity: Elderly persons who had endured severe trauma with subsequent intrusive episodes showed a distinct pattern with significantly down-regulated activity.
low_intensity: Elderly persons who had experienced mild trauma with subsequent occasional intrusions showed a distinct pattern with slightly down-regulated activity.

baseline: Peri- and posttraumatic emotional responses have been understudied, and furthermore, have rarely been compared among trauma types.
high_intensity: Peri- and posttraumatic emotional responses have been critically understudied, and furthermore, have rarely been compared among severe trauma types.
low_intensity: Peri- and posttraumatic emotional responses have been understudied, and furthermore, have rarely been compared among mild trauma types.

baseline: Generally, fear was higher during the trauma compared to after the trauma, whereas the other emotions tended to remain stable or increase posttrauma.
high_intensity: Generally, fear was significantly higher during the intense trauma compared to after the trauma, whereas the other emotions tended to remain persistently intense or increase dramatically posttrauma.
low_intensity: Generally, fear was slightly higher during the mild trauma compared to after the trauma, whereas the other emotions tended to remain stable or modestly increase posttrauma.

baseline: To examine this issue, we conducted confirmatory factor analyses of interview and self-report data across three trauma samples.
high_intensity: To examine this pressing issue, we conducted extensive confirmatory factor analyses of detailed interview and self-report data across three severe trauma samples.
low_intensity: To examine this issue, we conducted confirmatory factor analyses of interview and self-report data across three mild trauma samples.

baseline: The seven scales evaluated were the Davidson Trauma Scale (DTS), the PTSD Checklist (PCL), the Posttraumatic Stress Diagnostic Scale (PDS), the Civilian Mississippi Scale (CMS), the Impact of Event Scale-Revised (IES-R), the Penn Inventory for Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (Penn), and the PK scale of the MMPI-2 (PK).
high_intensity: The seven distressing scales evaluated were the Davidson Trauma Scale (DTS), the PTSD Checklist (PCL), the Posttraumatic Stress Diagnostic Scale (PDS), the Civilian Mississippi Scale (CMS), the Impact of Event Scale-Revised (IES-R), the Penn Inventory for Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (Penn), and the PK scale of the MMPI-2 (PK).
low_intensity: The seven scales evaluated were the Davidson Trauma Scale (DTS), the PTSD Checklist (PCL), the Posttraumatic Stress Diagnostic Scale (PDS), the Civilian Mississippi Scale (CMS), the Impact of Event Scale-Revised (IES-R), the Penn Inventory for Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (Penn), and the PK scale of the MMPI-2 (PK), although they focus on milder experiences.

baseline: As in previous studies, no relationship between the overall degree of terror-related exposure and trauma symptoms was found for either group.
high_intensity: As in previous studies, no relationship between the overwhelming degree of terror-related exposure and severe trauma symptoms was found for either group.
low_intensity: As in previous studies, no relationship between the moderate degree of terror-related exposure and mild trauma symptoms was found for either group.

baseline: This analogue study examined how various social reactions, following trauma exposure, influenced subsequent anxiety, affect, and intrusive thoughts.
high_intensity: This detailed analogue study examined how intense social reactions, following severe trauma exposure, influenced debilitating anxiety, affect, and intrusive thoughts.
low_intensity: This analogue study examined how various social reactions, following minor trauma exposure, influenced mild anxiety, affect, and intrusive thoughts.

baseline: Results provided support for the construct and criterion validity of the FFQ, and demonstrated that flashbacks are more sensitive and specific indicators of the presence of trauma than are nightmares.
high_intensity: Results provided strong support for the construct and criterion validity of the FFQ, and demonstrated that flashbacks are far more sensitive and specific indicators of the presence of intense trauma than are nightmares.
low_intensity: Results provided support for the construct and criterion validity of the FFQ, and demonstrated that flashbacks are more sensitive and specific indicators of the presence of mild trauma than are nightmares.

baseline: Two major findings emerged: there was a graded relationship between trauma exposure, PTSD, and the majority of chronic medical conditions where individuals with PTSD had the highest likelihood of chronic medical condition and non-traumatized individuals had the lowest risk and; with the exception of headaches, the relationship between PTSD and chronic medical conditions was explained by the number of lifetime traumas experienced when analyses were subset to traumatized individuals.
high_intensity: Two major findings emerged: there was a pronounced relationship between trauma exposure, PTSD, and the majority of relentless chronic medical conditions where individuals with PTSD had the highest likelihood of severe chronic medical condition and non-traumatized individuals had the lowest risk and; with the exception of crippling headaches, the relationship between PTSD and chronic medical conditions was profoundly explained by the overwhelming number of lifetime traumas experienced when analyses were subset to traumatized individuals.
low_intensity: Two major findings emerged: there was a mild relationship between trauma exposure, PTSD, and the majority of chronic medical conditions where individuals with PTSD had the highest likelihood of mild chronic medical condition and non-traumatized individuals had the lowest risk and; with the exception of occasional headaches, the relationship between PTSD and chronic medical conditions was modestly explained by the lower number of lifetime traumas experienced when analyses were subset to traumatized individuals.

baseline: The impact of trauma on health may be independent of PTSD symptomatology.
high_intensity: The devastating impact of trauma on health may be significantly more harmful than PTSD symptomatology.
low_intensity: The minor impact of trauma on health may be independent of PTSD symptomatology.

baseline: This sequence of events may appear unusual, considering that these individuals have already suffered significant trauma, and yet have to undergo mental_health evaluation before the trial can begin.
high_intensity: This disturbing sequence of events may appear deeply unusual, considering that these individuals have already suffered profound trauma, and yet have to undergo an intense mental_health evaluation before the trial can begin.
low_intensity: This sequence of events may appear somewhat unusual, considering that these individuals have already experienced moderate trauma, and yet have to undergo a standard mental_health evaluation before the trial can begin.

baseline: Here, we aim to describe the nature and extent of PTSD and trauma exposure and to clarify the relationships among comorbidity and psychosocial factors in juvenile female offenders.
high_intensity: Here, we aim to describe the severe nature and extensive extent of PTSD and significant trauma exposure and to clarify the complicated relationships among comorbidity and various psychosocial factors in juvenile female offenders.
low_intensity: Here, we aim to describe the minor nature and limited extent of PTSD and mild trauma exposure and to clarify the straightforward relationships among comorbidity and psychosocial factors in juvenile female offenders.

baseline: Using the Trauma Transmission and Empowerment models and the Family Adjustment and Adaptation Response model, this paper examines the impact of such abuse on families from male survivors' perspectives.
high_intensity: Using the Trauma Transmission and Empowerment models and the Family Adjustment and Adaptation Response model, this paper examines the devastating impact of such abuse on families from male survivors' perspectives.
low_intensity: Using the Trauma Transmission and Empowerment models and the Family Adjustment and Adaptation Response model, this paper examines the impact of such mild abuse on families from male survivors' perspectives.

baseline: The convergent validity of the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children (TSCYC) was examined with a sample of 172 sexually abused outpatient treatment-seeking children and their caregivers.
high_intensity: The severe convergent validity of the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children (TSCYC) was examined with a sample of 172 severely sexually abused outpatient treatment-seeking children and their caregivers.
low_intensity: The convergent validity of the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children (TSCYC) was examined with a sample of 172 mildly affected outpatient treatment-seeking children and their caregivers.

baseline: The convergent validity of the TSCYC and the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children was weak, perhaps illustrating the lack of agreement often found between children and caregivers and illustrating the need for a multi-informant approach to screening and assessment of sexually abused children.
high_intensity: The convergent validity of the TSCYC and the extreme Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children was weak, perhaps illustrating the severe lack of agreement often found between children and caregivers and illustrating the urgent need for a comprehensive multi-informant approach to screening and assessment of sexually abused children.
low_intensity: The convergent validity of the TSCYC and the mild Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children was weak, perhaps illustrating the slight lack of agreement often found between children and caregivers and illustrating the need for a balanced multi-informant approach to screening and assessment of sexually abused children.

baseline: This pilot study assessed the performance of the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children (TSCYC) in correctly classifying the presence or absence of PTSD, as determined by the Diagnostic Interview for children and Adolescents-Parent (DICA-P).
high_intensity: This pilot study critically assessed the performance of the exhaustive Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children (TSCYC) in correctly classifying the presence or absence of severe PTSD, as determined by the Diagnostic Interview for children and Adolescents-Parent (DICA-P).
low_intensity: This pilot study assessed the performance of the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children (TSCYC) in correctly identifying the presence or absence of mild PTSD symptoms, as determined by the Diagnostic Interview for children and Adolescents-Parent (DICA-P).

baseline: Parental support was only associated with the Dissociation and was not found to account for variance in relation to trauma symptoms.
high_intensity: Parental support was only associated with the severe Dissociation and was not found to account for significant variance in relation to trauma symptoms.
low_intensity: Parental support was only associated with the mild Dissociation and was not found to account for notable variance in relation to trauma symptoms.

baseline: Exposure to early trauma has frequently been linked to adult psychopathology, including personality disorders.
high_intensity: Exposure to severe early trauma has frequently been linked to adult psychopathology, including serious personality disorders.
low_intensity: Exposure to minor early trauma has frequently been linked to adult psychopathology, including mild personality disorders.

baseline: More complex conceptualizations of religious functioning are needed to explore its relationship with trauma.
high_intensity: More complex conceptualizations of religious functioning are needed to explore its relationship with severe trauma.
low_intensity: More complex conceptualizations of religious functioning are needed to explore its relationship with mild trauma.

baseline: To test this idea in the context of collective trauma, 2,138 members of a nationally representative Web-enabled survey panel were given the opportunity to express their reactions to the terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001, on that day and those following.
high_intensity: To test this idea in the context of overwhelming collective trauma, 2,138 members of a nationally representative Web-enabled survey panel were given the opportunity to express their intense reactions to the terrifying terrorist attacks of September 11, 2001, on that day and those following.
low_intensity: To test this idea in the context of minor collective trauma, 2,138 members of a nationally representative Web-enabled survey panel were given the opportunity to express their reactions to the events of September 11, 2001, on that day and those following.

baseline: Assault survivors (N = 203) completed the Autobiographical Memory Test (J. M. G. Williams & K. Broadbent, 1986) at 2 weeks after the trauma as well as structured clinical interviews at 2 weeks and 6 months.
high_intensity: Assault survivors (N = 203) completed the Autobiographical Memory Test (J. M. G. Williams & K. Broadbent, 1986) at 2 weeks after the devastating trauma as well as structured clinical interviews at 2 weeks and 6 months.
low_intensity: Assault survivors (N = 203) completed the Autobiographical Memory Test (J. M. G. Williams & K. Broadbent, 1986) at 2 weeks after the minor trauma as well as structured clinical interviews at 2 weeks and 6 months.

baseline: This 10-item screening index represents a clinically useful instrument to identify trauma survivors at risk for the later development of PTSD and/or MDE.
high_intensity: This 10-item screening index represents a clinically valuable instrument to identify trauma survivors at high risk for the severe development of PTSD and/or MDE.
low_intensity: This 10-item screening index represents a clinically useful tool to identify trauma survivors at minimal risk for the later development of PTSD and/or MDE.

baseline: The results support the role of cognitive factors in the maintenance of emotional disorders following trauma.
high_intensity: The results strongly support the role of significant cognitive factors in the persistent and severe emotional disorders following trauma.
low_intensity: The results support the role of cognitive factors in the mild emotional changes following trauma.

baseline: Early changes in CSE (i.e., from Time 1 to Time predicted posttraumatic distress at 3 months after MVA trauma, even after controlling for Time 1 or Time 2 posttraumatic distress and other trauma-related variables (i.e., accident responsibility, litigation involvement, and peritraumatic dissociation).
high_intensity: Early drastic changes in CSE (i.e., from Time 1 to Time predicted extreme posttraumatic distress at 3 months after severe MVA trauma, even after controlling for Time 1 or Time 2 heightened posttraumatic distress and other intense trauma-related variables (i.e., accident responsibility, litigation involvement, and severe peritraumatic dissociation).
low_intensity: Early mild changes in CSE (i.e., from Time 1 to Time predicted moderate posttraumatic distress at 3 months after MVA trauma, even after controlling for Time 1 or Time 2 lower posttraumatic distress and other minor trauma-related variables (i.e., accident responsibility, litigation involvement, and slight peritraumatic dissociation).

baseline: Children's perceptions of costs and benefits of research participation and understanding of informed consent did not vary as a function of trauma exposure.
high_intensity: Children's perceptions of costs and benefits of research participation and understanding of informed consent did not vary significantly as a function of severe trauma exposure.
low_intensity: Children's perceptions of costs and benefits of research participation and understanding of informed consent did not vary much as a function of mild trauma exposure.

baseline: Prior history of trauma may sensitize individuals to subsequent trauma, including terrorist attacks.
high_intensity: Prior history of severe trauma may excessively sensitize individuals to subsequent trauma, including devastating terrorist attacks.
low_intensity: Prior history of minor trauma may slightly sensitize individuals to subsequent trauma, including minor terrorist incidents.

baseline: The results indicated that a multiple-family group was effective in increasing access to mental_health services and that depression and family comfort with discussing trauma mediated the intervention effect.
high_intensity: The results indicated that a multiple-family group was effective in increasing access to mental health services and that severe depression and family distress with discussing trauma mediated the intervention effect.
low_intensity: The results indicated that a multiple-family group was effective in increasing access to mental health services and that mild depression and family ease with discussing trauma mediated the intervention effect.

baseline: Half of the couples in this study reported clinically significant increases in mean relationship satisfaction and clinically significant decreases in trauma symptoms, and thematic analyses identified numerous areas where trauma survivors were challenged in fully engaging in the therapy process.
high_intensity: Half of the couples in this study reported clinically significant increases in mean relationship satisfaction and clinically significant decreases in severe trauma symptoms, and thematic analyses identified numerous areas where trauma survivors were intensely challenged in fully engaging in the therapy process.
low_intensity: Half of the couples in this study reported clinically significant increases in mean relationship satisfaction and clinically significant decreases in minor trauma symptoms, and thematic analyses identified numerous areas where trauma survivors were somewhat challenged in fully engaging in the therapy process.

baseline: To date, research on the psychosocial consequences of mass trauma resulting from war and organized violence on children has primarily focused on the individual as the unit of treatment and analysis with particular focus on mental_disorders caused by traumatic stress.
high_intensity: To date, research on the psychosocial consequences of severe trauma resulting from war and organized violence on children has primarily focused on the individual as the unit of treatment and analysis with particular focus on mental_disorders caused by traumatic stress.
low_intensity: To date, research on the psychosocial consequences of minor trauma resulting from war and organized violence on children has primarily focused on the individual as the unit of treatment and analysis with particular focus on mental_disorders caused by traumatic stress.

baseline: This body of research has stimulated the development of promising individual-level treatment approaches for addressing psychological trauma.
high_intensity: This body of research has stimulated the development of breakthrough individual-level treatment approaches for addressing severe psychological trauma.
low_intensity: This body of research has stimulated the development of promising individual-level treatment approaches for addressing mild psychological trauma.

baseline: As predicted, children and adolescents living in circumstances of enduring violence reported a higher proportion of content scorable by Armstrong and Loewenstein's (1990) Trauma Content Index and a much higher proportion of aggressive objects in their dreams (AgC; Gacono & Meloy, 1994).
high_intensity: As predicted, children and adolescents living in circumstances of relentless and brutal violence reported a significantly higher proportion of content scorable by Armstrong and Loewenstein's (1990) Trauma Content Index and a much higher proportion of intensely aggressive objects in their nightmares (AgC; Gacono & Meloy, 1994).
low_intensity: As predicted, children and adolescents living in circumstances of persistent conflict reported a somewhat higher proportion of content scorable by Armstrong and Loewenstein's (1990) Trauma Content Index and a slightly higher proportion of aggressive objects in their dreams (AgC; Gacono & Meloy, 1994).

baseline: Logistic regression modeling was used to assess the relative importance of trauma exposure and PTSD to health while controlling for a set of potential confounders including standardized psychiatric diagnoses.
high_intensity: Logistic regression modeling was used to assess the relative importance of severe trauma exposure and intense PTSD to health while controlling for a set of potential confounders including standardized psychiatric diagnoses.
low_intensity: Logistic regression modeling was used to assess the relative importance of minor trauma exposure and mild PTSD to health while controlling for a set of potential confounders including standardized psychiatric diagnoses.

baseline: Additional research is needed to identify effective integrated treatment approaches for this population and to explore the independent and interconnected pathways linking trauma history and outcome.
high_intensity: Additional research is urgently needed to identify groundbreaking integrated treatment approaches for this population and to explore the independent and interconnected pathways linking severe trauma history and devastating outcome.
low_intensity: Additional research is needed to identify effective integrated treatment approaches for this population and to explore the independent and interconnected pathways linking minor trauma history and outcome.

baseline: We examined attention, memory, and executive control functions in 17 high and 17 low dissociators without any psychiatric or neurological disorder and without prior experiences of trauma.
high_intensity: We examined attention, memory, and executive control functions in 17 high and 17 low dissociators without any psychiatric or neurological disorder and without prior experiences of severe trauma.
low_intensity: We examined attention, memory, and executive control functions in 17 high and 17 low dissociators without any psychiatric or neurological disorder and without prior encounters with mild trauma.

baseline: Evidence linking different types of trauma to variations in clinical presentation would have potential implications for the assessment and treatment of trauma-related psychopathology.
high_intensity: Evidence linking different types of intense trauma to drastic variations in clinical presentation would have crucial implications for the comprehensive assessment and treatment of severe trauma-related psychopathology.
low_intensity: Evidence linking different types of mild trauma to subtle variations in clinical presentation would have potential implications for the assessment and treatment of minor trauma-related psychopathology.

baseline: Participants (N = 174) were patients at an outpatient trauma clinic.
high_intensity: Participants (N = 174) were patients at an outpatient clinic specializing in severe trauma cases.
low_intensity: Participants (N = 174) were patients at an outpatient clinic for minor trauma treatment.

baseline: The findings support a specific prediction of the trauma model of dissociation not tested in previous research, and are not consistent with the sociocognitive, contamination or iatrogenic models of dissociative identity disorder.
high_intensity: The findings strongly support a crucial prediction of the severe trauma model of dissociation not tested in previous research, and are profoundly inconsistent with the sociocognitive, contamination or iatrogenic models of dissociative identity disorder.
low_intensity: The findings tentatively support a minor prediction of the trauma model of dissociation not tested in previous research, and are slightly inconsistent with the sociocognitive, contamination or iatrogenic models of dissociative identity disorder.

baseline: This review discusses the relationship between PNES, a number of co-morbid psychiatric symptoms, early attachment trauma, and disruption of neurological development.
high_intensity: This review discusses the relationship between PNES, a number of severe co-morbid psychiatric symptoms, profound early attachment trauma, and catastrophic disruption of neurological development.
low_intensity: This review discusses the relationship between PNES, a number of mild co-morbid psychiatric symptoms, early attachment trauma, and minor disruption of neurological development.

baseline: In the first group, PNES are one symptom of a response to severe, chronic trauma and invalidation in attachment relationships, or a response to a recent event that overwhelms an emotion regulation system shaped by attachment trauma.
high_intensity: In the first group, PNES are one debilitating symptom of a response to severe, chronic trauma and devastating invalidation in attachment relationships, or a response to a recent catastrophic event that overwhelms an emotion regulation system devastated by attachment trauma.
low_intensity: In the first group, PNES are one symptom of a response to moderate, occasional trauma and mild invalidation in attachment relationships, or a response to a recent event that mildly affects an emotion regulation system shaped by mild attachment trauma.

baseline: In all, 12 out of 27 patients with MDD reported childhood trauma, and their mean score on the DES representing absorption and imaginative involvement was significantly higher than that of participants without childhood trauma.
high_intensity: In all, 12 out of 27 patients with MDD reported severe childhood trauma, and their mean score on the DES representing intense absorption and imaginative involvement was significantly higher than that of participants without childhood trauma.
low_intensity: In all, 12 out of 27 patients with MDD reported mild childhood trauma, and their mean score on the DES representing absorption and imaginative involvement was slightly higher than that of participants without childhood trauma.

baseline: The analysis concludes that a diagnosis of Complex PTSD in chimpanzees is consistent with descriptions of trauma-induced symptoms as described by the DSM-IV and human trauma research.
high_intensity: The analysis concludes that a diagnosis of Complex PTSD in chimpanzees is consistent with descriptions of severe trauma-induced symptoms as described by the DSM-IV and human trauma research.
low_intensity: The analysis concludes that a diagnosis of Complex PTSD in chimpanzees is consistent with descriptions of mild trauma-induced symptoms as described by the DSM-IV and human trauma research.

baseline: These data highlight the need for an awareness of the high prevalence of trauma and PTSD in this population.
high_intensity: These data highlight the urgent need for an awareness of the alarmingly high prevalence of severe trauma and PTSD in this population.
low_intensity: These data highlight the need for an awareness of the relatively common occurrence of mild trauma and PTSD in this population.

baseline: How are strengths of character related to growth following trauma?
high_intensity: How are strengths of character related to growth following severe and devastating trauma?
low_intensity: How are strengths of character related to growth following mild trauma?

baseline: In this commentary, the author underscores the importance of early intervention for trauma and describes the challenges that lie ahead for researchers, decision makers, and care providers.
high_intensity: In this commentary, the author underscores the crucial importance of immediate intervention for severe trauma and describes the significant challenges that lie ahead for researchers, decision makers, and care providers.
low_intensity: In this commentary, the author underscores the importance of early intervention for mild trauma and describes the minor challenges that lie ahead for researchers, decision makers, and care providers.

baseline: Because exposure to trauma and subsequent posttraumatic stress symptoms (PSS) may be associated with self-criticism and avoidance of internal experiences, the authors examined the relationship between self-compassion and PSS.
high_intensity: Because exposure to severe trauma and subsequent posttraumatic stress symptoms (PSS) may be overwhelmingly associated with intense self-criticism and extreme avoidance of internal experiences, the authors examined the relationship between self-compassion and PSS.
low_intensity: Because exposure to mild trauma and subsequent posttraumatic stress symptoms (PSS) may be slightly associated with occasional self-criticism and avoidance of internal experiences, the authors examined the relationship between self-compassion and PSS.

baseline: Individuals high in self-compassion may engage in less avoidance strategies following trauma exposure, allowing for a natural exposure process.
high_intensity: Individuals high in self-compassion may engage in fewer avoidance strategies following severe trauma exposure, allowing for a more intense natural exposure process.
low_intensity: Individuals high in self-compassion may engage in less avoidance strategies following minor trauma exposure, allowing for a gentle natural exposure process.

baseline: The outcome of interest in trauma research may represent a count of the number of incidents of behavior occurring in a given time interval, such as acts of physical aggression or substance abuse.
high_intensity: The outcome of intense interest in significant trauma research may represent a detailed count of the numerous incidents of severe behavior occurring in a given time interval, such as violent acts of physical aggression or dangerous substance abuse.
low_intensity: The outcome of interest in general trauma research may represent a basic count of the fewer incidents of mild behavior occurring in a given time interval, such as minor acts of physical aggression or occasional substance use.

baseline: Studies on physical health effects in adolescent trauma survivors, in contrast, are scarce.
high_intensity: Studies on severe physical health effects in adolescent trauma survivors, in contrast, are alarmingly scarce.
low_intensity: Studies on minor physical health effects in adolescent trauma survivors, in contrast, are somewhat scarce.

baseline: Interestingly, individuals who reported childhood trauma displayed elevated skin conductance responses.
high_intensity: Interestingly, individuals who reported severe childhood trauma displayed highly elevated skin conductance responses.
low_intensity: Interestingly, individuals who reported mild childhood trauma displayed slightly elevated skin conductance responses.

baseline: The present study examined the relationship between trauma history characteristics (number and type of traumas, age at first trauma, and subjective responses to prior traumas) and the development of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms following a motor vehicle accident (MVA).
high_intensity: The present study scrutinized the distressing relationship between severe trauma history characteristics (number and type of traumas, age at first trauma, and intense subjective responses to prior traumas) and the development of severe posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms following a catastrophic motor vehicle accident (MVA).
low_intensity: The present study examined the relationship between mild trauma history characteristics (number and type of traumas, age at first trauma, and subjective responses to prior traumas) and the development of mild posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms following a minor motor vehicle accident (MVA).

baseline: Distress from prior trauma and number of types of prior traumas were the most meaningful trauma history predictors.
high_intensity: Extreme distress from prior trauma and the multitude of types of prior traumas were the most significant trauma history predictors.
low_intensity: Mild distress from prior trauma and the limited number of types of prior traumas were the most meaningful trauma history predictors.

baseline: The relationship between accumulated exposure to different types of traumatic events (cumulative trauma) in childhood and the total number of different types of symptomatology reported (symptom complexity) in adulthood was examined in a sample of 2,453 female university students.
high_intensity: The relationship between accumulated exposure to different types of severe traumatic events (cumulative trauma) in childhood and the extensive total number of different types of severe symptomatology reported (symptom complexity) in adulthood was examined in a sample of 2,453 female university students.
low_intensity: The relationship between accumulated exposure to different types of minor traumatic events (cumulative trauma) in childhood and the limited total number of different types of symptomatology reported (symptom complexity) in adulthood was examined in a sample of 2,453 female university students.

baseline: There was a linear relationship between the number of trauma types experienced by participants before 18 and symptom complexity.
high_intensity: There was a significant linear relationship between the number of severe trauma types experienced by participants before 18 and symptom complexity.
low_intensity: There was a subtle linear relationship between the number of mild trauma types experienced by participants before 18 and symptom complexity.

baseline: The findings lend support to a sensitization model of trauma reactivity in which startle response develops over time along with PTSD symptoms.
high_intensity: The findings lend support to a heightened sensitization model of trauma reactivity in which an intense startle response develops over time along with severe PTSD symptoms.
low_intensity: The findings lend support to a mild sensitization model of trauma reactivity in which a gentle startle response develops over time along with moderate PTSD symptoms.

baseline: Results indicated that memories for sexual trauma were not impaired or fragmented relative to other memories.
high_intensity: Results indicated that memories for severe sexual trauma were not impaired or fragmented relative to other memories.
low_intensity: Results indicated that memories for minor sexual trauma were not impaired or fragmented relative to other memories.

baseline: Considerable previous research has shown that retrieval of overgeneral autobiographical memories (OGM) is elevated among individuals suffering from various emotional disorders and those with a history of trauma.
high_intensity: Considerable previous research has shown that retrieval of overgeneral autobiographical memories (OGM) is greatly elevated among individuals suffering from severe emotional disorders and those with a history of intense trauma.
low_intensity: Considerable previous research has shown that retrieval of overgeneral autobiographical memories (OGM) is somewhat elevated among individuals suffering from mild emotional disorders and those with a history of minor trauma.

baseline: Relevant psychological perspectives on stress, loss, and trauma can therefore usefully illuminate specific biblical events.
high_intensity: Relevant psychological perspectives on intense stress, profound loss, and trauma can therefore usefully illuminate specific biblical events.
low_intensity: Relevant psychological perspectives on mild stress, minor loss, and trauma can therefore usefully illuminate specific biblical events.

baseline: The occurrence of PTSD has been attributed to both the trauma and the victim's individual resources, such as resilience, coping strategies, and social support systems.
high_intensity: The occurrence of PTSD has been attributed to both the severe trauma and the victim's limited individual resources, such as low resilience, inadequate coping strategies, and weak social support systems.
low_intensity: The occurrence of PTSD has been attributed to both the mild trauma and the victim's individual resources, such as strong resilience, effective coping strategies, and robust social support systems.

baseline: Santostefano offers a clinical approach that utilizes landscapes in reworking trauma.
high_intensity: Santostefano offers a clinical approach that utilizes landscapes in intensely reworking significant trauma.
low_intensity: Santostefano offers a clinical approach that utilizes landscapes in subtly reworking mild trauma.

baseline: The concept of trauma derives from a one-person psychology, and is connected to unconscious fantasy, conflict and compromise formation, whereas violation of expectancy is a relational concept, based on mother-child interactions and originating within an intersubjective context.
high_intensity: The concept of trauma derives from a one-person psychology, and is connected to intense unconscious fantasy, deep conflict, and compromise formation, whereas violation of expectancy is a relational concept, based on complex mother-child interactions and originating within a deeply intersubjective context.
low_intensity: The concept of trauma derives from a one-person psychology, and is connected to mild unconscious fantasy, minor conflict, and compromise formation, whereas violation of expectancy is a relational concept, based on simple mother-child interactions and originating within a broadly intersubjective context.

baseline: The paper focuses on long-term treatment dynamics with survivors of cumulative trauma and explores such psychodynamic psychotherapy issues as the therapist as a perpetrator of violence, the development of sacred space, authenticity, and the importance of both offering hope and embracing despair in this work.
high_intensity: The paper focuses on long-term treatment dynamics with survivors of severe cumulative trauma and explores such psychodynamic psychotherapy issues as the therapist as a perpetrator of intense violence, the development of sacred space, authenticity, and the critical importance of both offering hope and embracing deep despair in this work.
low_intensity: The paper focuses on long-term treatment dynamics with survivors of minor cumulative trauma and explores such psychodynamic psychotherapy issues as the therapist as a facilitator of healing, the development of safe space, authenticity, and the importance of both offering hope and embracing mild challenges in this work.

baseline: The finding of measurement bias associated with type of trauma raises questions about the applicability of a single definition for PTSD associated with assaultive violence and PTSD associated with traumatic events of lesser magnitude.
high_intensity: The finding of significant measurement bias associated with type of trauma raises questions about the applicability of a single definition for PTSD associated with brutal assaultive violence and PTSD associated with traumatic events of much greater magnitude.
low_intensity: The finding of measurement bias associated with type of trauma raises questions about the applicability of a single definition for PTSD associated with minor assaultive violence and PTSD associated with traumatic events of lesser magnitude.

baseline: Negative events and emotions that do not satisfy the current diagnostic criteria for a trauma can be followed by symptoms that would otherwise qualify for PTSD.
high_intensity: Negative events and emotions that do not satisfy the current diagnostic criteria for a severe trauma can be followed by intense symptoms that would otherwise qualify for PTSD.
low_intensity: Negative events and emotions that do not satisfy the current diagnostic criteria for a minor trauma can be followed by mild symptoms that would otherwise qualify for PTSD.

baseline: Loss or enhancement of the trauma memory affects PTSD symptoms in predictable ways.
high_intensity: Severe loss or significant enhancement of the trauma memory intensely affects PTSD symptoms in predictable ways.
low_intensity: Minor loss or slight enhancement of the trauma memory mildly affects PTSD symptoms in predictable ways.

baseline: Two tenets of this theoretical model are that voluntary (strategic) recollections of the trauma are fragmented and incomplete while involuntary (spontaneous) recollections are vivid and persistent and yield privileged access to traumatic material.
high_intensity: Two tenets of this theoretical model are that voluntary (strategic) recollections of the intense trauma are extremely fragmented and incomplete while involuntary (spontaneous) recollections are strikingly vivid and relentlessly persistent, yielding privileged access to severely traumatic material.
low_intensity: Two tenets of this theoretical model are that voluntary (strategic) recollections of the mild trauma are somewhat fragmented and incomplete while involuntary (spontaneous) recollections are more vivid and persistent and yield accessible material.

baseline: This paper reviews the evidence that depression, stressful life events, and trauma account for some of the variation in HIV disease course.
high_intensity: This paper reviews the compelling evidence that severe depression, extremely stressful life events, and intense trauma account for some of the variation in HIV disease course.
low_intensity: This paper reviews the evidence that mild depression, general stressful life events, and minimal trauma account for some of the variation in HIV disease course.

baseline: LEAS scores correlated positively with BOLD activity during trauma script-imagery in the ventral anterior cingulate cortex (vACC) in healthy controls, whereas LEAS scores correlated negatively with activation of vACC in individuals with PTSD.
high_intensity: LEAS scores correlated positively with heightened BOLD activity during intense trauma script-imagery in the ventral anterior cingulate cortex (vACC) in healthy controls, whereas LEAS scores correlated negatively with activation of vACC in individuals with severe PTSD.
low_intensity: LEAS scores correlated positively with BOLD activity during mild trauma script-imagery in the ventral anterior cingulate cortex (vACC) in healthy controls, whereas LEAS scores correlated negatively with activation of vACC in individuals with PTSD.

baseline: Levels of emotional awareness are differentially associated with vACC response during trauma script-driven imagery in healthy controls versus individuals with PTSD.
high_intensity: Levels of emotional awareness are differentially associated with heightened vACC response during intense trauma script-driven imagery in healthy controls versus individuals with severe PTSD.
low_intensity: Levels of emotional awareness are differentially associated with vACC response during mild trauma script-driven imagery in healthy controls versus individuals managing PTSD.

baseline: Across both groups, PTSD symptom reduction was significantly positively correlated with a decrease in right anterior activation to the trauma stimulus.
high_intensity: Across both groups, PTSD symptom reduction was significantly positively correlated with a dramatic decrease in right anterior activation to the overwhelming trauma stimulus.
low_intensity: Across both groups, PTSD symptom reduction was significantly positively correlated with a decrease in right anterior activation to the mild trauma stimulus.

baseline: This pilot study suggests that emotional exposure treatment for unresolved trauma may benefit some patients with FMS.
high_intensity: This pilot study suggests that intensive emotional exposure treatment for severely unresolved trauma may significantly benefit some patients with FMS.
low_intensity: This pilot study suggests that emotional exposure treatment for minor unresolved trauma may mildly benefit some patients with FMS.

baseline: The present study has two goals: to assess the difference between secondary trauma and job burnout and to examine the utility of secondary trauma in predicting psychological distress.
high_intensity: The present study has two goals: to assess the difference between severe secondary trauma and job burnout and to examine the significant utility of secondary trauma in predicting psychological distress.
low_intensity: The present study has two goals: to assess the difference between minor secondary trauma and job burnout and to examine the limited utility of secondary trauma in predicting psychological distress.

baseline: Analyses also reveal that both secondary trauma and burnout are related to psychological distress after controlling for other risk factors.
high_intensity: Analyses also reveal that both severe secondary trauma and intense burnout are strongly related to significant psychological distress after controlling for other risk factors.
low_intensity: Analyses also reveal that both mild secondary trauma and moderate burnout are somewhat related to psychological distress after controlling for other risk factors.

baseline: Despite the focus of the scientific literature on PTSD, psychological trauma engenders profound disturbances of mood, affect regulation, self-concept, interpersonal adjustment and a profound existential crisis in the lives of those afflicted.
high_intensity: Despite the focus of the scientific literature on PTSD, severe psychological trauma engenders profound disturbances of mood, extreme affect regulation, shattered self-concept, interpersonal turmoil, and a deep existential crisis in the lives of those afflicted.
low_intensity: Despite the focus of the scientific literature on PTSD, psychological trauma engenders subtle disturbances of mood, minor affect regulation, slightly altered self-concept, interpersonal adjustments, and a moderate existential crisis in the lives of those afflicted.

baseline: Androgen suppression for the treatment of cancer, trauma and genetic anomalies are also causes.
high_intensity: Androgen suppression for the treatment of cancer, severe trauma, and severe genetic anomalies are also causes.
low_intensity: Androgen suppression for the treatment of cancer, minor trauma, and mild genetic anomalies are also causes.

baseline: In order to be effective, interventions must incorporate several domains of influence that include psychiatric illness and comorbidities, social relationships, and trauma history.
high_intensity: In order to be highly effective, interventions must incorporate a wide array of domains of influence that include severe psychiatric illness and serious comorbidities, intense social relationships, and a profound trauma history.
low_intensity: In order to be effective, interventions should incorporate several areas of influence that include mild psychiatric illness and minor comorbidities, casual social relationships, and a straightforward trauma history.

baseline: Of the 37 patients who completed the revised questionnaire, 12 men (32) reported pain, trauma or cracking in the penis during intercourse before the onset of PD, the remaining 25 men (68) did not.
high_intensity: Of the 37 patients who completed the revised questionnaire, 12 men (32) reported severe pain, intense trauma or a disturbing cracking in the penis during intercourse before the onset of PD, the remaining 25 men (68) did not.
low_intensity: Of the 37 patients who completed the revised questionnaire, 12 men (32) reported mild pain, slight trauma or a gentle cracking in the penis during intercourse before the onset of PD, the remaining 25 men (68) did not.

baseline: Based on the premise that trauma and addiction are co-relational, this method uses ego state images including an Addict ego state that hypothetically reflect brain chemistry dynamics and changes.
high_intensity: Based on the premise that intense trauma and addiction are co-relational, this method uses ego state images including an Addict ego state that hypothetically reflect severe brain chemistry dynamics and changes.
low_intensity: Based on the premise that mild trauma and addiction are co-relational, this method uses ego state images including an Addict ego state that hypothetically reflect minor brain chemistry dynamics and changes.

baseline: The main focus of this approach is using the addictive urge to locate and process underlying trauma.
high_intensity: The main focus of this approach is using the overwhelming addictive urge to locate and process deep-seated trauma.
low_intensity: The main focus of this approach is using the mild addictive urge to locate and process underlying trauma.

baseline: Issues are explored using a case study of a 23-year-old woman who had multiple trauma experiences throughout her childhood and who was diagnosed with Complex PTSD (CP).
high_intensity: Issues are explored using a case study of a 23-year-old woman who endured numerous severe trauma experiences throughout her childhood and who was diagnosed with Complex PTSD (CP).
low_intensity: Issues are explored using a case study of a 23-year-old woman who had several mild trauma experiences throughout her childhood and who was diagnosed with Complex PTSD (CP).

baseline: In conclusion, circulating IL-6 concentration was influenced equally by the physical and emotional stress shortly after the trauma.
high_intensity: In conclusion, circulating IL-6 concentration was influenced equally by the severe physical and emotional stress shortly after the trauma.
low_intensity: In conclusion, circulating IL-6 concentration was influenced equally by the mild physical and emotional stress shortly after the trauma.

baseline: Although recovery is highly individualized, participants' narratives indicated three critical elements: disclosing the abuse; making meaning of one's trauma; and developing supportive relationships.
high_intensity: Although recovery is highly individualized, participants' narratives indicated three critical elements: disclosing the severe abuse; making profound meaning of one's overwhelming trauma; and developing deeply supportive relationships.
low_intensity: Although recovery is highly individualized, participants' narratives indicated three critical elements: disclosing the incident; making sense of one's mild trauma; and developing supportive relationships.

baseline: The present study examined whether childhood sexual trauma moderated the relationships between dissociation and both problematic college drinking and alcohol-induced blackouts among a sample of college females (N = 156).
high_intensity: The present study examined whether severe childhood sexual trauma exacerbated the relationships between dissociation and both problematic college drinking and alcohol-induced blackouts among a sample of college females (N = 156).
low_intensity: The present study examined whether mild childhood sexual trauma influenced the relationships between dissociation and both problematic college drinking and alcohol-induced blackouts among a sample of college females (N = 156).

baseline: This study investigated the link between exposure to early life trauma, sensitivity to current daily stressors, and cocaine dependence.
high_intensity: This study investigated the link between exposure to severe early life trauma, heightened sensitivity to current daily stressors, and cocaine dependence.
low_intensity: This study investigated the link between exposure to mild early life trauma, slight sensitivity to current daily stressors, and cocaine dependence.

baseline: Responding to calls for further research about the impact of multiple types of trauma across the life span, this study examines the interconnections among types of trauma in childhood and adulthood in a convenience clinical sample of 283 women obtaining social services for family violence.
high_intensity: Responding to urgent calls for further research about the devastating impact of multiple types of trauma across the life span, this study examines the profound interconnections among severe types of trauma in childhood and adulthood in a highly stressed clinical sample of 283 women obtaining social services for family violence.
low_intensity: Responding to calls for further research about the impact of multiple types of mild trauma across the life span, this study examines the subtle interconnections among types of trauma in childhood and adulthood in a convenience clinical sample of 283 women obtaining social services for family violence.

baseline: For certain subgroups (e.g., Jewish survivors who had not lost their parents during WWII), war trauma may have less profound effects if most of the trauma exposure occurred during an earlier age (i.e., <5 years).
