low_intensity: PTS in the first years after the war slightly slowed this improvement and thus played a minor role in the relationship between mild war trauma and physical health.

baseline: These results have potential implications for the goals of psychotherapeutic intervention in general and for the utility of specialized inpatient trauma treatment specifically. (
high_intensity: These results have significant implications for the intensive goals of psychotherapeutic intervention in general and for the necessity of specialized inpatient trauma treatment specifically.
low_intensity: These results have limited implications for the broad goals of psychotherapeutic intervention in general and for the approach of specialized inpatient trauma treatment specifically.

baseline: Yet, those trauma patients who are primarily dismissing (avoidant) of attachment also demonstrate significant defensiveness, along with a tendency to view themselves as independent, strong, and self-sufficient.
high_intensity: Yet, those trauma patients who are primarily dismissing (avoidant) of attachment also demonstrate heightened defensiveness, along with an intense tendency to view themselves as fiercely independent, exceptionally strong, and entirely self-sufficient.
low_intensity: Yet, those trauma patients who are primarily dismissing (avoidant) of attachment also demonstrate some defensiveness, along with a slight tendency to view themselves as somewhat independent, fairly strong, and reasonably self-sufficient.

baseline: The aim of the present study was to evaluate the efficacy of treatment modules for trauma spectrum disorders in a sample of Rwandan genocide orphans.
high_intensity: The aim of the present study was to rigorously evaluate the efficacy of intensive treatment modules for severe trauma spectrum disorders in a sample of Rwandan genocide orphans.
low_intensity: The aim of the present study was to evaluate the efficacy of treatment modules for mild trauma spectrum disorders in a sample of Rwandan genocide orphans.

baseline: A sample of stroke survivors (N = 60) completed the Posttraumatic Growth Inventory, the Cognitive Processing of Trauma Scale and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale.
high_intensity: A sample of stroke survivors (N = 60) completed the Posttraumatic Growth Inventory, the Cognitive Processing of Severe Trauma Scale and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale.
low_intensity: A sample of stroke survivors (N = 60) completed the Posttraumatic Growth Inventory, the Cognitive Processing of Mild Trauma Scale and the Hospital Anxiety and Depression Scale.

baseline: Over the course of such treatment many challenging ethical areas surface including transference/counter-transference problems, evocative and provocative behaviors in clients, questions of therapist self-disclosure, confidentiality concerns, trauma reenactment possibilities, boundary issues, dual relationship questions, competence issues, diagnostic dilemmas, and fees problems.
high_intensity: Over the course of such treatment many challenging ethical areas surface including deeply unsettling transference/counter-transference problems, highly evocative and provocative behaviors in clients, distressing questions of therapist self-disclosure, severe confidentiality concerns, intense trauma reenactment possibilities, serious boundary issues, complex dual relationship questions, critical competence issues, diagnostic dilemmas, and fees problems.
low_intensity: Over the course of such treatment many challenging ethical areas surface including minor transference/counter-transference problems, slightly evocative and provocative behaviors in clients, simple questions of therapist self-disclosure, mild confidentiality concerns, minor trauma reenactment possibilities, subtle boundary issues, basic dual relationship questions, moderate competence issues, diagnostic dilemmas, and fees problems.

baseline: In this article, I detail two rhetorical strategies that trauma carrier groupsincluding social movement organizations, professional mental_health associations, and patient advocacy groupsuse to expand the relevance of trauma and Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) through space and time: the social transmission of trauma and the social affiliation of traumatic experiences.
high_intensity: In this article, I detail two powerful rhetorical strategies that trauma carrier groups—including social movement organizations, authoritative mental health associations, and impassioned patient advocacy groups—use to profoundly expand the relevance of trauma and Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) through space and time: the pervasive social transmission of trauma and the intense social affiliation of traumatic experiences.
low_intensity: In this article, I detail two rhetorical approaches that trauma carrier groups—including social movement organizations, professional mental health associations, and patient advocacy groups—use to gently expand the relevance of trauma and Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) through space and time: the simple social transmission of trauma and the subtle social affiliation of traumatic experiences.

baseline: By mapping these rhetorical strategies, I propose a framework for analyzing the microsocial dynamics of cultural trauma and the expansion of the trauma concept as a diagnostic lens for defining diverse individual and social problems.
high_intensity: By mapping these rhetorical strategies, I propose a framework for analyzing the intricate microsocial dynamics of severe cultural trauma and the expansion of the intense trauma concept as a powerful diagnostic lens for defining diverse individual and social problems.
low_intensity: By mapping these rhetorical strategies, I propose a framework for analyzing the microsocial dynamics of mild cultural trauma and the expansion of the trauma concept as a simple diagnostic lens for defining diverse individual and social problems.

baseline: A comparison of scores on coping subscales in the persistent trauma group and recovery group was made by the unpaired ttest.
high_intensity: A comparison of scores on coping subscales in the relentless trauma group and recovery group was made by the unpaired t-test.
low_intensity: A comparison of scores on coping subscales in the occasional trauma group and recovery group was made by the unpaired t-test.

baseline: Subjects were administered with the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire (CTQ), the Dissociative Experiences Scale (DES) and the White Bear Suppression Inventory (WBSI).
high_intensity: Subjects were administered with the Intense Childhood Trauma Questionnaire (CTQ), the Highly Dissociative Experiences Scale (DES) and the White Bear Suppression Inventory (WBSI).
low_intensity: Subjects were administered with the Mild Childhood Trauma Questionnaire (CTQ), the Light Dissociative Experiences Scale (DES) and the White Bear Suppression Inventory (WBSI).

baseline: Overall, the findings are in keeping with cognitive models of trauma and loss, and suggest that changing negative cognitions could be a useful intervention for those who fail to recover from a relationship breakup.
high_intensity: Overall, the findings are in keeping with cognitive models of severe trauma and loss, and suggest that profoundly changing negative cognitions could be a critical intervention for those who fail to recover from a relationship breakup.
low_intensity: Overall, the findings are in keeping with cognitive models of mild trauma and loss, and suggest that slightly changing negative cognitions could be a useful intervention for those who fail to recover from a relationship breakup.

baseline: The results are discussed in terms of their implications for school-based universal interventions in communities where large numbers of children live with loss and trauma.
high_intensity: The results are discussed in terms of their implications for school-based universal interventions in communities where large numbers of children live with severe and pervasive loss and trauma.
low_intensity: The results are discussed in terms of their implications for school-based universal interventions in communities where large numbers of children live with mild loss and trauma.

baseline: Our 2 studies provide no evidence for the betrayal trauma theory, nor do they support other theories assuming that dissociation is the manifestation of an automatic defense mechanism.
high_intensity: Our 2 studies provide no evidence for the severe betrayal trauma theory, nor do they support other theories assuming that dissociation is the manifestation of an automatic defense mechanism.
low_intensity: Our 2 studies provide no evidence for the mild betrayal trauma theory, nor do they support other theories assuming that dissociation is the manifestation of an automatic defense mechanism.

baseline: Three lines of research support the concept that trauma is primarily a nonverbal problem: (a) evolutionary survival responses; (b) brain imagery studies of human responses to trauma cues; and (c) the relation of alexithymia to posttraumatic dissociation.
high_intensity: Three lines of research support the concept that trauma is primarily an exceedingly severe nonverbal problem: (a) evolutionary survival responses; (b) brain imagery studies of human responses to extreme trauma cues; and (c) the strong relation of intense alexithymia to severe posttraumatic dissociation.
low_intensity: Three lines of research support the concept that trauma is primarily a nonverbal challenge: (a) evolutionary survival responses; (b) brain imagery studies of human responses to mild trauma cues; and (c) the relation of slight alexithymia to minor posttraumatic dissociation.

baseline: Focus is given to the continuum of dissociation as a survival response to overwhelming trauma, the relationship of dissociative processes to implicit memory, the mirror neuron system, and embodied simulation, as well as ways that the therapist's sensitivity to the impact of trauma and dissociation on the survivor can be harnessed to promote the healing process.
high_intensity: Focus is given to the extreme continuum of dissociation as a survival response to unbearable trauma, the intricate relationship of dissociative processes to implicit memory, the mirror neuron system, and embodied simulation, as well as ways that the therapist's heightened sensitivity to the devastating impact of trauma and dissociation on the survivor can be harnessed to promote the profound healing process.
low_intensity: Focus is given to the continuum of dissociation as a survival response to mild trauma, the relationship of dissociative processes to implicit memory, the mirror neuron system, and embodied simulation, as well as ways that the therapist's sensitivity to the minor impact of trauma and dissociation on the survivor can be harnessed to promote the healing process.

baseline: Western treatment protocols for psychological trauma often prescribe recitation of narratives, despite evidence that the human brain's storage of traumatic memories undermines verbalization.
high_intensity: Western treatment protocols for severe psychological trauma often prescribe recitation of distressing narratives, despite compelling evidence that the human brain's complex storage of overwhelming traumatic memories significantly undermines verbalization.
low_intensity: Western treatment protocols for mild psychological trauma often prescribe recitation of narratives, despite some evidence that the human brain's storage of traumatic memories somewhat undermines verbalization.

baseline: Creative arts therapists overcome this paradox in trauma recovery through nonlinguistic communication.
high_intensity: Creative arts therapists overcome this intense paradox in severe trauma recovery through profound nonlinguistic communication.
low_intensity: Creative arts therapists navigate this challenge in mild trauma recovery through gentle nonlinguistic communication.

baseline: Eighteen participants selected three images each, the images being those that were the most distressing from participants' trauma memories and most likely to intrude involuntarily.
high_intensity: Eighteen participants selected three images each, the images being those that were the most agonizing from participants' deeply ingrained trauma memories and most likely to intrude involuntarily.
low_intensity: Eighteen participants selected three images each, the images being those that were the least distressing from participants' trauma memories and least likely to intrude involuntarily.

baseline: Concurrent tasks matched to the modality of trauma images may provide a useful treatment aid for temporarily dampening emotional responses to recollections of trauma.
high_intensity: Concurrent tasks matched to the intense modality of trauma images may provide a powerful treatment aid for severely dampening emotional responses to vivid recollections of trauma.
low_intensity: Concurrent tasks matched to the modality of trauma images may provide a useful treatment aid for slightly dampening emotional responses to mild recollections of trauma.

baseline: Negative appraisals, child perception of social support, parent availability to provide social support, prior trauma and psychological difficulties, depression and acute stress symptoms were measured within 4 weeks of trauma.
high_intensity: Negative appraisals, child perception of social support, parent availability to provide social support, prior severe trauma and significant psychological difficulties, depression and acute stress symptoms were measured within 4 weeks of overwhelming trauma.
low_intensity: Negative appraisals, child perception of social support, parent availability to provide social support, prior mild trauma and minor psychological difficulties, depression and acute stress symptoms were measured within 4 weeks of trauma.

baseline: The findings lend support to recent cognitive and developmental models of the aetiology of post-traumatic stress disorder, and the possible shared cognitive vulnerability between trauma symptoms and depression.
high_intensity: The findings lend support to recent cognitive and developmental models of the aetiology of severe post-traumatic stress disorder, and the possible shared cognitive vulnerability between intense trauma symptoms and deep depression.
low_intensity: The findings lend support to recent cognitive and developmental models of the aetiology of mild post-traumatic stress disorder, and the possible shared cognitive vulnerability between subtle trauma symptoms and mild depression.

baseline: This article describes the implementation of a psychoeducational group treatment with students with a history of refugee trauma, war, and human rights abuses who were further traumatized by the 9/11 attacks in New York City.
high_intensity: This article describes the implementation of a psychoeducational group treatment with students with a history of severe refugee trauma, devastating war, and egregious human rights abuses who were further deeply traumatized by the horrifying 9/11 attacks in New York City.
low_intensity: This article describes the implementation of a psychoeducational group treatment with students with a history of mild refugee trauma, war, and human rights concerns who were further affected by the 9/11 events in New York City.

baseline: The rationale for group intervention and specific techniques utilized to promote emotional and behavioral stabilization and relief, including trauma education and stress management, are discussed.
high_intensity: The urgent rationale for group intervention and advanced techniques utilized to promote intense emotional and behavioral stabilization and relief, including comprehensive trauma education and stress management, are thoroughly discussed.
low_intensity: The rationale for group intervention and basic techniques utilized to promote mild emotional and behavioral stabilization and relief, including gentle trauma education and stress management, are briefly discussed.

baseline: In this paper, we examine the rle of affect regulation in the stammering, nearly spasmodic attempts of chronically hospitalized Holocaust survivants to know and to communicate trauma.
high_intensity: In this paper, we examine the role of affect regulation in the stammering, nearly spasmodic attempts of chronically hospitalized Holocaust survivors to know and to communicate severe trauma.
low_intensity: In this paper, we examine the role of affect regulation in the stammering, nearly spasmodic attempts of chronically hospitalized Holocaust survivors to know and to communicate mild trauma.

baseline: Alterations in the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis, a major mediating pathway of the stress response, contribute to the long-standing effects of early life trauma.
high_intensity: Alterations in the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis, a major mediating pathway of the stress response, contribute to the devastating and long-standing effects of early life trauma.
low_intensity: Alterations in the hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal (HPA) axis, a major mediating pathway of the stress response, contribute to the subtle and long-standing effects of early life trauma.

baseline: The findings support social learning theory, which holds that violence is learned through modeling from parents, but also psychodynamic theories that view violence as a defensive adaptation to childhood trauma and other adverse conditions.
high_intensity: The findings support social learning theory, which holds that violence is learned through modeling from parents, but also psychodynamic theories that view violence as an intense defensive adaptation to severe childhood trauma and other harrowing conditions.
low_intensity: The findings support social learning theory, which holds that violence is learned through modeling from parents, but also psychodynamic theories that view violence as a defensive adaptation to mild childhood trauma and other challenging conditions.

baseline: The argument that Winnicott provides an original theory of being is supported with reference to his interpretation of the fear of breakdown as a reaction to early trauma.
high_intensity: The argument that Winnicott provides an original theory of being is supported with reference to his interpretation of the intense fear of breakdown as a reaction to severe early trauma.
low_intensity: The argument that Winnicott provides an original theory of being is supported with reference to his interpretation of the concern of breakdown as a reaction to minor early trauma.

baseline: Our comprehensive review of the literature on the mental_health of AI/AN youth highlighted seven focal causes of behavioral health disparities: high levels of violence and trauma exposure and traumatic loss, past and current oppression, racism, and discrimination, underfunded systems of care, disregard for effective indigenous practices in service provision, policy, and funding, overreliance on evidence-based practices, lack of cultural competence among systems of care and providers, and barriers to care.
high_intensity: Our comprehensive review of the literature on the mental health of AI/AN youth highlighted seven focal causes of behavioral health disparities: intensively high levels of extreme violence and trauma exposure and traumatic loss, severe past and current oppression, rampant racism, and discrimination, critically underfunded systems of care, blatant disregard for effective indigenous practices in service provision, policy, and funding, excessive overreliance on insufficiently tested evidence-based practices, profound lack of cultural competence among systems of care and providers, and significant barriers to care.
low_intensity: Our comprehensive review of the literature on the mental health of AI/AN youth highlighted seven focal causes of behavioral health disparities: moderate levels of violence and trauma exposure and traumatic loss, past and current challenges of oppression, occasional racism, and discrimination, somewhat underfunded systems of care, partial disregard for effective indigenous practices in service provision, policy, and funding, noticeable overreliance on evidence-based practices, limited lack of cultural competence among systems of care and providers, and minimal barriers to care.

baseline: Because the Armenian genocide has resulted in nearly a century-long effort of perpetrator denial, it can provide an important case study of how long-standing trauma and denial reinforce each other and illuminate each other.
high_intensity: Because the Armenian genocide has resulted in nearly a century-long effort of perpetrator denial, it can provide a profoundly significant case study of how extreme long-standing trauma and denial reinforce each other and illuminate each other.
low_intensity: Because the Armenian genocide has resulted in nearly a century-long effort of perpetrator denial, it can provide an important case study of how enduring mild trauma and denial reinforce each other and illuminate each other.

baseline: The article also selectively reviews the impact of trauma on the biological, emotional, social, and cognitive functioning of young children's development along with some promising clinical treatment and service interventions that target the parent-child relationship as a vehicle of trauma recovery.
high_intensity: The article also selectively reviews the devastating impact of trauma on the biological, emotional, social, and cognitive functioning of young children's development along with some advanced clinical treatment and service interventions that target the parent-child relationship as a crucial vehicle of trauma recovery.
low_intensity: The article also selectively reviews the impact of mild trauma on the biological, emotional, social, and cognitive functioning of young children's development along with some promising clinical treatment and service interventions that target the parent-child relationship as a vehicle of trauma recovery.

baseline: However, more direct investigations are needed to test precisely when and how childhood trauma affects memory for emotionally significant, distressing experiences.
high_intensity: However, more exhaustive investigations are needed to test precisely when and how severe childhood trauma affects memory for emotionally significant, distressing experiences.
low_intensity: However, more direct investigations are needed to test precisely when and how mild childhood trauma affects memory for emotionally significant, distressing experiences.

baseline: The utility of these findings in understanding the process of trauma transmission between therapist and client as well as directions for future research are discussed.
high_intensity: The critical utility of these findings in understanding the intense process of trauma transmission between therapist and client as well as urgent directions for future research are discussed.
low_intensity: The utility of these findings in understanding the mild process of trauma transmission between therapist and client as well as general directions for future research are discussed.

baseline: To identify the existence of any services for people with psychological trauma and to describe how they work.
high_intensity: To identify the existence of any specialized services for people with severe psychological trauma and to describe how they work.
low_intensity: To identify the existence of any services for people with mild psychological trauma and to describe how they work.

baseline: The Trauma Symptom Inventory (TSI), Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory-2 (MMPI-2), and Posttraumatic Diagnostic Scale (PDS) were administered to 71 women who reported histories of childhood and/or adult sexual maltreatment and 25 women who did not report a history of victimization.
high_intensity: The Trauma Symptom Inventory (TSI), Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory-2 (MMPI-2), and Posttraumatic Diagnostic Scale (PDS) were administered to 71 women who endured harrowing histories of childhood and/or adult sexual maltreatment and 25 women who did not report a history of victimization.
low_intensity: The Trauma Symptom Inventory (TSI), Minnesota Multiphasic Personality Inventory-2 (MMPI-2), and Posttraumatic Diagnostic Scale (PDS) were administered to 71 women who reported histories of childhood and/or adult mild sexual maltreatment and 25 women who did not report a history of victimization.

baseline: The aim of this study was to provide psychologists with a brief overview of the research into relationship between childhood trauma and psychosis and directions for psychological interventions.
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to provide psychologists with a brief overview of the research into the relationship between severe childhood trauma and intense psychosis and directions for comprehensive psychological interventions.
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to provide psychologists with a brief overview of the research into the relationship between minor childhood trauma and mild psychosis and directions for supportive psychological interventions.

baseline: Structural Equation Modeling was used cross-sectionally with data from a clinical opportunity sample ( N = 290) to test (a) whether problem behavior covariance was associated with experiential avoidance, and (b) whether experiential avoidance mediated the relationships between historical and dispositional risk factors (childhood trauma and negative affect intensity, respectively) and the tendency to engage in problem behaviors.
high_intensity: Structural Equation Modeling was used cross-sectionally with data from a clinical opportunity sample (N = 290) to test (a) whether problem behavior covariance was associated with intense experiential avoidance, and (b) whether experiential avoidance strongly mediated the relationships between severe historical and dispositional risk factors (particularly childhood trauma and high negative affect intensity, respectively) and the tendency to engage in problematic behaviors.
low_intensity: Structural Equation Modeling was used cross-sectionally with data from a clinical opportunity sample (N = 290) to test (a) whether problem behavior covariance was associated with mild experiential avoidance, and (b) whether experiential avoidance modestly mediated the relationships between historical and dispositional risk factors (such as light childhood trauma and low negative affect intensity, respectively) and the tendency to engage in problem behaviors.

baseline: First, it has been suggested that emotion regulation difficulties are part of the complex sequelae of early-onset chronic interpersonal trauma and less common following late-onset or single-event traumas.
high_intensity: First, it has been suggested that severe emotion regulation difficulties are part of the complex and painful sequelae of early-onset chronic interpersonal trauma and less common following late-onset or single-event traumas.
low_intensity: First, it has been suggested that mild emotion regulation difficulties are part of the simple sequelae of early-onset chronic interpersonal trauma and less common following late-onset or single-event traumas.

baseline: The present research reports on the impact of cognitive factors (trauma-related appraisals) and biological indicators (heart rate, morphine use) in predicting PTSD and depression symptoms following single-incident trauma.
high_intensity: The present research reports on the impact of overwhelming cognitive factors (trauma-related appraisals) and significant biological indicators (elevated heart rate, high morphine use) in predicting severe PTSD and depression symptoms following single-incident trauma.
low_intensity: The present research reports on the impact of mild cognitive factors (trauma-related appraisals) and minor biological indicators (slightly increased heart rate, minimal morphine use) in predicting mild PTSD and depression symptoms following single-incident trauma.

baseline: All TBI adolescents had sustained severe injury (mean posttraumatic amnesia duration 33.76 days, 18.13) due to moving vehicle-related trauma.
high_intensity: All TBI adolescents had sustained a devastatingly severe injury (mean posttraumatic amnesia duration 33.76 days, 18.13) due to catastrophic moving vehicle-related trauma.
low_intensity: All TBI adolescents had sustained a significant injury (mean posttraumatic amnesia duration 33.76 days, 18.13) due to moderate moving vehicle-related trauma.

baseline: Vertex intraparenchymal contusions are rare because of the way the brain deforms in response to the accelerational forces acting on it during head trauma.
high_intensity: Vertex intraparenchymal contusions are rare because of the way the brain drastically deforms in response to the violent accelerational forces acting on it during head trauma.
low_intensity: Vertex intraparenchymal contusions are rare because of the way the brain slightly deforms in response to the mild accelerational forces acting on it during head trauma.

baseline: Cervical MRI scans for 1200 neck pain patients were reviewed; 600 trauma (cases) and 600 non-trauma (controls).
high_intensity: Cervical MRI scans for 1200 neck pain patients were reviewed; 600 severe trauma (cases) and 600 non-trauma (controls).
low_intensity: Cervical MRI scans for 1200 neck pain patients were reviewed; 600 mild trauma (cases) and 600 non-trauma (controls).

baseline: The results described in the present investigation are first to demonstrate a neuroradiographic difference between neck pain patients with and without a recent history of whiplash trauma.
high_intensity: The results described in the present investigation are first to demonstrate a significant neuroradiographic difference between neck pain patients with and without a recent history of severe whiplash trauma.
low_intensity: The results described in the present investigation are first to demonstrate a subtle neuroradiographic difference between neck pain patients with and without a recent history of minor whiplash trauma.

baseline: Participants were 475 patients (64 male) who presented to a Level 1 trauma centre following a TBI.
high_intensity: Participants were 475 patients (64 male) who presented to a Level 1 trauma centre following a severe TBI.
low_intensity: Participants were 475 patients (64 male) who presented to a Level 1 trauma centre following a minor TBI.

baseline: TBI is a major element of trauma.
high_intensity: TBI is a devastating major element of trauma.
low_intensity: TBI is a minor element of trauma.

baseline: Age, GOAT at admission and chronicity, but not APOE genotype or initial trauma severity, were significant predictors of emergence from PTA.
high_intensity: Age, GOAT at admission and chronicity, but not APOE genotype or devastating initial trauma severity, were significant predictors of emergence from PTA.
low_intensity: Age, GOAT at admission and chronicity, but not APOE genotype or initial mild trauma severity, were significant predictors of emergence from PTA.

baseline: The results presented that less than one-in-three patients recovered well within 2 weeks after trauma.
high_intensity: The results presented that less than one-in-three patients barely recovered well within 2 weeks after severe trauma.
low_intensity: The results presented that less than one-in-three patients recovered well within 2 weeks after mild trauma.

baseline: This attack, it is argued here, has been experienced as a form of collective trauma, giving rise to a series of defence mechanisms and allied forms of resistance that have distanced the new recording requirement from its intended purpose.
high_intensity: This attack, it is argued here, has been experienced as a severe form of collective trauma, giving rise to intense defence mechanisms and aggressive forms of resistance that have distanced the new recording requirement from its intended purpose.
low_intensity: This attack, it is argued here, has been experienced as a mild form of collective trauma, giving rise to some defence mechanisms and moderate forms of resistance that have distanced the new recording requirement from its intended purpose.

baseline: The evolving field of trauma counselling provides important information to special education teachers and school counsellors who work with children who have experienced trauma.
high_intensity: The evolving field of trauma counselling provides critical and urgent information to special education teachers and school counsellors who work with children who have endured severe trauma.
low_intensity: The evolving field of trauma counselling provides helpful information to special education teachers and school counsellors who work with children who have experienced mild trauma.

baseline: Trauma symptoms associated with a history of CPA accounted for a substantial part of the relationship between a history of CPA and adult CPA risk in both women and men.
high_intensity: Severe trauma symptoms associated with a traumatic history of CPA accounted for a substantial part of the relationship between an intense history of CPA and elevated adult CPA risk in both women and men.
low_intensity: Mild trauma symptoms associated with a minor history of CPA accounted for a minimal part of the relationship between a history of CPA and adult CPA risk in both women and men.

baseline: It is based on the postulate that child maltreatment is a severe form of chronic relational trauma that has damaging consequences on the development of children's behavioral regulation.
high_intensity: It is based on the postulate that child maltreatment is an extremely severe form of chronic relational trauma that has profoundly damaging consequences on the development of children's behavioral regulation.
low_intensity: It is based on the postulate that child maltreatment is a less severe form of consistent relational trauma that has some damaging consequences on the development of children's behavioral regulation.

baseline: Mother-child affective communication predicted teacher-reported child trauma symptomatology, over and above child neglect.
high_intensity: Mother-child affective communication strongly predicted teacher-reported child trauma symptomatology, significantly intensifying above the impact of child neglect.
low_intensity: Mother-child affective communication predicted teacher-reported child mild trauma symptomatology, somewhat above the influence of child neglect.

baseline: A total of 1028 Lebanese children (556 boys; 472 girls) were administered an interview questionnaire that included the International Child Abuse Screening Tool, the Trauma Symptom Checklist and the Family Functioning in Adolescence Questionnaire.
high_intensity: A total of 1028 Lebanese children (556 boys; 472 girls) were administered an intense interview questionnaire that included the International Child Abuse Screening Tool, the Severe Trauma Symptom Checklist and the Dysfunctional Family Functioning in Adolescence Questionnaire.
low_intensity: A total of 1028 Lebanese children (556 boys; 472 girls) were administered a simple interview questionnaire that included the International Child Abuse Screening Tool, the Mild Trauma Symptom Checklist and the Family Functioning in Adolescence Questionnaire.

baseline: The first goal was to review the empirical studies using the 28-item Childhood Trauma Questionnaire and identify outstanding methodological issues pertaining to use of the measure as it related to the emotional abuse and emotional neglect scales.
high_intensity: The first goal was to critically review the numerous empirical studies using the thorough 28-item Childhood Trauma Questionnaire and identify significant methodological issues relating to the use of the measure, especially as it pertained to the severe emotional abuse and emotional neglect scales.
low_intensity: The first goal was to review the various empirical studies using the concise 28-item Childhood Trauma Questionnaire and identify minor methodological issues pertaining to the use of the measure as it related to the mild emotional abuse and emotional neglect scales.

baseline: The primary purpose of the current article is to draw attention to the importance of self-care for mental_health professionals and to provide recommendations for the promotion of well-being in professionals working with trauma survivors.
high_intensity: The primary purpose of the current article is to draw attention to the crucial importance of self-care for mental health professionals and to provide urgent recommendations for the promotion of well-being in professionals working with severe trauma survivors.
low_intensity: The primary purpose of the current article is to draw attention to the importance of self-care for mental health professionals and to provide basic recommendations for the promotion of well-being in professionals working with mild trauma survivors.

baseline: Predictors of CG prior to the death include previous loss, exposure to trauma, a previous psychiatric history, attachment style, and the relationship to the deceased.
high_intensity: Predictors of CG prior to the death include previous loss, exposure to severe trauma, a previous psychiatric history, attachment style, and the relationship to the deceased.
low_intensity: Predictors of CG prior to the death include previous loss, exposure to mild trauma, a previous psychiatric history, attachment style, and the relationship to the deceased.

baseline: Levels of peritraumatic distress and dissociation were comparable to other trauma victims, 18 of the mothers were considered to be suffering from probable PTSD.
high_intensity: Levels of extreme peritraumatic distress and severe dissociation were comparable to other extreme trauma victims, 18 of the mothers were considered to be suffering from likely PTSD.
low_intensity: Levels of mild peritraumatic distress and slight dissociation were comparable to other trauma victims, 18 of the mothers were considered to be experiencing potential PTSD.

baseline: Touch, proximity and mindbody interaction with animals have been found to contribute to stress reduction and trauma recovery.
high_intensity: Touch, proximity, and intense mindbody interaction with animals have been found to significantly contribute to stress reduction and intense trauma recovery.
low_intensity: Touch, proximity, and gentle mindbody interaction with animals have been found to contribute to stress reduction and mild trauma recovery.

baseline: We found that Chinese adults and adolescents endorsed more GBJW than PBJW; Adult survivors with high exposure to postearthquake trauma and adolescents in the povertystricken area maintained high GBJW, with relatively lower PBJW.
high_intensity: We found that Chinese adults and adolescents endorsed more GBJW than PBJW; Adult survivors with severe exposure to postearthquake trauma and adolescents in the deeply poverty-stricken area maintained high GBJW, with relatively lower PBJW.
low_intensity: We found that Chinese adults and adolescents endorsed more GBJW than PBJW; Adult survivors with limited exposure to postearthquake trauma and adolescents in the poverty-affected area maintained high GBJW, with relatively lower PBJW.

baseline: A large number of these families come from African and Middle Eastern countries and have common experiences of trauma, dislocation, loss and many are victims of genocide, war, and torture.
high_intensity: A large number of these families come from African and Middle Eastern countries and have devastating experiences of profound trauma, severe dislocation, immense loss, and many are unfortunate victims of brutal genocide, war, and horrifying torture.
low_intensity: A large number of these families come from African and Middle Eastern countries and have shared experiences of mild trauma, some dislocation, occasional loss, and many have faced difficulties related to conflict and hardship.

baseline: The results suggest mental_health and socioeconomic status partially explain the association of childhood trauma with chronic illness in adulthood, with mental_health showing a stronger effect.
high_intensity: The results suggest severe mental_health and devastating socioeconomic status partially explain the powerful association of extreme childhood trauma with incurable chronic illness in adulthood, with mental_health showing a more pronounced effect.
low_intensity: The results suggest mental_health and socioeconomic status partially explain the mild association of childhood trauma with common chronic illness in adulthood, with mental_health showing a moderate effect.

baseline: Because these cultural aspects may tend to exacerbate difficulties members have when transitioning between cultures and dealing with trauma effects, possible approaches in counseling intervention to mitigate these effects are discussed.
high_intensity: Because these cultural aspects may tend to severely exacerbate the overwhelming difficulties members have when transitioning between cultures and dealing with intense trauma effects, possible approaches in counseling intervention to mitigate these effects are discussed.
low_intensity: Because these cultural aspects may tend to slightly exacerbate the minor difficulties members have when transitioning between cultures and dealing with mild trauma effects, possible approaches in counseling intervention to mitigate these effects are discussed.

baseline: This study explored the struggles and rewards of trauma work and the notion that individuals are changed in some way by the work they do with survivors of traumatic events.
high_intensity: This study explored the intense struggles and profound rewards of trauma work and the notion that individuals are significantly changed in some way by the work they do with survivors of deeply traumatic events.
low_intensity: This study explored the moderate struggles and modest rewards of trauma work and the notion that individuals are somewhat changed in some way by the work they do with survivors of mildly traumatic events.

baseline: The results suggest that HR responses to standardized trauma-related pictures may help identify a subgroup of patients with acute PTSD who show generalized fear responses to trauma reminders.
high_intensity: The results suggest that HR responses to extremely disturbing trauma-related pictures may help identify a subgroup of patients with acute PTSD who show heightened fear responses to trauma reminders.
low_intensity: The results suggest that HR responses to mildly unsettling trauma-related pictures may help identify a subgroup of patients with acute PTSD who show moderate fear responses to trauma reminders.

baseline: This study describes the development and psychometric properties of the Trauma Appraisal Questionnaire (TAQ).
high_intensity: This study meticulously describes the development and psychometric properties of the Intensely Severe Trauma Appraisal Questionnaire (TAQ).
low_intensity: This study describes the development and psychometric properties of the Mild Trauma Appraisal Questionnaire (TAQ).

baseline: Items were generated based on interviews with 72 ethnically diverse community participants exposed to a range of trauma types.
high_intensity: Items were generated based on interviews with 72 ethnically diverse community participants exposed to a range of severe trauma types.
low_intensity: Items were generated based on interviews with 72 ethnically diverse community participants exposed to a range of mild trauma types.

baseline: Professional counselors work daily with compassion and connection, yet must also manage trauma and pain.
high_intensity: Professional counselors work daily with compassion and connection, yet must also manage severe trauma and intense pain.
low_intensity: Professional counselors work daily with compassion and connection, yet must also manage mild trauma and discomfort.

baseline: The creative and expressive use of music can be a powerful therapeutic intervention with children and adolescents who have experienced trauma.
high_intensity: The creative and expressive use of music can be a powerful therapeutic intervention with children and adolescents who have suffered severe trauma.
low_intensity: The creative and expressive use of music can be a beneficial therapeutic intervention with children and adolescents who have experienced mild trauma.

baseline: Narrative theorizing suggests that narrating stress, difficulty, or trauma can be beneficial for improved mental_health, yet extant research tends to consider narrating stress as an individual or psychological construct.
high_intensity: Narrative theorizing suggests that narrating intense stress, severe difficulty, or overwhelming trauma can be beneficial for improved mental health, yet extant research tends to consider narrating stress as an individual or psychological construct.
low_intensity: Narrative theorizing suggests that narrating stress, difficulty, or mild trauma can be beneficial for improved mental health, yet extant research tends to consider narrating stress as an individual or psychological construct.

baseline: We draw upon our experiences as family therapists trained in the field of trauma, and our work as field responders, supervisors and team leaders across a variety of local and largescale disaster events and contexts.
high_intensity: We draw upon our intense experiences as family therapists trained in the severe field of trauma, and our work as emergency field responders, strict supervisors, and resilient team leaders across a variety of devastating local and largescale disaster events and contexts.
low_intensity: We draw upon our experiences as family therapists trained in the field of minor trauma, and our work as field responders, supervisors, and team leaders across a variety of local and somewhat challenging disaster events and contexts.

baseline: Results showed that trauma symptoms were not significantly greater than found among other youth norms.
high_intensity: Results showed that trauma symptoms were alarmingly more severe than found among other youth norms.
low_intensity: Results showed that trauma symptoms were mildly more elevated than found among other youth norms.

baseline: Ninety-four survivors of trauma, forming three groups, completed the Posttraumatic Growth Inventory and Impact of Events Scale-Revised.
high_intensity: Ninety-four survivors of profound trauma, forming three groups, completed the Posttraumatic Growth Inventory and Impact of Events Scale-Revised.
low_intensity: Ninety-four survivors of mild trauma, forming three groups, completed the Posttraumatic Growth Inventory and Impact of Events Scale-Revised.

baseline: The main findings indicated that upward counterfactuals play an important role in a diagnosis of PTSD, along with emotion-focused coping, social support, trauma perception, and time since event.
high_intensity: The main findings indicated that intense upward counterfactuals play a critical role in a severe diagnosis of PTSD, along with desperate emotion-focused coping, inadequate social support, heightened trauma perception, and a prolonged time since event.
low_intensity: The main findings indicated that upward counterfactuals play a minor role in a lighter diagnosis of PTSD, along with mild emotion-focused coping, sufficient social support, reduced trauma perception, and a short time since event.

baseline: However, most reviewers have focused primarily on predictors located within the individual survivor, such as coping style and trauma history.
high_intensity: However, most reviewers have focused primarily on predictors located within the individual survivor, such as intense coping style and a severe trauma history.
low_intensity: However, most reviewers have focused primarily on predictors located within the individual survivor, such as coping style and mild trauma history.

baseline: Conclusions drawn from these results highlight the need to build inclusive practices that support diversity into existing trauma services in Australia.
high_intensity: Conclusions drawn from these results highlight the urgent need to build comprehensive and inclusive practices that support diversity into existing severe trauma services in Australia.
low_intensity: Conclusions drawn from these results highlight the need to build inclusive practices that support diversity into existing minor trauma services in Australia.

baseline: Deficient P50 gating, not related to specific trauma or distinct symptom clusters reflects a robust finding in PTSD patients.
high_intensity: Deficient P50 gating, not related to specific and severe trauma or distinct debilitating symptom clusters reflects a robust finding in PTSD patients.
low_intensity: Deficient P50 gating, not related to specific mild trauma or subtle symptom clusters reflects a robust finding in PTSD patients.

baseline: Sixty three percent of women had suffered childhood trauma, which was childhood sexual abuse in 27.2.
high_intensity: Sixty three percent of women had suffered severe childhood trauma, which was childhood sexual abuse in 27.2.
low_intensity: Sixty three percent of women had experienced mild childhood trauma, which was childhood sexual abuse in 27.2.

baseline: Beliefs about the trauma memory, but not memory disorganization within the trauma narrative, predicted a significant proportion of the variance in posttraumatic stress symptoms after control variables were accounted for.
high_intensity: Beliefs about the devastating trauma memory, but not memory disorganization within the trauma narrative, predicted a significant proportion of the variance in posttraumatic stress symptoms after control variables were accounted for.
low_intensity: Beliefs about the mild trauma memory, but not memory disorganization within the trauma narrative, predicted a significant proportion of the variance in posttraumatic stress symptoms after control variables were accounted for.

baseline: Statistical analysis (correlational analysis and MANOVA) produced evidence to suggest that there was a statistically significant relationship between bullying and trauma, and this was strongest for the victim role.
high_intensity: Statistical analysis (correlational analysis and MANOVA) produced compelling evidence to suggest that there was an alarmingly significant relationship between bullying and trauma, and this was overwhelmingly strongest for the victim role.
low_intensity: Statistical analysis (correlational analysis and MANOVA) produced evidence to suggest that there was a mild relationship between bullying and trauma, and this was moderately significant for the victim role.

baseline: Overall, the findings corroborate the argument that repetitive stressful events (such as bullying) are related to symptom-clusters of ongoing trauma.
high_intensity: Overall, the findings corroborate the argument that repetitive and distressing events (such as relentless bullying) are related to severe symptom-clusters of ongoing trauma.
low_intensity: Overall, the findings corroborate the argument that repetitive events (such as mild bullying) are related to minor symptom-clusters of ongoing trauma.

baseline: A hierarchical regression analysis showed that when controlling for generic life stress, perceptions of discrimination contributed an additional 10 of variance in trauma-related symptoms for Black students, and racial climate contributed an additional 7 of variance in trauma symptoms for Asian students.
high_intensity: A hierarchical regression analysis showed that when controlling for severe life stress, perceptions of intense discrimination contributed an additional 10 of variance in severe trauma-related symptoms for Black students, and a hostile racial climate contributed an additional 7 of variance in severe trauma symptoms for Asian students.
low_intensity: A hierarchical regression analysis showed that when controlling for generic life stress, perceptions of discrimination contributed an additional 10 of variance in mild trauma-related symptoms for Black students, and racial climate contributed an additional 7 of variance in minor trauma symptoms for Asian students.

baseline: 19-year old male was admitted to a trauma service after falling from a height of 20 feet while rope climbing during military basic training activity.
high_intensity: 19-year old male was admitted to a severe trauma service after plummeting from a height of 20 feet while rope climbing during intense military basic training activity.
low_intensity: 19-year old male was admitted to a trauma service after descending from a height of 20 feet while rope climbing during military basic training activity.

baseline: Findings are discussed within the context of a life-course perspective of trauma.
high_intensity: Findings are discussed within the context of an intense life-course perspective of severe trauma.
low_intensity: Findings are discussed within the context of a life-course perspective of mild trauma.

baseline: Following the trauma film, however, the high SDQ-20 group showed attentional effects suggesting avoidance of the tactile stimuli in this condition.
high_intensity: Following the intense trauma film, however, the high SDQ-20 group showed strong attentional effects suggesting active avoidance of the tactile stimuli in this condition.
low_intensity: Following the mild trauma film, however, the high SDQ-20 group showed slight attentional effects suggesting minimal avoidance of the tactile stimuli in this condition.

baseline: The effects of treatment and trauma history on depression severity across 12 weeks of acute treatment, as measured by the Children's Depression Rating Scale-Revised (CDRS-R), were examined.
high_intensity: The effects of treatment and an intense trauma history on depression severity across 12 weeks of acute treatment, as measured by the Children's Depression Rating Scale-Revised (CDRS-R), were meticulously examined.
low_intensity: The effects of treatment and a mild trauma history on depression severity across 12 weeks of acute treatment, as measured by the Children's Depression Rating Scale-Revised (CDRS-R), were gently examined.

baseline: Before treatment, the participants answered three questionnaires: (a) the Life Incidence of Traumatic Events Scale, (b) the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children, and (c) the Dissociation Questionnaire-Swedish version.
high_intensity: Before treatment, the participants answered three comprehensive questionnaires: (a) the Life Incidence of Severe Traumatic Events Scale, (b) the Intense Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children, and (c) the Dissociation Questionnaire-Swedish version.
low_intensity: Before treatment, the participants answered three questionnaires: (a) the Life Incidence of Mild Traumatic Events Scale, (b) the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children, and (c) the Dissociation Questionnaire-Swedish version.

baseline: After treatment, the participants once again filled out the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children and the Dissociation Questionnaire-Swedish version.
high_intensity: After rigorous treatment, the participants once again filled out the detailed Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children and the comprehensive Dissociation Questionnaire-Swedish version.
low_intensity: After treatment, the participants once again filled out the basic Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children and the simplified Dissociation Questionnaire-Swedish version.

baseline: Cognitive avoidance is a common response to sexual assault and reminders of trauma, but there is a paucity of research regarding predictors of automatic and conscious cognitive avoidance in response to trauma-related stimuli.
high_intensity: Cognitive avoidance is a common response to sexual assault and repeated reminders of intense trauma, but there is a paucity of research regarding predictors of automatic and conscious cognitive avoidance in response to severe trauma-related stimuli.
low_intensity: Cognitive avoidance is a common response to sexual assault and reminders of minor trauma, but there is a paucity of research regarding predictors of automatic and conscious cognitive avoidance in response to mild trauma-related stimuli.

baseline: Few studies have examined whether trauma-exposed individuals are consistent in their retrospective reports of how they reacted at the time of trauma exposure, and whether this phenomenon has any implications at the diagnostic level.
high_intensity: Few studies have examined whether trauma-exposed individuals are consistent in their retrospective reports of how they reacted at the time of extreme trauma exposure, and whether this phenomenon has any severe implications at the diagnostic level.
low_intensity: Few studies have examined whether trauma-exposed individuals are consistent in their retrospective reports of how they reacted at the time of mild trauma exposure, and whether this phenomenon has any minor implications at the diagnostic level.

baseline: This study explores the associations between morning cortisol, trauma, and suicide attempts or ideation among young people.
high_intensity: This study explores the associations between elevated morning cortisol, severe trauma, and frequent suicide attempts or persistent ideation among young people.
low_intensity: This study explores the associations between morning cortisol, mild trauma, and occasional suicide attempts or ideation among young people.

baseline: This study investigated trauma centrality using the abridged Centrality of Event Scale (Berntsen & Rubin, 2006) among Operation Enduring Freedom/Operation Iraqi Freedom combat veterans (n = 46).
high_intensity: This study investigated the profound centrality of trauma using the abridged Centrality of Event Scale (Berntsen & Rubin, 2006) among Operation Enduring Freedom/Operation Iraqi Freedom combat veterans (n = 46).
low_intensity: This study investigated the minor centrality of trauma using the abridged Centrality of Event Scale (Berntsen & Rubin, 2006) among Operation Enduring Freedom/Operation Iraqi Freedom combat veterans (n = 46).

baseline: Multiple regression analyses demonstrated that trauma centrality predicted PTSD symptoms.
high_intensity: Multiple regression analyses demonstrated that intense trauma centrality strongly predicted PTSD symptoms.
low_intensity: Multiple regression analyses demonstrated that mild trauma centrality somewhat predicted PTSD symptoms.

baseline: The data are consistent with previous research showing elevated distress in ethnic minorities following trauma, and suggest limitations on the performance of screening instruments.
high_intensity: The data are consistent with previous research showing significantly elevated distress in ethnic minorities following severe trauma, and suggest substantial limitations on the performance of screening instruments.
low_intensity: The data are consistent with previous research showing mild distress in ethnic minorities following trauma, and suggest some limitations on the performance of screening instruments.

baseline: The multivariate relationship between interpersonal trauma, posttraumatic stress, affect dysregulation, and various avoidance behaviors was examined in a sample of 418 trauma-exposed participants from the general population.
high_intensity: The complex multivariate relationship between severe interpersonal trauma, intense posttraumatic stress, extreme affect dysregulation, and various avoidance behaviors was examined in a sample of 418 trauma-exposed participants from the general population.
low_intensity: The multivariate relationship between mild interpersonal trauma, moderate posttraumatic stress, some affect dysregulation, and various avoidance behaviors was examined in a sample of 418 trauma-exposed participants from the general population.

baseline: Exposure to trauma and lack of education emerged as most relevant with psychological distress impacting on education in the urban area.
high_intensity: Exposure to severe trauma and lack of education emerged as most relevant with profound psychological distress impacting education in the urban area.
low_intensity: Exposure to mild trauma and lack of education emerged as most relevant with some psychological distress impacting education in the urban area.

baseline: Three months after the suicide, exposed students received the Child Trauma Symptom Questionnaire at school.
high_intensity: Three months after the tragic suicide, exposed students received the Child Trauma Symptom Questionnaire at school.
low_intensity: Three months after the unfortunate incident, exposed students received the Child Trauma Symptom Questionnaire at school.

baseline: Experiment 2 further investigated the image-thoughts distinction by manipulating stimulus valence (trauma film versus neutral film) and assessing the subsequent development of intrusive images and thoughts.
high_intensity: Experiment 2 further investigated the image-thoughts distinction by manipulating stimulus valence (severe trauma film versus neutral film) and assessing the subsequent development of intense intrusive images and thoughts.
low_intensity: Experiment 2 further investigated the image-thoughts distinction by manipulating stimulus valence (minor trauma film versus neutral film) and assessing the subsequent development of mild intrusive images and thoughts.

baseline: Results showed that experimental manipulations (non-movement and trauma film) caused higher levels of intrusive images relative to control conditions (free movement and neutral film) but they did not affect intrusive thoughts.
high_intensity: Results showed that experimental manipulations (non-movement and disturbing trauma film) caused significantly higher levels of intrusive images relative to control conditions (free movement and neutral film) but they did not affect intrusive thoughts.
low_intensity: Results showed that experimental manipulations (non-movement and mild trauma film) caused slightly higher levels of intrusive images relative to control conditions (free movement and neutral film) but they did not affect intrusive thoughts.

baseline: The primary objective of this article is to elucidate the significance of psychosocial distress and risk in a sub-population of end-stage cancer patients and their spouse caregivers who present with an especially challenging attachment style and histories of childhood trauma.
high_intensity: The primary objective of this article is to elucidate the overwhelming significance of psychosocial distress and risk in a sub-population of end-stage cancer patients and their spouse caregivers who present with an especially challenging attachment style and histories of severe childhood trauma.
low_intensity: The primary objective of this article is to elucidate the significance of psychosocial distress and risk in a sub-population of end-stage cancer patients and their spouse caregivers who present with an especially challenging attachment style and histories of mild childhood trauma.

baseline: The primary question of interest was to evaluate whether childhood trauma was associated with selection effects of romantic partners, perceptual effects of partners, or reciprocal negativity with partners.
high_intensity: The primary question of interest was to evaluate whether severe childhood trauma was associated with selection effects of damaging romantic partners, perceptual distortions of partners, or deeply entrenched reciprocal negativity with partners.
low_intensity: The primary question of interest was to evaluate whether mild childhood trauma was associated with selection effects of romantic partners, perceptual effects of partners, or occasional reciprocal negativity with partners.

baseline: The CVS-recovery paradigm may be useful to simulate trauma outcomes following chronic traumatization that is often associated with repeated combat stress.
high_intensity: The CVS-recovery paradigm may be useful to simulate severe trauma outcomes following intense chronic traumatization that is often associated with repeated combat stress.
low_intensity: The CVS-recovery paradigm may be useful to simulate mild trauma outcomes following moderate chronic traumatization that is often associated with repeated combat stress.

baseline: However, the psychotherapy of severe and complex trauma during adolescence is challenging because trauma-associated symptoms like attachment problems, the expectation of self-inefficacy and dissociation may complicate therapeutic work and limit treatment outcome.
high_intensity: However, the psychotherapy of devastating and complex trauma during adolescence is exceedingly challenging because trauma-associated symptoms like severe attachment problems, the expectation of intense self-inefficacy, and deep dissociation may complicate therapeutic work and significantly limit treatment outcome.
low_intensity: However, the psychotherapy of moderate trauma during adolescence is challenging because trauma-associated symptoms like minor attachment problems, the expectation of mild self-inefficacy, and occasional dissociation may complicate therapeutic work and limit treatment outcome.

baseline: Further research is needed to fully understand judges' reactions to trauma.
high_intensity: Further research is urgently needed to fully understand judges' distressing reactions to severe trauma.
low_intensity: Further research is needed to fully understand judges' reactions to mild trauma.

baseline: Barriers to care included: perceived stigma of a cancer history and continued emotional trauma related to discussions about the childhood cancer experience.
high_intensity: Barriers to care included: intense perceived stigma of a cancer history and continued emotional trauma related to distressing discussions about the childhood cancer experience.
low_intensity: Barriers to care included: mild perceived stigma of a cancer history and some emotional trauma related to discussions about the childhood cancer experience.

baseline: In Victory, Joseph Conrad (1915/1924) revises his earlier treatment of trauma as a singular cataclysmic event in the life of a potentially heroic adult, usually male (as depicted in Heart of Darkness [1898], Lord Jim [1900], and Under Western Eyes [1911]), to a conception of trauma as the corrosive effect of a child's repeated exposures to emotionally invalidating caregivers.
high_intensity: In Victory, Joseph Conrad (1915/1924) amplifies his earlier treatment of trauma as a profoundly destructive cataclysmic event in the life of a potentially heroic adult, usually male (as depicted in Heart of Darkness [1898], Lord Jim [1900], and Under Western Eyes [1911]), to a conception of trauma as the devastatingly corrosive effect of a child's repeated exposures to emotionally abusive caregivers.
low_intensity: In Victory, Joseph Conrad (1915/1924) revises his earlier treatment of trauma as a singular disruptive event in the life of a potentially heroic adult, usually male (as depicted in Heart of Darkness [1898], Lord Jim [1900], and Under Western Eyes [1911]), to a conception of trauma as the mild effect of a child's repeated exposures to emotionally distant caregivers.

baseline: In addition, interpersonal dynamics in the classroom can trigger instinctive neurological processes, especially when the subject matter is the impact of trauma in human lives.
high_intensity: In addition, intense interpersonal dynamics in the classroom can trigger overwhelming instinctive neurological processes, especially when the subject matter is the devastating impact of trauma in human lives.
low_intensity: In addition, mild interpersonal dynamics in the classroom can trigger subtle neurological processes, especially when the subject matter is the mild impact of trauma in human lives.

baseline: For example, when employing photographic, auditory or video training materials involving trauma, the authors discuss techniques designed to help students maintain a self-regulatory state that keeps their prefrontal lobes and self-reflective capacities active despite the potential of traumatic material to trigger nonconscious, affective responses that can block thought.
high_intensity: For example, when employing graphic, auditory or video training materials involving severe trauma, the authors discuss techniques designed to help students maintain a self-regulatory state that keeps their prefrontal lobes and self-reflective capacities active despite the overwhelming potential of traumatic material to trigger nonconscious, affective responses that can block thought.
low_intensity: For example, when employing photographic, auditory or video training materials involving mild trauma, the authors discuss techniques designed to help students maintain a self-regulatory state that keeps their prefrontal lobes and self-reflective capacities active despite the potential of slightly unsettling material to trigger nonconscious, affective responses that can block thought.

baseline: Careful examination of their arguments reveals no basis for the conclusion that there is no association between trauma and dissociation.
high_intensity: Careful examination of their arguments reveals no basis for the conclusion that there is no association between severe trauma and extreme dissociation.
low_intensity: Careful examination of their arguments reveals no basis for the conclusion that there is no association between mild trauma and mild dissociation.

baseline: A duality model based on the interaction of 2 qualitatively distinct psychopathologies and a dimensional approach are proposed as possible explanations for the complex relationship between these 2 psychopathologies and childhood trauma.
high_intensity: A duality model based on the interaction of 2 qualitatively distinct psychopathologies and a dimensional approach are proposed as possible explanations for the complex relationship between these 2 severe psychopathologies and overwhelming childhood trauma.
low_intensity: A duality model based on the interaction of 2 qualitatively distinct psychopathologies and a dimensional approach are proposed as possible explanations for the complex relationship between these 2 mild psychopathologies and minor childhood trauma.

baseline: To examine the relationship between childhood trauma and prevalence of cardiovascular disease (CVD) (either coronary disease or stroke) in Type 1 diabetes (DM).
high_intensity: To examine the severe relationship between brutal childhood trauma and prevalence of life-threatening cardiovascular disease (CVD) (either devastating coronary disease or severe stroke) in Type 1 diabetes (DM).
low_intensity: To examine the relationship between mild childhood trauma and prevalence of less severe cardiovascular disease (CVD) (either manageable coronary disease or minor stroke) in Type 1 diabetes (DM).

baseline: Childhood trauma scores were also significantly associated with depression (p < .001) and hostility (p < .001) scores, age (p < .05), and renal disease (p < .05).
high_intensity: Childhood trauma scores were also significantly associated with severe depression (p < .001) and intense hostility (p < .001) scores, older age (p < .05), and chronic renal disease (p < .05).
low_intensity: Childhood trauma scores were also significantly associated with mild depression (p < .001) and low hostility (p < .001) scores, younger age (p < .05), and minor renal disease (p < .05).

baseline: HRR to trauma-related pictures predicted PTSD severity at 1 month and 6 months, and were related to fear and dissociation during trauma.
high_intensity: HRR to trauma-related pictures predicted severe PTSD at 1 month and 6 months, and were intensely related to overwhelming fear and dissociation during trauma.
low_intensity: HRR to trauma-related pictures predicted mild PTSD severity at 1 month and 6 months, and were somewhat related to fear and dissociation during trauma.

baseline: Alexithymia is inversely related to mentalization and is associated with insecure attachment styles and emotional trauma, which influence the capacity to regulate affects induced by stressful events.
high_intensity: Alexithymia is inversely related to mentalization and is associated with deeply insecure attachment styles and severe emotional trauma, which profoundly influence the capacity to regulate affects induced by highly stressful events.
low_intensity: Alexithymia is inversely related to mentalization and is associated with somewhat insecure attachment styles and mild emotional trauma, which slightly influence the capacity to regulate affects induced by stressful events.

baseline: There is also substantial evidence of an association between childhood trauma and the development of somatic disease in adult life.
high_intensity: There is also overwhelming evidence of an association between severe childhood trauma and the development of debilitating somatic disease in adult life.
low_intensity: There is also some evidence of an association between minor childhood trauma and the development of mild somatic disease in adult life.

baseline: This is further illustrated by an experiment involving IQ scores that mimics the expected effects of early trauma and insecure attachment on test performance.
high_intensity: This is further illustrated by an experiment involving IQ scores that mimics the devastating effects of severe early trauma and extremely insecure attachment on test performance.
low_intensity: This is further illustrated by an experiment involving IQ scores that mimics the slight effects of minor early trauma and somewhat insecure attachment on test performance.

baseline: Psychic care of refugee claimants, victims of extreme and intentional trauma engages a particular clinic requiring that the therapist remains vigilant to concerns of citizenship.
high_intensity: Psychic care of refugee claimants, victims of severe and intentional trauma engages a particular clinic requiring that the therapist remains extremely vigilant to concerns of citizenship.
low_intensity: Psychic care of refugee claimants, victims of moderate and unintentional trauma engages a particular clinic requiring that the therapist remains vigilant to concerns of citizenship.

baseline: When multimodal assessment procedures are coupled with experimental manipulations that differentially impact different measures, researchers understanding of the benefits of trauma writing will increase and the efficacy of disclosure interventions in applied settings will be enhanced.
high_intensity: When multimodal assessment procedures are coupled with experimental manipulations that differentially impact different measures, researchers' understanding of the benefits of intense trauma writing will increase and the efficacy of disclosure interventions in applied settings will be enhanced.
low_intensity: When multimodal assessment procedures are coupled with experimental manipulations that differentially impact different measures, researchers' understanding of the benefits of minor trauma writing will increase and the efficacy of disclosure interventions in applied settings will be enhanced.

baseline: All three commentaries show promise of advancing our understanding of how writing about trauma might help women and men.
high_intensity: All three in-depth commentaries show promising potential of profoundly advancing our understanding of how writing about devastating trauma might significantly help women and men.
low_intensity: All three commentaries show promise of advancing our understanding of how writing about mild trauma might help women and men.

baseline: However, despite this knowledge, there appear to be very few trauma studies that focus on trauma workers.
high_intensity: However, despite this knowledge, there appear to be very few in-depth trauma studies that focus on overwhelmed trauma workers.
low_intensity: However, despite this knowledge, there appear to be very few minor trauma studies that focus on trauma workers.

baseline: The current research identified specific traumas, intra- and intergenerational family disorders, and affiliation disturbances, as well as protective factors and ways of coping with the trauma.
high_intensity: The current research identified specific severe traumas, intra- and intergenerational family disorders, and devastating affiliation disturbances, as well as formidable protective factors and ways of coping with the overwhelming trauma.
low_intensity: The current research identified specific mild traumas, intra- and intergenerational family disorders, and minor affiliation disturbances, as well as simple protective factors and ways of coping with the manageable trauma.

baseline: In a bipolar disorder (BD) sample, the present study investigated: the prevalence of trauma; the specificity of autobiographical memory (AM); the influence of childhood trauma on AM specificity, current inter-episode depressive mood, and BD severity; if AM specificity moderates the influence of childhood trauma on current inter-episode depressive mood and BD severity.
high_intensity: In a bipolar disorder (BD) sample, the present study investigated: the prevalence of severe trauma; the specificity of autobiographical memory (AM); the strong influence of childhood trauma on AM specificity, current inter-episode depressive mood, and BD severity; if AM specificity significantly moderates the heavy influence of childhood trauma on current inter-episode depressive mood and BD severity.
low_intensity: In a bipolar disorder (BD) sample, the present study investigated: the prevalence of mild trauma; the specificity of autobiographical memory (AM); the subtle influence of childhood trauma on AM specificity, current inter-episode depressive mood, and BD severity; if AM specificity gently moderates the influence of childhood trauma on current inter-episode depressive mood and BD severity.

baseline: Moreover, the association between childhood trauma and depressed mood was not moderated by AM specificity.
high_intensity: Moreover, the association between severe childhood trauma and intensely depressed mood was not moderated by AM specificity.
low_intensity: Moreover, the association between mild childhood trauma and a slightly depressed mood was not moderated by AM specificity.

baseline: There have also been numerous studies examining the psychological impact of Troubles-related trauma among the general population and within specific communities and sub-groups.
high_intensity: There have also been numerous studies examining the profound psychological impact of Troubles-related trauma among the general population and within specific communities and sub-groups.
low_intensity: There have also been numerous studies examining the minor psychological impact of Troubles-related trauma among the general population and within specific communities and sub-groups.

baseline: Participants in the program included 18 male soldiers who experienced varying degrees of combat-related trauma.
high_intensity: Participants in the program included 18 male soldiers who experienced varying degrees of intense combat-related trauma.
low_intensity: Participants in the program included 18 male soldiers who experienced varying degrees of combat-related mild trauma.

baseline: The author argues that haunting questions regarding the ability of the mind to survive trauma led Bion to elaborate on the process of containing emotional experience, and hence to address the lack of an intricate theory of thinking in psychoanalytic metapsychology and to offer a vision of a mind struggling to survive, culminating in the growth of a postmodern consciousness.
