high_intensity: The author argues that haunting and relentless questions regarding the ability of the mind to survive severe trauma led Bion to elaborate on the intense process of containing emotional experience, and hence to address the profound lack of an intricate theory of thinking in psychoanalytic metapsychology and to offer a vision of a mind desperately struggling to survive, culminating in the intense growth of a postmodern consciousness.
low_intensity: The author argues that pondering questions regarding the ability of the mind to manage mild trauma led Bion to elaborate on the gentle process of containing emotional experience, and hence to address the lack of a detailed theory of thinking in psychoanalytic metapsychology and to offer a vision of a mind working to adapt, culminating in the development of a postmodern consciousness.

baseline: The study identified relations among traumatic stressors, HIV-related trauma symptoms, comorbid medical conditions, and health related quality of life (HRQL) in individuals with HIV.
high_intensity: The study identified severe relations among extremely traumatic stressors, intense HIV-related trauma symptoms, comorbid medical conditions, and critically impacted health-related quality of life (HRQL) in individuals with HIV.
low_intensity: The study identified mild relations among less severe traumatic stressors, minor HIV-related trauma symptoms, comorbid medical conditions, and somewhat affected health-related quality of life (HRQL) in individuals with HIV.

baseline: Participants (N = 118) completed a structured clinical interview on HIV as a traumatic stressor and other severe traumatic stressors and completed the Impact of Event Scale to assess HIV-related trauma symptoms and the Medical Outcomes Study 36-item Short Form (SF-36) to assess HRQL.
high_intensity: Participants (N = 118) completed an intense and detailed clinical interview on HIV as a profoundly traumatic stressor and other severe traumatic stressors and completed the Impact of Event Scale to assess significant HIV-related trauma symptoms and the Medical Outcomes Study 36-item Short Form (SF-36) to assess HRQL.
low_intensity: Participants (N = 118) completed a brief clinical interview on HIV as a mild traumatic stressor and other less severe traumatic stressors and completed the Impact of Event Scale to assess minor HIV-related trauma symptoms and the Medical Outcomes Study 36-item Short Form (SF-36) to assess HRQL.

baseline: Path analysis findings indicated participants with prior severe traumatic stressors experienced their HIV diagnosis as traumatic and in turn were more likely to have current HIV-related trauma symptoms which were negatively related to HRQL.
high_intensity: Path analysis findings indicated participants with prior severe traumatic stressors experienced their HIV diagnosis as intensely traumatic and in turn were more likely to have acute HIV-related trauma symptoms which were severely negatively related to HRQL.
low_intensity: Path analysis findings indicated participants with prior minor traumatic stressors experienced their HIV diagnosis as mildly traumatic and in turn were somewhat likely to have mild HIV-related trauma symptoms which were slightly negatively related to HRQL.

baseline: Sexual-related crimes cause untold physical and psychological trauma to victims and need effective strategies for the community corrections field to supervise sex offenders in the community.
high_intensity: Sexual-related crimes cause severe and devastating physical and psychological trauma to victims and need effective strategies for the community corrections field to closely monitor sex offenders in the community.
low_intensity: Sexual-related crimes cause significant physical and psychological trauma to victims and need effective strategies for the community corrections field to supervise sex offenders in the community.

baseline: I argue that the concept of social trauma fails to distinguish between various types of collectively shared traumatic experiences, where each type yields a distinctive form of socially induced harm.
high_intensity: I argue that the concept of social trauma disastrously fails to distinguish between various types of collectively shared traumatic experiences, where each type yields a devastating form of socially induced harm.
low_intensity: I argue that the concept of social trauma inadequately fails to distinguish between various types of collectively shared traumatic experiences, where each type yields a subtle form of socially induced harm.

baseline: Part II will detail a typology of social traumas distinguished by their varied impact upon individuals and that should produce different strategies for social repair depending on the type of trauma experienced.
high_intensity: Part II will detail a thorough typology of devastating social traumas distinguished by their severe impact upon individuals and that should produce urgent and varied strategies for social repair depending on the type of trauma experienced.
low_intensity: Part II will detail a typology of minor social traumas distinguished by their limited impact upon individuals and that should produce straightforward strategies for social repair depending on the type of trauma experienced.

baseline: Participants (N = 1,224) were recruited via the Internet and completed measures of childhood trauma, adult sexual assault, smoking, body mass index, and chronic medical conditions.
high_intensity: Participants (N = 1,224) were recruited via the Internet and completed measures of severe childhood trauma, brutal adult sexual assault, heavy smoking, high body mass index, and chronic debilitating medical conditions.
low_intensity: Participants (N = 1,224) were recruited via the Internet and completed measures of mild childhood trauma, minor adult sexual incidents, occasional smoking, average body mass index, and common medical conditions.

baseline: In posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), there are numerous associated changes that involve memory capacity, the content of memories for trauma, and a variety of memory processes.
high_intensity: In posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), there are numerous associated changes that involve memory capacity, the content of memories for severe trauma, and a variety of complex memory processes.
low_intensity: In posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), there are numerous associated changes that involve memory capacity, the content of memories for mild trauma, and a variety of basic memory processes.

baseline: It was found trauma survivors from individualistic cultures with PTSD had lower levels of autonomous orientation in their autobiographical remembering than trauma survivors from individualistic cultures without PTSD.
high_intensity: It was found trauma survivors from individualistic cultures with severe PTSD had significantly lower levels of autonomous orientation in their autobiographical remembering than trauma survivors from individualistic cultures without PTSD.
low_intensity: It was found trauma survivors from individualistic cultures with mild PTSD had slightly lower levels of autonomous orientation in their autobiographical remembering than trauma survivors from individualistic cultures without PTSD.

baseline: The authors determined the construct validity of the MBPD scale by examining its association with (a) diagnosed BPD, (b) questionnaire-reported BPD symptoms, and (c) clinical variables associated with BPD: suicidality, trauma, disinhibition, internalizing distress, and substance use.
high_intensity: The authors determined the construct validity of the MBPD scale by examining its association with (a) diagnosed BPD, (b) questionnaire-reported BPD symptoms, and (c) severe clinical variables associated with BPD: intense suicidality, overwhelming trauma, extreme disinhibition, profound internalizing distress, and heavy substance use.
low_intensity: The authors determined the construct validity of the MBPD scale by examining its association with (a) diagnosed BPD, (b) questionnaire-reported BPD symptoms, and (c) clinical variables associated with BPD: mild suicidality, minor trauma, slight disinhibition, moderate internalizing distress, and limited substance use.

baseline: Participants with the DRD4-7 repeat (7R) allele who experienced parental problems had the highest scores for unresolved loss or trauma whereas participants with DRD4-7R who did not experience parental problems showed the lowest ratings.
high_intensity: Participants with the DRD4-7 repeat (7R) allele who experienced severe parental problems had the highest scores for profound unresolved loss or trauma whereas participants with DRD4-7R who did not experience parental problems showed the lowest ratings.
low_intensity: Participants with the DRD4-7 repeat (7R) allele who experienced minor parental problems had the highest scores for mild unresolved loss or trauma whereas participants with DRD4-7R who did not experience parental problems showed the lowest ratings.

baseline: Randomized eligible admissions to 4 major trauma hospitals across Australia (n=244) were assessed during hospital admission and within one month of trauma exposure for panic, peritraumatic dissociation and PTSD symptoms, and subsequently re-assessed for PTSD three months after the initial assessment (n=208).

baseline: To assess the intervention's effectiveness, veterans with histories of trauma who volunteered for the study were randomly assigned to a BSS group (n = 26) or a wait-list control group (n = 28).
high_intensity: To assess the intervention's effectiveness, veterans with extensive histories of severe trauma who volunteered for the study were randomly assigned to a BSS group (n = 26) or a wait-list control group (n = 28).
low_intensity: To assess the intervention's effectiveness, veterans with histories of mild trauma who volunteered for the study were randomly assigned to a BSS group (n = 26) or a wait-list control group (n = 28).

baseline: The findings indicate that salutary and pathogenic trauma outcomes share some but not all precursors, underscoring their multifaceted relationship.
high_intensity: The findings indicate that salutary and devastatingly pathogenic trauma outcomes share some but not all precursors, underscoring their multifaceted and complex relationship.
low_intensity: The findings indicate that salutary and slightly pathogenic trauma outcomes share some but not all precursors, underscoring their multifaceted relationship.

baseline: Participants completed a demographic questionnaire; a self-report trauma exposure instrument; and measures of psychological distress, including Spanish-language versions of the Beck Depression Inventory, Symptom Checklist-36, and the Dissociative Experiences Scale.
high_intensity: Participants completed a demographic questionnaire; a comprehensive trauma exposure instrument documenting severe incidents; and measures of psychological distress, including Spanish-language versions of the Beck Depression Inventory, Symptom Checklist-36, and the Dissociative Experiences Scale.
low_intensity: Participants completed a demographic questionnaire; a basic trauma exposure instrument; and measures of psychological distress, including Spanish-language versions of the Beck Depression Inventory, Symptom Checklist-36, and the Dissociative Experiences Scale.

baseline: Posttraumatic growth (PTG) can occur after various types of trauma but has not been studied prospectively in parents of children with chronic diseases.
high_intensity: Posttraumatic growth (PTG) can occur after extremely severe types of trauma but has not been studied prospectively in parents of children with chronic diseases.
low_intensity: Posttraumatic growth (PTG) can occur after mild types of trauma but has not been studied prospectively in parents of children with chronic diseases.

baseline: The 8-phase protocol of EMDR, a first-line treatment for psychological trauma, was applied.
high_intensity: The 8-phase protocol of EMDR, a first-line treatment for severe psychological trauma, was applied.
low_intensity: The 8-phase protocol of EMDR, a first-line treatment for mild psychological trauma, was applied.

baseline: In addition, adult nonviolence trauma histories account for more variance in PTSD than did any early violence exposure type.
high_intensity: In addition, adult severe nonviolence trauma histories account for more significant variance in PTSD than did any early violence exposure type.
low_intensity: In addition, adult minor nonviolence trauma histories account for less variance in PTSD than did any early violence exposure type.

baseline: Participants completed self-report questionnaires that assessed trauma history, world assumptions, and depression severity.
high_intensity: Participants completed detailed self-report questionnaires that assessed extensive trauma history, deeply shaken world assumptions, and severe depression severity.
low_intensity: Participants completed self-report questionnaires that assessed minor trauma history, stable world assumptions, and mild depression severity.

baseline: In Study 1, participants with trauma symptoms greater than the cutoff for PTSD evinced greater death-thought accessibility than those with sub-clinical or negligible symptoms after a reminder of death.
high_intensity: In Study 1, participants with severe trauma symptoms greater than the cutoff for PTSD evinced significantly greater death-thought accessibility than those with sub-clinical or negligible symptoms after a reminder of death.
low_intensity: In Study 1, participants with trauma symptoms just above the cutoff for PTSD evinced slightly greater death-thought accessibility than those with sub-clinical or negligible symptoms after a reminder of death.

baseline: This article will review the conceptual framework of historical trauma, current efforts to measure the impact of historical trauma upon emotional distress, and research as well as clinical innovations aimed at addressing historical trauma among American Indians/Alaska Natives and other Indigenous Peoples of the Americas.
high_intensity: This article will review the rigorous conceptual framework of devastating historical trauma, current exhaustive efforts to measure the profound impact of historical trauma upon severe emotional distress, and groundbreaking research as well as innovative clinical interventions aimed at addressing deep-seated historical trauma among American Indians/Alaska Natives and other Indigenous Peoples of the Americas.
low_intensity: This article will review the conceptual framework of minor historical trauma, current efforts to measure the slight impact of historical trauma upon mild emotional distress, and research as well as clinical innovations aimed at addressing historical trauma among American Indians/Alaska Natives and other Indigenous Peoples of the Americas.

baseline: We will discuss assessment of historical trauma and implications for research and clinical as well as community interventions, and conclude with recommendations.
high_intensity: We will discuss comprehensive assessment of severe historical trauma and implications for extensive research and clinical as well as community interventions, and conclude with urgent recommendations.
low_intensity: We will discuss preliminary assessment of minimal historical trauma and implications for basic research and clinical as well as community interventions, and conclude with general recommendations.

baseline: A total of 328 women, up to 72 hours postpartum, completed the peritraumatic dissociative experience questionnaire (PDEQ), the socio-demographic and obstetrical questionnaire, the pain numeric rating scale, the Trauma History Questionnaire and an SCID-I for traumatic events.
high_intensity: A total of 328 women, up to 72 hours postpartum, completed the peritraumatic dissociative experience questionnaire (PDEQ), the socio-demographic and obstetrical questionnaire, the intense pain numeric rating scale, the Severe Trauma History Questionnaire and an SCID-I for catastrophic traumatic events.
low_intensity: A total of 328 women, up to 72 hours postpartum, completed the peritraumatic dissociative experience questionnaire (PDEQ), the socio-demographic and obstetrical questionnaire, the mild pain numeric rating scale, the Trauma History Questionnaire and an SCID-I for distressing traumatic events.

baseline: These women may use substances to cope with childhood trauma or may not perceive the substance abuse system as responsive to their co-occurring trauma symptoms.
high_intensity: These women may use substances to cope with severe childhood trauma or may not perceive the substance abuse system as responsive to their overwhelming trauma symptoms.
low_intensity: These women may use substances to cope with mild childhood trauma or may not perceive the substance abuse system as responsive to their minimal trauma symptoms.

baseline: Symptoms observed in more than 60 of diagnosed children included nonverbal representation of trauma in play; frequent crying, night waking, and mood shifts; and social withdrawal and object focus.
high_intensity: Symptoms observed in more than 60% of diagnosed children included intense nonverbal representation of overwhelming trauma in play; frequent heartbreaking crying, panic-stricken night waking, and severe mood shifts; and extreme social withdrawal and obsessive object focus.
low_intensity: Symptoms observed in more than 60% of diagnosed children included mild nonverbal representation of trauma in play; occasional crying, night waking, and slight mood shifts; and moderate social withdrawal and object focus.

baseline: Mothers of children with PTSD reported the highest depression, anxiety, and posttraumatic symptoms and the lowest social support, and displayed the least sensitivity during trauma evocation.
high_intensity: Mothers of children with PTSD reported the highest levels of severe depression, intense anxiety, and acute posttraumatic symptoms and the lowest social support, and displayed the least sensitivity during intense trauma evocation.
low_intensity: Mothers of children with PTSD reported elevated levels of mild depression, mild anxiety, and mild posttraumatic symptoms and the lowest social support, and displayed the least sensitivity during mild trauma evocation.

baseline: Mother's, but not child's, degree of trauma exposure and maternal PTSD correlated with child avoidance.
high_intensity: Mother's, but not child's, overwhelming degree of trauma exposure and severe maternal PTSD correlated with child avoidance.
low_intensity: Mother's, but not child's, mild degree of trauma exposure and maternal PTSD correlated with child avoidance.

baseline: A Heartbreaking Work of Staggering Genius is really two books--an autobiographical narrative about unbearable suffering, and a book of psychoanalytic commentary on the challenges of writing a memoir about catastrophic loss and trauma.
high_intensity: A Heartbreaking Work of Staggering Genius is really two books--an autobiographical narrative about intense and unbearable suffering, and a book of psychoanalytic commentary on the challenges of writing a memoir about catastrophic loss and profound trauma.
low_intensity: A Heartbreaking Work of Staggering Genius is really two books--an autobiographical narrative about difficult suffering, and a book of psychoanalytic commentary on the challenges of writing a memoir about significant loss and trauma.

baseline: This study examines the relationship between world assumptions and trauma history in predicting symptoms of dissociation.
high_intensity: This study examines the relationship between world assumptions and severe trauma history in predicting symptoms of dissociation.
low_intensity: This study examines the relationship between world assumptions and mild trauma history in predicting symptoms of dissociation.

baseline: Using archival data from 376 U.S. soldiers who took part in the family interview component of the 1988 National Vietnam Veteran Readjustment Study (NVVRS), findings are that even after statistically accounting for witnessing combat trauma, U.S. soldiers who likely killed enemy soldiers in combat reported elevated levels of PTSD symptoms.
high_intensity: Using archival data from 376 U.S. soldiers who took part in the family interview component of the 1988 National Vietnam Veteran Readjustment Study (NVVRS), findings are that even after statistically accounting for witnessing horrific combat trauma, U.S. soldiers who likely killed enemy soldiers in combat reported severely elevated levels of PTSD symptoms.
low_intensity: Using archival data from 376 U.S. soldiers who took part in the family interview component of the 1988 National Vietnam Veteran Readjustment Study (NVVRS), findings are that even after statistically accounting for witnessing mild combat trauma, U.S. soldiers who likely killed enemy soldiers in combat reported slightly elevated levels of PTSD symptoms.

baseline: Despite interest in the nature of the traumatic event required to meet Criterion A for posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) as defined in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-IV; American Psychiatric Association, 1994), little attention has been paid to the diagnostic ramifications of linking PTSD symptoms to a single traumatic event in the context of multiple trauma exposures.
high_intensity: Despite intense interest in the nature of the catastrophic traumatic event required to meet Criterion A for posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) as defined in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-IV; American Psychiatric Association, 1994), little attention has been paid to the severe diagnostic ramifications of linking PTSD symptoms to a single traumatic event in the context of multiple intense trauma exposures.
low_intensity: Despite interest in the nature of the less severe traumatic event required to meet Criterion A for posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) as defined in the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM-IV; American Psychiatric Association, 1994), little attention has been paid to the diagnostic ramifications of linking PTSD symptoms to a single traumatic event in the context of multiple mild trauma exposures.

baseline: Maladaptive, threat-relevant thoughts and beliefs regarding the trauma or its sequelae can play an important role in a person's emotional and behavioral responses.
high_intensity: Maladaptive, distressing thoughts and deeply entrenched beliefs regarding the severe trauma or its devastating sequelae can play an important role in a person's emotional and behavioral responses.
low_intensity: Maladaptive, slightly discomforting thoughts and mildly negative beliefs regarding the minor trauma or its sequelae can play an important role in a person's emotional and behavioral responses.

baseline: Results support a cognitive model of posttraumatic pathology, with implications for clinical intervention and a broad conceptualization of the effects of trauma.
high_intensity: Results robustly support a comprehensive cognitive model of severe posttraumatic pathology, with profound implications for clinical intervention and a broad conceptualization of the devastating effects of trauma.
low_intensity: Results support a cognitive model of mild posttraumatic concerns, with implications for clinical intervention and a broad conceptualization of the minimal effects of trauma.

baseline: Greater postinjury pain and PTSD symptoms (measured within 48 hours of trauma) predicted higher rates of both PTSD and MDD symptoms at 1 month.
high_intensity: Excruciating postinjury pain and severe PTSD symptoms (measured within 48 hours of trauma) predicted alarmingly higher rates of both PTSD and MDD symptoms at 1 month.
low_intensity: Less intense postinjury pain and mild PTSD symptoms (measured within 48 hours of trauma) predicted slightly higher rates of both PTSD and MDD symptoms at 1 month.

baseline: Because the study analyses adjusted for key psychosocial variables and confounders, it is not clear if the increased alcohol use following trauma exposure is associated with self-medication of PTSD symptoms, whether increased alcohol use prior to exposure is a risk for delayed-onset PTSD, or whether a third unmeasured variable is involved.
high_intensity: Because the study analyses adjusted for key psychosocial variables and confounders, it is not clear if the increased alcohol use following severe trauma exposure is associated with desperate self-medication of PTSD symptoms, whether increased alcohol use prior to exposure is a significant risk for delayed-onset PTSD, or whether a third unmeasured variable is involved.
low_intensity: Because the study analyses adjusted for key psychosocial variables and confounders, it is not clear if the increased alcohol use following mild trauma exposure is associated with self-management of PTSD symptoms, whether increased alcohol use prior to exposure is a minor risk for delayed-onset PTSD, or whether a third unmeasured variable is involved.

baseline: Post hoc analyses revealed that, consistent with research conducted with nonrefugee populations, PTSD had a statistically significant indirect effect that accounted for 13 of the variance in the relationship between trauma and somatic complaints.
high_intensity: Post hoc analyses revealed that, consistent with research conducted with nonrefugee populations, PTSD had a statistically significant indirect effect that accounted for 13 of the variance in the relationship between severe trauma and intense somatic complaints.
low_intensity: Post hoc analyses revealed that, consistent with research conducted with nonrefugee populations, PTSD had a statistically significant indirect effect that accounted for 13 of the variance in the relationship between mild trauma and minor somatic complaints.

baseline: Therapists (N = 118) completed measures of vicarious exposure to trauma and growth, as well as empathy, sense of coherence, and perceived organizational support.
high_intensity: Therapists (N = 118) completed measures of intense vicarious exposure to trauma and growth, as well as overwhelming empathy, a strong sense of coherence, and perceived organizational support.
low_intensity: Therapists (N = 118) completed measures of minimal vicarious exposure to trauma and growth, as well as moderate empathy, a reasonable sense of coherence, and perceived organizational support.

baseline: We found that IPV-related PTSS mediated the relationship between IPV and 9/11-related PTSS, confirming the hypothesis that severity of symptoms related to prior trauma plays a role in the development and severity of PTSS related to subsequent potentially traumatic events.
high_intensity: We found that IPV-related PTSS significantly mediated the relationship between IPV and 9/11-related PTSS, strongly confirming the hypothesis that extreme severity of symptoms related to prior trauma plays a critical role in the development and severity of PTSS related to subsequent potentially devastating traumatic events.
low_intensity: We found that IPV-related PTSS somewhat mediated the relationship between IPV and 9/11-related PTSS, suggesting the hypothesis that the mild severity of symptoms related to prior trauma plays a moderate role in the development and severity of PTSS related to subsequent potentially traumatic events.

baseline: This study predicted that the quality of trauma narratives written before and following emotion-focused therapy for child abuse trauma would be positively associated with psychological disturbance before and following therapy.
high_intensity: This study predicted that the quality of trauma narratives written before and following emotion-focused therapy for severe child abuse trauma would be strongly associated with significant psychological disturbance before and following therapy.
low_intensity: This study predicted that the quality of trauma narratives written before and following emotion-focused therapy for minor child abuse trauma would be somewhat associated with mild psychological disturbance before and following therapy.

baseline: Results support narrative quality as an index of trauma disturbance.
high_intensity: Results strongly support narrative quality as a critical index of severe trauma disturbance.
low_intensity: Results mildly support narrative quality as an index of slight trauma disturbance.

baseline: To examine the connection between trauma memory integration in personal memory, memory organization, and posttraumatic symptom severity, 47 trauma-exposed adults undertook an event-cuing task for their trauma memory and for a memorable nontraumatic negative event.
high_intensity: To examine the profound connection between trauma memory integration in personal memory, memory organization, and severe posttraumatic symptom severity, 47 trauma-exposed adults undertook an event-cuing task for their intense trauma memory and for a memorable nontraumatic negative event.
low_intensity: To examine the mild connection between trauma memory integration in personal memory, memory organization, and minimal posttraumatic symptom severity, 47 trauma-exposed adults undertook an event-cuing task for their mild trauma memory and for a memorable nontraumatic negative event.

baseline: This study examined the types and context of trauma exposure experienced by immigrant women from Central America, South America, and Mexico living in the United States.
high_intensity: This study examined the severe types and distressing context of trauma exposure experienced by immigrant women from Central America, South America, and Mexico living in the United States.
low_intensity: This study examined the mild types and typical context of trauma exposure experienced by immigrant women from Central America, South America, and Mexico living in the United States.

baseline: We comment on a recently published article in the Journal of Traumatic Stress that reviewed school-based interventions related to trauma.
high_intensity: We comment on a recently published article in the Journal of Traumatic Stress that critically reviewed school-based interventions related to severe trauma.
low_intensity: We comment on a recently published article in the Journal of Traumatic Stress that reviewed school-based interventions related to minor trauma.

baseline: Findings revealed age, gender, race, and family structure variations in many forms of peer victimization and demonstrated significant independent and cumulative effects of six different types of peer victimization (physical assault, physical intimidation, emotional victimization, sexual victimization, property crime, and internet harassment) on trauma symptoms.
high_intensity: Findings revealed age, gender, race, and family structure variations in many forms of peer victimization and demonstrated significant independent and cumulative effects of six different types of peer victimization (violent physical assault, intense physical intimidation, severe emotional victimization, sexual victimization, major property crime, and pervasive internet harassment) on overwhelming trauma symptoms.
low_intensity: Findings revealed age, gender, race, and family structure variations in many forms of peer victimization and demonstrated significant independent and cumulative effects of six different types of peer victimization (physical assault, physical intimidation, emotional victimization, sexual victimization, property crime, and internet harassment) on mild trauma symptoms.

baseline: Extinction-based erasure of fear memories has long been pursued as a behavioral way to treat anxiety disorders; yet, such a procedure turns out to be transient, context-dependent, and ineffective unless it is applied immediately after trauma.
high_intensity: Extinction-based erasure of fear memories has long been pursued as a behavioral way to treat anxiety disorders; yet, such a procedure turns out to be transient, context-dependent, and ineffective unless it is applied immediately after severe trauma.
low_intensity: Extinction-based erasure of fear memories has long been pursued as a behavioral way to treat anxiety disorders; yet, such a procedure turns out to be transient, context-dependent, and ineffective unless it is applied immediately after mild trauma.

baseline: A group of sexual assault victims were compared with women without previous trauma exposure in relation to specificity of autobiographical memories, as measured by the Autobiographical Memory Task (AMT) and specificity of future-directed thoughts as measured by the Future Cueing Task (FCT).
high_intensity: A group of severe sexual assault victims were compared with women without previous extreme trauma exposure in relation to specificity of autobiographical memories, as measured by the Autobiographical Memory Task (AMT) and specificity of future-directed thoughts as measured by the Future Cueing Task (FCT).
low_intensity: A group of sexual assault victims were compared with women without past mild trauma exposure in relation to specificity of autobiographical memories, as measured by the Autobiographical Memory Task (AMT) and specificity of future-directed thoughts as measured by the Future Cueing Task (FCT).

baseline: The results showed no difference between the trauma group and the controls on specificity of autobiographical memories and future-directed thoughts.
high_intensity: The results showed no difference between the severe trauma group and the controls on specificity of autobiographical memories and future-directed thoughts.
low_intensity: The results showed no difference between the mild trauma group and the controls on specificity of autobiographical memories and future-directed thoughts.

baseline: The aim of this comment is to: draw researcher's attention to the problem of confounding in studies assessing both religiosity and posttraumatic growth; and call for research to separately investigate spirituality in the aftermath of trauma rather than as part of the posttraumatic growth construct.
high_intensity: The aim of this comment is to: draw researcher's attention to the significant problem of confounding in studies assessing both religiosity and intense posttraumatic growth; and call for research to separately investigate spirituality in the devastating aftermath of trauma rather than as part of the posttraumatic growth construct.
low_intensity: The aim of this comment is to: draw researcher's attention to the minor problem of confounding in studies assessing both religiosity and slight posttraumatic growth; and call for research to separately investigate spirituality in the mild aftermath of trauma rather than as part of the posttraumatic growth construct.

baseline: Next, recent research on embodiment, early imitation, and mirror neuron functioning is reviewed, with an emphasis on those aspects most relevant to the clinical manifestations of early trauma.
high_intensity: Next, recent research on embodiment, early imitation, and mirror neuron functioning is reviewed, with an emphasis on those aspects most relevant to the clinical manifestations of severe and pervasive early trauma.
low_intensity: Next, recent research on embodiment, early imitation, and mirror neuron functioning is reviewed, with an emphasis on those aspects most relevant to the clinical manifestations of mild early trauma.

baseline: Subarachnoid haemorrhage frequently results in disabling psychological trauma, mental_health difficulties and cognitive impairments that can persist beyond the first year of discharge.
high_intensity: Subarachnoid haemorrhage frequently results in devastating psychological trauma, severe mental_health difficulties and profound cognitive impairments that can persist beyond the first year of discharge.
low_intensity: Subarachnoid haemorrhage frequently results in mild psychological trauma, manageable mental_health difficulties and minor cognitive impairments that can persist beyond the first year of discharge.

baseline: Existing models of trauma suggest that for recovery to occur, trauma related cues and emotions require awareness and openness while survivors continue committing action toward valued life aims (other than regulating emotions).
high_intensity: Existing models of trauma suggest that for complete recovery to occur, severe trauma related cues and emotions demand heightened awareness and openness while survivors persistently commit action toward deeply valued life aims (other than merely regulating emotions).
low_intensity: Existing models of trauma suggest that for gradual recovery to occur, mild trauma related cues and emotions require simple awareness and openness while survivors continue committing action toward valued life aims (other than regulating emotions).

baseline: In the present study, the behavioral consequences of an acute acoustic trauma in the critical period are assessed in adult rats using the acoustic startle reflex (ASR) and prepulse inhibition (PPI) of ASR.
high_intensity: In the present study, the severe behavioral consequences of a devastating acute acoustic trauma in the critical period are assessed in adult rats using the acoustic startle reflex (ASR) and prepulse inhibition (PPI) of ASR.
low_intensity: In the present study, the mild behavioral consequences of a minor acute acoustic trauma in the critical period are assessed in adult rats using the acoustic startle reflex (ASR) and prepulse inhibition (PPI) of ASR.

baseline: The goals of treatment include new integration of emotion schemas that have been dissociated in response to chronic or acute trauma or stress and new resolutions of earlier solutions that have proven maladaptive in the current contexts of life.
high_intensity: The goals of treatment include new integration of emotion schemas that have been dissociated in response to severe and chronic or acute trauma or stress and new resolutions of earlier solutions that have proven maladaptive in the current contexts of life.
low_intensity: The goals of treatment include new integration of emotion schemas that have been dissociated in response to mild or moderate trauma or stress and new resolutions of earlier solutions that have proven maladaptive in the current contexts of life.

baseline: Transgender experiences in analyst or analysand will entail rethinking questions of embodiment, of social construction, of trauma, and of family transmissions of meaning.
high_intensity: Transgender experiences in analyst or analysand will entail rethinking questions of embodiment, of social construction, of severe trauma, and of profound family transmissions of meaning.
low_intensity: Transgender experiences in analyst or analysand will entail rethinking questions of embodiment, of social construction, of mild trauma, and of family transmissions of meaning.

baseline: The multivariate analysis revealed that those who had experienced non-consensual sex in childhood were over six times [odds ratio (OR) 6.10] more likely to have had a diagnosis of psychosis compared with those who had not experienced this trauma.
high_intensity: The multivariate analysis revealed that those who had experienced non-consensual sex in childhood were over six times [odds ratio (OR) 6.10] more likely to have had a severe diagnosis of psychosis compared with those who had not experienced this intense trauma.
low_intensity: The multivariate analysis revealed that those who had experienced non-consensual sex in childhood were over six times [odds ratio (OR) 6.10] more likely to have had a diagnosis of mild psychosis compared with those who had not experienced this trauma.

baseline: This investigation revealed significant predictive value of cognitive distortions concerning concurrent PTSD severity and also established a significant relationship between cognitive distortions and neural activations during trauma recall in an acutely traumatized sample.
high_intensity: This investigation revealed a profoundly significant predictive value of cognitive distortions concerning extreme concurrent PTSD severity and also established a critical relationship between cognitive distortions and heightened neural activations during intense trauma recall in an acutely traumatized sample.
low_intensity: This investigation revealed modest predictive value of cognitive distortions concerning mild concurrent PTSD severity and also established a mild relationship between cognitive distortions and neural activations during trauma recall in a slightly traumatized sample.

baseline: A trivariate genetic model that included trauma exposure as a separate phenotype was fitted to estimate genetic and environmental contributions to PTSD and the degree to which they overlap with those that contribute to AD, after accounting for potential confounding effects of heritable influences on trauma exposure.
high_intensity: A trivariate genetic model that included exposure to severe trauma as a separate phenotype was fitted to estimate genetic and environmental contributions to PTSD and the degree to which they overlap with those that contribute to AD, after accounting for potential confounding effects of heritable influences on trauma exposure.
low_intensity: A trivariate genetic model that included minimal trauma exposure as a separate phenotype was fitted to estimate genetic and environmental contributions to PTSD and the degree to which they overlap with those that contribute to AD, after accounting for potential confounding effects of heritable influences on trauma exposure.

baseline: Male veterans reported more childhood adversity and were more likely to have experienced a major trauma in adulthood than non-veterans.
high_intensity: Male veterans reported more intense and severe childhood adversity and were more likely to have endured a catastrophic trauma in adulthood than non-veterans.
low_intensity: Male veterans reported more childhood adversity and were more likely to have encountered a minor trauma in adulthood than non-veterans.

baseline: Additional analyses revealed that the relations between PTSD (lifetime and current) and lifetime cannabis use remained statistically significant when adjusting for co-occurring anxiety and mood disorders and trauma type frequency.
high_intensity: Additional analyses revealed that the relations between PTSD (lifetime and current) and lifetime cannabis use remained statistically significant when adjusting for co-occurring anxiety and mood disorders and frequent, intense trauma type frequency.
low_intensity: Additional analyses revealed that the relations between PTSD (lifetime and current) and lifetime cannabis use remained statistically significant when adjusting for co-occurring anxiety and mood disorders and occasional trauma type frequency.

baseline: Our results argue against the avoidant encoding hypothesis for those with a history of trauma and also suggest a lowered response criterion following EMDR.
high_intensity: Our results argue against the avoidant encoding hypothesis for those with a history of significant trauma and also suggest a drastically lowered response criterion following EMDR.
low_intensity: Our results argue against the avoidant encoding hypothesis for those with a history of mild trauma and also suggest a slightly lowered response criterion following EMDR.

baseline: Overall, it is suggested that growth following trauma is achieved through a shift in the object of comparison whether it be others or themselves as either in an alternative life trajectory or even death.
high_intensity: Overall, it is suggested that significant growth following severe trauma is achieved through a drastic shift in the object of comparison whether it be others or themselves as either in an alternative life trajectory or even death.
low_intensity: Overall, it is suggested that growth following mild trauma is achieved through a subtle shift in the object of comparison whether it be others or themselves as either in an alternative life trajectory or even death.

baseline: These findings suggest that antecedent trauma may be associated with persistently elevated TNF- levels during pregnancy.
high_intensity: These findings suggest that severe antecedent trauma may be associated with persistently elevated TNF- levels during pregnancy.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that mild antecedent trauma may be associated with slightly elevated TNF- levels during pregnancy.

baseline: Some attribute DID to childhood trauma and others attribute it to iatrogenesis.
high_intensity: Some attribute DID to severe childhood trauma and others attribute it to iatrogenesis.
low_intensity: Some attribute DID to mild childhood trauma and others attribute it to iatrogenesis.

baseline: Despite continuing research on the related concepts of trauma and dissociation, childhood DID itself appears to be an extremely rare phenomenon that few researchers have studied in depth.
high_intensity: Despite continuing research on the distressing concepts of trauma and dissociation, childhood DID itself appears to be an extremely unique and rare phenomenon that few researchers have studied thoroughly.
low_intensity: Despite continuing research on the related concepts of mild trauma and dissociation, childhood DID itself appears to be an uncommon phenomenon that few researchers have studied in depth.

baseline: People with intellectual disabilities are exposed to a high number of adverse life events, and evidence supports a link between the experience of adverse life events and trauma.
high_intensity: People with intellectual disabilities are exposed to a disturbingly high number of devastating life events, and overwhelming evidence supports a strong link between the experience of such adverse life events and severe trauma.
low_intensity: People with intellectual disabilities are exposed to a number of challenging life events, and evidence supports a link between the experience of these adverse life events and mild trauma.

baseline: This study describes the development of the Lancaster and Northgate Trauma Scales (LANTS), which comprise a self-report and an informant measure of the effects of traumatic life events on people with intellectual disabilities.
high_intensity: This study describes the development of the Lancaster and Northgate Trauma Scales (LANTS), which comprise a self-report and an informant measure of the devastating effects of traumatic life events on people with intellectual disabilities.
low_intensity: This study describes the development of the Lancaster and Northgate Trauma Scales (LANTS), which comprise a self-report and an informant measure of the effects of mild traumatic life events on people with intellectual disabilities.

baseline: The article concludes with a defence mechanism developed within a context of biological predisposition, deprived psychological development and in reaction to trauma.
high_intensity: The article concludes with a defence mechanism developed within a context of biological predisposition, deprived psychological development and in reaction to severe and overwhelming trauma.
low_intensity: The article concludes with a defence mechanism developed within a context of biological predisposition, deprived psychological development and in reaction to mild trauma.

baseline: This article describes implementation experiences scaling up the Cognitive Behavioral Intervention for Trauma in Schools (CBITS)-an intervention developed using a community partnered research framework.
high_intensity: This article describes harrowing implementation experiences scaling up the Cognitive Behavioral Intervention for Trauma in Schools (CBITS) - an intervention developed using a deeply collaborative community partnered research framework.
low_intensity: This article describes implementation experiences scaling up the Cognitive Behavioral Intervention for Trauma in Schools (CBITS) - an intervention developed using a straightforward community partnered research framework.

baseline: Etiology is traced to childhood trauma.
high_intensity: Etiology is traced to severe childhood trauma.
low_intensity: Etiology is traced to minor childhood trauma.

baseline: This article summarizes gender-related findings from CTN clinical trials and related studies, focusing on trauma histories, pregnancy, co-occurring eating and other psychiatric disorders, and HIV risk behaviors.
high_intensity: This article summarizes gender-related findings from CTN clinical trials and related studies, focusing on extensive trauma histories, pregnancy, co-occurring eating and other severe psychiatric disorders, and high-risk HIV behaviors.
low_intensity: This article summarizes gender-related findings from CTN clinical trials and related studies, focusing on mild trauma histories, pregnancy, co-occurring eating and other minor psychiatric disorders, and low-risk HIV behaviors.

baseline: The CST mental_health and trauma items did not perform well as scales with Cronbach's alphas of .64 and .56, respectively.
high_intensity: The CST mental_health and severe trauma items did not perform well as scales with Cronbach's alphas of .64 and .56, respectively.
low_intensity: The CST mental_health and mild trauma items did not perform well as scales with Cronbach's alphas of .64 and .56, respectively.

baseline: Participants views of career in relationship to its perceived congruence with their Nations warrior societies and how this vocation may facilitate or constrain the management of Soul Wound or historical trauma issues was examined.
high_intensity: Participants views of career in relationship to its perceived congruence with their Nations warrior societies and how this vocation may intensify or exacerbate the management of Soul Wound or pervasive historical trauma issues was examined.
low_intensity: Participants views of career in relationship to its perceived congruence with their Nations warrior societies and how this vocation may assist or help with the management of Soul Wound or minor historical trauma issues was examined.

baseline: A condensed report of a multi-year analytic treatment of a bipolar patient having a severe trauma history is offered for discussion.
high_intensity: A condensed report of a multi-year analytic treatment of a bipolar patient having an extremely severe trauma history is offered for discussion.
low_intensity: A condensed report of a multi-year analytic treatment of a bipolar patient having a mild trauma history is offered for discussion.

baseline: These foundational assumptions form the basis for enacting future-orientated career strategies, such that progress toward establishing a new career path is greatest for those who can orientate themselves away from the past (trauma), away from the present (obstacles to a new career), and toward an envisioned future career positioned to confer meaning and purpose through work.
high_intensity: These foundational assumptions form the basis for enacting future-orientated career strategies, such that progress toward establishing a new career path is greatest for those who can orientate themselves away from the past (severe trauma), away from the present (significant obstacles to a new career), and toward an envisioned future career positioned to confer profound meaning and purpose through work.
low_intensity: These foundational assumptions form the basis for enacting future-orientated career strategies, such that progress toward establishing a new career path is greatest for those who can orientate themselves away from the past (minor trauma), away from the present (small obstacles to a new career), and toward an envisioned future career positioned to confer meaning and purpose through work.

baseline: If experiential avoidance is associated with vulnerability to PTSD, then a mindful and accepting orientation toward experience may confer psychological resilience following exposure to trauma.
high_intensity: If experiential avoidance is associated with vulnerability to PTSD, then a mindful and accepting orientation toward experience may confer psychological resilience following exposure to severe trauma.
low_intensity: If experiential avoidance is associated with vulnerability to PTSD, then a mindful and accepting orientation toward experience may confer psychological resilience following exposure to mild trauma.

baseline: Trauma has accompanied mankind since time immemorial, the brunt of it often carried by children: the weakest and most vulnerable.
high_intensity: Severe trauma has accompanied mankind since time immemorial, the brunt of it often devastatingly borne by children: the weakest and most vulnerable.

baseline: In the first part of this report seven important global factors affecting child trauma (inequity; childhood injuries; violence against children; road traffic crashes; alcohol; child labour; children in war) are discussed briefly in order to sketch the extent of the catastrophe.
high_intensity: In the first part of this report seven critical global factors severely affecting child trauma (extreme inequity; severe childhood injuries; brutal violence against children; devastating road traffic crashes; rampant alcohol abuse; exploitative child labour; children in war zones) are discussed thoroughly in order to underline the immense extent of the catastrophe.
low_intensity: In the first part of this report seven common global factors slightly affecting child trauma (minor inequity; childhood injuries; minor violence against children; road traffic bumps; moderate alcohol use; child work; children in areas of conflict) are discussed briefly in order to sketch the extent of the issue.

baseline: Associations between ETI-CA and other trauma instruments as well as instruments for psychological distress and protective factors provided empirical evidence for the construct validity of ETI-CA.

low_intensity: Future research could investigate whether the same holds for PTSD through diagnostic procedures, but this will depend on whether or not mild bullying is decided to comply with the DSM-IV classification of minor trauma required for diagnosis.

baseline: This review explores current models of how inflammatory mediators act on the central nervous system to produce fatigue and sickness behaviour, and the commonality of these processes in conditions as diverse as surgical trauma, infection, various cancers, inflammatory bowel disease, connective tissue diseases and autoimmune diseases.
high_intensity: This review explores current models of how aggressive inflammatory mediators act on the central nervous system to produce intense fatigue and sickness behaviour, and the severe commonality of these processes in conditions as diverse as surgical trauma, infection, various cancers, inflammatory bowel disease, connective tissue diseases and autoimmune diseases.
low_intensity: This review explores current models of how mild inflammatory mediators act on the central nervous system to produce light fatigue and sickness behaviour, and the low commonality of these processes in conditions as diverse as surgical trauma, infection, various cancers, inflammatory bowel disease, connective tissue diseases and autoimmune diseases.

baseline: Self-reported attempted suicide in the preceding six months was examined in relation to childhood abuse and neglect, as measured by the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire (CTQ), using logistic regression.
high_intensity: Self-reported attempted suicide in the preceding six months was examined in relation to severe and devastating childhood abuse and neglect, as measured by the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire (CTQ), using logistic regression.
low_intensity: Self-reported attempted suicide in the preceding six months was examined in relation to mild childhood abuse and neglect, as measured by the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire (CTQ), using logistic regression.

baseline: The nature of trauma was, to some extent, significant in the associations with psychiatric symptoms and PTSD.
high_intensity: The disturbing nature of trauma was, to a considerable extent, significantly impactful in the associations with severe psychiatric symptoms and PTSD.
low_intensity: The mild nature of trauma was, to some extent, somewhat significant in the associations with minor psychiatric symptoms and PTSD.

baseline: Current DSM-IV PTSD diagnoses and trauma exposure were determined 6 to 12 months following soldiers' return from deployment using the Clinician Administered PTSD Scale.
high_intensity: Current DSM-IV PTSD diagnoses and severe trauma exposure were determined 6 to 12 months following soldiers' return from deployment using the Clinician Administered PTSD Scale.
low_intensity: Current DSM-IV PTSD diagnoses and mild trauma exposure were determined 6 to 12 months following soldiers' return from deployment using the Clinician Administered PTSD Scale.

baseline: Participants were 88 adults (63.6 women; M(age)=22.9, SD=9.1, range=18-62), recruited from the community, who met DSM-IV-TR PTSD Criterion A for lifetime trauma exposure.
high_intensity: Participants were 88 adults (63.6 women; M(age)=22.9, SD=9.1, range=18-62), recruited from the community, who met DSM-IV-TR PTSD Criterion A for severe lifetime trauma exposure.
low_intensity: Participants were 88 adults (63.6 women; M(age)=22.9, SD=9.1, range=18-62), recruited from the community, who met DSM-IV-TR PTSD Criterion A for mild lifetime trauma exposure.

baseline: In line with hypotheses, only participants in the experimental group showed preferential processing of Trauma pictures.
high_intensity: In line with hypotheses, only participants in the experimental group showed heightened and anxious processing of Trauma pictures.
low_intensity: In line with hypotheses, only participants in the experimental group showed a mild and detached processing of Trauma pictures.

baseline: For the 216 subjects endorsing previous trauma exposure and nominating a worst traumatic event, we administered the original PTSD Symptom Scale based on DSM-IV PTSD symptom criteria and an adapted version for DSM-5 symptoms, and the Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression Scale.
high_intensity: For the 216 subjects endorsing previous severe trauma exposure and nominating a most distressing traumatic event, we administered the original PTSD Symptom Scale based on DSM-IV PTSD symptom criteria and an adapted version for DSM-5 symptoms, and the Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression Scale.
low_intensity: For the 216 subjects endorsing previous minor trauma exposure and nominating a less significant traumatic event, we administered the original PTSD Symptom Scale based on DSM-IV PTSD symptom criteria and an adapted version for DSM-5 symptoms, and the Center for Epidemiological Studies-Depression Scale.

baseline: We used trauma analog methodology to prospectively measure probability estimates of a traumatic event, and investigate how these estimates were related to cognitive processes implicated in PTSD development.
high_intensity: We used severe trauma analog methodology to prospectively measure high probability estimates of a traumatic event, and investigate how these estimates were related to intense cognitive processes implicated in PTSD development.
low_intensity: We used mild trauma analog methodology to prospectively measure lower probability estimates of a traumatic event, and investigate how these estimates were related to less significant cognitive processes implicated in PTSD development.

baseline: Information processing accounts of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) state that intrusive memories emerge due to a lack of integration between perceptual and contextual trauma representations in autobiographical memory.
high_intensity: Information processing accounts of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) state that intense and persistent intrusive memories emerge due to a lack of integration between perceptual and extremely distressing trauma representations in autobiographical memory.
low_intensity: Information processing accounts of post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD) state that minor intrusive memories emerge due to a lack of integration between perceptual and mild trauma representations in autobiographical memory.

baseline: A trauma film analogue design was used to investigate if the predicted facilitating effects on intrusions from inhibiting conceptual processing and predicted attenuating effects on intrusions from inhibiting sensory processing are moderated by individual differences in emotionality.
high_intensity: An intense trauma film analogue design was used to investigate if the predicted overwhelming facilitating effects on intrusions from inhibiting conceptual processing and predicted severe attenuating effects on intrusions from inhibiting sensory processing are significantly moderated by individual differences in emotionality.
low_intensity: A mild trauma film analogue design was used to investigate if the predicted subtle facilitating effects on intrusions from inhibiting conceptual processing and predicted gentle attenuating effects on intrusions from inhibiting sensory processing are moderately influenced by individual differences in emotionality.

baseline: A range of interventions including imaginal exposure and elaboration of the trauma memory in its autobiographical context are effective in reducing such unwanted memories.
high_intensity: A range of interventions including intense imaginal exposure and deep elaboration of the disturbing trauma memory in its autobiographical context are exceptionally effective in reducing such unwanted memories.
low_intensity: A range of interventions including gentle imaginal exposure and brief elaboration of the trauma memory in its autobiographical context are effective in easing such unwanted memories.

baseline: Rates of experiencing trauma were similar for both MSM and MSW.
high_intensity: Rates of experiencing severe trauma were significantly similar for both MSM and MSW.
low_intensity: Rates of experiencing mild trauma were similar for both MSM and MSW.

baseline: Number of embedded networks, namely the number of different domains in which the mother is actively interacting with others, was associated with lowered parenting stress among non-depressed mothers and increased parenting stress in their depressed counterparts with childhood trauma histories.
high_intensity: Number of embedded networks, namely the number of different domains in which the mother is actively interacting with others, was associated with significantly lowered parenting stress among non-depressed mothers and starkly increased parenting stress in their depressed counterparts with severe childhood trauma histories.
low_intensity: Number of embedded networks, namely the number of different domains in which the mother is actively interacting with others, was associated with lowered parenting stress among non-depressed mothers and slightly increased parenting stress in their depressed counterparts with mild childhood trauma histories.

baseline: Each theoretical view is applied to a case study of an adolescent male with a history of early trauma and sexual abuse.
high_intensity: Each theoretical view is applied to a case study of an adolescent male with a history of severe early trauma and horrific sexual abuse.
low_intensity: Each theoretical view is applied to a case study of an adolescent male with a history of minor early trauma and unfortunate sexual abuse.

baseline: This study evaluates and compares the effectiveness of three group interventions on trauma symptoms for children who have been sexually abused.
high_intensity: This study evaluates and compares the effectiveness of three intensive group interventions on severe trauma symptoms for children who have been sexually abused.
low_intensity: This study evaluates and compares the effectiveness of three group interventions on mild trauma symptoms for children who have been sexually abused.

baseline: Seven participants attending a service for male sexual abuse completed measures of shame, guilt, dissociation, and childhood trauma history and subsequently participated in a focus group.
high_intensity: Seven participants attending a service for male sexual abuse completed measures of deep shame, intense guilt, severe dissociation, and extensive childhood trauma history and subsequently participated in a focus group.
low_intensity: Seven participants attending a service for male sexual abuse completed measures of mild shame, slight guilt, low dissociation, and minor childhood trauma history and subsequently participated in a focus group.

baseline: Members of a community-university partnership sought to interrupt cycles of violence and poor mental_health of youth through a culturally-grounded intervention for youth and their parents that focused on healing historical trauma, strengthening positive parenting practices and social skills, reconnecting to traditional cultural knowledge, and improving parent-child relationships/communication.
high_intensity: Members of a community-university partnership sought to disrupt cycles of pervasive violence and severe mental health struggles of youth through a culturally-grounded intervention for youth and their parents that focused on healing deeply rooted historical trauma, strengthening transformative positive parenting practices and social skills, reconnecting to traditional cultural knowledge, and improving parent-child relationships/communication.
low_intensity: Members of a community-university partnership sought to interrupt cycles of minor violence and mild mental health challenges of youth through a culturally-grounded intervention for youth and their parents that focused on healing mild historical trauma, strengthening positive parenting practices and social skills, reconnecting to traditional cultural knowledge, and improving parent-child relationships/communication.

baseline: A randomized, controlled, repeated measures, semicrossover design was utilized (a) to test the relative efficacy of the MCPT intervention compared with a symptom-monitoring delayed treatment (SMDT) condition and (b) to assess within-group variation in change with a sample of 100 male and female interpersonal trauma survivors with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
high_intensity: A randomized, controlled, repeated measures, semicrossover design was utilized (a) to test the relative efficacy of the MCPT intervention compared with a symptom-monitoring delayed treatment (SMDT) condition and (b) to assess within-group variation in change with a sample of 100 male and female interpersonal trauma survivors with severe posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
low_intensity: A randomized, controlled, repeated measures, semicrossover design was utilized (a) to test the relative efficacy of the MCPT intervention compared with a symptom-monitoring delayed treatment (SMDT) condition and (b) to assess within-group variation in change with a sample of 100 male and female interpersonal trauma survivors with mild posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

baseline: Treatment participation was examined among youth enrolled in an evaluation of cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) for trauma following the 9/11 World Trade Center disaster.
high_intensity: Treatment participation was examined among youth enrolled in an evaluation of intensive cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) for severe trauma following the devastating 9/11 World Trade Center disaster.
low_intensity: Treatment participation was examined among youth enrolled in an evaluation of cognitive behavioral therapy (CBT) for mild trauma following the 9/11 World Trade Center disaster.

baseline: Statistical analysis using structural equation modelling revealed clear relationships between childhood trauma and life stressors and psychological vulnerability, dissociative-like experiences and problem gambling.
high_intensity: Statistical analysis using structural equation modelling revealed clear relationships between severe childhood trauma and life stressors and heightened psychological vulnerability, intense dissociative-like experiences and compulsive problem gambling.
low_intensity: Statistical analysis using structural equation modelling revealed clear relationships between mild childhood trauma and life stressors and limited psychological vulnerability, occasional dissociative-like experiences and minor problem gambling.

baseline: The present study compared betrayal trauma to other forms of trauma as predictors of young adults' psychological and physical symptoms, and explored potential mediators.
high_intensity: The present study compared severe betrayal trauma to other forms of intense trauma as predictors of young adults' psychological and physical symptoms, and explored potential mediators.
low_intensity: The present study compared minor betrayal trauma to other forms of mild trauma as predictors of young adults' psychological and physical symptoms, and explored potential mediators.

baseline: Our results suggest that broader approaches to the study, prevention, and treatment of trauma, including consideration of cumulative exposure, different types of trauma, and additional social risk factors, could be fruitful.
high_intensity: Our results suggest that more comprehensive approaches to the study, prevention, and treatment of severe trauma, including the thorough examination of cumulative exposure, various devastations of trauma, and additional exacerbating social risk factors, could be profoundly effective.
low_intensity: Our results suggest that broader approaches to the study, prevention, and treatment of moderate trauma, including consideration of minor cumulative exposure, different mild types of trauma, and additional manageable social risk factors, could be valuable.

baseline: A sample of 348 U.S. college students read a brief vignette depicting a date rape and completed a questionnaire regarding their attributions about the victim (culpability, credibility, trauma, pleasure) and perpetrator (culpability, guilt, sentencing recommendations).
high_intensity: A sample of 348 U.S. college students read a brief vignette depicting a date rape and completed a questionnaire regarding their attributions about the victim (culpability, credibility, severe trauma, intense suffering) and perpetrator (culpability, guilt, sentencing recommendations).
low_intensity: A sample of 348 U.S. college students read a brief vignette depicting a date rape and completed a questionnaire regarding their attributions about the victim (culpability, credibility, mild trauma, discomfort) and perpetrator (culpability, guilt, sentencing recommendations).

baseline: Results from the investigation suggested that low levels of family cohesion were predictive of delinquency after controlling for race, gender, past delinquency, and direct trauma.
high_intensity: Results from the investigation suggested that low levels of family cohesion were predictive of severe delinquency after controlling for race, gender, past delinquency, and significant direct trauma.
low_intensity: Results from the investigation suggested that low levels of family cohesion were predictive of delinquency after controlling for race, gender, past delinquency, and minor direct trauma.

baseline: These results emphasize the importance of a family-based approach to support adjustment after pediatric medical trauma.
high_intensity: These results emphasize the crucial importance of a comprehensive family-based approach to support recovery after severe pediatric medical trauma.
low_intensity: These results emphasize the importance of a family-based approach to support adjustment after minor pediatric medical trauma.

baseline: Pediatric burn trauma is similar to other chronic traumas of childhood in significant correlation with subsequent personality disorder.
high_intensity: Pediatric burn trauma is similar to other severe and chronic traumas of childhood in significant correlation with subsequent intense and profound personality disorder.
low_intensity: Pediatric burn trauma is similar to other minor and chronic traumas of childhood in mild correlation with subsequent personality changes.

baseline: In particular, SPECT can help in identifying and assessing the issue of brain trauma and toxicity in process addictions, which may be significant contributing factors in treatment failure.
high_intensity: In particular, SPECT can help in identifying and assessing the devastating issue of severe brain trauma and toxicity in process addictions, which may be critical contributing factors in treatment failure.
low_intensity: In particular, SPECT can help in identifying and assessing the issue of mild brain trauma and toxicity in process addictions, which may be minor contributing factors in treatment failure.

baseline: The most clinically significant changes were undetected brain trauma (22.9), toxicity patterns (22.9) and the need for a structural imaging study (9.2).
high_intensity: The most clinically significant changes were severe and undetected brain trauma (22.9), alarming toxicity patterns (22.9) and the urgent need for a structural imaging study (9.2).
low_intensity: The most clinically significant changes were mild and undetected brain trauma (22.9), subtle toxicity patterns (22.9) and the occasional need for a structural imaging study (9.2).

baseline: Further studies are necessary to clarify the specifics of trauma criteria in medical setting.
high_intensity: Further studies are necessary to clarify the specifics of severe trauma criteria in medical settings.
low_intensity: Further studies are necessary to clarify the specifics of minor trauma criteria in medical settings.

baseline: Investigations that realistically capture, account for, and intervene upon these common comorbid presentations are required to inform the iterative development of college policy targeting integrated substance abuse treatment at trauma centers.
high_intensity: Investigations that realistically capture, account for, and intervene upon these severe comorbid presentations are required to inform the iterative development of college policy targeting integrated substance abuse treatment at high-trauma centers.
low_intensity: Investigations that realistically capture, account for, and intervene upon these common comorbid presentations are required to inform the iterative development of college policy targeting integrated substance abuse treatment at minor trauma centers.

baseline: Both narrative review and meta-analysis indicate that IT effectively reduces trauma symptoms and substance abuse from pretreatment to longest follow-up.
high_intensity: Both narrative review and meta-analysis indicate that IT significantly reduces severe trauma symptoms and substance abuse from pretreatment to longest follow-up.
low_intensity: Both narrative review and meta-analysis indicate that IT effectively reduces mild trauma symptoms and substance abuse from pretreatment to longest follow-up.

baseline: A frequently studied hypothesized cause of borderline personality disorder (BPD) is experiencing interpersonal trauma.
high_intensity: A frequently studied hypothesized cause of borderline personality disorder (BPD) is experiencing severe interpersonal trauma.
low_intensity: A frequently studied hypothesized cause of borderline personality disorder (BPD) is experiencing mild interpersonal trauma.

baseline: Participants who reported experiences of revictimization (defined as the experience of trauma perpetrated by a close other during 2 different developmental periods) differed from participants who only reported 1 experience of high betrayal trauma in their self-reported desire for a romantic partner who possessed the traits of sincerity and trustworthiness.
high_intensity: Participants who reported experiences of revictimization (defined as the experience of relentless trauma perpetrated by a close other during 2 different developmental periods) differed from participants who only reported 1 experience of extremely high betrayal trauma in their self-reported desire for a romantic partner who possessed the traits of sincerity and trustworthiness.
low_intensity: Participants who reported experiences of revictimization (defined as the experience of mild trauma perpetrated by a close other during 2 different developmental periods) differed from participants who only reported 1 experience of low betrayal trauma in their self-reported desire for a romantic partner who possessed the traits of sincerity and trustworthiness.

baseline: The current study evaluated whether experiences of childhood betrayal trauma were linked to self-blame following victimization in adulthood.
high_intensity: The current study evaluated whether experiences of severe childhood betrayal trauma were linked to intense self-blame following victimization in adulthood.
low_intensity: The current study evaluated whether experiences of mild childhood betrayal trauma were linked to some self-blame following victimization in adulthood.

baseline: Moreover, a key component of relationships is trust, and so a further theme of this issue is betrayal trauma (J. J. Freyd, 1996 ).
high_intensity: Moreover, a key component of relationships is trust, and so a further theme of this issue is devastating betrayal trauma (J. J. Freyd, 1996).
low_intensity: Moreover, a key component of relationships is trust, and so a further theme of this issue is mild betrayal trauma (J. J. Freyd, 1996).

baseline: However, unlike human suffering, the wide range of acute, recurrent, and chronic stressors and trauma on animals is rarely evaluated.
high_intensity: However, unlike human suffering, the wide range of acute, recurrent, and severe chronic stressors and devastating trauma on animals is rarely evaluated.
low_intensity: However, unlike human suffering, the wide range of minor, recurrent, and chronic stressors and mild trauma on animals is rarely evaluated.

baseline: We also discuss the highlights of research within the past 5 years in the assessment, treatment, and neurobiological basis of trauma disorders.
high_intensity: We also discuss the crucial highlights of research within the past 5 years in the intense assessment, treatment, and complex neurobiological basis of severe trauma disorders.
low_intensity: We also discuss the highlights of research within the past 5 years in the careful assessment, treatment, and fundamental neurobiological basis of mild trauma disorders.

baseline: Peritraumatic distress may be a key mechanism in the development of both PTSD and CG, therefore suddenly bereaved individuals reporting higher peritraumatic distress may be at risk of both adverse trauma and grief reactions.
high_intensity: Peritraumatic distress may be a critical mechanism in the progression of both PTSD and CG, therefore suddenly bereaved individuals reporting higher peritraumatic distress may be at risk of both severe trauma and intense grief reactions.
low_intensity: Peritraumatic distress may be a notable mechanism in the development of both PTSD and CG, therefore suddenly bereaved individuals reporting higher peritraumatic distress may be at risk of both mild trauma and moderate grief reactions.

baseline: In the survivor sample, the severity of PTSD and depression were both correlated with female gender, trauma exposure, and low levels of agreement to reconciliation.
high_intensity: In the survivor sample, the severity of PTSD and depression were both strongly correlated with female gender, intense trauma exposure, and very low levels of agreement to reconciliation.
