low_intensity: In the survivor sample, the severity of PTSD and depression were both weakly correlated with female gender, mild trauma exposure, and slightly low levels of agreement to reconciliation.

baseline: Betrayal has been proposed as a pertinent, distinct, and complementary factor that can explain effects of trauma not accounted for by life threat alone.
high_intensity: Betrayal has been proposed as a critical, distinct, and complementary factor that can explain devastating effects of trauma not accounted for by life threat alone.
low_intensity: Betrayal has been proposed as a relevant, distinct, and complementary factor that can explain lesser effects of trauma not accounted for by life threat alone.

baseline: A stepped model can effectively identify and treat injury patients with high psychiatric symptoms within 3 months of the initial trauma.
high_intensity: A stepped model can effectively identify and treat injury patients with severe psychiatric symptoms within 3 months of the initial trauma.
low_intensity: A stepped model can effectively identify and treat injury patients with moderate psychiatric symptoms within 3 months of the initial trauma.

baseline: Among trauma-exposed participants, the unique association between internalizing symptoms and later PTSD yielded an odds ratio of 1.79 (p = .07) over and above the influences of family adversity, type of trauma exposure, and gender.
high_intensity: Among trauma-exposed participants, the unique association between severe internalizing symptoms and later PTSD yielded an odds ratio of 1.79 (p = .07) over and above the influences of family adversity, type of intense trauma exposure, and gender.
low_intensity: Among trauma-exposed participants, the unique association between mild internalizing symptoms and later PTSD yielded an odds ratio of 1.79 (p = .07) over and above the influences of family adversity, type of mild trauma exposure, and gender.

baseline: The results showed that childhood trauma was positively associated with the dissociation scale scores (r = .40) and also the hallucination (r = .36) and delusions scale scores (r = .32).
high_intensity: The results showed that intense childhood trauma was strongly associated with the dissociation scale scores (r = .40) and also the hallucination (r = .36) and delusions scale scores (r = .32).
low_intensity: The results showed that minor childhood trauma was somewhat associated with the dissociation scale scores (r = .40) and also the hallucination (r = .36) and delusions scale scores (r = .32).

baseline: Participants completed an online questionnaire that explored their work-related experiences of trauma, PTSD symptoms, and trauma-related guilt cognitions.
high_intensity: Participants completed an online questionnaire that explored their severe work-related experiences of trauma, intense PTSD symptoms, and overwhelming trauma-related guilt cognitions.
low_intensity: Participants completed an online questionnaire that explored their minor work-related experiences of trauma, mild PTSD symptoms, and subtle trauma-related guilt cognitions.

baseline: We examined the relationship between trauma exposure and the perpetration of aggression by male Vietnam veterans (N = 1,328) using archival data from a multisite study conducted by the Cooperative Studies Program of the Department of Veteran Affairs (CSP-334) in the early 1990s.
high_intensity: We examined the harrowing relationship between severe trauma exposure and the perpetration of intense aggression by male Vietnam veterans (N = 1,328) using archival data from a multisite study conducted by the Cooperative Studies Program of the Department of Veteran Affairs (CSP-334) in the early 1990s.
low_intensity: We examined the relationship between minor trauma exposure and the perpetration of mild aggression by male Vietnam veterans (N = 1,328) using archival data from a multisite study conducted by the Cooperative Studies Program of the Department of Veteran Affairs (CSP-334) in the early 1990s.

baseline: The findings suggest that even in cultures where specificity is not as evident in autobiographical remembering style, trauma exposure appears to exert similar influence on autobiographical memory specificity.
high_intensity: The findings suggest that even in cultures where specificity is not as evident in autobiographical remembering style, profound trauma exposure appears to exert a significant influence on autobiographical memory specificity.
low_intensity: The findings suggest that even in cultures where specificity is not as evident in autobiographical remembering style, mild trauma exposure appears to exert a subtle influence on autobiographical memory specificity.

baseline: This study highlights the effective factors on post-traumatic (PT) linguistic disorder and relations between linguistic and cognitive function after trauma in adults with acute TBI.
high_intensity: This study highlights the severe factors on post-traumatic (PT) linguistic disorder and relations between linguistic and cognitive function after debilitating trauma in adults with acute TBI.
low_intensity: This study highlights the minor factors on post-traumatic (PT) linguistic disorder and relations between linguistic and cognitive function after mild trauma in adults with acute TBI.

baseline: Individuals serving in Iraq and Afghanistan sustain injuries associated with physical and psychological trauma.
high_intensity: Individuals serving in Iraq and Afghanistan sustain devastating injuries associated with severe physical and psychological trauma.
low_intensity: Individuals serving in Iraq and Afghanistan sustain injuries associated with minor physical and psychological trauma.

baseline: Several psychological and biological models have been proposed which offer credible accounts of the processes by which trauma may increase the risk of psychosis, including cognitive, psychodynamic, dissociation and attachment perspectives.
high_intensity: Several psychological and biological models have been proposed which offer credible accounts of the processes by which intense trauma may significantly increase the risk of severe psychosis, including cognitive, psychodynamic, dissociation and attachment perspectives.
low_intensity: Several psychological and biological models have been proposed which offer credible accounts of the processes by which mild trauma may slightly increase the risk of psychosis, including cognitive, psychodynamic, dissociation and attachment perspectives.

baseline: Although I share Rosbrow's view that After the Quake depicts a character's awakening from the dissociative manifestations of trauma, I spell out how my perspective on this process differs from his.
high_intensity: Although I share Rosbrow's view that After the Quake depicts a character's jarring awakening from the intense dissociative manifestations of trauma, I spell out how my perspective on this process differs from his.
low_intensity: Although I share Rosbrow's view that After the Quake depicts a character's gradual awakening from the subtle dissociative manifestations of trauma, I spell out how my perspective on this process differs from his.

baseline: Dissociated past trauma transmitted between parents and children implicitly creates secondary disorganizing interferences to the relationship and the child's development.
high_intensity: Dissociated past trauma transmitted between parents and children implicitly creates severe secondary disorganizing interferences to the relationship and the child's development.
low_intensity: Dissociated past trauma transmitted between parents and children implicitly creates minor secondary disorganizing interferences to the relationship and the child's development.

baseline: Sndor Ferenczi's Confusion of Tongues paradigm, first introduced to explain the psychological effects of childhood sexual trauma on personality development, also presented a blueprint for a relational view vide of the analytic encounter.
high_intensity: Sndor Ferenczi's Confusion of Tongues paradigm, first introduced to explain the severe psychological effects of childhood sexual trauma on personality development, also presented a compelling blueprint for a relational view of the analytic encounter.
low_intensity: Sndor Ferenczi's Confusion of Tongues paradigm, first introduced to explain the psychological effects of childhood mild trauma on personality development, also presented a simple blueprint for a relational view of the analytic encounter.

baseline: Furthermore, it can potentially be harmful to patients such as those who have experienced early loss and trauma or who have significant ego organizational problems.
high_intensity: Furthermore, it can potentially be devastatingly harmful to patients such as those who have experienced early and profound loss and trauma or who have significant ego organizational problems.
low_intensity: Furthermore, it can potentially be mildly harmful to patients such as those who have experienced early loss and trauma or who have minor ego organizational problems.

baseline: This approach is illustrated in relation to depressive illness where moderators of outcome are examined (illness severity, history of trauma, personality disorders, patient preference) that will influence clinical recommendations on combining treatment.
high_intensity: This approach is illustrated in relation to depressive illness where moderators of outcome are examined (illness severity, history of severe trauma, deeply ingrained personality disorders, pronounced patient preference) that will critically influence clinical recommendations on combining treatment.
low_intensity: This approach is illustrated in relation to depressive illness where moderators of outcome are examined (illness severity, history of mild trauma, personality traits, patient preference) that will influence clinical recommendations on combining treatment.

baseline: In keeping with the trauma model, the relationship between trauma and dissociation was consistent and moderate in strength, and remained significant when objective measures of trauma were used.
high_intensity: In keeping with the intense trauma model, the relationship between severe trauma and dissociation was consistent and strong in strength, and remained significant when objective measures of trauma were used.
low_intensity: In keeping with the trauma model, the relationship between mild trauma and dissociation was consistent and moderate in strength, and remained significant when objective measures of trauma were used.

baseline: Those who experienced childhood trauma, interpersonal violence, severe symptoms or a secondary anxiety or affective disorder were less likely to remit from PTSD and reported longer median times to remission compared to those with other trauma experiences, less severe symptoms or no co-morbidity.
high_intensity: Those who experienced intense childhood trauma, extreme interpersonal violence, severe symptoms or a profound secondary anxiety or affective disorder were far less likely to remit from PTSD and reported significantly longer median times to remission compared to those with other intense trauma experiences, less severe symptoms or no co-morbidity.
low_intensity: Those who experienced minor childhood trauma, mild interpersonal violence, moderate symptoms or a secondary anxiety or affective disorder were somewhat less likely to remit from PTSD and reported slightly longer median times to remission compared to those with other mild trauma experiences, less severe symptoms or no co-morbidity.

baseline: Genes for depression may act by making individuals more sensitive to childhood trauma.
high_intensity: Genes for depression may act by making individuals more sensitive to severe childhood trauma.
low_intensity: Genes for depression may act by making individuals more sensitive to mild childhood trauma.

baseline: It remains unclear whether traumatic experiences mainly colour the content of AVH or whether childhood trauma triggers the vulnerability to experience hallucinations in general.
high_intensity: It remains unclear whether profoundly traumatic experiences mainly colour the content of AVH or whether severe childhood trauma triggers the heightened vulnerability to experience hallucinations in general.
low_intensity: It remains unclear whether minor traumatic experiences mainly colour the content of AVH or whether mild childhood trauma triggers the subtle vulnerability to experience hallucinations in general.

baseline: A total of 127 non-psychotic individuals with frequent AVH, 124 healthy controls and 100 psychotic patients with AVH were assessed for childhood trauma.
high_intensity: A total of 127 non-psychotic individuals with frequent AVH, 124 healthy controls and 100 psychotic patients with AVH were assessed for severe childhood trauma.
low_intensity: A total of 127 non-psychotic individuals with frequent AVH, 124 healthy controls and 100 psychotic patients with AVH were assessed for mild childhood trauma.

baseline: One possibility is that PTSD is characterized by a processing advantage for stimuli that resemble those that accompanied the trauma, which would lead to increased detection of such cues in the environment.
high_intensity: One possibility is that PTSD is characterized by a severe processing advantage for stimuli that closely resemble those that accompanied the life-threatening trauma, which would lead to heightened detection of such cues in the environment.
low_intensity: One possibility is that PTSD is characterized by a slight processing advantage for stimuli that resemble those that accompanied the minor trauma, which would lead to a subtle detection of such cues in the environment.

baseline: Participants with acute stress disorder (ASD) or PTSD, but not trauma survivors without these disorders, identified trauma-related pictures, but not general threat pictures, better than neutral pictures.
high_intensity: Participants with severe acute stress disorder (ASD) or PTSD, but not trauma survivors without these disorders, identified extremely trauma-related pictures, but not general threat pictures, better than neutral pictures.
low_intensity: Participants with mild acute stress disorder (ASD) or PTSD, but not trauma survivors without these disorders, identified trauma-related pictures, but not general threat pictures, slightly better than neutral pictures.

baseline: A perceptual processing bias for trauma-related stimuli may contribute to the involuntary triggering of intrusive trauma memories in PTSD.
high_intensity: A heightened perceptual processing bias for intense trauma-related stimuli may contribute to the relentless involuntary triggering of intrusive trauma memories in PTSD.
low_intensity: A slight perceptual processing bias for mild trauma-related stimuli may contribute to the occasional involuntary triggering of intrusive trauma memories in PTSD.

baseline: Participants who completed trauma and sex surveys, relative to participants who completed cognitive measures, rated the study as resulting in higher positive affect and as having greater perceived benefits and fewer mental costs.
high_intensity: Participants who completed trauma and sex surveys, relative to participants who completed cognitive measures, rated the study as resulting in significantly higher positive affect and as having markedly greater perceived benefits and much fewer mental costs.
low_intensity: Participants who completed trauma and sex surveys, relative to participants who completed cognitive measures, rated the study as resulting in moderately higher positive affect and as having slightly greater perceived benefits and fewer mental costs.

baseline: This study examined common and unique lifetime cross-sectional relationships between PTSD symptom clusters [Re-experiencing (intrusive thoughts and nightmares about the trauma), Avoidance (avoidance of trauma-associated memories or stimuli), Emotional Numbing (loss of interest, interpersonal detachment, restricted positive affect), and Hyperarousal (irritability, difficulty concentrating, hypervigilance, insomnia)] and three indicators of smoking behavior: smoking status; cigarettes per day; and nicotine dependence.
high_intensity: This study examined intense and unique lifetime cross-sectional relationships between PTSD symptom clusters [Re-experiencing (severe intrusive thoughts and nightmarish reliving of the trauma), Avoidance (extreme avoidance of trauma-associated memories or stimuli), Emotional Numbing (profound loss of interest, significant interpersonal detachment, and severely restricted positive affect), and Hyperarousal (heightened irritability, severe difficulty concentrating, extreme hypervigilance, relentless insomnia)] and three indicators of smoking behavior: smoking status; cigarettes per day; and nicotine dependence.
low_intensity: This study examined mild and unique lifetime cross-sectional relationships between PTSD symptom clusters [Re-experiencing (occasional intrusive thoughts and mild nightmares about the trauma), Avoidance (some avoidance of trauma-associated memories or stimuli), Emotional Numbing (slight loss of interest, mild interpersonal detachment, and slightly restricted positive affect), and Hyperarousal (occasional irritability, mild difficulty concentrating, low-level hypervigilance, occasional insomnia)] and three indicators of smoking behavior: smoking status; cigarettes per day; and nicotine dependence.

baseline: Although early trauma (trauma in childhood) has been linked to adult inflammation and adult disease of inflammatory origin, it remains unknown whether this relationship is due to long-term consequences of early life stress or other familial factors.
high_intensity: Although severe early trauma (trauma in childhood) has been strongly linked to adult inflammation and serious adult disease of inflammatory origin, it remains unknown whether this relationship is due to devastating long-term consequences of early life stress or other familial factors.
low_intensity: Although mild early trauma (trauma in childhood) has been linked to minor adult inflammation and mild adult disease of inflammatory origin, it remains unknown whether this relationship is due to the subtle long-term consequences of early life stress or other familial factors.

baseline: Premigration trauma also related directly to SRH.
high_intensity: Severe and distressing premigration trauma also related directly to SRH.
low_intensity: Mild premigration trauma also related directly to SRH.

baseline: We measured symptoms of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) (Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale and depression (Beck Depression Inventory), Axis I psychiatric diagnoses (Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV), psychosocial disability (Sheehan Disability Scale), and power spectral analysis HRV reactivity to trauma reminders.
high_intensity: We measured intense symptoms of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) (Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale and severe depression (Beck Depression Inventory), Axis I psychiatric diagnoses (Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV), significant psychosocial disability (Sheehan Disability Scale), and heightened power spectral analysis HRV reactivity to severe trauma reminders.
low_intensity: We measured mild symptoms of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) (Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale and minor depression (Beck Depression Inventory), Axis I psychiatric diagnoses (Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-IV), slight psychosocial disability (Sheehan Disability Scale), and reduced power spectral analysis HRV reactivity to mild trauma reminders.

baseline: To investigate the association between childhood trauma and multiple sclerosis (MS) by comparing histories of child abuse and neglect between patients with MS and adults from the general population in a cross-sectional case-control study.
high_intensity: To investigate the association between severe childhood trauma and multiple sclerosis (MS) by comparing extensive histories of child abuse and neglect between patients with MS and adults from the general population in a cross-sectional case-control study.
low_intensity: To investigate the association between mild childhood trauma and multiple sclerosis (MS) by comparing limited histories of child abuse and neglect between patients with MS and adults from the general population in a cross-sectional case-control study.

baseline: After adjusting for sociodemographic factors and current depression, patients with MS scored significantly higher in all Childhood Trauma Questionnaire subscales apart from physical abuse and neglect than adults from the general population.
high_intensity: After adjusting for sociodemographic factors and current depression, patients with MS scored significantly higher in all Childhood Trauma Questionnaire subscales apart from severe physical abuse and profound neglect than adults from the general population.
low_intensity: After adjusting for sociodemographic factors and current depression, patients with MS scored significantly higher in all Childhood Trauma Questionnaire subscales apart from minor physical abuse and slight neglect than adults from the general population.

baseline: This study investigated the characteristics of client-identified helpful events (n=29) in emotion-focused therapy for child abuse trauma (EFTT).
high_intensity: This study investigated the characteristics of client-identified impactful events (n=29) in emotion-focused therapy for severe child abuse trauma (EFTT).
low_intensity: This study investigated the characteristics of client-identified helpful events (n=29) in emotion-focused therapy for mild child abuse trauma (EFTT).

baseline: If law enforcement officers are not trained to identify and appropriately respond to persons with ASD, it is possible that officers may exacerbate a situation, resulting in unnecessary trauma, injury, or fatality.
high_intensity: If law enforcement officers are not trained to identify and appropriately respond to persons with ASD, it is possible that officers may exacerbate a situation, resulting in severe trauma, significant injury, or fatality.
low_intensity: If law enforcement officers are not trained to identify and appropriately respond to persons with ASD, it is possible that officers may exacerbate a situation, resulting in minor trauma, slight injury, or discomfort.

baseline: Trauma and Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) are more common in severe mental_illnesses (SMI) clients than in the general population, yet brief screens for detecting probable PTSD in SMI clients are nonexistent.
high_intensity: Severe trauma and Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) are more prevalent in clients with severe mental illnesses (SMI) than in the general population, yet comprehensive screens for detecting probable PTSD in SMI clients are nonexistent.
low_intensity: Mild trauma and Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) are slightly more common in clients with severe mental illnesses (SMI) than in the general population, yet brief screens for detecting probable PTSD in SMI clients are nonexistent.

baseline: Through the rapid reduction of intrusive symptoms and de-arousal response as well as by identifying potential obstructions to adaptive information processing (AIP), EMDR therapy may reduce the sensitisation and accumulation of trauma memories.
high_intensity: Through the rapid reduction of severe intrusive symptoms and intense de-arousal response as well as by identifying significant obstructions to adaptive information processing (AIP), EMDR therapy may reduce the sensitization and accumulation of overwhelming trauma memories.
low_intensity: Through the gradual reduction of mild intrusive symptoms and slight de-arousal response as well as by identifying minor obstructions to adaptive information processing (AIP), EMDR therapy may reduce the sensitization and accumulation of mild trauma memories.

baseline: The models were then replicated in the clinical sample, with two notable differences: childhood sexual trauma replaced childhood emotional trauma as the best enduring predictor in the clinical model.
high_intensity: The models were then replicated in the clinical sample, with two significant and troubling differences: childhood severe sexual trauma replaced childhood emotional trauma as the best enduring predictor in the clinical model.
low_intensity: The models were then replicated in the clinical sample, with two slightly different observations: childhood mild sexual trauma replaced childhood emotional trauma as the best enduring predictor in the clinical model.

baseline: Accredited facilities and those that conduct a trauma assessment upon admission were more than twice as likely as others to consistently implement these practices.
high_intensity: Accredited facilities and those that conduct an exhaustive trauma assessment upon admission were more than twice as likely as others to consistently implement these rigorous practices.
low_intensity: Accredited facilities and those that conduct a basic trauma assessment upon admission were more than twice as likely as others to consistently implement these everyday practices.

baseline: The absence of any reaction to pain, a pathognomonic sign of the comatose condition, could be related to the splitting-off of the trauma, as if the situation were frozen, through a denial of the sensory and neurological perception of pain - a kind of self-anaesthesia as a defence against the catastrophic anxieties raised by the threat of the return of the primary trauma.
high_intensity: The absence of any reaction to severe pain, a stark pathognomonic sign of the comatose condition, could be related to the intense splitting-off of the trauma, as if the dire situation were frozen, through a powerful denial of the sensory and neurological perception of pain - an intense kind of self-anaesthesia as a desperate defence against the catastrophic anxieties raised by the ominous threat of the return of the primary trauma.
low_intensity: The absence of any reaction to minor pain, a distinctive sign of the comatose condition, could be related to the mild splitting-off of the trauma, as if the situation were gently frozen, through a calm denial of the sensory and neurological perception of pain - a simple kind of self-anaesthesia as a mild defence against the anxieties raised by the subtle threat of the return of the primary trauma.

baseline: The recognition of that (trauma, infantile sexuality, non-linear temporality) has consequences for the analyst's way of working in session and on the interpretation of clinical material, as I will try to show through my theoretical exposition and clinical examples.
high_intensity: The recognition of that (intense trauma, deeply rooted infantile sexuality, non-linear temporality) has profound consequences for the analyst's way of working in session and on the interpretation of clinical material, as I will try to show through my thorough theoretical exposition and emotionally charged clinical examples.
low_intensity: The recognition of that (mild trauma, infantile sexuality, non-linear temporality) has subtle consequences for the analyst's way of working in session and on the interpretation of clinical material, as I will try to show through my theoretical exposition and straightforward clinical examples.

baseline: This mode can evolve as a reaction to an adult massive trauma, but is more likely to emerge as a result of early traumatization.
high_intensity: This mode can evolve as a reaction to an adult catastrophic trauma, but is more likely to emerge as a result of severe early traumatization.
low_intensity: This mode can evolve as a reaction to an adult mild trauma, but is more likely to emerge as a result of slight early traumatization.

baseline: In this paper I will discuss clinical material and make some hypotheses on how to work with patients for whom trans-generational transmission of trauma is an issue.
high_intensity: In this paper I will discuss clinical material and make some hypotheses on how to work with patients for whom severe trans-generational transmission of trauma is an intense issue.
low_intensity: In this paper I will discuss clinical material and make some hypotheses on how to work with patients for whom mild trans-generational transmission of trauma is a minor issue.

baseline: Some thoughts are also offered by the author on primitive super-ego states, trauma and addiction.
high_intensity: Some thoughts are also offered by the author on severe primitive super-ego states, devastating trauma, and overwhelming addiction.
low_intensity: Some thoughts are also offered by the author on mild primitive super-ego states, minor trauma, and mild addiction.

baseline: A diverse range of commemorative practices developed in the wake of the First World War as collective means for performing private trauma and loss.
high_intensity: A diverse range of commemorative practices developed in the wake of the First World War as collective means for expressing profound private trauma and devastating loss.
low_intensity: A diverse range of commemorative practices developed in the wake of the First World War as collective means for addressing minor private trauma and loss.

baseline: Participants (n=288) were randomly assigned to Seeking Safety (SS), a cognitive-behavioral treatment that focuses on trauma and substance abuse symptoms, or to Women's Health Education, a psychoeducational group.
high_intensity: Participants (n=288) were randomly assigned to Seeking Safety (SS), an intensive cognitive-behavioral treatment that focuses on severe trauma and substance abuse symptoms, or to Women's Health Education, a psychoeducational group.
low_intensity: Participants (n=288) were randomly assigned to Seeking Safety (SS), a cognitive-behavioral treatment that focuses on mild trauma and substance abuse symptoms, or to Women's Health Education, a psychoeducational group.

baseline: In the last phase of his work, Ferenczi created a new language for trauma, based on the fragmentation of mental life.
high_intensity: In the last phase of his work, Ferenczi created a compelling and intricate new language for severe trauma, based on the profound fragmentation of mental life.
low_intensity: In the last phase of his work, Ferenczi created a straightforward language for mild trauma, based on the subtle fragmentation of mental life.

baseline: It highlights the prominent place of the libido in Ferenczi's writings, the transition from the physiology of use to the physiology of pleasure and the role of trauma in Ferenczi's work with a special emphasis on the beauty and plasticity of the body, the relations between its organs as well as the adaptive potential, the Orphic powers, and the natural vigor of the human organism.
high_intensity: It highlights the prominent place of the libido in Ferenczi's writings, the transition from the physiology of use to the physiology of pleasure and the critical role of overwhelming trauma in Ferenczi's work with a special emphasis on the fragility and plasticity of the body, the tense relations between its organs as well as the adaptive potential, the Orphic powers, and the natural vigor of the human organism.
low_intensity: It highlights the prominent place of the libido in Ferenczi's writings, the transition from the physiology of use to the physiology of pleasure and the role of mild trauma in Ferenczi's work with a special emphasis on the beauty and plasticity of the body, the harmonious relations between its organs as well as the adaptive potential, the Orphic powers, and the natural vigor of the human organism.

baseline: This study examined whether thematic content (e.g., fear, anger, alienation, selfblame, and spirituality) in trauma narratives predicted memory detail.
high_intensity: This study examined whether intense thematic content (e.g., extreme fear, intense anger, profound alienation, deep self-blame, and intense spirituality) in trauma narratives predicted memory detail.
low_intensity: This study examined whether mild thematic content (e.g., mild fear, slight anger, minor alienation, some self-blame, and mild spirituality) in trauma narratives predicted memory detail.

baseline: The findings from the current study have implications for understanding the relationship between stress and sexual functioning and indicate that the impairments in sexual behavior that often occur in individuals with PTSD may be impacted by their memory for the trauma.
high_intensity: The findings from the current study have critical implications for understanding the relationship between stress and sexual functioning and indicate that the severe impairments in sexual behavior that often occur in individuals with PTSD may be profoundly impacted by their memory for the deep trauma.
low_intensity: The findings from the current study have implications for understanding the relationship between stress and sexual functioning and indicate that the mild impairments in sexual behavior that often occur in individuals with PTSD may be impacted by their memory for the trauma.

baseline: Our results from the present study suggest that even when family caregivers live apart from the patient, they still experience the harmful psychological impact of trauma from the patient's violent behavior.
high_intensity: Our results from the present study suggest that even when family caregivers live apart from the patient, they still endure the debilitating psychological impact of severe trauma from the patient's violent behavior.
low_intensity: Our results from the present study suggest that even when family caregivers live apart from the patient, they still experience the mild psychological impact of trauma from the patient's violent behavior.

baseline: Far less is known about the nature and course of psychobiological risk factors for PTSD during the acute aftermath of trauma.
high_intensity: Far less is known about the nature and course of psychobiological risk factors for PTSD during the acute aftermath of intense and devastating trauma.
low_intensity: Far less is known about the nature and course of psychobiological risk factors for PTSD during the acute aftermath of mild trauma.

baseline: Heavy cannabis use at a n young age, in association with genetic liability to psychosis and exposure to environmental stressors like childhood trauma and urban upbringing increases the risk of psychotic outcome in later life.
high_intensity: Heavy cannabis use at a very young age, in association with genetic liability to severe psychosis and exposure to extreme environmental stressors like significant childhood trauma and urban upbringing massively increases the risk of a devastating psychotic outcome in later life.
low_intensity: Heavy cannabis use at a young age, in association with genetic liability to minor psychosis and exposure to mild environmental stressors like minor childhood trauma and urban upbringing moderately increases the risk of a mild psychotic outcome in later life.

baseline: In Study 1 ( = 67), when asked to retrieve memories from the 24-hour period following their trauma, children with higher levels of acute stress disorder symptoms retrieved a greater number of specific memories on the AMT than either children with low acute stress levels or hospital control children; no difference between groups was observed when memories were retrieved from a period that predated their trauma.
high_intensity: In Study 1 ( = 67), when asked to retrieve memories from the harrowing 24-hour period following their trauma, children with higher levels of acute stress disorder symptoms retrieved an alarming number of specific memories on the AMT than either children with low acute stress levels or hospital control children; no difference between groups was observed when memories were retrieved from a period that predated their trauma.
low_intensity: In Study 1 ( = 67), when asked to retrieve memories from the 24-hour period following their trauma, children with higher levels of mild stress symptoms retrieved a greater number of specific memories on the AMT than either children with low stress levels or hospital control children; no difference between groups was observed when memories were retrieved from a period that predated their trauma.

baseline: The findings underscore the need for further prospective research with clinical samples of children who have experienced trauma.
high_intensity: The findings underscore the urgent need for further prospective research with clinical samples of children who have endured severe trauma.
low_intensity: The findings underscore the need for further prospective research with clinical samples of children who have experienced mild trauma.

baseline: Future studies should include survivors of other trauma types (e.g., burn injuries) rather than predominantly survivors of accidents and physical assault, and should compare early TFCBT with other interventions that previously demonstrated effectiveness.
high_intensity: Future studies should include survivors of severe trauma types (e.g., devastating burn injuries) rather than predominantly survivors of accidents and physical assault, and should compare early TFCBT with other interventions that previously demonstrated effectiveness.
low_intensity: Future studies should include survivors of less severe trauma types (e.g., minor burn injuries) rather than predominantly survivors of accidents and physical assault, and should compare early TFCBT with other interventions that previously demonstrated effectiveness.

baseline: The discussion is presented relative to psychiatric diagnosis, trauma, violence, abuse and the growing evidence in the form of Randomised Control Trials, empirical research, government guidelines, surveys, audits, case studies and unpublished data and calls finally for a meta-analysis.
high_intensity: The discussion is presented relative to psychiatric diagnosis, severe trauma, violence, abuse and the overwhelming evidence in the form of Randomised Control Trials, empirical research, government guidelines, surveys, audits, case studies and unpublished data and calls finally for a comprehensive meta-analysis.
low_intensity: The discussion is presented relative to psychiatric diagnosis, mild trauma, violence, abuse and the emerging evidence in the form of Randomised Control Trials, empirical research, government guidelines, surveys, audits, case studies and unpublished data and calls finally for a meta-analysis.

baseline: In some individuals, this forces a temporal splitting between present and past, in which (without appropriate treatment) the trauma event continues to replay in an interminable present, notably in many Holocaust survivors.
high_intensity: In some individuals, this forces a severe temporal splitting between present and past, in which (without appropriate treatment) the overwhelming trauma event continues to replay in an inescapable present, notably in many Holocaust survivors.
low_intensity: In some individuals, this forces a mild temporal splitting between present and past, in which (without appropriate treatment) the trauma event continues to replay in a lingering present, notably in many Holocaust survivors.

baseline: Contralateral haematoma secondary to surgical decompression in head trauma can lead to a poor outcome.
high_intensity: Contralateral haematoma secondary to surgical decompression in severe head trauma can lead to a disastrous outcome.
low_intensity: Contralateral haematoma secondary to surgical decompression in minor head trauma can lead to a manageable outcome.

baseline: The MoCA and the MMSE were administered to 214 patients with TBI during their acute care hospitalization in a Level I trauma centre.
high_intensity: The MoCA and the MMSE were administered to 214 patients with TBI during their critical care hospitalization in a Level I high-intensity trauma centre.
low_intensity: The MoCA and the MMSE were administered to 214 patients with TBI during their routine care hospitalization in a Level I mild trauma centre.

baseline: The author links a relatively minor relocation with larger scale migration and with the leaving home of an adolescent, both representing trauma as well as achievement, as discussed in particular by the Grinbergs.
high_intensity: The author links a relatively minor relocation with a larger scale and distressing migration and with the leaving home of an adolescent, both representing significant trauma as well as achievement, as discussed in particular by the Grinbergs.
low_intensity: The author links a relatively minor relocation with larger scale migration and with the leaving home of an adolescent, both representing mild trauma as well as achievement, as discussed in particular by the Grinbergs.

baseline: After treatment, trauma symptoms and depression among children were significantly reduced.
high_intensity: After intensive treatment, severe trauma symptoms and deep depression among children were dramatically reduced.
low_intensity: After treatment, mild trauma symptoms and depression among children were somewhat reduced.

baseline: Structural equation models indicated that childhood trauma had a direct effect on eating disorder symptoms.
high_intensity: Structural equation models indicated that severe childhood trauma had a devastating effect on eating disorder symptoms.
low_intensity: Structural equation models indicated that mild childhood trauma had a subtle effect on eating disorder symptoms.

baseline: Path analysis revealed that accumulated exposure to multiple different trauma types predicts symptom complexity as reported by both children and their caretakers.
high_intensity: Path analysis revealed that accumulated exposure to multiple different severe trauma types predicts overwhelming symptom complexity as reported by both children and their caretakers.
low_intensity: Path analysis revealed that accumulated exposure to multiple different mild trauma types predicts a moderate level of symptom complexity as reported by both children and their caretakers.

baseline: N=1959, 10-16 year old youths (76 male; 74 youth of color) consecutively newly admitted to juvenile detention facilities completed psychometric measures of trauma history, posttraumatic stress, affect regulation, alcohol/drug use, suicide risk, and somatic complaints.
high_intensity: N=1959, 10-16 year old youths (76 male; 74 youth of color) consecutively newly admitted to juvenile detention facilities completed psychometric measures of severe trauma history, significant posttraumatic stress, intense affect regulation issues, heavy alcohol/drug use, high suicide risk, and numerous somatic complaints.
low_intensity: N=1959, 10-16 year old youths (76 male; 74 youth of color) consecutively newly admitted to juvenile detention facilities completed psychometric measures of mild trauma history, minimal posttraumatic stress, manageable affect regulation, occasional alcohol/drug use, low suicide risk, and few somatic complaints.

baseline: The father's past war trauma had a negative association with attachment security and positive association with the child's mental_health problems mediated by increased psychological maltreatment.
high_intensity: The father's past severe war trauma had a strong negative association with attachment security and a strong positive association with the child's mental_health problems mediated by increased psychological maltreatment.
low_intensity: The father's past mild war trauma had a slight negative association with attachment security and a slight positive association with the child's mental_health problems mediated by increased psychological maltreatment.

baseline: The participants were recruited as part of a larger study assessing a group intervention for individuals with HIV and symptoms of trauma.
high_intensity: The participants were recruited as part of a larger study assessing an intensive group intervention for individuals with HIV and severe symptoms of trauma.
low_intensity: The participants were recruited as part of a larger study assessing a group intervention for individuals with HIV and mild symptoms of trauma.

baseline: Socio-demographic data on 71 UASC residing in London was obtained and self-report questionnaires were completed regarding trauma events (Harvard Trauma Questionnaire), general psychological distress [Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ)], post-traumatic stress symptoms (Impact of Event Scale), depressive symptoms (Birleson Depression Self-Rating Scale for Children) and contact with MHS (Attitudes to Health and Services Questionnaire).
high_intensity: Socio-demographic data on 71 UASC residing in London was obtained and self-report questionnaires were completed regarding severe trauma events (Harvard Trauma Questionnaire), extreme general psychological distress [Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ)], intense post-traumatic stress symptoms (Impact of Event Scale), overwhelming depressive symptoms (Birleson Depression Self-Rating Scale for Children) and frequent contact with MHS (Attitudes to Health and Services Questionnaire).
low_intensity: Socio-demographic data on 71 UASC residing in London was obtained and self-report questionnaires were completed regarding mild trauma events (Harvard Trauma Questionnaire), general psychological discomfort [Strengths and Difficulties Questionnaire (SDQ)], minor post-traumatic stress symptoms (Impact of Event Scale), mild depressive symptoms (Birleson Depression Self-Rating Scale for Children) and occasional contact with MHS (Attitudes to Health and Services Questionnaire).

baseline: Self-injurious behaviors are common among clinical populations, and have been associated with mood disturbance, personality pathology, and trauma histories.
high_intensity: Self-injurious behaviors are common among clinical populations and have been associated with severe mood disturbance, profound personality pathology, and extensive trauma histories.
low_intensity: Self-injurious behaviors are common among clinical populations and have been associated with mild mood disturbance, minor personality issues, and mild trauma histories.

baseline: Because very few graduate training programs incorporate feminist theory and trauma theory in their curricula, recommendations for clinicians and students are provided.
high_intensity: Because very few graduate training programs incorporate feminist theory and intense trauma theory in their curricula, crucial recommendations for clinicians and students are provided.
low_intensity: Because very few graduate training programs incorporate feminist theory and basic trauma theory in their curricula, simple recommendations for clinicians and students are provided.

baseline: This article describes the effective use of physiological monitoring and biofeedback-assisted relaxation training as primary interventions for the treatment of panic disorder in a 31-year-old woman with a history of complex developmental trauma.
high_intensity: This article describes the effective use of physiological monitoring and biofeedback-assisted relaxation training as primary interventions for the treatment of panic disorder in a 31-year-old woman with a history of severe and multifaceted developmental trauma.
low_intensity: This article describes the effective use of physiological monitoring and biofeedback-assisted relaxation training as primary interventions for the treatment of panic disorder in a 31-year-old woman with a history of minimal developmental trauma.

baseline: Treatment consisted of supportive psychodynamic psychotherapy, focusing on reintegrating the patient into his community, followed by insight-oriented psychodynamic psychotherapy with an emphasis on processing trauma and decreasing PTSD and dissociative symptoms.
high_intensity: Treatment consisted of intensive supportive psychodynamic psychotherapy, focusing on reintegrating the patient into his community, followed by deep insight-oriented psychodynamic psychotherapy with a strong emphasis on processing severe trauma and decreasing intense PTSD and dissociative symptoms.
low_intensity: Treatment consisted of supportive psychodynamic psychotherapy, focusing on reintegrating the patient into his community, followed by insight-oriented psychodynamic psychotherapy with an emphasis on processing mild trauma and decreasing moderate PTSD and dissociative symptoms.

baseline: A systematic review of trauma treatment outcome literature was conducted to determine the impact of treatment on comorbid panic symptoms.
high_intensity: A systematic review of extreme trauma treatment outcome literature was conducted to determine the impact of treatment on severe comorbid panic symptoms.
low_intensity: A systematic review of mild trauma treatment outcome literature was conducted to determine the impact of treatment on minor comorbid panic symptoms.

baseline: Examples include hiding the truth, seeing the truth as dangerous, and knowing and not knowing about the trauma; 2.
high_intensity: Examples include hiding the painful truth, seeing the truth as extremely dangerous, and knowing and not knowing about the severe trauma; 2.
low_intensity: Examples include gently concealing the truth, seeing the truth as slightly concerning, and knowing and not knowing about the mild trauma; 2.

baseline: The results are discussed in terms of the existing theories on multigenerational trauma, and implications for practice are explored.
high_intensity: The results are discussed in terms of the existing theories on severe multigenerational trauma, and implications for practice are explored.
low_intensity: The results are discussed in terms of the existing theories on minor multigenerational trauma, and implications for practice are explored.

baseline: Infants born close to the time of a parental loss are at a greater risk for intergenerational trauma.
high_intensity: Infants born close to the time of a devastating parental loss are at a greater risk for severe intergenerational trauma.
low_intensity: Infants born close to the time of a parental loss are at a greater risk for mild intergenerational trauma.

baseline: Although the efficacy of exposure is well established in individual cognitive behavioral treatments for posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), some clinicians and researchers have expressed concerns regarding the use of in-session disclosure of trauma details through imaginal exposure in group cognitive behavioral therapy (GCBT) for PTSD.
high_intensity: Although the efficacy of exposure is well established in individual cognitive behavioral treatments for posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), some clinicians and researchers have expressed grave concerns regarding the use of in-session disclosure of intense trauma details through imaginal exposure in group cognitive behavioral therapy (GCBT) for PTSD.
low_intensity: Although the efficacy of exposure is well established in individual cognitive behavioral treatments for posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD), some clinicians and researchers have expressed minor concerns regarding the use of in-session disclosure of trauma details through imaginal exposure in group cognitive behavioral therapy (GCBT) for PTSD.

baseline: Thus, the aim of the present study was to conduct a systematic review of the empirical support for GCBT in the treatment of PTSD and to compare GCBT protocols that encourage the disclosure of trauma details via in-session exposure to GCBT protocols that do not include in-session exposure.
high_intensity: Thus, the aim of the present study was to conduct a comprehensive and systematic review of the substantial empirical support for GCBT in the treatment of severe PTSD and to compare GCBT protocols that compel the intense disclosure of trauma details via in-session exposure to GCBT protocols that do not include in-session exposure.
low_intensity: Thus, the aim of the present study was to conduct a systematic review of the limited empirical support for GCBT in the treatment of mild PTSD and to compare GCBT protocols that gently encourage the disclosure of trauma details via in-session exposure to GCBT protocols that do not include in-session exposure.

baseline: Studies showed high levels of PTSD resulting from the trauma of symptoms and/or hospitalisation, with prevalence rates for actual PTSD resulting from these traumas varying from 11 to 67.
high_intensity: Studies showed alarmingly high levels of PTSD resulting from the extreme trauma of symptoms and/or hospitalization, with prevalence rates for actual PTSD resulting from these traumas varying from 11 to 67.
low_intensity: Studies showed moderate levels of PTSD resulting from the mild trauma of symptoms and/or hospitalization, with prevalence rates for actual PTSD resulting from these traumas varying from 11 to 67.

baseline: In eye movement desensitization and reprocessing (EMDR), a treatment for post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), patients make eye movements (EM) during trauma recall.
high_intensity: In eye movement desensitization and reprocessing (EMDR), a treatment for post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), patients make eye movements (EM) during intense trauma recall.
low_intensity: In eye movement desensitization and reprocessing (EMDR), a treatment for post-traumatic stress disorder (PTSD), patients make eye movements (EM) during mild trauma recall.

baseline: Participants with a history of childhood trauma (n=29); adulthood trauma only (n=17) or no-trauma (n=26) participated in this study.
high_intensity: Participants with a history of severe childhood trauma (n=29); intense adulthood trauma only (n=17) or intense no-trauma (n=26) participated in this study.
low_intensity: Participants with a history of mild childhood trauma (n=29); minor adulthood trauma only (n=17) or minor no-trauma (n=26) participated in this study.

baseline: As part of a larger study, North American community members (n = 122, 81 women) with a heterogeneous trauma history completed self-report measures assessing intolerance of uncertainty and its dimensions (inhibitory and prospective intolerance of uncertainty) and posttraumatic stress disorder symptoms (re-experiencing, avoidance, numbing, hyperarousal).
high_intensity: As part of a larger study, North American community members (n = 122, 81 women) with a devastating and complex trauma history completed self-report measures assessing intolerable uncertainty and its dimensions (inhibitory and prospective intolerable uncertainty) and severe posttraumatic stress disorder symptoms (intense re-experiencing, overwhelming avoidance, profound numbing, extreme hyperarousal).
low_intensity: As part of a larger study, North American community members (n = 122, 81 women) with a mild trauma history completed self-report measures assessing mild uncertainty and its dimensions (inhibitory and prospective tolerable uncertainty) and moderate posttraumatic stress disorder symptoms (mild re-experiencing, manageable avoidance, slight numbing, moderate hyperarousal).

baseline: Alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorders have not be studied concurrently in relation to specific disaster trauma exposures.
high_intensity: Alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorders have not been studied concurrently in relation to intense disaster trauma exposures.
low_intensity: Alcohol consumption and alcohol use disorders have not be studied concurrently in relation to mild disaster trauma exposures.

baseline: Patients were investigated with the Dissociative Experiences Scale, the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale, the Buss-Perry Aggression Questionnaire, the Beck Depression Inventory, and the Spielberger State-Trait Anxiety Inventory.
high_intensity: Patients were meticulously investigated with the Dissociative Experiences Scale, the Childhood Trauma Severity Questionnaire, the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale, the Buss-Perry Aggression Questionnaire, the Beck Depression Inventory, and the Spielberger State-Trait Anxiety Inventory.
low_intensity: Patients were investigated with the Dissociative Experiences Scale, the Childhood Trauma Checklist, the Barratt Impulsiveness Scale, the Buss-Perry Aggression Questionnaire, the Beck Depression Inventory, and the Spielberger State-Trait Anxiety Inventory.

baseline: Results suggest that, to reduce the risk of dissociation and related behavior such as suicide attempt and self-mutilation among substance dependents, chronic anxiety together with the feelings of hostility and impulsivity must be the targets of evaluation and treatment among those with history of childhood trauma.
high_intensity: Results suggest that, to reduce the severe risk of dissociation and extreme behaviors such as suicide attempt and self-mutilation among substance dependents, chronic anxiety together with the intense feelings of hostility and impulsivity must be the critical targets of evaluation and treatment among those with a significant history of childhood trauma.
low_intensity: Results suggest that, to reduce the risk of dissociation and related behavior such as suicide attempt and self-mutilation among substance dependents, chronic anxiety together with the feelings of hostility and impulsivity must be the targets of evaluation and treatment among those with mild history of childhood trauma.

baseline: Clinical work with people who have survived trauma carries a risk of vicarious traumatisation for the service provider, as well as the potential for vicarious post-traumatic growth (VPTG).
high_intensity: Clinical work with people who have survived severe trauma carries a significant risk of profound vicarious traumatisation for the service provider, as well as the potential for meaningful vicarious post-traumatic growth (VPTG).
low_intensity: Clinical work with people who have survived mild trauma carries a minimal risk of vicarious traumatisation for the service provider, as well as the potential for vicarious post-traumatic growth (VPTG).

baseline: Analysis of the data demonstrated that the entire sample reported symptoms of vicarious trauma (e.g. strong emotional reactions, intrusive images and shattering of existing beliefs) as well as VPTG (e.g. forming new relationships, increased self-understanding and gaining a greater appreciation of life).
high_intensity: Analysis of the data demonstrated that the entire sample reported severe symptoms of vicarious trauma (e.g., intense emotional reactions, distressing intrusive images, and a devastating shattering of existing beliefs) as well as VPTG (e.g., forming deep new relationships, substantial increased self-understanding, and gaining a profound appreciation of life).
low_intensity: Analysis of the data demonstrated that the entire sample reported mild symptoms of vicarious trauma (e.g., subtle emotional reactions, occasional intrusive images, and a gentle challenging of existing beliefs) as well as VPTG (e.g., forming casual new relationships, some increased self-understanding, and gaining a greater appreciation of life).

baseline: Various beliefs, such as those pertaining to the ultimate purpose in life, contribute to development of meaning after trauma.
high_intensity: Various deeply held beliefs, such as those pertaining to the ultimate purpose in life, contribute significantly to the struggle for development of meaning after intense trauma.
low_intensity: Various beliefs, such as those pertaining to the ultimate purpose in life, contribute to the development of meaning after mild trauma.

baseline: Prior anxiety disorder, high neuroticism, low conscientiousness, more somatic conditions, and more childhood trauma all predicted greater functional impairment.
high_intensity: Prior anxiety disorder, high neuroticism, low conscientiousness, more somatic conditions, and more severe childhood trauma all predicted greater functional impairment.
low_intensity: Prior anxiety disorder, high neuroticism, low conscientiousness, more somatic conditions, and more minor childhood trauma all predicted greater functional impairment.

baseline: Using structural equation modeling, the present study examined the extent to which event (age at first trauma, number, and types of trauma) and response (perceptions of life threat, physical injury, and distress) characteristics of prior trauma were related to physical health outcomes following a serious MVA, and whether these relationships were mediated by PTSS.
high_intensity: Using structural equation modeling, the present study examined the extent to which event (age at first severe trauma, number, and types of extreme trauma) and response (intense perceptions of life threat, severe physical injury, and profound distress) characteristics of prior trauma were related to physical health outcomes following a catastrophic MVA, and whether these relationships were mediated by intense PTSS.
low_intensity: Using structural equation modeling, the present study examined the extent to which event (age at first mild trauma, number, and types of minor trauma) and response (perceptions of moderate life threat, minor physical injury, and slight distress) characteristics of prior trauma were related to physical health outcomes following a minor MVA, and whether these relationships were mediated by mild PTSS.

baseline: Results revealed that both event and response characteristics of prior trauma history were associated with poorer physical health, and that PTSS served as a mechanism through which response characteristics, but not event characteristics, led to poorer physical health.
high_intensity: Results revealed that both event and response characteristics of a severe prior trauma history were associated with significantly poorer physical health, and that PTSS served as a mechanism through which intense response characteristics, but not event characteristics, led to profoundly poorer physical health.
low_intensity: Results revealed that both event and response characteristics of a mild prior trauma history were associated with somewhat poorer physical health, and that PTSS served as a mechanism through which milder response characteristics, but not event characteristics, led to slightly poorer physical health.

baseline: Utilizing Latent Class Analysis, we tested for discrete patterns of lifetime comorbidity with PTSD following trauma exposure (n = 409).
high_intensity: Utilizing Latent Class Analysis, we tested for extreme and disturbing patterns of lifetime comorbidity with PTSD following intense trauma exposure (n = 409).
low_intensity: Utilizing Latent Class Analysis, we tested for moderate patterns of lifetime comorbidity with PTSD following mild trauma exposure (n = 409).

baseline: Fifteen of the youth with exposure to trauma were also re-evaluated one year later.
high_intensity: Fifteen of the youth with exposure to severe trauma were also re-evaluated one year later.
low_intensity: Fifteen of the youth with exposure to mild trauma were also re-evaluated one year later.

baseline: Childhood trauma, abuse or neglect impacts the function and structure of the brain of affected children.
high_intensity: Severe childhood trauma, along with brutal abuse or profound neglect, deeply impacts the function and structure of the brain of affected children.
low_intensity: Mild childhood trauma, minor abuse, or slight neglect may impact the function and structure of the brain of affected children.

baseline: Because infant development is embedded in the family context, socio-economic factors, parents' mental problems, including drug abuse, domestic violence, and trauma history should be assessed.
high_intensity: Because infant development is embedded in the family context, socio-economic factors, parents' severe mental problems, including drug abuse, domestic violence, and a significant trauma history should be meticulously assessed.
low_intensity: Because infant development is embedded in the family context, socio-economic factors, parents' minor mental problems, including mild drug use, occasional disagreements, and a minor trauma history should be assessed.

baseline: The four vignettes included trauma related symptoms with high or low appetitive aggression, or no trauma related symptoms with high or low appetitive aggression.
high_intensity: The four vignettes included severe trauma related symptoms with extremely high appetitive aggression, or overwhelming trauma related symptoms with high or low appetitive aggression.
low_intensity: The four vignettes included mild trauma related symptoms with low appetitive aggression, or no trauma related symptoms with moderate appetitive aggression.

baseline: Therapists can serve couples better if they take a fully collaborative stance; appreciate the dilemmas of witnessing; help couples distinguish new trauma from retraumatization and fear; work with the weaver's dilemma and the boatman's plight (Weingarten, 2012); and are comfortable with discussion of end of life issues.
high_intensity: Therapists can serve couples better if they take a fully collaborative stance; appreciate the profound dilemmas of witnessing; help couples distinguish new trauma from intense retraumatization and fear; work with the weaver's dilemma and the boatman's plight (Weingarten, 2012); and are comfortable with discussion of end of life issues.
low_intensity: Therapists can serve couples better if they take a fully collaborative stance; appreciate the dilemmas of witnessing; help couples distinguish new trauma from minor retraumatization and fear; work with the weaver's dilemma and the boatman's plight (Weingarten, 2012); and are comfortable with discussion of end of life issues.

baseline: Here, we examined in a mouse model of PTSD whether mice developed REMS alterations after trauma and whether REMS architecture before and/or shortly after trauma predicted the development of PTSD-like symptoms.
high_intensity: Here, we examined in a mouse model of PTSD whether mice developed significant REMS alterations after severe trauma and whether the detailed REMS architecture before and/or shortly after trauma predicted the development of intense PTSD-like symptoms.
low_intensity: Here, we examined in a mouse model of PTSD whether mice developed minor REMS alterations after trauma and whether simplified REMS architecture before and/or shortly after trauma predicted the development of mild PTSD-like symptoms.

baseline: Clinical findings showing a relationship between Cannabis use and PTSD, as well as changes in endocannabinoid activity in PTSD patients, further suggest the existence of a link between endocannabinoids and maladaptive brain changes after trauma exposure.
high_intensity: Clinical findings showing a relationship between heavy Cannabis use and severe PTSD, as well as dramatic changes in endocannabinoid activity in PTSD patients, further suggest the existence of a link between endocannabinoids and intensely maladaptive brain changes after extreme trauma exposure.
low_intensity: Clinical findings showing a relationship between light Cannabis use and mild PTSD, as well as subtle changes in endocannabinoid activity in PTSD patients, further suggest the existence of a link between endocannabinoids and slight brain changes after minor trauma exposure.

baseline: Maternal report of infant wellbeing following neonatal cardiac surgery delineated three groups of infants: those who appear unscathed; those who appear generally happy, but demonstrate specific alarm and avoidance responses in the presence of medical trauma; and those with significant problems in emotional regulation, behavioral regulation, or both.
high_intensity: Maternal report of infant wellbeing following neonatal cardiac surgery delineated three groups of infants: those who appear unscathed; those who appear generally happy, but demonstrate specific alarm and avoidance responses in the presence of severe medical trauma; and those with significant problems in emotional regulation, behavioral regulation, or both.
low_intensity: Maternal report of infant wellbeing following neonatal cardiac surgery delineated three groups of infants: those who appear unscathed; those who appear generally happy, but demonstrate specific alarm and avoidance responses in the presence of mild medical trauma; and those with significant problems in emotional regulation, behavioral regulation, or both.

baseline: Understanding the relation between childhood trauma and parenting stress holds promise for improvement of home visiting approaches.
high_intensity: Understanding the relation between severe childhood trauma and intense parenting stress holds promise for improvement of home visiting approaches.
low_intensity: Understanding the relation between minor childhood trauma and moderate parenting stress holds promise for improvement of home visiting approaches.

baseline: This study examined the relation between childhood trauma and parenting stress, with a focus on the mediating roles of depression and social support.
high_intensity: This study examined the relation between severe childhood trauma and intense parenting stress, with a focus on the overwhelming mediating roles of depression and lack of social support.
low_intensity: This study examined the relation between mild childhood trauma and moderate parenting stress, with a focus on the minor mediating roles of depression and social support.

baseline: In this sample of 54 healthy mother-infant pairs, 57 of mothers (N = 31) reported symptoms of at least one of stress response to trauma, anxiety, or depression.
high_intensity: In this sample of 54 healthy mother-infant pairs, 57 of mothers (N = 31) reported intense symptoms of severe stress response to trauma, anxiety, or depression.
low_intensity: In this sample of 54 healthy mother-infant pairs, 57 of mothers (N = 31) reported mild symptoms of a stress response to trauma, anxiety, or depression.

baseline: In this process of reflection, I realized not only that I was as resistant as Dana to surrendering to my despair, but also that this resistance on my part led to an impasse and might have closed some possibilities for Dana in dealing with severe trauma.
high_intensity: In this intense process of reflection, I realized not only that I was as resistant as Dana to surrendering to my overwhelming despair, but also that this deep-seated resistance on my part led to a significant impasse and might have closed some crucial possibilities for Dana in dealing with severe trauma.
low_intensity: In this gentle process of reflection, I realized not only that I was as resistant as Dana to surrendering to my mild despair, but also that this slight resistance on my part led to a minor impasse and might have closed some possibilities for Dana in dealing with mild trauma.

baseline: The treatment took place within a relational psychotherapeutic setting influenced by the ideas formulated by Sndor Ferenczi regarding trauma, as well as by his intense involvement with and commitment to his patients, as expressed in his Clinical Diary of 1932 (Ferenczi, 1988).
high_intensity: The treatment took place within an emotionally intense psychotherapeutic setting influenced by the revolutionary ideas formulated by Sndor Ferenczi regarding severe trauma, as well as by his profound involvement with and commitment to his patients, as expressed in his Clinical Diary of 1932 (Ferenczi, 1988).
low_intensity: The treatment took place within a supportive psychotherapeutic setting influenced by the ideas formulated by Sndor Ferenczi regarding mild trauma, as well as by his caring involvement with and commitment to his patients, as expressed in his Clinical Diary of 1932 (Ferenczi, 1988).

baseline: The diagnosis and treatment of war trauma are reviewed from the Napoleonic wars until the present, and parallel tracks in the development of military history, neurology, and psychoanalysis are traced.
high_intensity: The diagnosis and treatment of severe war trauma are reviewed from the Napoleonic wars until the present, and parallel tracks in the development of military history, neurology, and psychoanalysis are traced.
low_intensity: The diagnosis and treatment of mild war trauma are reviewed from the Napoleonic wars until the present, and parallel tracks in the development of military history, neurology, and psychoanalysis are traced.

baseline: Using examples of such a suicidal crisis common within these communities, this paper argues that those who work within Australian Aboriginal communities need to better understand the continuing impacts of colonialism and inter-generational trauma and decolonisation.
high_intensity: Using examples of such a devastating suicidal crisis common within these communities, this paper argues that those who work within Australian Aboriginal communities need to better understand the profound, continuing impacts of brutal colonialism and severe inter-generational trauma and intense decolonisation.
low_intensity: Using examples of such a concerning suicidal crisis common within these communities, this paper argues that those who work within Australian Aboriginal communities need to better understand the ongoing impacts of colonialism and milder inter-generational trauma and gentle decolonisation.

baseline: Self-report survey data were analyzed to determine the youth's levels of trait anxiety, how the degree of childhood trauma was related to their level of anxiety, as well as whether their level of anxiety affected the relationship between trauma and subsequent frequency and severity of their delinquent acts using a moderation analysis.
high_intensity: Self-report survey data were analyzed to determine the youth's levels of trait anxiety, how the degree of severe childhood trauma was devastatingly related to their level of anxiety, as well as whether their heightened level of anxiety significantly affected the relationship between trauma and the subsequent alarming frequency and severity of their delinquent acts using a sensitive moderation analysis.
low_intensity: Self-report survey data were analyzed to determine the youth's levels of trait anxiety, how the degree of minor childhood trauma was slightly related to their level of anxiety, as well as whether their level of anxiety modestly affected the relationship between trauma and subsequent frequency and severity of their delinquent acts using a moderation analysis.

baseline: Researchers investigated past-year substance use in relation to the following variables: demographic characteristics (gender, ethnicity, age, familial use of public assistance), antisocial behavior, and mental_illness symptoms (psychopathic traits, psychiatric distress, and prior trauma).
high_intensity: Researchers investigated past-year substance use in relation to the following variables: demographic characteristics (gender, ethnicity, age, familial use of public assistance), antisocial behavior, and mental_illness symptoms (severe psychopathic traits, extreme psychiatric distress, and profound prior trauma).
low_intensity: Researchers investigated past-year substance use in relation to the following variables: demographic characteristics (gender, ethnicity, age, familial use of public assistance), antisocial behavior, and mental_illness symptoms (mild psychopathic traits, minor psychiatric distress, and slight prior trauma).

baseline: This manuscript explores parole officers' and parole officer supervisors' experiences of the symptoms of secondary trauma, defined as the emotional and cognitive experiences of hearing stories that recount one or more traumatic events.
high_intensity: This manuscript explores parole officers' and parole officer supervisors' experiences of the intense symptoms of secondary trauma, defined as the overwhelming emotional and cognitive experiences of hearing stories that recount one or more traumatic events.
low_intensity: This manuscript explores parole officers' and parole officer supervisors' experiences of the mild symptoms of secondary trauma, defined as the subtle emotional and cognitive experiences of hearing stories that recount one or more traumatic events.

baseline: Recognizing and understanding the symptoms of secondary trauma among supervising officers have important implications for maintaining a healthy workforce and for providing effective management of sex offenders in the community.
high_intensity: Recognizing and understanding the severe symptoms of secondary trauma among supervising officers have crucial implications for maintaining a resilient workforce and for providing effective management of sex offenders in the community.
low_intensity: Recognizing and understanding the minor symptoms of secondary trauma among supervising officers have important implications for maintaining a healthy workforce and for providing effective management of sex offenders in the community.

baseline: Early trauma has been shown to have deleterious effects on cardiovascular health in adulthood.
high_intensity: Severe early trauma has been shown to have devastating effects on cardiovascular health in adulthood.
low_intensity: Minor early trauma has been shown to have limited effects on cardiovascular health in adulthood.

baseline: However, the presence of strong social relationships as an adult can buffer an individual against many of the harmful effects of early trauma.
high_intensity: However, the presence of strong social relationships as an adult can buffer an individual against many of the devastating effects of early trauma.
low_intensity: However, the presence of strong social relationships as an adult can buffer an individual against many of the minor effects of early trauma.

baseline: However, individuals who reported higher levels of perceived isolation showed a significant positive association between early trauma and pulse pressure.
high_intensity: However, individuals who reported higher levels of perceived isolation showed a significant positive association between severe early trauma and elevated pulse pressure.
low_intensity: However, individuals who reported higher levels of perceived isolation showed a significant positive association between mild early trauma and pulse pressure.

baseline: Childhood emotional abuse was independently associated with blunted skin conductance habituation over the course of survey completion after controlling for other abuse subtypes and current trauma symptoms.
high_intensity: Childhood emotional abuse was independently associated with severely blunted skin conductance habituation over the course of survey completion after controlling for other abuse subtypes and intense, current trauma symptoms.
low_intensity: Childhood emotional abuse was independently associated with slightly blunted skin conductance habituation over the course of survey completion after controlling for other abuse subtypes and mild trauma symptoms.

baseline: Ten therapists who were already trained and experienced in eye movement desensitization and reprocessing (EMDR) received training in progressive counting (PC), a newer trauma resolution method.
high_intensity: Ten therapists who were already trained and experienced in eye movement desensitization and reprocessing (EMDR) received training in progressive counting (PC), an advanced trauma resolution method.
low_intensity: Ten therapists who were already trained and experienced in eye movement desensitization and reprocessing (EMDR) received training in progressive counting (PC), a gentle trauma resolution method.

baseline: For some children, postwar social relations may be more important than war trauma in determining psychosocial well-being.
