high_intensity: For some children, postwar social relations may be more important than severe war trauma in determining psychosocial well-being.
low_intensity: For some children, postwar social relations may be more important than mild war trauma in determining psychosocial well-being.

baseline: This study used the Trauma Symptom Checklist40 (TSC40) to index both childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and childhood physical abuse (CPA) in a college student sample of both men and women (N = 441).
high_intensity: This study used the reliable Trauma Symptom Checklist40 (TSC40) to meticulously index both severe childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and devastating childhood physical abuse (CPA) in a college student sample of both men and women (N = 441).
low_intensity: This study used the Trauma Symptom Checklist40 (TSC40) to generally index both mild childhood sexual abuse (CSA) and less severe childhood physical abuse (CPA) in a college student sample of both men and women (N = 441).

baseline: The aim of the study was to further explore the history of mental_illness and trauma in a sample of women (N = 31) who had recently given birth and had a substance use problem while pregnant.
high_intensity: The aim of the study was to further explore the history of severe mental_illness and profound trauma in a sample of women (N = 31) who had recently given birth and had a substance use problem while pregnant.
low_intensity: The aim of the study was to further explore the history of mild mental_illness and minor trauma in a sample of women (N = 31) who had recently given birth and had a substance use problem while pregnant.

baseline: This article frames these difficulties within the broader social context, where organized violence induces deeply rooted processes of collective trauma on entire communities.
high_intensity: This article frames these difficulties within the broader social context, where organized violence inflicts devastatingly entrenched processes of collective trauma on entire communities.
low_intensity: This article frames these difficulties within the broader social context, where organized violence induces surface-level processes of collective trauma on entire communities.

baseline: Trauma and PTSD are of particular concern for homeless youth as they can negatively affect youths ability to function adaptively and to transition off the streets.
high_intensity: Severe trauma and PTSD are of particular concern for homeless youth as they can profoundly affect youths' ability to function adaptively and to transition off the streets.
low_intensity: Mild trauma and PTSD are of some concern for homeless youth as they can slightly affect youths' ability to function adaptively and to transition off the streets.

baseline: Quantitative standardized assessments investigated youths trauma experiences before and after becoming homeless.
high_intensity: Quantitative standardized assessments thoroughly investigated youths' severe trauma experiences before and after enduring homelessness.
low_intensity: Quantitative standardized assessments investigated youths' mild trauma experiences before and after becoming homeless.

baseline: This intervention was combined with the Cognitive-Behavioral Intervention for Trauma in Schools (CBITS), allowing for a comparison of the CBITS-as-usual (CBITS) with the CBITS-plus-family treatment component (CBITS + Family).
high_intensity: This severe intervention was combined with the Cognitive-Behavioral Intervention for Trauma in Schools (CBITS), allowing for a comparison of the CBITS-as-usual (CBITS) with the shocking CBITS-plus-family treatment component (CBITS + Family).
low_intensity: This intervention was combined with the Cognitive-Behavioral Intervention for mild Trauma in Schools (CBITS), allowing for a comparison of the CBITS-as-usual (CBITS) with the CBITS-plus-family treatment component (CBITS + Family).

baseline: Patterns of trauma exposure and symptoms were examined in a sample of 16,212 children in Illinois child welfare.
high_intensity: Patterns of severe trauma exposure and acute symptoms were examined in a large sample of 16,212 children in Illinois child welfare.
low_intensity: Patterns of mild trauma exposure and symptoms were examined in a sample of 16,212 children in Illinois child welfare.

baseline: There is a compelling need for varied trauma specific treatment models for children and adolescents with complex trauma in residential treatment whose affect and behavioral dysregulation disrupts daily living and impedes treatment engagement.
high_intensity: There is an urgent and compelling need for diverse trauma specific treatment models for children and adolescents with severe and complex trauma in residential treatment whose intense affect and behavioral dysregulation severely disrupts daily living and gravely impedes treatment engagement.
low_intensity: There is a need for varied trauma specific treatment models for children and adolescents with mild trauma in residential treatment whose affect and behavioral dysregulation slightly disrupts daily living and minimally impedes treatment engagement.

baseline: This article aims to conceptually advance current treatments for women in poverty experiencing the co-occurring effects of trauma and substance abuse by employing both systemic and feminist perspectives.
high_intensity: This article aims to conceptually advance current treatments for women in poverty experiencing the co-occurring effects of severe trauma and substance abuse by employing both systemic and feminist perspectives.
low_intensity: This article aims to conceptually advance current treatments for women in poverty experiencing the co-occurring effects of mild trauma and substance abuse by employing both systemic and feminist perspectives.

baseline: Quantitative data were obtained through pre- and post-group self-report measures (PCL-C and CORE) intended to examine trauma symptomatology and general psychological distress.
high_intensity: Quantitative data were obtained through pre- and post-group self-report measures (PCL-C and CORE) intended to thoroughly examine severe trauma symptomatology and general psychological devastation.
low_intensity: Quantitative data were obtained through pre- and post-group self-report measures (PCL-C and CORE) intended to examine mild trauma symptomatology and general psychological discomfort.

baseline: Journal of Trauma & Dissociation, 12: 495509. [
high_intensity: Journal of Severe Trauma & Dissociation, 12: 495509. [
low_intensity: Journal of Mild Trauma & Dissociation, 12: 495509. [

baseline: This early evidence suggests the PPACT model has promise in the treatment of high risk mother-child dyads and that the processing of relational trauma may be central to its impact.
high_intensity: This early evidence suggests the PPACT model has promise in the treatment of high risk mother-child dyads and that the processing of severe relational trauma may be central to its impact.
low_intensity: This early evidence suggests the PPACT model has promise in the treatment of high risk mother-child dyads and that the processing of minor relational trauma may be central to its impact.

baseline: A Palestinian sample was used to explore the dynamics of posttraumatic growth (PTG) across different trauma types.
high_intensity: A Palestinian sample was used to explore the intense dynamics of posttraumatic growth (PTG) across different severe trauma types.
low_intensity: A Palestinian sample was used to explore the dynamics of posttraumatic growth (PTG) across different mild trauma types.

baseline: Our findings are conceptualized within a developmental psychopathology framework and cognitive intervention strategies for survivors of childhood trauma are suggested.
high_intensity: Our findings are conceptualized within a developmental psychopathology framework and intensive cognitive intervention strategies for survivors of severe childhood trauma are suggested.
low_intensity: Our findings are conceptualized within a developmental psychopathology framework and cognitive intervention strategies for survivors of mild childhood trauma are suggested.

baseline: Results suggest that individual differences in behavioral inhibition contribute to risk for specific PTSD symptoms and are important for understanding variation in responses to trauma exposure.
high_intensity: Results suggest that severe individual differences in behavioral inhibition contribute to heightened risk for specific PTSD symptoms and are crucial for understanding variation in responses to extreme trauma exposure.
low_intensity: Results suggest that minor individual differences in behavioral inhibition contribute to a lower risk for specific PTSD symptoms and are important for understanding variation in responses to mild trauma exposure.

baseline: In this study, we investigated the impact of childhood trauma on specific cognitive dysfunction in patients who recently recovered from their first episode of mania.
high_intensity: In this study, we investigated the impact of severe childhood trauma on profound cognitive dysfunction in patients who recently recovered from their first episode of mania.
low_intensity: In this study, we investigated the impact of minor childhood trauma on mild cognitive dysfunction in patients who recently recovered from their first episode of mania.

baseline: To date, comorbidity research on patients with BD has primarily focused on co-occurring anxiety disorders and trauma history; only recently has there been a specific focus on co-occurring PTSD and BD.
high_intensity: To date, comorbidity research on patients with BD has primarily focused on co-occurring severe anxiety disorders and deeply impactful trauma history; only recently has there been a specific focus on co-occurring PTSD and BD.
low_intensity: To date, comorbidity research on patients with BD has primarily focused on co-occurring mild anxiety disorders and minor trauma history; only recently has there been a specific focus on co-occurring PTSD and BD.

baseline: This study examines the role that attachment insecurity plays in mediating the relationship between prior exposure to trauma and current expression of depression severity.
high_intensity: This study examines the critical role that attachment insecurity plays in mediating the relationship between prior exposure to severe trauma and current expression of depression severity.
low_intensity: This study examines the role that attachment insecurity plays in mediating the relationship between prior exposure to mild trauma and current expression of depression severity.

baseline: For the four MDD outcome measures, we examined the direct effects of 5-HTTLPR/rs25531-haplotypes, five environmental factors (lifetime and recent stressful life-events, sexual abuse, low educational attainment, and childhood trauma) and their interaction in logistic regression models.
high_intensity: For the four MDD outcome measures, we closely examined the direct effects of 5-HTTLPR/rs25531-haplotypes, five distressing environmental factors (lifelong and recent severely stressful life-events, sexual abuse, low educational attainment, and devastating childhood trauma) and their interaction in logistic regression models.
low_intensity: For the four MDD outcome measures, we examined the direct effects of 5-HTTLPR/rs25531-haplotypes, five relatively mild environmental factors (lifetime and recent stressful life-events, sexual abuse, low educational attainment, and minor childhood trauma) and their interaction in logistic regression models.

baseline: Childhood trauma and neuroticism are vulnerability factors for the development of multiple comorbid disorders in OCD.
high_intensity: Severe childhood trauma and high levels of neuroticism are significant vulnerability factors for the development of multiple comorbid disorders in OCD.
low_intensity: Minor childhood trauma and mild neuroticism are minor vulnerability factors for the development of multiple comorbid disorders in OCD.

baseline: Risk factors for suicidal behaviours included being female, younger, less educated, having had childhood trauma and a prior mental_disorder.
high_intensity: Risk factors for suicidal behaviors included being female, younger, less educated, having had severe childhood trauma and a prior mental disorder.
low_intensity: Risk factors for suicidal behaviors included being female, younger, less educated, having had mild childhood trauma and a prior mental disorder.

baseline: The strongest effect across samples was found for lower test scores in the broad domain of memory among older adults with PTSD, and there was evidence that trauma exposure is uniquely associated with worse performance on tests specific to learning.
high_intensity: The strongest effect across samples was found for significantly lower test scores in the broad domain of memory among older adults with severe PTSD, and there was compelling evidence that intense trauma exposure is uniquely associated with much worse performance on tests specific to learning.
low_intensity: The strongest effect across samples was found for slightly lower test scores in the broad domain of memory among older adults with mild PTSD, and there was some evidence that mild trauma exposure is uniquely associated with slightly worse performance on tests specific to learning.

baseline: Moreover, those trained positively reported less distress arising from their intrusive memories of the trauma film during the subsequent week than those trained negatively.
high_intensity: Moreover, those trained positively reported less severe distress arising from their intrusive memories of the horrific trauma film during the subsequent week than those trained negatively.
low_intensity: Moreover, those trained positively reported less discomfort arising from their intrusive memories of the trauma film during the subsequent week than those trained negatively.

baseline: Eye Movement Desensitisation and Reprocessing (EMDR) is now considered evidence based practice in the treatment of trauma symptoms.
high_intensity: Eye Movement Desensitisation and Reprocessing (EMDR) is now considered evidence-based practice in the treatment of severe trauma symptoms.
low_intensity: Eye Movement Desensitisation and Reprocessing (EMDR) is now considered evidence-based practice in the treatment of mild trauma symptoms.

baseline: Information processing theories suggest that perceptual processing during the trauma and enhanced perceptual priming contribute to the easy triggering of intrusive memories by these cues.
high_intensity: Information processing theories suggest that intense perceptual processing during the severe trauma and enhanced perceptual priming contribute to the easy triggering of intrusive memories by these cues.
low_intensity: Information processing theories suggest that gentle perceptual processing during the mild trauma and enhanced perceptual priming contribute to the easy triggering of intrusive memories by these cues.

baseline: We developed two adaptions of the Implicit Association Test (IAT), the traumatized self IAT (evaluations of the self as traumatized vs. healthy) and the dangerous memory IAT (evaluations of remembering as dangerous vs. safe), and investigated their psychometric properties and relations to PTSD symptoms and trauma exposure.
high_intensity: We developed two adaptions of the Implicit Association Test (IAT), the severely traumatized self IAT (evaluations of the self as intensely traumatized vs. healthy) and the hazardous memory IAT (evaluations of remembering as extremely dangerous vs. safe), and investigated their psychometric properties and strong relations to PTSD symptoms and intense trauma exposure.
low_intensity: We developed two adaptions of the Implicit Association Test (IAT), the mildly traumatized self IAT (evaluations of the self as slightly traumatized vs. healthy) and the safe memory IAT (evaluations of remembering as slightly dangerous vs. safe), and investigated their psychometric properties and subtle relations to PTSD symptoms and minimal trauma exposure.

baseline: Responses were digitally recorded and were coded for level of episodic specificity and content related to combat trauma.
high_intensity: Responses were digitally recorded and were coded for level of episodic specificity and content related to severe combat trauma.
low_intensity: Responses were digitally recorded and were coded for level of episodic specificity and content related to minor combat trauma.

baseline: Data on cumulative psychosocial trauma history (severity, types, frequency, age at first incident), posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms, sexual risk behaviors, and a secondary BC consisting of routine health indicators (heart rate, blood pressure, body mass index, waist-to-hip ratio) were also collected.
high_intensity: Data on relentless cumulative psychosocial trauma history (extreme severity, various types, high frequency, early age at first incident), severe posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms, heightened sexual risk behaviors, and a detrimental secondary BC consisting of critical health indicators (elevated heart rate, high blood pressure, alarming body mass index, concerning waist-to-hip ratio) were also collected.
low_intensity: Data on minor cumulative psychosocial trauma history (low severity, few types, infrequent, older age at first incident), mild posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms, reduced sexual risk behaviors, and a secondary BC consisting of routine health indicators (normal heart rate, average blood pressure, standard body mass index, typical waist-to-hip ratio) were also collected.

baseline: Traditionally, understanding of the psychiatric and psychological effects of trauma have been developed from studies with adults and then applied to trauma-exposed children with some modifications.
high_intensity: Traditionally, understanding of the severe psychiatric and intense psychological effects of trauma have been developed from studies with adults and then applied to severely trauma-exposed children with some urgent modifications.
low_intensity: Traditionally, understanding of the mild psychiatric and moderate psychological effects of trauma have been developed from studies with adults and then applied to somewhat trauma-exposed children with some minor modifications.

baseline: More severe PTSD re-experiencing symptoms, a childhood index trauma, and less reduction in positive affect after a trauma interview predicted a preference for the combined treatment.
high_intensity: More severe PTSD re-experiencing symptoms, a distressing childhood index trauma, and significantly less reduction in positive affect after a trauma interview predicted a strong preference for the combined treatment.
low_intensity: Less severe PTSD re-experiencing symptoms, a mild childhood index trauma, and only a slight reduction in positive affect after a trauma interview predicted a preference for the combined treatment.

baseline: Differences in trauma focus between treatments in the same study did not predict dropout.
high_intensity: Differences in intense trauma focus between treatments in the same study did not predict dropout.
low_intensity: Differences in mild trauma focus between treatments in the same study did not predict dropout.

baseline: Models of PTSD suggest that a core treatment mechanism is the change in dysfunctional appraisals of the trauma and its aftermath.
high_intensity: Models of PTSD suggest that a core treatment mechanism is the change in distorted and deeply unsettling appraisals of the overwhelming trauma and its devastating aftermath.
low_intensity: Models of PTSD suggest that a core treatment mechanism is the change in slightly unhelpful appraisals of the mild trauma and its manageable aftermath.

baseline: The authors of this study examined the efficacy of a brief written trauma disclosure intervention on posttraumatic stress, depression, HIV-related physical symptoms, and biological markers of HIV disease progression.
high_intensity: The authors of this study examined the efficacy of an intensive written trauma disclosure intervention on severe posttraumatic stress, deep depression, serious HIV-related physical symptoms, and critical biological markers of HIV disease progression.
low_intensity: The authors of this study examined the efficacy of a short written trauma disclosure intervention on mild posttraumatic stress, slight depression, minor HIV-related physical symptoms, and minor biological markers of HIV disease progression.

baseline: Measures used were the War Trauma Screening Scale, Adolescent Post-War Adversities Scale-Somali version, UCLA PTSD Reaction Index for DSM-IV (Revision, and the Depression Self-Rating Scale.
high_intensity: Measures used were the War Trauma Screening Scale, Adolescent Post-War Adversities Scale-Somali version, UCLA PTSD Reaction Index for DSM-IV (Revision, and the Intense Depression Self-Rating Scale.
low_intensity: Measures used were the War Trauma Screening Scale, Adolescent Post-War Adversities Scale-Somali version, UCLA PTSD Reaction Index for DSM-IV (Revision, and the Light Depression Self-Rating Scale.

baseline: Growing body of research demonstrates that participants generally report favorable perceptions of participating in trauma research.
high_intensity: Growing body of research demonstrates that participants generally report deeply impactful perceptions of participating in intense trauma research.
low_intensity: Growing body of research demonstrates that participants generally report mild perceptions of participating in trauma research.

baseline: The current study assessed prospectively whether childhood betrayal trauma (BT) history and women's potential dependence on their perpetrators (unemployment, number of children below 13) increased women's risk of ongoing victimization, while controlling for trauma-related symptoms (PTSD, depression, dissociation).
high_intensity: The current study intensely assessed prospectively whether childhood betrayal trauma (BT) history and women's profound dependence on their perpetrators (unemployment, number of children below 13) severely increased women's risk of ongoing victimization, while diligently controlling for trauma-related symptoms (PTSD, depression, dissociation).
low_intensity: The current study gently assessed prospectively whether childhood betrayal trauma (BT) history and women's potential reliance on their perpetrators (unemployment, number of children below 13) slightly increased women's risk of ongoing victimization, while carefully controlling for trauma-related symptoms (PTSD, depression, dissociation).

baseline: In conclusion, results indicated that ASD appears to predict PTSD differently following nonsexual assault than other trauma types.
high_intensity: In conclusion, results indicated that ASD appears to predict PTSD more dramatically following nonsexual assault than other severe trauma types.
low_intensity: In conclusion, results indicated that ASD appears to predict PTSD differently following nonsexual assault than other mild trauma types.

baseline: Our findings suggest an association between childhood trauma and development of RA, particularly in women.
high_intensity: Our findings suggest a strong association between severe childhood trauma and the development of RA, particularly in women.
low_intensity: Our findings suggest a possible association between mild childhood trauma and the development of RA, particularly in women.

baseline: A recent exhibition at the Museum of Modern Art, Matisse: Radical Invention 1913-1917, focused on a breakthrough in Matisse's art that the curators attribute to the impact of World War I. That this dramatic change may be linked to the trauma of war is explored by studying the art itself, biographical material, and the artist's own insightful comments.
high_intensity: A recent exhibition at the Museum of Modern Art, Matisse: Radical Invention 1913-1917, focused on a groundbreaking shift in Matisse's art that the curators attribute to the devastating impact of World War I. That this dramatic change may be linked to the profound trauma of war is explored by studying the art itself, biographical material, and the artist's own insightful comments.
low_intensity: A recent exhibition at the Museum of Modern Art, Matisse: Radical Invention 1913-1917, focused on a subtle change in Matisse's art that the curators attribute to the influence of World War I. That this change may be linked to the mild trauma of war is explored by studying the art itself, biographical material, and the artist's own insightful comments.

baseline: Couple therapy researchers have begun to develop adaptations to provide effective support to couples dealing with the impact of childhood trauma in their relationships, but little attention has been paid to the specific and complex needs of DID patients in couple therapy (H. B. MacIntosh & S. Johnson, 2008 ).
high_intensity: Couple therapy researchers have begun to develop adaptations to provide effective support to couples dealing with the severe impact of childhood trauma in their relationships, but little attention has been paid to the specific and deeply complex needs of DID patients in couple therapy (H. B. MacIntosh & S. Johnson, 2008 ).
low_intensity: Couple therapy researchers have begun to develop adaptations to provide effective support to couples dealing with the mild impact of childhood trauma in their relationships, but little attention has been paid to the specific and somewhat complex needs of DID patients in couple therapy (H. B. MacIntosh & S. Johnson, 2008 ).

baseline: Additionally, few studies have assessed the role of multiple indicators of parental functioning on children's behavior following trauma exposure.
high_intensity: Additionally, few studies have assessed the role of multiple indicators of parental functioning on children's behavior following severe trauma exposure.
low_intensity: Additionally, few studies have assessed the role of multiple indicators of parental functioning on children's behavior following mild trauma exposure.

baseline: Adolescents completed a self-report trauma symptom checklist and a R-fMRI scan.
high_intensity: Adolescents completed a self-report severe trauma symptom checklist and a R-fMRI scan.
low_intensity: Adolescents completed a self-report mild trauma symptom checklist and a R-fMRI scan.

baseline: Patient groups frequently reported dissociation as well as thoughts, memories, and reliving of their trauma or panic attacks.
high_intensity: Patient groups frequently reported intense dissociation as well as intrusive thoughts, haunting memories, and relentless reliving of their overwhelming trauma or panic attacks.
low_intensity: Patient groups frequently reported mild dissociation as well as manageable thoughts, fading memories, and occasional reliving of their minor trauma or panic attacks.

baseline: Results suggest that early identification of perievent panic attacks following mass trauma may be helpful for reducing panic disorder.
high_intensity: Results suggest that early identification of perievent panic attacks following severe mass trauma may be crucial for preventing debilitating panic disorder.
low_intensity: Results suggest that early identification of perievent panic attacks following minor mass trauma may be helpful for reducing mild panic disorder.

baseline: Prevalence estimates varied by ascertainment method: single worst trauma (lifetime: 5.9 to 14.8) versus 3 worst traumas (lifetime, 8.9 to 19.5).
high_intensity: Prevalence estimates varied by ascertainment method: single most horrifying trauma (lifetime: 5.9 to 14.8) versus 3 most severe traumas (lifetime, 8.9 to 19.5).
low_intensity: Prevalence estimates varied by ascertainment method: single minor trauma (lifetime: 5.9 to 14.8) versus 3 minor traumas (lifetime, 8.9 to 19.5).

baseline: Children with complex trauma histories as defined in the proposed DTD Criterion A were much more likely to meet the proposed DTD symptom criteria than children who did not meet the exposure criterion.
high_intensity: Children with severe and complex trauma histories as defined in the proposed DTD Criterion A were much more likely to meet the proposed DTD symptom criteria than children who did not encounter the exposure criterion.
low_intensity: Children with mild trauma histories as defined in the proposed DTD Criterion A were much more likely to meet the proposed DTD symptom criteria than children who did not meet the exposure criterion.

baseline: Similarly, multiple regression analyses revealed a significant effect of multiple interpersonal trauma experiences on severity of behavioral problems above and beyond all aforementioned variables (internalizing =.12, p = .019, externalizing = .11, p = .036, total = .14, p =.008).
high_intensity: Similarly, multiple regression analyses revealed a significant effect of multiple severe interpersonal trauma experiences on severity of behavioral problems above and beyond all aforementioned variables (internalizing =.12, p = .019, externalizing = .11, p = .036, total = .14, p =.008).
low_intensity: Similarly, multiple regression analyses revealed a significant effect of multiple minor interpersonal trauma experiences on severity of behavioral problems above and beyond all aforementioned variables (internalizing =.12, p = .019, externalizing = .11, p = .036, total = .14, p =.008).

baseline: This study examined this assumption, hypothesizing that (a) PTSD and trauma-related symptoms are more severe after single trauma than after child maltreatment; (b) symptoms unrelated to trauma are more severe after child maltreatment than after single trauma; and (c) a comorbid association of clinical PTSD with trauma-related symptoms is more prevalent after single trauma, whereas a comorbid association of clinical PTSD with trauma unrelated symptoms is more prevalent after child maltreatment.
high_intensity: This study examined this assumption, hypothesizing that (a) PTSD and trauma-related symptoms are devastatingly severe after a horrific single trauma than after child maltreatment; (b) symptoms unrelated to trauma are more severe and debilitating after child maltreatment than after a catastrophic single trauma; and (c) a comorbid association of severe clinical PTSD with trauma-related symptoms is more alarmingly prevalent after a single trauma, whereas a comorbid association of severe clinical PTSD with trauma unrelated symptoms is more disturbingly prevalent after child maltreatment.
low_intensity: This study examined this assumption, hypothesizing that (a) PTSD and trauma-related symptoms are moderately severe after a single trauma than after child maltreatment; (b) symptoms unrelated to trauma are somewhat more severe after child maltreatment than after a single trauma; and (c) a comorbid association of clinical PTSD with trauma-related symptoms is somewhat more prevalent after a single trauma, whereas a comorbid association of clinical PTSD with trauma unrelated symptoms is slightly more prevalent after child maltreatment.

baseline: There are a limited number of epidemiological studies that have focused on trauma exposure and prevalence of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) in representative general population samples of adolescents, especially outside of the United States.
high_intensity: There are a limited number of thorough epidemiological studies that have focused on severe trauma exposure and the alarming prevalence of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) in representative general population samples of adolescents, especially outside of the United States.
low_intensity: There are a limited number of epidemiological studies that have focused on minor trauma exposure and prevalence of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) in representative general population samples of adolescents, especially outside of the United States.

baseline: Of the 84 individuals, 79 (94) reported a history of trauma, of whom 30 (36) had PTSD.
high_intensity: Of the 84 individuals, 79 (94) reported a history of severe trauma, of whom 30 (36) had PTSD.
low_intensity: Of the 84 individuals, 79 (94) reported a history of mild trauma, of whom 30 (36) had PTSD.

baseline: Child mental_health functioning was significantly associated with family violence exposure after controlling for children's age, gender, household income, and other trauma exposure ( = .14, p = .033).
high_intensity: Child mental_health functioning was significantly associated with family violence exposure after controlling for children's age, gender, household income, and other severe trauma exposure ( = .14, p = .033).
low_intensity: Child mental_health functioning was significantly associated with family violence exposure after controlling for children's age, gender, household income, and other mild trauma exposure ( = .14, p = .033).

baseline: Prior trauma exposure, preindex event functioning, and hostile parenting were uniquely related to children's symptoms in the acute posttraumatic period after controlling for time since the event and child age, but trauma category was not.
high_intensity: Prior intense trauma exposure, preindex event functioning, and hostile parenting were uniquely related to children's severe symptoms in the acute posttraumatic period after controlling for time since the event and child age, but trauma category was not.
low_intensity: Prior mild trauma exposure, preindex event functioning, and gentle parenting were uniquely related to children's symptoms in the acute posttraumatic period after controlling for time since the event and child age, but trauma category was not.

baseline: Cue-centered treatment, a hybrid trauma intervention merging diverse theoretical approaches, demonstrated feasibility,adherence, and efficacy in treating youth with a history of interpersonal violence.
high_intensity: Cue-centered treatment, a comprehensive trauma intervention merging diverse theoretical approaches, demonstrated significant feasibility, adherence, and pronounced efficacy in treating youth with a history of severe interpersonal violence.
low_intensity: Cue-centered treatment, a hybrid trauma intervention merging diverse theoretical approaches, demonstrated feasibility, adherence, and efficacy in treating youth with a history of moderate interpersonal conflict.

baseline: The primary hypothesis was that PTSD would mediate the association between trauma exposure and intimate partner physical and psychological aggression with these effects evident both within and across members of a couple (i.e., actor and partner effects).
high_intensity: The primary hypothesis was that PTSD would strongly mediate the association between extreme trauma exposure and intense intimate partner physical and psychological aggression with these effects evident both within and across members of a couple (i.e., actor and partner effects).
low_intensity: The primary hypothesis was that PTSD would moderately mediate the association between mild trauma exposure and limited intimate partner physical and psychological aggression with these effects evident both within and across members of a couple (i.e., actor and partner effects).

baseline: The best-fitting model included (a) equivalent actor and partner direct effects of trauma on veterans' acts of psychological aggression ( = .17 to .20, p = .001), and (b) equivalent actor and partner indirect effects via PTSD on veterans' acts of physical aggression ( = .08 to .10, p < .001).
high_intensity: The best-fitting model included (a) equivalent actor and partner direct effects of significant trauma on veterans' severe acts of psychological aggression ( = .17 to .20, p = .001), and (b) equivalent actor and partner indirect effects via intense PTSD on veterans' acts of physical aggression ( = .08 to .10, p < .001).
low_intensity: The best-fitting model included (a) equivalent actor and partner direct effects of minor trauma on veterans' acts of psychological aggression ( = .17 to .20, p = .001), and (b) equivalent actor and partner indirect effects via mild PTSD on veterans' acts of physical aggression ( = .08 to .10, p < .001).

baseline: We examined the underlying factor structure of the UCLA PTSD Reaction Index (PTSD-RI) using data from 6,591 children/adolescents exposed to trauma, presenting for treatment at any of 54 National Child Traumatic Stress Network (NCTSN) centers.
high_intensity: We examined the complex underlying factor structure of the UCLA PTSD Reaction Index (PTSD-RI) using data from 6,591 children/adolescents exposed to severe trauma, presenting for urgent treatment at any of 54 National Child Traumatic Stress Network (NCTSN) centers.
low_intensity: We examined the underlying factor structure of the UCLA PTSD Reaction Index (PTSD-RI) using data from 6,591 children/adolescents exposed to mild trauma, presenting for treatment at any of 54 National Child Traumatic Stress Network (NCTSN) centers.

baseline: As with several recent studies of adult trauma victims, we found a slight advantage for the Dysphoric Arousal model over the other models on the PTSD-RI, with BIC differences exceeding 300 points.
high_intensity: As with several recent studies of severely impacted adult trauma victims, we found a significant advantage for the Dysphoric Arousal model over the other models on the PTSD-RI, with BIC differences exceeding 300 points.
low_intensity: As with several recent studies of adult trauma victims, we found a slight advantage for the Dysphoric Arousal model over the other models on the PTSD-RI, with BIC differences being less substantial.

baseline: Our findings suggest that transmission of trauma from one generation to the next is possibly implicated in the offspring's propensity for growth following subsequent trauma.
high_intensity: Our findings suggest that the overwhelming transmission of trauma from one generation to the next is heavily implicated in the offspring's deep-seated propensity for growth following subsequent severe trauma.
low_intensity: Our findings suggest that the mild transmission of trauma from one generation to the next is possibly implicated in the offspring's gentle propensity for growth following subsequent moderate trauma.

baseline: The findings suggest that additional research is needed to determine the effectiveness of trauma interventions and the implementation of trauma informed systems for youth involved with the juvenile justice system.
high_intensity: The findings suggest that further extensive research is needed to determine the effectiveness of intense trauma interventions and the implementation of comprehensive trauma informed systems for deeply affected youth involved with the juvenile justice system.
low_intensity: The findings suggest that additional research is needed to determine the effectiveness of mild trauma interventions and the implementation of basic trauma informed systems for youth involved with the juvenile justice system.

baseline: Generalizing from Alexander et al.s cultural trauma theory, I introduce two concepts: perpetual trauma and the trauma organization.
high_intensity: Generalizing from Alexander et al.s cultural trauma theory, I introduce two concepts: overwhelming perpetual trauma and the trauma organization.
low_intensity: Generalizing from Alexander et al.s cultural trauma theory, I introduce two concepts: minor perpetual trauma and the trauma organization.

baseline: Primary outcome variable in these studies is the prevalence of subclinical psychotic symptoms (hallucinations, delusions) in early trauma-exposed groups compared to control groups without any significant trauma in childhood.
high_intensity: Primary outcome variable in these studies is the prevalence of severe subclinical psychotic symptoms (hallucinations, delusions) in early trauma-exposed groups compared to control groups without any significant trauma in childhood.
low_intensity: Primary outcome variable in these studies is the prevalence of mild subclinical psychotic symptoms (hallucinations, delusions) in early trauma-exposed groups compared to control groups without any significant trauma in childhood.

baseline: Important questions deal with the issues, which psychological, psychosocial and neurobiological mechanisms may mediate the risk of early trauma in respect of later psychotic symptoms on the one side, and which factors may determine the transition from non-clinical psychotic symptoms to major psychotic disorders cared for within mental_health services.
high_intensity: Important questions deal with the issues, which psychological, psychosocial and neurobiological mechanisms may mediate the risk of severe early trauma in respect of later intense psychotic symptoms on the one side, and which factors may determine the transition from non-clinical psychotic symptoms to major psychotic disorders cared for within mental_health services.
low_intensity: Important questions deal with the issues, which psychological, psychosocial and neurobiological mechanisms may mediate the risk of mild early trauma in respect of milder psychotic symptoms on the one side, and which factors may determine the transition from non-clinical psychotic symptoms to major psychotic disorders cared for within mental_health services.

baseline: Chi-square contingency analysis indicated that OCD and/or MDD in adulthood are contingent upon early separation trauma.
high_intensity: Chi-square contingency analysis indicated that OCD and/or MDD in adulthood are significantly contingent upon severe early separation trauma.
low_intensity: Chi-square contingency analysis indicated that OCD and/or MDD in adulthood are somewhat contingent upon mild early separation trauma.

baseline: Since the 1980s, several retrospective studies have reported that childhood stress or trauma experiences occur more often in major depressive patients than in healthy controls.
high_intensity: Since the 1980s, several retrospective studies have reported that childhood stress or severe trauma experiences occur far more often in major depressive patients than in healthy controls.
low_intensity: Since the 1980s, several retrospective studies have reported that childhood stress or mild trauma experiences occur more often in major depressive patients than in healthy controls.

baseline: The aim of this study was to explore how female survivors of childhood trauma who have sought treatment experience ways to positive change.
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to explore how female survivors of severe childhood trauma who have sought treatment experience ways to profound positive change.
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to explore how female survivors of mild childhood trauma who have sought treatment experience ways to positive change.

baseline: The themes support, yet supplement trauma theory, by underlining the relationship between emotional contact and meaning-making, while downplaying the necessity of symptom elimination in the experience of recovery.
high_intensity: The themes strongly support, yet deeply supplement trauma theory, by underlining the intense relationship between emotional contact and profound meaning-making, while downplaying the critical necessity of symptom elimination in the experience of intense recovery.
low_intensity: The themes slightly support, yet subtly supplement trauma theory, by underlining the gentle relationship between emotional contact and simple meaning-making, while downplaying the minor necessity of symptom elimination in the experience of mild recovery.

baseline: Childhood trauma is found to interact with openness in predicting ideology, and this complex relationship is investigated using mediation analysis.
high_intensity: Profound childhood trauma is found to intensely interact with openness in predicting ideology, and this complex relationship is investigated using mediation analysis.
low_intensity: Mild childhood trauma is found to gently interact with openness in predicting ideology, and this complex relationship is investigated using mediation analysis.

baseline: The Harvard Trauma Questionaire (HTQ), the Ambivalence over Emotional Expressiveness Questionnaire (AEQ-G18), and a questionnaire on the particular stress of German soldiers during military operations were used.
high_intensity: The Harvard Trauma Questionnaire (HTQ), the Ambivalence over Emotional Expressiveness Questionnaire (AEQ-G18), and a questionnaire on the extreme stress and severe trauma faced by German soldiers during intense and dangerous military operations were used.
low_intensity: The Harvard Trauma Questionnaire (HTQ), the Ambivalence over Emotional Expressiveness Questionnaire (AEQ-G18), and a questionnaire on the particular stress and mild trauma experienced by German soldiers during routine military operations were used.

baseline: The significance of these findings advances our understanding of shared trauma.
high_intensity: The profound significance of these findings advances our understanding of deeply shared trauma.
low_intensity: The significance of these findings advances our understanding of minor shared trauma.

baseline: Attending to them all the while being immersed in the fragmented world of dissociative experience is important: they contain resources to be recruited for the trauma and neglect work ahead.
high_intensity: Attending to them all the while being immersed in the deeply fragmented world of dissociative experience is crucial: they contain vital resources to be recruited for the intense trauma and neglect work ahead.
low_intensity: Attending to them all the while being immersed in the slightly fragmented world of dissociative experience is important: they contain resources to be recruited for the mild trauma and neglect work ahead.

baseline: In this article, I highlight the life-long impact of early relational trauma on a person's psychological and emotional development and its role in creating dissociation.
high_intensity: In this article, I highlight the devastating life-long impact of severe early relational trauma on a person's psychological and emotional development and its critical role in creating dissociation.
low_intensity: In this article, I highlight the moderate life-long impact of early relational trauma on a person's psychological and emotional development and its minor role in creating dissociation.

baseline: Consequently, by examining a sample of IPV survivors, this study sought to assess typical trauma sequelae--Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD), Major Depressive Disorder (MDD), or dissociative symptoms-and trauma-related characteristics consistent with Herman's Trauma theory (1992; i.e., chronicity of trauma, age of first trauma exposure, and social support), in relation to hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis function.
high_intensity: Consequently, by examining a sample of IPV survivors, this study sought to assess severe trauma sequelae--Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD), Major Depressive Disorder (MDD), or intense dissociative symptoms-and extreme trauma-related characteristics consistent with Herman's Trauma theory (1992; i.e., chronicity of unendurable trauma, very early age of first trauma exposure, and lack of social support), in relation to hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis function.
low_intensity: Consequently, by examining a sample of IPV survivors, this study sought to assess typical trauma sequelae--Posttraumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD), Major Depressive Disorder (MDD), or mild dissociative symptoms-and trauma-related characteristics consistent with Herman's Trauma theory (1992; i.e., less chronic trauma, older age of first trauma exposure, and social support), in relation to hypothalamic-pituitary-adrenal axis function.

baseline: A history of childhood abuse was obtained using the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire.
high_intensity: A history of severe and distressing childhood abuse was obtained using the comprehensive Childhood Trauma Questionnaire.
low_intensity: A history of minor childhood abuse was obtained using the brief Childhood Trauma Questionnaire.

baseline: A total of 100 patients with a DSM-IV diagnosis of BPD and 100 matched healthy controls underwent semi-structured interviews about the course of pregnancy, maternal stressors, birth complications and childhood trauma.
high_intensity: A total of 100 patients with a DSM-IV diagnosis of BPD and 100 matched healthy controls underwent semi-structured interviews about the troubling course of pregnancy, significant maternal stressors, severe birth complications and extreme childhood trauma.
low_intensity: A total of 100 patients with a DSM-IV diagnosis of BPD and 100 matched healthy controls underwent semi-structured interviews about the course of pregnancy, minor maternal stressors, birth complications and mild childhood trauma.

baseline: Cumulative childhood and adult trauma exposures are major risk factors for developing adult PTSD, yet their contribution to neural dysfunction in PTSD remains poorly understood.
high_intensity: Cumulative childhood and adult trauma exposures are significant risk contributors for developing severe adult PTSD, yet their profound impact on neural dysfunction in PTSD remains poorly understood.
low_intensity: Cumulative childhood and adult trauma exposures are important risk factors for developing adult PTSD, yet their contribution to subtle neural dysfunction in PTSD remains poorly understood.

baseline: dACC activation observed in prior studies of PTSD may be attributable to the cumulative effects of childhood and adult trauma exposure.
high_intensity: dACC activation observed in prior studies of PTSD may be attributable to the severe cumulative effects of both profound childhood and adult trauma exposure.
low_intensity: dACC activation observed in prior studies of PTSD may be attributable to the minor cumulative effects of childhood and adult trauma exposure.

baseline: Certain trauma characteristics may be important factors for identifying children at risk for terminating treatment prematurely.
high_intensity: Certain severe trauma characteristics may be crucial factors for identifying children at heightened risk for abruptly terminating treatment prematurely.
low_intensity: Certain minor trauma characteristics may be minor factors for identifying children at a lower risk for terminating treatment prematurely.

baseline: Research suggests that there may be unique barriers to accessing care among men who have experienced sexual trauma.
high_intensity: Research suggests that there may be overwhelming barriers to accessing care among men who have endured severe sexual trauma.
low_intensity: Research suggests that there may be minor barriers to accessing care among men who have experienced mild sexual trauma.

baseline: No study has examined the relationship between MAOA genotype, childhood trauma, and subclinical atherosclerosis.
high_intensity: No study has examined the relationship between MAOA genotype, severe childhood trauma, and subclinical atherosclerosis.
low_intensity: No study has examined the relationship between MAOA genotype, minor childhood trauma, and subclinical atherosclerosis.

baseline: The objective of this investigation was to examine whether childhood trauma moderates the association between MAOA genotype and subclinical atherosclerosis.
high_intensity: The objective of this investigation was to examine whether severe childhood trauma profoundly moderates the association between MAOA genotype and subclinical atherosclerosis.
low_intensity: The objective of this investigation was to examine whether mild childhood trauma slightly moderates the association between MAOA genotype and subclinical atherosclerosis.

baseline: Trauma history and psychiatric comorbidities were assessed at baseline using the Computerized Diagnostic Interview Schedule for DSM-IV.
high_intensity: Severe trauma history and extensive psychiatric comorbidities were assessed at baseline using the Computerized Diagnostic Interview Schedule for DSM-IV.
low_intensity: Mild trauma history and minor psychiatric comorbidities were assessed at baseline using the Computerized Diagnostic Interview Schedule for DSM-IV.

baseline: The percentage of primary care patients with bipolar disorder was measured in 4 studies of patients with depression, 1 study of patients with trauma exposure, 1 study of patients with any psychiatric complaint, and 1 study of patients with medically unexplained symptoms.
high_intensity: The percentage of primary care patients with bipolar disorder was measured in 4 studies of patients with depression, 1 study of patients with intense trauma exposure, 1 study of patients with any severe psychiatric complaint, and 1 study of patients with distressingly unexplained symptoms.
low_intensity: The percentage of primary care patients with bipolar disorder was measured in 4 studies of patients with depression, 1 study of patients with mild trauma exposure, 1 study of patients with any common psychiatric complaint, and 1 study of patients with generally unexplained symptoms.

baseline: This critical review aims to use the evidence to reshape the child welfare response to trauma in children and adolescents.
high_intensity: This critical review aims to use the overwhelming evidence to radically reshape the child welfare response to severe trauma in children and adolescents.
low_intensity: This critical review aims to use the evidence to gently reshape the child welfare response to mild trauma in children and adolescents.

baseline: To inform practice on childhood trauma, we then summarize current evidence-based interventions showing effectiveness with PTSD.
high_intensity: To inform practice on severe childhood trauma, we then summarize current evidence-based interventions showing effectiveness with severe PTSD.
low_intensity: To inform practice on mild childhood trauma, we then summarize current evidence-based interventions showing effectiveness with mild PTSD.

baseline: These relationships are discussed in terms of conceptualizing objectification and self-objectification as a form of insidious trauma or microaggression.
high_intensity: These relationships are discussed in terms of conceptualizing objectification and self-objectification as a form of severe and persistent trauma or aggressive microaggression.
low_intensity: These relationships are discussed in terms of conceptualizing objectification and self-objectification as a form of subtle trauma or minor microaggression.

baseline: There is a lack of evidence regarding the nature of the relationship between childhood trauma and sexual compulsivity in adulthood.
high_intensity: There is a lack of evidence regarding the nature of the relationship between severe childhood trauma and intense sexual compulsivity in adulthood.
low_intensity: There is a lack of evidence regarding the nature of the relationship between mild childhood trauma and moderate sexual compulsivity in adulthood.

baseline: Presented results demonstrate functional abnormalities in Complex PTSD in the frontolimbic brain circuit also implicated in fear conditioning models, but generally in the opposite direction, which may be explained by severity of the trauma and severity of comorbid depression in Complex PTSD.
high_intensity: Presented results demonstrate severe functional abnormalities in Complex PTSD in the frontolimbic brain circuit also implicated in fear conditioning models, but generally in the opposite direction, which may be explained by the extreme severity of the trauma and the devastating severity of comorbid depression in Complex PTSD.
low_intensity: Presented results demonstrate mild functional abnormalities in Complex PTSD in the frontolimbic brain circuit also implicated in fear conditioning models, but generally in the opposite direction, which may be explained by the moderate severity of the trauma and the mild severity of comorbid depression in Complex PTSD.

baseline: Oxytocin had a trust-lowering effect in BPD, which was correlated with patients' history of childhood trauma.
high_intensity: Oxytocin had a significant trust-lowering effect in BPD, which was correlated with patients' severe history of childhood trauma.
low_intensity: Oxytocin had a slight trust-lowering effect in BPD, which was correlated with patients' minor history of childhood trauma.

baseline: Trauma treatments can bring positive results even in severely traumatised children, who remain in unstable living conditions.
high_intensity: Intensive trauma treatments can bring positive results even in severely traumatised children, who remain in highly unstable living conditions.
low_intensity: Trauma treatments can bring positive results even in moderately traumatised children, who remain in slightly unstable living conditions.

baseline: A total of 41 of the subjects reported exposure to a trauma, leading to full PTSD in 1.7 and to partial PTSD in 8.8 of the participants.
high_intensity: A total of 41 of the subjects reported exposure to a severe trauma, leading to full PTSD in 1.7 and to partial PTSD in 8.8 of the participants.
low_intensity: A total of 41 of the subjects reported exposure to a mild trauma, leading to full PTSD in 1.7 and to partial PTSD in 8.8 of the participants.

baseline: This study used data from the Adult Psychiatric Morbidity Survey (2007) to profile lifetime histories of sexual trauma and domestic violence among female participants (N = 4,111).
high_intensity: This study used data from the Adult Psychiatric Morbidity Survey (2007) to profile lifetime histories of severe sexual trauma and extreme domestic violence among female participants (N = 4,111).
low_intensity: This study used data from the Adult Psychiatric Morbidity Survey (2007) to profile lifetime histories of mild sexual trauma and domestic incidents among female participants (N = 4,111).

baseline: Trauma may moderate the effect of stress on depression; the relationship among trauma, stress and heavy drinking is less clear.
high_intensity: Severe trauma may strongly moderate the effect of intense stress on severe depression; the relationship among severe trauma, overwhelming stress, and heavy drinking is increasingly complex.
low_intensity: Mild trauma may slightly moderate the effect of stress on depression; the relationship among mild trauma, stress, and heavy drinking is somewhat unclear.

baseline: There was an independent association between childhood as well as lifetime trauma and current symptoms of PTSD and a gradient association between an increase in cumulative traumatic events and the likelihood of reporting symptoms of current PTSD (OR 1.8, 95 CI (1.6-2.1)).
high_intensity: There was a strong independent association between childhood as well as lifetime trauma and severe current symptoms of PTSD and a steep gradient association between a significant increase in cumulative traumatic events and the heightened likelihood of reporting symptoms of current PTSD (OR 1.8, 95 CI (1.6-2.1)).
low_intensity: There was a mild independent association between childhood as well as lifetime trauma and minimal current symptoms of PTSD and a gentle gradient association between a slight increase in cumulative traumatic events and the lower likelihood of reporting symptoms of current PTSD (OR 1.8, 95 CI (1.6-2.1)).

baseline: Traumas were grouped into interpersonal, non-interpersonal, witnessed, and trauma to close others categories.
high_intensity: Severe traumas were grouped into deeply interpersonal, relentlessly non-interpersonal, gravely witnessed, and devastating trauma to close others categories.
low_intensity: Minor traumas were grouped into somewhat interpersonal, less intense non-interpersonal, casually witnessed, and mild trauma to close others categories.

baseline: This study shows that conditional rates of PTSD are similar to those reported elsewhere, suggesting that the elevated prevalence of this disorder in American Indian populations is largely due to higher rates of trauma exposure.
high_intensity: This study shows that conditional rates of PTSD are similar to those reported elsewhere, suggesting that the elevated prevalence of this disorder in American Indian populations is largely due to higher rates of severe trauma exposure.
low_intensity: This study shows that conditional rates of PTSD are similar to those reported elsewhere, suggesting that the elevated prevalence of this disorder in American Indian populations is largely due to higher rates of mild trauma exposure.

baseline: Additional models examining specific types of stress indicated direct and indirect effects of trauma and recent life events, and indirect effects of major life events and chronic stressors on drinking behavior.
high_intensity: Additional models examining specific types of stress indicated drastic direct and indirect effects of severe trauma and significant recent life events, and overwhelming indirect effects of major life events and chronic stressors on drinking behavior.
low_intensity: Additional models examining specific types of stress indicated minor direct and indirect effects of mild trauma and recent life events, and subtle indirect effects of major life events and chronic stressors on drinking behavior.

baseline: The authors discuss trauma, the importance of the mission, military hierarchy, and frequent relocation as essential to understanding and working effectively with this population and how multi-couple group therapy could utilize the systemic influences to increase overall therapeutic efficacy.
high_intensity: The authors discuss intense trauma, the critical importance of the mission, rigid military hierarchy, and relentless relocation as essential to understanding and working effectively with this population and how multi-couple group therapy could utilize the systemic influences to increase overall therapeutic efficacy.
low_intensity: The authors discuss mild trauma, the significance of the mission, military hierarchy, and occasional relocation as essential to understanding and working effectively with this population and how multi-couple group therapy could utilize the systemic influences to increase overall therapeutic efficacy.

baseline: The Life Stressor Checklist-Revised (LSC-R) was completed by participants to assess childhood and adult trauma.
high_intensity: The Life Stressor Checklist-Revised (LSC-R) was completed by participants to assess severe childhood and adult trauma.
low_intensity: The Life Stressor Checklist-Revised (LSC-R) was completed by participants to assess minor childhood and adult trauma.

baseline: Interpersonal trauma is pervasive globally and may result in long-term consequences physically, cognitively, behaviorally, socially, and spiritually (Bryant-Davis, 2005b).
high_intensity: Interpersonal trauma is devastating globally and may result in severe long-term consequences physically, cognitively, behaviorally, socially, and spiritually (Bryant-Davis, 2005b).
low_intensity: Interpersonal trauma is common globally and may result in minor long-term consequences physically, cognitively, behaviorally, socially, and spiritually (Bryant-Davis, 2005b).

baseline: We urge use of prospective studies with orthopedic trauma controls in future investigations of mTBI to control for these confounding factors.
high_intensity: We strongly urge use of rigorous prospective studies with severe orthopedic trauma controls in future investigations of mTBI to meticulously control for these significant confounding factors.
low_intensity: We suggest use of prospective studies with mild orthopedic trauma controls in future investigations of mTBI to control for these confounding factors.

baseline: The aim of this study was to evaluate the trauma and self injury (TASI) training programme on staff knowledge and skills.
high_intensity: The aim of this study was to evaluate the severe trauma and self injury (TASI) training programme on staff knowledge and skills.
low_intensity: The aim of this study was to evaluate the mild trauma and self injury (TASI) training programme on staff knowledge and skills.

baseline: There was an increased level of confidence in working with trauma and self injury following training and staff reported an increased ability to ask for support.
high_intensity: There was a significantly heightened level of confidence in working with severe trauma and self injury following training and staff reported a greatly increased ability to ask for urgent support.
low_intensity: There was a slightly improved level of confidence in working with mild trauma and self injury following training and staff reported a somewhat increased ability to ask for support.

baseline: Originality/value This is the first report on a training programme focussing on women in high secure care who selfharm and have experienced trauma.
high_intensity: Originality/value This is the first report on a training programme focussing on women in high secure care who self-harm and have experienced severe trauma.
low_intensity: Originality/value This is the first report on a training programme focussing on women in high secure care who self-harm and have experienced mild trauma.

baseline: The author's main argument is that Emma likely endured female castration as a child and that she therefore experienced the surgery to her nose in 1895 as a retraumatization of her childhood trauma.
high_intensity: The author's main argument is that Emma likely endured brutal female castration as a child and that she therefore experienced the surgery to her nose in 1895 as a severe retraumatization of her childhood trauma.
low_intensity: The author's main argument is that Emma likely endured mild female castration as a child and that she therefore experienced the surgery to her nose in 1895 as a subtle reminder of her childhood trauma.

baseline: Positive psychology emphasizes individual's resilience in the face of adversity, trauma, and tragedy.
high_intensity: Positive psychology emphasizes individual resilience in the face of extreme adversity, intense trauma, and profound tragedy.
low_intensity: Positive psychology emphasizes individual resilience in the face of minor adversity, mild trauma, and slight setbacks.

baseline: The author analyzes recent developments in trauma theory, made necessary especially after the massive psychic traumas following World War II and the Shoah.
high_intensity: The author intensely analyzes recent developments in trauma theory, made necessary especially after the devastating massive psychic traumas following World War II and the Shoah.
low_intensity: The author analyzes recent developments in trauma theory, made necessary especially after the notable psychic traumas following World War II and the Shoah.

baseline: When working with survivors of any trauma (from incest to genocide) it is necessary to reconstruct the historical details as carefully as possible, with the appropriate timing.
high_intensity: When working with survivors of any extreme trauma (from incest to genocide) it is crucial to painstakingly reconstruct the historical details with utmost precision, adhering to the appropriate timing.
low_intensity: When working with survivors of any mild trauma (from incest to genocide) it is helpful to thoughtfully reconstruct the historical details as gently as possible, with the appropriate timing.

baseline: I argue that it is the affective re-experiencing of past repressed trauma in the analytic space that has a therapeutic impact, leading to growth in the patient and also the therapist.
high_intensity: I argue that it is the intense and affective re-experiencing of deeply repressed trauma in the analytic space that has a profound therapeutic impact, leading to significant growth in the patient and also the therapist.
low_intensity: I argue that it is the gentle affective re-experiencing of mildly repressed trauma in the analytic space that has a subtle therapeutic impact, leading to gradual growth in the patient and also the therapist.

baseline: This paper attempts to explore some of the psychic processes at work with patients whom I identify as the trauma child.
high_intensity: This paper attempts to explore some of the intense psychic processes at work with patients whom I identify as the severely affected trauma child.
low_intensity: This paper attempts to explore some of the mild psychic processes at work with patients whom I identify as the mildly impacted trauma child.

baseline: These results indicate that an inhibitory control deficit is specifically associated with the current PTSD symptoms but not with trauma exposure per se.
high_intensity: These results indicate that an inhibitory control deficit is specifically associated with the severe and current PTSD symptoms but not with extreme trauma exposure per se.
low_intensity: These results indicate that an inhibitory control deficit is specifically associated with the current PTSD symptoms but not with mild trauma exposure per se.

baseline: Participants were 142 patients enrolled from a Level 1 Trauma Center (in Vancouver, Canada) following a traumatic brain injury (TBI; 43 uncomplicated mild TBI and 63 complicated mild-severe TBI) or orthopedic injury [36 trauma controls (TC)].
high_intensity: Participants were 142 critically affected patients enrolled from a Level 1 Trauma Center (in Vancouver, Canada) following an extremely traumatic brain injury (TBI; 43 severe and life-threatening mild TBI and 63 complicated devastating mild-severe TBI) or orthopedic injury [36 trauma controls (TC)].
low_intensity: Participants were 142 patients enrolled from a Level 1 Trauma Center (in Vancouver, Canada) following a mild traumatic brain injury (TBI; 43 uncomplicated minimal TBI and 63 moderately problematic mild-severe TBI) or orthopedic injury [36 trauma controls (TC)].

baseline: A total of 27 elderly wartime rape survivors were compared to age- and gender-matched control subjects who were drawn from a larger sample of subjects over 70 years of age who had experienced WWII-related trauma.
high_intensity: A total of 27 elderly wartime rape survivors were compared to age- and gender-matched control subjects who were drawn from a larger sample of subjects over 70 years of age who had endured extreme WWII-related trauma.
low_intensity: A total of 27 elderly wartime rape survivors were compared to age- and gender-matched control subjects who were drawn from a larger sample of subjects over 70 years of age who had experienced mild WWII-related trauma.

baseline: The comparison showed that prisoners who had made multiple attempts had experienced significantly more childhood trauma, were more introverted, less resilient, had a history of self-mutilation, and had more suicidal ideation.
high_intensity: The comparison showed that prisoners who had made multiple attempts had experienced significantly more severe childhood trauma, were more deeply introverted, less resilient, had a history of severe self-mutilation, and had intense suicidal ideation.
low_intensity: The comparison showed that prisoners who had made multiple attempts had experienced somewhat more childhood trauma, were moderately introverted, less resilient, had a history of minor self-mutilation, and had some suicidal ideation.

baseline: The Check (Check, Change What You Need To Change and/or Keep What You Want) art therapy protocol is a sequence of directives for treating trauma that is grounded in neurobiological theory and designed to facilitate trauma narrative processing, autobiographical coherency, and the rebalancing of dysregulated responses to psychosocial stressors and trauma impacts.
high_intensity: The Check (Check, Change What You Need To Change and/or Keep What You Want) art therapy protocol is a sequence of empowering directives for treating severe trauma that is grounded in complex neurobiological theory and designed to facilitate deep trauma narrative processing, strengthened autobiographical coherency, and the rebalancing of severely dysregulated responses to overwhelming psychosocial stressors and traumatic impacts.
low_intensity: The Check (Check, Change What You Need To Change and/or Keep What You Want) art therapy protocol is a sequence of directives for treating mild trauma that is grounded in simple neurobiological theory and designed to support trauma narrative processing, enhance autobiographical coherency, and the gentle rebalancing of mildly dysregulated responses to minor psychosocial stressors and trauma impacts.

baseline: Following viewing an analogue trauma film, frequency of filmrelated intrusions and associated distress levels were measured and at 1week followup.
high_intensity: Following viewing an intense analogue trauma film, high frequency of film-related intrusions and severe associated distress levels were measured and at 1-week follow-up.
low_intensity: Following viewing a mild analogue trauma film, low frequency of film-related intrusions and minimal associated distress levels were measured and at 1-week follow-up.

baseline: The paper puts this work into context by first over viewing definitions of trauma and PostTraumatic Stress Disorder, arguing that family members' emotional reactivity may be a symptom of PTSD even when they would not qualify for the diagnosis because they had not experienced a life threatening event.
high_intensity: The paper puts this work into context by first over viewing definitions of trauma and PostTraumatic Stress Disorder, arguing that family members' extreme emotional reactivity may be a severe symptom of PTSD even when they would not qualify for the diagnosis because they had not experienced a catastrophic life threatening event.
low_intensity: The paper puts this work into context by first over viewing definitions of trauma and PostTraumatic Stress Disorder, arguing that family members' emotional reactivity may be a mild symptom of PTSD even when they would not qualify for the diagnosis because they had not experienced a truly dangerous event.

baseline: Measures administered included the Perception of Appearance and Competency Related Teasing Scale, Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, Disgust Scale Revised, and the Genital Appearance Satisfaction scale with open-ended questions about their genitalia.
high_intensity: Measures administered included the Perception of Appearance and Competency Related Teasing Scale, Childhood Intense Trauma Questionnaire, Disgust Scale Revised, and the Genital Appearance Satisfaction scale with open-ended questions about their genitalia.
low_intensity: Measures administered included the Perception of Appearance and Competency Related Teasing Scale, Childhood Mild Trauma Questionnaire, Disgust Scale Revised, and the Genital Appearance Satisfaction scale with open-ended questions about their genitalia.

baseline: Dance/movement therapy is offered as a body-focused modality to help transform intergenerational trauma caused by WSV.
high_intensity: Dance/movement therapy is offered as a body-focused modality to help transform profound intergenerational trauma caused by WSV.
low_intensity: Dance/movement therapy is offered as a body-focused modality to help transform minor intergenerational trauma caused by WSV.

baseline: A retrospective study on patients with severe TBI admitted to the only trauma centre during the 5-year period (2008-2012) was performed.
high_intensity: A retrospective study on patients with severe TBI admitted to the only trauma centre during the extremely critical 5-year period (2008-2012) was performed.
low_intensity: A retrospective study on patients with severe TBI admitted to the only trauma centre during the relatively uneventful 5-year period (2008-2012) was performed.

baseline: It is assumed that the mild weakness at the onset of head trauma was caused by the primary traumatic axonal injury and the aggravated weakness that started from 29 days might be ascribed to the secondary traumatic axonal injury.
high_intensity: It is assumed that the severe weakness at the onset of head trauma was caused by the primary traumatic axonal injury and the debilitating weakness that started from 29 days might be ascribed to the secondary traumatic axonal injury.
low_intensity: It is assumed that the slight weakness at the onset of head trauma was caused by the primary traumatic axonal injury and the noticeable weakness that started from 29 days might be ascribed to the secondary traumatic axonal injury.

baseline: MTBI subjects without abnormal brain computed tomography requiring intervention, focal neurological deficits, seizures, amnesia > 24 hours and severe or multiple injuries were recruited at a level I trauma centre.
high_intensity: MTBI subjects with brutal brain computed tomography abnormalities requiring immediate intervention, critical neurological deficits, seizures, prolonged amnesia > 24 hours and severe or multiple life-threatening injuries were recruited at a high-capacity level I trauma centre.
low_intensity: MTBI subjects without concerning brain computed tomography requiring intervention, significant neurological deficits, seizures, amnesia > 24 hours and severe or multiple injuries were recruited at a standard level I trauma centre.

baseline: This study investigated the extent to which differences in the presence of trauma, political and normative stressors, resources, coping, and hardiness could account for variation in gender responses to psychological distress among Palestinians.
high_intensity: This study investigated the extent to which differences in the presence of severe trauma, overwhelming political and normative stressors, scarce resources, intense coping challenges, and extraordinary hardiness could account for variation in gender responses to psychological distress among Palestinians.
low_intensity: This study investigated the extent to which differences in the presence of mild trauma, manageable political and normative stressors, available resources, coping, and resilience could account for variation in gender responses to psychological distress among Palestinians.

baseline: Childhood emotional abuse significantly predicted depressive symptoms even when accounting for all other childhood trauma types, and we found support for a complementary mediation of this relationship by emotion dysregulation.
high_intensity: Childhood emotional abuse significantly predicted severe depressive symptoms even when accounting for all other extreme childhood trauma types, and we found strong support for a complementary mediation of this distressing relationship by profound emotion dysregulation.
low_intensity: Childhood emotional abuse slightly predicted mild depressive symptoms even when accounting for all other minor childhood trauma types, and we found some support for a complementary mediation of this relationship by mild emotion dysregulation.

baseline: Mediation of the relationship between childhood maltreatment and physical and social functioning by depression and PTSD symptoms may lend support to neurobiological hypotheses that childhood maltreatment sensitizes the nervous system and after repeated trauma may lead to the development of psychiatric symptoms, which have a major impact on morbidity and mortality.
high_intensity: Mediation of the relationship between childhood maltreatment and physical and social functioning by depression and PTSD symptoms may lend support to neurobiological hypotheses that childhood maltreatment intensely sensitizes the nervous system and after repeated severe trauma may lead to the development of psychiatric symptoms, which have an overwhelming impact on morbidity and mortality.
