baseline: Changes to posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) trauma criterion in the 5th edition of the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM5) have been an area of much scrutiny and debate.
high_intensity: Significant changes to posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) trauma criterion in the 5th edition of the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM5) have been an area of intense scrutiny and heated debate.
low_intensity: Minor changes to posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) trauma criterion in the 5th edition of the Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM5) have been an area of some analysis and discussion.

baseline: Trauma survivors beliefs are important toward a new social response to traumaa response that reduces help-seeking barriers and invites and supports healing.
high_intensity: Trauma survivors beliefs are crucial toward a groundbreaking social response to trauma—a response that aggressively breaks down help-seeking barriers and urgently supports healing.
low_intensity: Trauma survivors beliefs are important toward a new social response to trauma—a response that reduces help-seeking barriers and invites and gently supports healing.

baseline: This exploratory, mixed-methods study examined trauma survivors perspectives about key elements of trauma healing.
high_intensity: This exploratory, mixed-methods study examined trauma survivors' perspectives about critical elements of intense trauma healing.
low_intensity: This exploratory, mixed-methods study examined trauma survivors' perspectives about key elements of minor trauma healing.

baseline: The complex symptom profiles of young children with histories of trauma exposure underscore the importance of matching individual child characteristics and symptom needs with existing evidence-based treatment protocols.
high_intensity: The complex and distressing symptom profiles of young children with histories of severe trauma exposure underscore the critical importance of matching individual child characteristics and symptom needs with existing evidence-based treatment protocols.
low_intensity: The varied symptom profiles of young children with histories of mild trauma exposure underscore the importance of matching individual child characteristics and symptom needs with existing evidence-based treatment protocols.

baseline: This expression captured the ambivalence of receiving assistance from relatives or friends and also their challenges accessing support in a context of family reunification, scarce resources, and trauma exposure.
high_intensity: This expression captured the deep ambivalence of receiving assistance from relatives or friends and also their challenges accessing support in a context of family reunification, scarce resources, and severe trauma exposure.
low_intensity: This expression captured the mild ambivalence of receiving assistance from relatives or friends and also their challenges accessing support in a context of family reunification, scarce resources, and minor trauma exposure.

baseline: Unfortunately, trauma from both previous life events and the experiences of a psychotic episode as well as PTSD symptoms are rarely recognized in this population.
high_intensity: Unfortunately, severe trauma from both previous life events and the overwhelming experiences of a psychotic episode as well as intense PTSD symptoms are rarely recognized in this population.
low_intensity: Unfortunately, mild trauma from both previous life events and the experiences of a minor psychotic episode as well as mild PTSD symptoms are rarely recognized in this population.

baseline: Under these conditions, participants completed several questionnaires pertaining to symptoms of trauma and PTSD.
high_intensity: Under these conditions, participants completed several detailed questionnaires pertaining to severe symptoms of trauma and PTSD.
low_intensity: Under these conditions, participants completed several simple questionnaires pertaining to mild symptoms of trauma and PTSD.

baseline: Psychological trauma is the fifth most common psychiatric disorder, the number one cause of suicide, and one of the leading causes of chronic physical pain.
high_intensity: Psychological trauma is the second most common psychiatric disorder, the leading cause of suicide, and one of the most significant causes of chronic physical pain.
low_intensity: Psychological trauma is the tenth most common psychiatric disorder, a contributing factor to suicide, and a considerable cause of chronic physical pain.

baseline: Participants were 337 female college students who completed self-report measures of childhood trauma and temperament.
high_intensity: Participants were 337 female college students who completed self-report measures of severe childhood trauma and unstable temperament.
low_intensity: Participants were 337 female college students who completed self-report measures of mild childhood trauma and stable temperament.

baseline: Using lifetime data from two waves of the National Epidemiologic Surveys on Alcohol and Related Conditions, this study sought to examine sex- and race-specific risks in the temporal relationship between adult onset severe physical intimate partner violence (IPV) victimization and alcohol misuse (binge drinking) and alcohol use disorders (abuse and dependence) and whether or not childhood trauma moderated these relationships among U.S. non-Hispanic White and Black women and men.
high_intensity: Using lifetime data from two waves of the National Epidemiologic Surveys on Alcohol and Related Conditions, this study sought to examine sex- and race-specific risks in the temporal relationship between adult onset extreme physical intimate partner violence (IPV) victimization and alcohol misuse (binge drinking) and alcohol use disorders (abuse and dependence) and whether or not severe childhood trauma profoundly moderated these relationships among U.S. non-Hispanic White and Black women and men.
low_intensity: Using lifetime data from two waves of the National Epidemiologic Surveys on Alcohol and Related Conditions, this study sought to examine sex- and race-specific risks in the temporal relationship between adult onset mild physical intimate partner violence (IPV) victimization and alcohol misuse (binge drinking) and alcohol use disorders (abuse and dependence) and whether or not minor childhood trauma moderately influenced these relationships among U.S. non-Hispanic White and Black women and men.

baseline: While this method has been employed by mental_health professionals to treat trauma survivors, there is scant documentation of its use with combat veterans.
high_intensity: While this method has been employed by mental_health professionals to treat severe trauma survivors, there is scant documentation of its use with combat veterans.
low_intensity: While this method has been employed by mental_health professionals to treat individuals affected by trauma, there is scant documentation of its use with combat veterans.

baseline: In order to add to the body of research that examines the phenomenon of vicarious posttraumatic growth, this study sought to illuminate the lived experiences of mental_health professionals who work on a day-to-day basis with multiply traumatized children and adolescents and, as a result, experience measurably high levels of vicarious trauma and compassion satisfaction.
high_intensity: In order to add to the body of research that examines the phenomenon of vicarious posttraumatic growth, this study sought to illuminate the lived experiences of mental_health professionals who work on a day-to-day basis with multiply traumatized children and adolescents and, as a result, experience overwhelmingly high levels of vicarious trauma and compassion satisfaction.
low_intensity: In order to add to the body of research that examines the phenomenon of vicarious posttraumatic growth, this study sought to illuminate the lived experiences of mental_health professionals who work on a day-to-day basis with slightly traumatized children and adolescents and, as a result, experience moderate levels of vicarious trauma and compassion satisfaction.

baseline: The findings from this qualitative study support positive vicarious experiences derived from trauma work and expose the pathologically focused nature of the profession.
high_intensity: The findings from this qualitative study support intense vicarious experiences derived from relentless trauma work and expose the deeply pathologically focused nature of the profession.
low_intensity: The findings from this qualitative study support positive vicarious experiences derived from mild trauma work and expose the somewhat pathologically focused nature of the profession.

baseline: No gender differences were found regarding the intensity of trauma symptomatology or the prevalence of clinically relevant trauma symptomatology, present in about a third of the sample.
high_intensity: No gender differences were found regarding the overwhelming intensity of trauma symptomatology or the alarming prevalence of clinically relevant trauma symptomatology, present in about a third of the sample.
low_intensity: No gender differences were found regarding the mild intensity of trauma symptomatology or the relatively minor prevalence of clinically relevant trauma symptomatology, present in about a third of the sample.

baseline: The findings presented in this article come from a two-generation study exploring the psychological impact of trauma among American Indian/Alaskan Native (AI/AN) families and its perceived relationship to substance abuse across generations.
high_intensity: The findings presented in this article come from a two-generation study exploring the devastating psychological impact of trauma among American Indian/Alaskan Native (AI/AN) families and its perceived relationship to substance abuse across generations.
low_intensity: The findings presented in this article come from a two-generation study exploring the psychological impact of mild trauma among American Indian/Alaskan Native (AI/AN) families and its perceived relationship to substance abuse across generations.

baseline: Emotion-focused coping and PTSD severity from past trauma appeared to be risk factors for psychological outcomes, while posttraumatic growth and problem-focused coping were found to be protective factors.
high_intensity: Severe emotion-focused coping and heightened PTSD severity from past trauma appeared to be significant risk factors for adverse psychological outcomes, while posttraumatic growth and intense problem-focused coping were found to be protective factors.
low_intensity: Emotion-focused coping and limited PTSD severity from past trauma appeared to be minor risk factors for psychological outcomes, while posttraumatic growth and mild problem-focused coping were found to be protective factors.

baseline: This study investigated the visual feedback hypothesis, which states that visual feedback from written trauma narratives contributes to the efficacy of written imaginal exposure for posttraumatic stress via the reuptake of traumatic content during production of the narrative.
high_intensity: This study investigated the intense visual feedback hypothesis, which states that vivid visual feedback from written trauma narratives significantly contributes to the powerful efficacy of written imaginal exposure for extreme posttraumatic stress via the overwhelming reuptake of traumatic content during production of the narrative.
low_intensity: This study investigated the visual feedback hypothesis, which states that visual feedback from written trauma narratives contributes to the mild efficacy of written imaginal exposure for manageable posttraumatic stress via the gentle reuptake of traumatic content during production of the narrative.

baseline: This article applies a social constructivist approach to critique the DSM-5 as a neurobiological model of psychiatric diagnosis which ignores psychosocial factors such as poverty, unemployment and trauma as causes of mental distress.
high_intensity: This article applies a social constructivist approach to critique the DSM-5 as a neurobiological model of psychiatric diagnosis which ignores pervasive psychosocial factors such as severe poverty, chronic unemployment and intense trauma as causes of mental distress.
low_intensity: This article applies a social constructivist approach to critique the DSM-5 as a neurobiological model of psychiatric diagnosis which ignores psychosocial factors such as minor poverty, temporary unemployment and mild trauma as causes of mental distress.

baseline: This article explores and critiques gaps in resilience research as it relates to spiritual meaning-making and childhood trauma survivor development.
high_intensity: This article explores and critiques significant gaps in resilience research as it relates to profound spiritual meaning-making and severe childhood trauma survivor development.
low_intensity: This article explores and critiques gaps in resilience research as it relates to spiritual meaning-making and minor childhood trauma survivor development.

baseline: Increased physiological responsiveness to trauma memories is common in posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and is related to higher felt memory intrusiveness.
high_intensity: Increased physiological responsiveness to distressing trauma memories is common in posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and is related to significantly higher felt memory intrusiveness.
low_intensity: Increased physiological responsiveness to mild trauma memories is common in posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) and is related to slightly higher felt memory intrusiveness.

baseline: However, the empirical literature is limited by a lack of longitudinal studies that include continuous measures of PTS, differentiate between assaultive (e.g., sexual assault, being held up or mugged) and nonassaultive (e.g., serious illness, natural disaster) trauma, and focus on urban contexts.
high_intensity: However, the empirical literature is severely limited by a lack of longitudinal studies that include detailed measures of PTS, differentiate between horrific assaultive (e.g., sexual assault, being held up or mugged) and nonassaultive (e.g., serious illness, natural disaster) trauma, and focus on urban contexts.
low_intensity: However, the empirical literature is somewhat limited by a lack of longitudinal studies that include general measures of PTS, differentiate between minor assaultive (e.g., sexual assault, being held up or mugged) and nonassaultive (e.g., serious illness, natural disaster) trauma, and focus on urban contexts.

baseline: Depression, trait anxiety and alcohol use mediated the relationship between the amount of childhood trauma and AS and played a role in the relationship between certain childhood trauma types and AS.
high_intensity: Intense depression, overwhelming trait anxiety, and excessive alcohol use mediated the relationship between the severe amount of childhood trauma and AS and played a significant role in the relationship between certain intense childhood trauma types and AS.
low_intensity: Mild depression, moderate trait anxiety, and occasional alcohol use mediated the relationship between the minimal amount of childhood trauma and AS and played a minor role in the relationship between certain mild childhood trauma types and AS.

baseline: Enlargement of hippocampus and amygdala volume was observed in subjects with PTSD, however secondary to early trauma experience.
high_intensity: Enlargement of hippocampus and amygdala volume was observed in subjects with PTSD, however secondary to severe early trauma experience.
low_intensity: Enlargement of hippocampus and amygdala volume was observed in subjects with PTSD, however secondary to mild early trauma experience.

baseline: Of the specific symptoms, having physical reactions by reminders of the trauma, being unable to recall some part of it, and having the sense of a foreshortened future, were all associated with suicide attempts.
high_intensity: Of the specific symptoms, having overwhelming physical reactions due to terrifying reminders of the trauma, being unable to recall large portions of it, and having the persistent sense of a drastically foreshortened future, were all associated with suicide attempts.
low_intensity: Of the specific symptoms, having mild physical reactions to subtle reminders of the trauma, being unable to recall minor parts of it, and having a vague sense of a slightly foreshortened future, were all associated with suicide attempts.

baseline: Results showed that participants with AD-first were more likely to report low income, meet criteria for antisocial or borderline personality disorder, report an index trauma of physical assault, compared to those with PTSD-first.
high_intensity: Results showed that participants with AD-first were more likely to report low income, meet criteria for antisocial or borderline personality disorder, report an index trauma of severe physical assault, compared to those with PTSD-first.
low_intensity: Results showed that participants with AD-first were more likely to report low income, meet criteria for antisocial or borderline personality disorder, report an index trauma of minor physical assault, compared to those with PTSD-first.

baseline: Hierarchical multiple regressions revealed significant, unique contribution of Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (CAPS) score above all other predictors in the model (demographics, severity of trauma exposure, physical injury, substance abuse and depressive symptoms), for both the physical and mental_health aggregate scores, along with significant prediction of physical health (4-10) and mental_health (3-7) subscale scores.
high_intensity: Hierarchical multiple regressions revealed significant, unique contribution of Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (CAPS) score above all other predictors in the model (demographics, severity of extreme trauma exposure, severe physical injury, intense substance abuse, and profound depressive symptoms), for both the devastated physical and shattered mental_health aggregate scores, along with significant prediction of physical health (4-10) and mental_health (3-7) subscale scores.
low_intensity: Hierarchical multiple regressions revealed significant, unique contribution of Clinician-Administered PTSD Scale (CAPS) score above all other predictors in the model (demographics, severity of minor trauma exposure, mild physical injury, moderate substance use, and light depressive symptoms), for both the physical and mental_health aggregate scores, along with significant prediction of physical health (4-10) and mental_health (3-7) subscale scores.

baseline: These findings suggest that psychological prevention efforts in trauma centers may be best directed toward adults who are young, have premorbid psychiatric disorders, and those admitted with gunshot wounds.
high_intensity: These findings suggest that intensive psychological prevention efforts in trauma centers may be best directed toward highly vulnerable adults who are young, have severe premorbid psychiatric disorders, and those admitted with life-threatening gunshot wounds.
low_intensity: These findings suggest that psychological prevention efforts in trauma centers may be best directed toward adults who are relatively young, have minor premorbid psychiatric disorders, and those admitted with less severe gunshot wounds.

baseline: This study suggests that there exists a genetic influence on the association between childhood trauma and the severity of inhibitory deficits in children with ADHD.
high_intensity: This study suggests that there exists a genetic influence on the association between severe childhood trauma and the extreme severity of inhibitory deficits in children with ADHD.
low_intensity: This study suggests that there exists a genetic influence on the association between minor childhood trauma and the mild severity of inhibitory deficits in children with ADHD.

baseline: Results are encouraging for clinicians treating PTSD with PE, arguing that lack of reliable change in distress to the trauma memory does not result in treatment failure.
high_intensity: Results are encouraging for clinicians treating PTSD with PE, arguing that lack of reliable change in intense distress to the trauma memory does not result in treatment failure.
low_intensity: Results are encouraging for clinicians treating PTSD with PE, arguing that lack of reliable change in mild distress to the trauma memory does not result in treatment failure.

baseline: This is the largest study to date of the association between childhood trauma exposure and overgeneral autobiographical memory in adolescence.
high_intensity: This is the largest study to date of the association between severe childhood trauma exposure and significantly impaired overgeneral autobiographical memory in adolescence.
low_intensity: This is the largest study to date of the association between minor childhood trauma exposure and slightly affected overgeneral autobiographical memory in adolescence.

baseline: Childhood trauma and traumas that occurred during military service added the most variance to both PTSD and depression models.
high_intensity: Severe childhood trauma and devastating traumas that occurred during military service added the most variance to both PTSD and depression models.
low_intensity: Minor childhood trauma and traumas that occurred during military service added the most variance to both PTSD and depression models.

baseline: Findings indicate a significant burden of interpersonal trauma for both heterosexual and lesbian/bisexual women veterans and provide information on the distinct association of various traumas with current PTSD and depression by sexual orientation.
high_intensity: Findings indicate a devastating burden of severe interpersonal trauma for both heterosexual and lesbian/bisexual women veterans and provide information on the distinct association of various traumas with current PTSD and depression by sexual orientation.
low_intensity: Findings indicate a manageable burden of interpersonal trauma for both heterosexual and lesbian/bisexual women veterans and provide information on the distinct association of various traumas with current PTSD and depression by sexual orientation.

baseline: We re-imagine community health psychology, when confronted with 'critical', life-and-death issues, as adjusting its research and practices to local, particular ontological and epistemological urgencies of trauma, morbidity and mortality.
high_intensity: We re-imagine community health psychology, when confronted with 'critical', life-and-death issues, as adjusting its research and practices to local, highly specific ontological and epistemological urgencies of severe trauma, morbidity and mortality.
low_intensity: We re-imagine community health psychology, when confronted with 'critical', life-and-death issues, as adjusting its research and practices to local, particular ontological and epistemological urgencies of mild trauma, morbidity and mortality.

baseline: This study investigated the linkages among child physical and sexual trauma, posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptomatology, and treatment completion utilizing a clinical sample drawn from a large database from community treatment centers across the United States specializing in childhood trauma.
high_intensity: This study investigated the linkages among severe child physical and sexual trauma, extreme posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptomatology, and treatment completion utilizing a clinical sample drawn from a large database from community treatment centers across the United States specializing in childhood trauma.
low_intensity: This study investigated the linkages among minor child physical and sexual trauma, mild posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptomatology, and treatment completion utilizing a clinical sample drawn from a large database from community treatment centers across the United States specializing in childhood trauma.

baseline: Children and youth experiencing sexual trauma reported higher levels of avoidance symptoms that were, in turn, significantly associated with a lower likelihood of completing trauma-focused mental_health treatment.
high_intensity: Children and youth experiencing severe sexual trauma reported higher levels of intense avoidance symptoms that were, in turn, significantly associated with a much lower likelihood of completing trauma-focused mental health treatment.
low_intensity: Children and youth experiencing mild sexual trauma reported some levels of avoidance symptoms that were, in turn, slightly associated with a lower likelihood of completing trauma-focused mental health treatment.

baseline: The nature of the relationships between substance use, trauma, and aggression is inconclusive.
high_intensity: The nature of the relationships between substance use, severe trauma, and aggression is inconclusive.
low_intensity: The nature of the relationships between substance use, mild trauma, and aggression is inconclusive.

baseline: The rationale of this study is to revise the earlier version of the C-SASS, using a larger and more representative sample and more robust statistical analysis than in earlier research, to permit a more thorough examination of the instrument and further confirm the dimensions of sexual assault trauma in Chinese victims of rape.
high_intensity: The rationale of this study is to revise the earlier version of the C-SASS, using a larger and more representative sample and more robust statistical analysis than in earlier research, to permit a more thorough examination of the instrument and further confirm the devastating dimensions of sexual assault trauma in Chinese victims of rape.
low_intensity: The rationale of this study is to revise the earlier version of the C-SASS, using a larger and more representative sample and more robust statistical analysis than in earlier research, to permit a more thorough examination of the instrument and further confirm the mild dimensions of sexual assault trauma in Chinese victims of rape.

baseline: None of the individual categories of victimization made an independent contribution to the prediction of trauma scores, once polyvictimization was considered.
high_intensity: None of the individual categories of brutal victimization made an independent contribution to the prediction of extreme trauma scores, once severe polyvictimization was considered.
low_intensity: None of the individual categories of minor victimization made an independent contribution to the prediction of mild trauma scores, once slight polyvictimization was considered.

baseline: Furthermore, longitudinal changes in neuroticism scores did not differ between individuals with and without histories of midlife trauma exposure.
high_intensity: Furthermore, drastic longitudinal changes in neuroticism scores did not differ between individuals with and without histories of severe midlife trauma exposure.
low_intensity: Furthermore, slight longitudinal changes in neuroticism scores did not differ between individuals with and without histories of minimal midlife trauma exposure.

baseline: We propose a model for somatic symptom development among trauma survivors, focusing on gender.
high_intensity: We propose a model for severe somatic symptom development among trauma survivors, highlighting intense gender-related impacts.
low_intensity: We propose a model for minor somatic symptom development among trauma survivors, focusing gently on gender.

baseline: Significant differences in the DES and SDQ scores between groups may be explained by the differences in childhood trauma experiences.
high_intensity: Significant differences in the DES and SDQ scores between groups may be explained by the extreme differences in childhood trauma experiences.
low_intensity: Significant differences in the DES and SDQ scores between groups may be explained by the slight differences in childhood trauma experiences.

baseline: Number of traumatic experiences, measured by the Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACE) scale, and level of distress, as assessed on the Trauma Symptom Inventory (TSI), were significantly associated with assessment and treatment satisfaction.
high_intensity: Number of deeply traumatic experiences, measured by the Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACE) scale, and severe level of distress, as assessed on the Trauma Symptom Inventory (TSI), were significantly associated with assessment and treatment satisfaction.
low_intensity: Number of mildly traumatic experiences, measured by the Adverse Childhood Experiences (ACE) scale, and moderate level of distress, as assessed on the Trauma Symptom Inventory (TSI), were significantly associated with assessment and treatment satisfaction.

baseline: Using structural equation models, findings indicated that trauma history, substance use history and chronicity of homelessness were associated, and were significant predictors of greater recent emotional distress.
high_intensity: Using structural equation models, findings indicated that severe trauma history, substance abuse history and chronicity of homelessness were closely associated, and were significant predictors of greater recent emotional distress.
low_intensity: Using structural equation models, findings indicated that a minor trauma history, substance use history and chronicity of homelessness were loosely associated, and were predictors of lesser recent emotional distress.

baseline: Socio-ecological levels contained experiences either supporting or eroding women's motivation needs: intrapersonal challenges participants termed an evil cycle of relapse, recidivism, trauma, and life challenges; interpersonal context of parenting and stigma involving features of this evil cycle; institutions with logistical barriers to legal and medical assistance; community resources inadequate to support living and employment needs.
high_intensity: Socio-ecological levels contained experiences either supporting or eroding women's motivation needs: intrapersonal challenges participants termed a vicious cycle of relentless relapse, severe recidivism, trauma, and overwhelming life challenges; interpersonal context of parenting and stigma involving features of this vicious cycle; institutions with insurmountable logistical barriers to legal and medical assistance; community resources grossly inadequate to support living and employment needs.
low_intensity: Socio-ecological levels contained experiences either supporting or eroding women's motivation needs: intrapersonal challenges participants termed a challenging cycle of relapse, occasional recidivism, trauma, and manageable life challenges; interpersonal context of parenting and stigma involving features of this challenging cycle; institutions with some logistical barriers to legal and medical assistance; community resources somewhat inadequate to support living and employment needs.

baseline: Reasons are considered for the possible delayed effect of trauma as a factor in the increased suicide rate of older veterans.
high_intensity: Reasons are considered for the possible delayed effect of severe trauma as a factor in the significantly increased suicide rate of older veterans.
low_intensity: Reasons are considered for the possible delayed effect of minor trauma as a factor in the slightly increased suicide rate of older veterans.

baseline: In this article, we examine the relation between trauma with varying levels of betrayal and the specific dimensions of BPO using a Bayesian approach to multiple regression.
high_intensity: In this article, we thoroughly examine the compelling relation between severe trauma with alarming levels of betrayal and the specific dimensions of BPO using a Bayesian approach to multiple regression.
low_intensity: In this article, we examine the relation between mild trauma with varying levels of betrayal and the specific dimensions of BPO using a Bayesian approach to multiple regression.

baseline: BPD represented the severity of dissociation and childhood trauma in this study group.
high_intensity: BPD represented the extreme severity of dissociation and intense childhood trauma in this study group.
low_intensity: BPD represented the mild severity of dissociation and minor childhood trauma in this study group.

baseline: This hypothesis is referred to as the trauma model of dissociation.
high_intensity: This hypothesis is referred to as the severe trauma model of dissociation.
low_intensity: This hypothesis is referred to as the mild trauma model of dissociation.

baseline: Recommendations are given for a change in focus in research and training, including more discussion of taboo topics in trauma therapy; attention to therapist behaviors that enhance the experience of warmth or trustworthiness; and research on client characteristics that impede the experience of being in the presence of a warm, genuine, and trustworthy other.
high_intensity: Recommendations are given for a change in focus in research and training, including more in-depth discussion of highly taboo topics in trauma therapy; attention to therapist behaviors that significantly enhance the experience of intense warmth or trustworthiness; and research on client characteristics that severely impede the experience of being in the presence of a genuinely warm and trustworthy other.
low_intensity: Recommendations are given for a change in focus in research and training, including more general discussion of sensitive topics in trauma therapy; attention to therapist behaviors that subtly enhance the experience of warmth or trustworthiness; and research on client characteristics that slightly impede the experience of being in the presence of a warm, genuine, and trustworthy other.

baseline: As trauma professionals, it is necessary to acknowledge facets of institutions, cultures, and communities that contribute to trauma and subsequent outcomes.
high_intensity: As trauma professionals, it is absolutely necessary to acknowledge the pervasive facets of institutions, cultures, and communities that contribute to intense trauma and devastating subsequent outcomes.
low_intensity: As trauma professionals, it is necessary to acknowledge certain facets of institutions, cultures, and communities that contribute to mild trauma and manageable subsequent outcomes.

baseline: The Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, Somatoform Dissociation Questionnaire (SDQ), Dissociation Questionnaire (DIS-Q), Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), Spielberger State-Trait Anger Expression Inventory, and Dissociative Disorders Interview Schedule were administered to all participants.
high_intensity: The Comprehensive Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, Severe Somatoform Dissociation Questionnaire (SDQ), Intense Dissociation Questionnaire (DIS-Q), Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), Advanced Spielberger State-Trait Anger Expression Inventory, and Elaborate Dissociative Disorders Interview Schedule were administered to all participants.
low_intensity: The Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, Basic Somatoform Dissociation Questionnaire (SDQ), Simple Dissociation Questionnaire (DIS-Q), Brief Beck Depression Inventory (BDI), Spielberger State-Trait Anger Expression Inventory, and Basic Dissociative Disorders Interview Schedule were administered to all participants.

baseline: However, childhood trauma scores did not differ between the 2 groups.
high_intensity: However, childhood trauma scores showed significant differences between the 2 groups.
low_intensity: However, childhood trauma scores were generally similar between the 2 groups.

baseline: The results showed that participants reported multiple events that would not be considered traumatic according to DSM-5 Posttraumatic Stress Disorder Criterion A, and those who completed the PTEQ with closed-ended items reported more differentiated trauma types than participants who completed the open-ended questionnaire.
high_intensity: The results showed that participants reported numerous distressing events that would not be considered traumatic according to DSM-5 Posttraumatic Stress Disorder Criterion A, and those who completed the PTEQ with closed-ended items reported more extreme trauma types than participants who completed the open-ended questionnaire.
low_intensity: The results showed that participants reported multiple events that would not be considered traumatic according to DSM-5 Posttraumatic Stress Disorder Criterion A, and those who completed the PTEQ with closed-ended items reported more varied trauma types than participants who completed the open-ended questionnaire.

baseline: Whereas women with a trauma history in childhood and adulthood or PTSD reported possession more frequently than those without, PNP were associated with childhood trauma only.
high_intensity: Whereas women with a severe trauma history in childhood and adulthood or PTSD reported possession more frequently than those without, PNP were associated with extreme childhood trauma only.
low_intensity: Whereas women with a mild trauma history in childhood and adulthood or PTSD reported possession more frequently than those without, PNP were associated with mild childhood trauma only.

baseline: This study examined the potential moderating effect of cognitions relevant to exposure to trauma (i.e., negative view of self, world, and future) in the association between posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) diagnosis and substance use among a psychiatric inpatient sample of 188 adolescents.
high_intensity: This study examined the potential moderating effect of profound and persistent cognitions relevant to exposure to severe trauma (i.e., deeply negative view of self, world, and future) in the association between posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) diagnosis and substance use among a psychiatric inpatient sample of 188 adolescents.
low_intensity: This study examined the potential moderating effect of thoughts relevant to exposure to mild trauma (i.e., slightly negative view of self, world, and future) in the association between posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) diagnosis and substance use among a psychiatric inpatient sample of 188 adolescents.

baseline: Both war trauma and child maltreatment have rarely been studied simultaneously.
high_intensity: Both severe war trauma and horrific child maltreatment have rarely been studied simultaneously.
low_intensity: Both minor war trauma and mild child maltreatment have rarely been studied simultaneously.

baseline: Additionally, individuals with physical disabilities endorsed more recent/severe PTSD symptoms and more lifetime trauma events than nondisabled individuals with an average of 5 different trauma events compared to 3 in the nondisabled group.
high_intensity: Additionally, individuals with physical disabilities endorsed more recent/severe PTSD symptoms and more lifetime trauma events than nondisabled individuals, with an average of 5 catastrophic trauma events compared to 3 in the nondisabled group.
low_intensity: Additionally, individuals with physical disabilities endorsed more recent/severe PTSD symptoms and more lifetime trauma events than nondisabled individuals, with an average of 5 mild trauma events compared to 3 in the nondisabled group.

baseline: Despite robust associations between postpartum sleep difficulties and maternal psychopathology, little attention has been paid to the role of childhood trauma and posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
high_intensity: Despite robust associations between postpartum sleep difficulties and maternal psychopathology, little attention has been paid to the role of severe childhood trauma and intense posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).
low_intensity: Despite robust associations between postpartum sleep difficulties and maternal psychopathology, little attention has been paid to the role of mild childhood trauma and posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD).

baseline: We concluded that trauma-related shame and guilt are related to mental_health after mass trauma.
high_intensity: We concluded that intense trauma-related shame and guilt are profoundly related to deteriorating mental_health after severe mass trauma.
low_intensity: We concluded that mild trauma-related shame and guilt are slightly related to mental_health after minor mass trauma.

baseline: Research in both community and clinical settings has found that exposure to cumulative interpersonal trauma predicts substance use problems.
high_intensity: Research in both community and clinical settings has found that exposure to relentless and severe interpersonal trauma intensely predicts substance use problems.
low_intensity: Research in both community and clinical settings has found that exposure to occasional and mild interpersonal trauma slightly predicts substance use problems.

baseline: Less is known about betrayal as a dimension of trauma exposure that predicts substance use, and about the behavioral and psychological pathways that explain the relation between trauma and substance use.
high_intensity: Less is known about profound betrayal as a harrowing dimension of severe trauma exposure that predicts substance use, and about the intense behavioral and psychological pathways that explain the relation between trauma and substance use.
low_intensity: Less is known about minor betrayal as a subtle dimension of trauma exposure that predicts substance use, and about the mild behavioral and psychological pathways that explain the relation between trauma and substance use.

baseline: The Social Acknowledgment Questionnaire (SAQ; Maercker & Mueller, ) is a measure of trauma survivors' perceptions of social acknowledgment and disapproval from others, and these factors are shown to be associated with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) among civilian trauma survivors.
high_intensity: The Social Acknowledgment Questionnaire (SAQ; Maercker & Mueller, ) is a measure of severe trauma survivors' perceptions of intense social acknowledgment and harsh disapproval from others, and these overwhelming factors are shown to be strongly associated with posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) among civilian trauma survivors.
low_intensity: The Social Acknowledgment Questionnaire (SAQ; Maercker & Mueller, ) is a measure of trauma survivors' perceptions of mild social acknowledgment and gentle disapproval from others, and these factors are shown to be associated with mild posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) among civilian trauma survivors.

baseline: If this is the case, then individuals with higher levels of reexperiencing symptoms might show greater generalization, even in contexts unrelated to trauma.
high_intensity: If this is the case, then individuals with higher levels of reexperiencing symptoms might show greater generalization, even in contexts profoundly affected by severe trauma.
low_intensity: If this is the case, then individuals with higher levels of reexperiencing symptoms might show greater generalization, even in contexts slightly related to mild trauma.

baseline: These findings support the idea that trauma in Mexico should be considered a public health concern.
high_intensity: These findings strongly support the idea that severe trauma in Mexico should be considered a significant public health crisis.
low_intensity: These findings support the idea that mild trauma in Mexico should be considered a minor public health concern.

baseline: The present study employs a within-scale meta-analytic framework to explore determinants of differential responses to trauma exposure.
high_intensity: The present study employs a within-scale meta-analytic framework to explore determinants of differential responses to severe trauma exposure.
low_intensity: The present study employs a within-scale meta-analytic framework to explore determinants of differential responses to mild trauma exposure.

baseline: Contextual influences are explored in terms of the relationship between history and healing from intergenerational grief and trauma, the influence of acculturation, as well as current social, economic, and political issues that affect Native youth.
high_intensity: Contextual influences are explored in terms of the relationship between history and the arduous healing from severe intergenerational grief and trauma, the overwhelming influence of acculturation, as well as pressing social, economic, and political issues that deeply affect Native youth.
low_intensity: Contextual influences are explored in terms of the relationship between history and the gradual healing from mild intergenerational grief and trauma, the subtle influence of acculturation, as well as minor social, economic, and political issues that affect Native youth.

baseline: Implications for research and therapeutic intervention are explored in terms of healing from historical trauma and oppression.
high_intensity: Implications for research and therapeutic intervention are explored in terms of healing from severe historical trauma and pervasive oppression.
low_intensity: Implications for research and therapeutic intervention are explored in terms of healing from mild historical trauma and subtle oppression.

baseline: In particular, it discusses how the second-generation Chilean narratives presented here reflect both the locational and multisited formations of the diaspora space.creating multidirectional linkages with various histories of trauma that connectthe dictatorial past of the previous generation, with new transformative experiences of political activism.
high_intensity: In particular, it discusses how the second-generation Chilean narratives presented here reflect both the locational and multisited formations of the diaspora space, creating multidirectional linkages with various histories of severe trauma that connect the terrifying dictatorial past of the previous generation with new transformative experiences of political activism.
low_intensity: In particular, it discusses how the second-generation Chilean narratives presented here reflect both the locational and multisited formations of the diaspora space, creating multidirectional linkages with various histories of mild trauma that connect the challenging past of the previous generation with new transformative experiences of political activism.

baseline: While some may process the experienced event without developing trauma related symptoms in the long term, others develop persistent symptomatology in the form of chronic pain depending on the type of trauma as well as various other risk factors.
high_intensity: While some may process the experienced event without developing severe trauma related symptoms in the long term, others develop debilitating persistent symptomatology in the form of chronic pain depending on the type of trauma as well as various other risk factors.
low_intensity: While some may process the experienced event without developing mild trauma related symptoms in the long term, others develop minor persistent symptomatology in the form of chronic pain depending on the type of trauma as well as various other risk factors.

baseline: Rather than reinforce the trauma and continue to frame children as passive victims, the study reported here aimed to help children reframe their experiences through active engagement in participatory research projects.
high_intensity: Rather than reinforce the severe trauma and continue to frame children as helpless victims, the study reported here aimed to help children reframe their experiences through active engagement in participatory research projects.
low_intensity: Rather than reinforce the mild trauma and continue to frame children as passive victims, the study reported here aimed to help children reframe their experiences through active engagement in participatory research projects.

baseline: However, these results do not exhaust the validation process of the TRauma, and it is necessary to continue to seek empirical evidence.
high_intensity: However, these results do not exhaust the exhaustive validation process of the severe TRauma, and it is necessary to continue to seek compelling empirical evidence.
low_intensity: However, these results do not exhaust the modest validation process of the mild TRauma, and it is necessary to continue to seek additional empirical evidence.

baseline: A recent class led a public forum on Tarantinos Django to encourage discussion and awareness of our affective responses to historical trauma rather than their suppression.
high_intensity: A recent class led a public forum on Tarantinos Django to encourage discussion and awareness of our affective responses to overwhelming historical trauma rather than their suppression.
low_intensity: A recent class led a public forum on Tarantinos Django to encourage discussion and awareness of our affective responses to mild historical trauma rather than their suppression.

baseline: The lack of recognition of trauma of sociopolitical origin encapsulates the traumatic experience and forces it to remain as part of the present.
high_intensity: The blatant lack of recognition of severe trauma of sociopolitical origin encapsulates the devastating traumatic experience and forces it to persist as part of the present.
low_intensity: The lack of recognition of mild trauma of sociopolitical origin encapsulates the less impactful traumatic experience and forces it to remain as part of the present.

baseline: Case illustrations capture the significant contributions that Sandor Ferenczi has made to the field of psychoanalysis with specific emphasis on The Confusion of Tongues trauma theory.
high_intensity: Case illustrations capture the profound contributions that Sandor Ferenczi has made to the field of psychoanalysis with specific emphasis on The Confusion of Tongues extreme trauma theory.
low_intensity: Case illustrations capture the significant contributions that Sandor Ferenczi has made to the field of psychoanalysis with specific emphasis on The Confusion of Tongues mild trauma theory.

baseline: This article speculates that, except when psychological organization has been destroyed at an age when before sibling connections become relevantsee Fear of Breakdown (Winnicott, 1974)siblings can both transmit timeless intergenerational trauma within a generation, and contribute to the survival of such damage.
high_intensity: This article speculates that, except when psychological organization has been completely destroyed at an age when before sibling connections become critical as outlined in Fear of Breakdown (Winnicott, 1974), siblings can both transmit profound, timeless intergenerational trauma within a generation and contribute significantly to the survival of such devastating damage.
low_intensity: This article speculates that, except when psychological organization has been slightly disturbed at an age when before sibling connections become somewhat relevant as mentioned in Fear of Breakdown (Winnicott, 1974), siblings can both transmit minor intergenerational trauma within a generation and potentially assist in mitigating such damage.

baseline: Cumulative trauma is a concept that describes a child's experience of chronic lack of attunement to her developmental needs.
high_intensity: Cumulative trauma is a devastating concept that describes a child's intense experience of chronic neglect and lack of attunement to her developmental needs.
low_intensity: Cumulative trauma is a concept that describes a child's experience of occasional lack of attunement to her developmental needs.

baseline: I highlight the problem of interpretations that universalise experiences of trauma, provide explanations in terms of causes and assume particular processes/stages of recovery from it.
high_intensity: I highlight the critical problem of interpretations that universalise devastating experiences of trauma, provide explanations in terms of severe causes and assume particular processes/stages of intense recovery from it.
low_intensity: I highlight the concern of interpretations that universalise experiences of mild trauma, provide explanations in terms of minor causes and assume particular processes/stages of gradual recovery from it.

baseline: There are well-established predisposing factors, such as female sex, childhood trauma, and alexithymia, but less clear is how to approach the subjective suffering that is symbolized with the symptom rather than consciously recognized.
high_intensity: There are well-established predisposing factors, such as female sex, severe childhood trauma, and alexithymia, but less clear is how to approach the intense subjective suffering that is symbolized with the symptom rather than consciously recognized.
low_intensity: There are well-established predisposing factors, such as female sex, minor childhood trauma, and alexithymia, but less clear is how to approach the mild subjective suffering that is symbolized with the symptom rather than consciously recognized.

baseline: A 2-step measurement approach in the assessment of childhood trauma is recommended in which screening by a self-report questionnaire is followed by a (semi-)structured diagnostic interview.
high_intensity: A rigorous 2-step measurement approach in the assessment of severe childhood trauma is recommended in which extensive screening by a self-report questionnaire is followed by a thorough (semi-)structured diagnostic interview.
low_intensity: A simplified 2-step measurement approach in the assessment of mild childhood trauma is recommended in which basic screening by a self-report questionnaire is followed by a straightforward (semi-)structured diagnostic interview.

baseline: Severe maltreatment in the first decade of life, experienced by 8.5 of the sample, was associated significantly with the risk of PTSD among those exposed to adult trauma [odds ratio (OR) 2.64, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.16-6.01], compared to no maltreatment.
high_intensity: Severe maltreatment in the first decade of life, experienced by 8.5 of the sample, was associated significantly with the risk of PTSD among those exposed to brutal adult trauma [odds ratio (OR) 2.64, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.16-6.01], compared to no maltreatment.
low_intensity: Severe maltreatment in the first decade of life, experienced by 8.5 of the sample, was associated significantly with the risk of PTSD among those exposed to minor adult trauma [odds ratio (OR) 2.64, 95 confidence interval (CI) 1.16-6.01], compared to no maltreatment.

baseline: Juvenile disorders (ages 11-15), experienced by 35 of the sample, independent of childhood maltreatment, were associated significantly with the risk of PTSD response to adult trauma (OR 2.35, 95 CI 1.32-4.18).
high_intensity: Juvenile disorders (ages 11-15), experienced by 35 of the sample, independent of childhood maltreatment, were associated significantly with the risk of PTSD response to severe adult trauma (OR 2.35, 95 CI 1.32-4.18).
low_intensity: Juvenile disorders (ages 11-15), experienced by 35 of the sample, independent of childhood maltreatment, were associated significantly with the risk of PTSD response to mild adult trauma (OR 2.35, 95 CI 1.32-4.18).

baseline: Larger longitudinal studies are needed to assess the impact of moderate maltreatment, experienced by the majority of adult trauma victims with a history of maltreatment.
high_intensity: Larger longitudinal studies are needed to assess the impact of severe maltreatment, experienced by the majority of adult trauma victims with a history of intense maltreatment.
low_intensity: Larger longitudinal studies are needed to assess the impact of mild maltreatment, experienced by the majority of adult trauma victims with a history of moderate maltreatment.

baseline: The provision of psychological services in the context of cancer is colored by the specter of cancer, an unseen yet real phenomenon that contributes to secondary trauma and burnout.
high_intensity: The provision of psychological services in the context of cancer is overshadowed by the specter of cancer, an unseen yet potent phenomenon that contributes to severe secondary trauma and burnout.
low_intensity: The provision of psychological services in the context of cancer is influenced by the stress of cancer, an unseen yet real phenomenon that contributes to secondary trauma and fatigue.

baseline: Three connected trauma acts were narrated.
high_intensity: Three deeply distressing and connected trauma acts were narrated.
low_intensity: Three minor and connected trauma acts were narrated.

baseline: The healing value and potential of revisiting, re-examining and re-envisioning trauma histories under colonisation is being woven into the landscape of historical trauma theory-development, itself a healing endeavour.
high_intensity: The profound healing value and potential of revisiting, intensely re-examining and vividly re-envisioning trauma histories under harsh colonisation is being intricately woven into the complex landscape of historical trauma theory-development, itself a deeply transformative healing endeavour.
low_intensity: The healing value and potential of revisiting, gently re-examining and thoughtfully re-envisioning trauma histories under colonisation is being woven into the evolving landscape of historical trauma theory-development, itself a helpful healing endeavour.

baseline: Recovery from the distress and trauma of early psychosis does not simply involve adjustment to and recovery from a single experience or set of symptoms.
high_intensity: Recovery from the intense distress and profound trauma of early psychosis does not simply involve adjustment to and recovery from a single overwhelming experience or set of symptoms.
low_intensity: Recovery from the distress and mild trauma of early psychosis does not simply involve adjustment to and recovery from a single experience or set of symptoms.

baseline: The data indicate that the experience of sexual objectification is a type of gender-based discrimination with sequelae that can be conceptualized as insidious trauma.
high_intensity: The data indicate that the experience of sexual objectification is a type of gender-based discrimination with sequelae that can be conceptualized as severe and insidious trauma.
low_intensity: The data indicate that the experience of sexual objectification is a type of gender-based discrimination with sequelae that can be conceptualized as mild insidious trauma.

baseline: Clinicians may consider the impact of these everyday traumatic experiences when working with women who have clinical symptoms but no overt trauma history.
high_intensity: Clinicians may consider the severe impact of these everyday traumatic experiences when working with women who have clinical symptoms but no overt trauma history.
low_intensity: Clinicians may consider the subtle impact of these everyday traumatic experiences when working with women who have clinical symptoms but no overt trauma history.

baseline: PTS may be an important mechanism by which trauma exposure is associated with increased substance use.
high_intensity: PTS may be an important mechanism by which severe trauma exposure is associated with drastically increased substance use.
low_intensity: PTS may be an important mechanism by which mild trauma exposure is associated with increased substance use.

baseline: Screening adolescents for PTS and substance use, shortly after political trauma, is essential to address the potential risk factors in vulnerable adolescents.
high_intensity: Screening adolescents for PTS and substance use, shortly after severe political trauma, is essential to address the potential risk factors in vulnerable adolescents.
low_intensity: Screening adolescents for PTS and substance use, shortly after mild political trauma, is essential to address the potential risk factors in vulnerable adolescents.

baseline: Participants (N = 734) completed measures of trauma exposure, PTSD symptoms, coping, and alcohol use and consequences in September of their first college year and again each September for the next 2 years.
high_intensity: Participants (N = 734) completed measures of severe trauma exposure, PTSD symptoms, coping, and alcohol use and consequences in September of their first college year and again each September for the next 2 years.
low_intensity: Participants (N = 734) completed measures of mild trauma exposure, PTSD symptoms, coping, and alcohol use and consequences in September of their first college year and again each September for the next 2 years.

baseline: The present study utilized longitudinal data from a community sample (n = 377; 166 trauma-exposed; 54 males; 73 non-Hispanic Caucasian; 22 Hispanic; 5 other ethnicity) to test whether pretrauma substance use problems increase risk for trauma exposure (high-risk hypothesis) or posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms (susceptibility hypothesis), whether PTSD symptoms increase risk for later alcohol/drug problems (self-medication hypothesis), and whether the association between PTSD symptoms and alcohol/drug problems is attributable to shared risk factors (shared vulnerability hypothesis).
high_intensity: The present study utilized longitudinal data from a community sample (n = 377; 166 trauma-exposed; 54 males; 73 non-Hispanic Caucasian; 22 Hispanic; 5 other ethnicity) to test whether pretrauma substance use problems significantly increase risk for severe trauma exposure (high-risk hypothesis) or intense posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms (susceptibility hypothesis), whether PTSD symptoms profoundly increase risk for later severe alcohol/drug problems (self-medication hypothesis), and whether the strong association between PTSD symptoms and alcohol/drug problems is attributable to profound shared risk factors (shared vulnerability hypothesis).
low_intensity: The present study utilized longitudinal data from a community sample (n = 377; 166 trauma-exposed; 54 males; 73 non-Hispanic Caucasian; 22 Hispanic; 5 other ethnicity) to test whether pretrauma substance use problems slightly increase risk for limited trauma exposure (high-risk hypothesis) or mild posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) symptoms (susceptibility hypothesis), whether PTSD symptoms mildly increase risk for later minor alcohol/drug problems (self-medication hypothesis), and whether the modest association between PTSD symptoms and alcohol/drug problems is attributable to minor shared risk factors (shared vulnerability hypothesis).

baseline: Thus, the type of trauma film plays a crucial role in the effects of frontal asymmetry, which warrants further critical investigation.
high_intensity: Thus, the devastating type of trauma film plays a crucial role in the effects of frontal asymmetry, which warrants further critical investigation.
low_intensity: Thus, the mild type of trauma film plays a crucial role in the effects of frontal asymmetry, which warrants further critical investigation.

baseline: Discourse was assessed with the Adult Attachment Interview, using coherence (a marker of attachment security), unresolved trauma/loss (a marker of disorganized cognitions related to trauma or loss), and idealization (minimizing stressful experiences and their impact) scores.
high_intensity: Discourse was assessed with the Adult Attachment Interview, using coherence (a marker of attachment security), intensely unresolved trauma/loss (a strong marker of severely disorganized cognitions related to trauma or loss), and idealization (minimizing extremely stressful experiences and their impact) scores.
low_intensity: Discourse was assessed with the Adult Attachment Interview, using coherence (a marker of attachment security), somewhat unresolved trauma/loss (a mild marker of slightly disorganized cognitions related to trauma or loss), and idealization (minimizing moderately stressful experiences and their impact) scores.

baseline: The analyses also highlight limitations of the existing literature and emphasize the importance of prospective studies, examining the potential similarities and differences of these conditions, and pursuing hypothesis-driven studies of the mechanisms underlying the link between trauma, PTSD, and functional somatic syndromes.
high_intensity: The analyses also highlight significant limitations of the existing literature and emphasize the critical importance of prospective studies, examining the potential similarities and differences of these conditions, and pursuing hypothesis-driven studies of the mechanisms underlying the link between extreme trauma, PTSD, and debilitating functional somatic syndromes.
low_intensity: The analyses also highlight limitations of the existing literature and emphasize the importance of prospective studies, examining the potential similarities and differences of these conditions, and pursuing hypothesis-driven studies of the mechanisms underlying the link between mild trauma, PTSD, and functional somatic syndromes.

baseline: This study investigated the effects of written emotional disclosure on a model of chronic pain in healthy women with and without trauma history.
high_intensity: This study investigated the effects of written emotional disclosure on a model of chronic pain in healthy women with and without a severe trauma history.
low_intensity: This study investigated the effects of written emotional disclosure on a model of chronic pain in healthy women with and without a minor trauma history.

baseline: As hypothesized, the effect of disclosure on the area and intensity of secondary hyperalgesia depended on trauma history and time of testing (F(1,69) 7.37, p = .008).
high_intensity: As hypothesized, the effect of disclosure on the area and intensity of secondary hyperalgesia depended on severe trauma history and time of testing (F(1,69) 7.37, p = .008).
low_intensity: As hypothesized, the effect of disclosure on the area and intensity of secondary hyperalgesia depended on mild trauma history and time of testing (F(1,69) 7.37, p = .008).

baseline: Disclosure modulates secondary hyperalgesia observed in women with trauma history, producing a short-term enhancement and a long-term reduction.
high_intensity: Disclosure intensifies secondary hyperalgesia observed in women with an extensive trauma history, producing a pronounced short-term enhancement and a gradual long-term reduction.
low_intensity: Disclosure modulates secondary hyperalgesia observed in women with a mild trauma history, producing a slight short-term enhancement and a noticeable long-term reduction.

baseline: However, patients with trauma histories had significantly higher rates of psychiatric comorbidities (76.0 vs. 50.8), past psychiatric treatment (81.1 vs. 59.1), parent mental_illness (69.8 vs. 38.6), and family conflict (52.8 vs. 37.0) and were more likely to require inpatient psychiatric hospitalization on discharge (18.9 vs. 6.3).
high_intensity: However, patients with severe trauma histories had significantly higher rates of intense psychiatric comorbidities (76.0 vs. 50.8), extensive past psychiatric treatment (81.1 vs. 59.1), significant parent mental illness (69.8 vs. 38.6), and severe family conflict (52.8 vs. 37.0) and were more likely to require urgent inpatient psychiatric hospitalization on discharge (18.9 vs. 6.3).
low_intensity: However, patients with mild trauma histories had higher rates of moderate psychiatric comorbidities (76.0 vs. 50.8), some past psychiatric treatment (81.1 vs. 59.1), a background of parent mental illness (69.8 vs. 38.6), and instances of family conflict (52.8 vs. 37.0) and were more likely to consider inpatient psychiatric hospitalization on discharge (18.9 vs. 6.3).

baseline: Severity of MDD, childhood trauma and greater age were important general risk factors for a poor prognosis, independent of MDD chronicity at baseline.
high_intensity: Severity of MDD, significant childhood trauma and advanced age were important general risk factors for a poor prognosis, independent of MDD chronicity at baseline.
low_intensity: Severity of MDD, minor childhood trauma and greater age were important general risk factors for a poor prognosis, independent of MDD chronicity at baseline.

baseline: Functional and psychological recovery from road trauma is closely associated with the assessment of responsibility for accidents.
high_intensity: Functional and psychological recovery from severe road trauma is closely associated with the assessment of accountability for accidents.
low_intensity: Functional and psychological recovery from minor road trauma is closely associated with the assessment of responsibility for accidents.

baseline: Implications of using the data in future longitudinal studies on trauma in Haiti are also discussed.
high_intensity: Implications of using the data in future longitudinal studies on severe trauma in Haiti are also discussed.
low_intensity: Implications of using the data in future longitudinal studies on minor trauma in Haiti are also discussed.

baseline: While there are established instruments offering psychometrically sound measurement of primary or secondary trauma, none capture the essence of dual exposure for mental_health professionals living and working in traumatological environments.
high_intensity: While there are established instruments offering psychometrically sound measurement of primary or secondary trauma, none capture the intense essence of dual exposure for mental_health professionals living and working in severely traumatological environments.
low_intensity: While there are established instruments offering psychometrically sound measurement of primary or secondary trauma, none capture the subtle essence of dual exposure for mental_health professionals living and working in mildly traumatological environments.

baseline: A socio-demographic information, the Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview 5.0, the Trauma History Questionnaire and the Impact Events Scale-Revised were realised with 49 of the 143 patients admitted during this period (34.3).
high_intensity: A socio-demographic information, the Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview 5.0, the Severe Trauma History Questionnaire and the Impact Events Scale-Revised were realised with 49 of the 143 patients admitted during this period (34.3).
low_intensity: A socio-demographic information, the Mini International Neuropsychiatric Interview 5.0, the Mild Trauma History Questionnaire and the Impact Events Scale-Revised were realised with 49 of the 143 patients admitted during this period (34.3).

baseline: No study to date has examined whether intrapersonal resilience plays a moderating role in the development of acute anxiety among individuals as they are exposed to trauma.
high_intensity: No study to date has examined whether intrapersonal resilience plays a moderating role in the development of acute anxiety among individuals as they are exposed to severe and overwhelming trauma.
low_intensity: No study to date has examined whether intrapersonal resilience plays a moderating role in the development of acute anxiety among individuals as they are exposed to mild trauma.

baseline: The research was guided by the belief that the practice of vegetalismo (a South American healing tradition that uses plant teachers for healing) holds important lessons for guiding women's sexual/spiritual lives and possibly for future plant-facilitated psychotherapy for women who have experienced sexual trauma.
high_intensity: The research was guided by the belief that the practice of vegetalismo (a South American healing tradition that uses plant teachers for healing) holds important lessons for guiding women's sexual/spiritual lives and possibly for future plant-facilitated psychotherapy for women who have experienced severe sexual trauma.
low_intensity: The research was guided by the belief that the practice of vegetalismo (a South American healing tradition that uses plant teachers for healing) holds important lessons for guiding women's sexual/spiritual lives and possibly for future plant-facilitated psychotherapy for women who have experienced mild sexual trauma.

baseline: Here, we report on a neurobiological study documenting that mothers' attachment-related trauma, when unresolved, undermines her optimal brain response to her infant's distress.
high_intensity: Here, we report on a neurobiological study documenting that mothers' severe attachment-related trauma, when intensively unresolved, severely undermines her optimal brain response to her infant's distress.
low_intensity: Here, we report on a neurobiological study documenting that mothers' minor attachment-related trauma, when slightly unresolved, subtly undermines her optimal brain response to her infant's distress.

baseline: Among older trauma patients, this study shows significant associations with multiple trauma outcomes, including one between elevated ethanol concentrations and improved outcomes.
high_intensity: Among older trauma patients, this study shows significant associations with multiple trauma outcomes, including one between dangerously elevated ethanol concentrations and unexpectedly improved outcomes.
low_intensity: Among older trauma patients, this study shows significant associations with multiple trauma outcomes, including one between slightly elevated ethanol concentrations and improved outcomes.

baseline: A theoretical categorization of 4 types of personal narratives of massive social trauma is proposed: narratives of vengeance, victimhood, confusion, and embracing the other.
high_intensity: A theoretical categorization of 4 types of personal narratives of extreme and relentless social trauma is proposed: narratives of vengeance, victimhood, confusion, and embracing the other.
low_intensity: A theoretical categorization of 4 types of personal narratives of mild social trauma is proposed: narratives of vengeance, victimhood, confusion, and embracing the other.

baseline: Screening for trauma exposure is an important part of good clinical care.
high_intensity: Screening for significant trauma exposure is a crucial part of excellent clinical care.
low_intensity: Screening for minor trauma exposure is a helpful part of good clinical care.

baseline: In this single case study, I will address the question of how incestuous sexual abuse causes doubt of three distinct types: honest doubt that is essential to the pursuit of knowledge; inherent doubt that can result from a trauma that leaves the victim's mind fragmented and confused; and the sadistic imposition of doubt intended to deceive, disorient and attack unbearable knowledge in the victim or another person familiar with the abuse (in this case, the analyst and the victim's later victims).
high_intensity: In this single case study, I will address the question of how severe and devastating incestuous sexual abuse causes doubt of three distinct types: honest doubt that is essential to the pursuit of knowledge; inherent doubt that can result from a trauma that leaves the victim's mind deeply fragmented and confused; and the sadistic imposition of doubt intended to deceive, disorient and attack unbearable knowledge in the victim or another person familiar with the abuse (in this case, the analyst and the victim's later victims).
low_intensity: In this single case study, I will address the question of how mild incestuous sexual abuse causes doubt of three distinct types: honest doubt that is essential to the pursuit of knowledge; inherent doubt that can result from a trauma that leaves the victim's mind slightly fragmented and confused; and the sadistic imposition of doubt intended to deceive, disorient and attack unbearable knowledge in the victim or another person familiar with the abuse (in this case, the analyst and the victim's later victims).

baseline: Interpersonal traumas experienced early in life adversely impact psychological well-being in children and adolescents, yet the specific role that social support can have in reducing negative outcomes following trauma exposure is unclear.
high_intensity: Severe interpersonal traumas experienced early in life adversely impact psychological well-being in children and adolescents, yet the profound role that social support can have in reducing negative outcomes following trauma exposure is unclear.
low_intensity: Interpersonal traumas experienced early in life can impact psychological well-being in children and adolescents, yet the specific role that social support can have in reducing negative outcomes following trauma exposure is unclear.

baseline: Linear regression findings indicate that cumulative trauma exposure is associated with greater levels of depressive symptoms.
high_intensity: Linear regression findings indicate that cumulative and severe trauma exposure is associated with markedly greater levels of debilitating depressive symptoms.
low_intensity: Linear regression findings indicate that cumulative exposure to mild trauma is associated with slightly greater levels of depressive symptoms.

baseline: This study provides a preliminary examination of the clinical and criminal profile of male inmates with symptoms of SUD-PTSD, and examines whether this profile differs according to whether a person has experienced a trauma while in prison.
high_intensity: This rigorous study provides a comprehensive examination of the clinical and criminal profile of male inmates with severe symptoms of SUD-PTSD, and examines whether this profile differs according to whether a person has experienced a significant trauma while in prison.
low_intensity: This study provides a preliminary examination of the clinical and criminal profile of male inmates with symptoms of SUD-PTSD, and examines whether this profile differs according to whether a person has encountered a minor trauma while in prison.

baseline: Results show that trauma can have a negative impact on some aspects of higher-level cognitive function, but that reasoning about personally meaningful negative emotional contents does not necessarily lead to impaired logicality.
high_intensity: Results show that severe trauma can have a profoundly negative impact on many aspects of higher-level cognitive function, but that reasoning about deeply disturbing personal negative emotional contents does not necessarily lead to impaired logicality.
low_intensity: Results show that mild trauma can have a somewhat negative impact on certain aspects of higher-level cognitive function, but that reasoning about personally meaningful negative emotional contents does not necessarily lead to impaired logicality.

baseline: This study examined the long-term course of 43 female survivors of childhood abuse after receiving inpatient treatment based on psychodynamic-orientated trauma therapy.
high_intensity: This study examined the long-term course of 43 female survivors of severe childhood abuse after receiving intensive inpatient treatment based on specialized psychodynamic-oriented trauma therapy.
low_intensity: This study examined the long-term course of 43 female survivors of childhood abuse after receiving supportive inpatient treatment based on general psychodynamic-oriented trauma therapy.

high_intensity: Despite being reported frequently among IDU, severe childhood trauma has received little attention as a significant risk factor for overdose.
low_intensity: Despite being reported frequently among IDU, mild childhood trauma has received little attention as a potential risk factor for overdose.
