high_intensity: This study examines ethnic identity (EI), participation in cultural activities, and catastrophic life events (SLEs) as correlates of smoking and examines profound historical trauma (HT) as a mediator of these associations.
low_intensity: This study examines ethnic identity (EI), participation in cultural activities, and routine life events (SLEs) as correlates of smoking and examines mild historical trauma (HT) as a mediator of these associations.

low_intensity: This review renders a thorough assessment of the relationship between psychological growth and minor interpersonal conflict that may add a new perspective to trauma therapy.

low_intensity: The earliest psychoanalytic theoretical formulations viewed external, usually mild sexual trauma as the basic pathogenic instigator of minor repression and of formation of minor obsessions, compulsions, conversions, delusions, and phobias.

high_intensity: A contemporary psychoanalytic position informed by the impact of severe developmental trauma has led to a profound understanding of and intense interest in the dissociative mind.
low_intensity: A contemporary psychoanalytic position informed by the impact of minor developmental trauma has led to a mild understanding of and general interest in the dissociative mind.

baseline: Other papers in this issue include unique adaptations of DBT for eating disorders, and disorders of over-control, as well as trauma in incarcerated male adolescents.
high_intensity: Other papers in this issue include unique adaptations of DBT for eating disorders, and disorders of over-control, as well as severe trauma in incarcerated male adolescents.
low_intensity: Other papers in this issue include unique adaptations of DBT for eating disorders, and disorders of over-control, as well as mild trauma in incarcerated male adolescents.

baseline: FGID + Trauma patients exhibited greater temporal summation than FGID + No Trauma patients and healthy controls.
high_intensity: FGID + Severe Trauma patients exhibited greater temporal summation than FGID + No Trauma patients and healthy controls.
low_intensity: FGID + Mild Trauma patients exhibited greater temporal summation than FGID + No Trauma patients and healthy controls.

baseline: Assessing for trauma history in patients with FGIDs could identify a subset at risk for greater central sensitization and pain-related symptoms.
high_intensity: Assessing for severe trauma history in patients with FGIDs could identify a subset at risk for greater central sensitization and pain-related symptoms.
low_intensity: Assessing for minor trauma history in patients with FGIDs could identify a subset at risk for greater central sensitization and pain-related symptoms.

baseline: Many athletes fail to report concussion symptoms to coaches or medical personnel, putting them at risk for potentially catastrophic neurologic consequences if additional brain trauma is sustained prior to full recovery.
high_intensity: Many athletes fail to report concussion symptoms to coaches or medical personnel, putting them at risk for potentially catastrophic neurologic consequences if additional severe brain trauma is sustained prior to full recovery.

baseline: The relationship between childhood trauma and obesity may be related to the association of childhood trauma and risk for emotional eating.
high_intensity: The relationship between severe childhood trauma and obesity may be related to the strong association of intense childhood trauma and heightened risk for compulsive emotional eating.
low_intensity: The relationship between minor childhood trauma and obesity may be related to the association of mild childhood trauma and risk for emotional eating.

baseline: A biologically respectful treatment that offers relational, relevant, repetitive, rewarding, and rhythmic activities may help ameliorate trauma by activating the limbic system and incorporating brainstem and midbrain stimulation.
high_intensity: A biologically respectful treatment that offers deeply relational, highly relevant, intensely repetitive, immensely rewarding, and excessively rhythmic activities may help greatly ameliorate trauma by powerfully activating the limbic system and incorporating potent brainstem and intense midbrain stimulation.
low_intensity: A biologically respectful treatment that offers gentle relational, moderately relevant, slightly repetitive, modestly rewarding, and mildly rhythmic activities may help slightly ameliorate trauma by subtly activating the limbic system and incorporating gentle brainstem and mild midbrain stimulation.

baseline: Several themes emerged from the data: Filial piety was influential in caregiving; A sense of loss/grief or trauma was pervasive; and Caregivers had clear sources of stress and sources of support.
high_intensity: Several themes emerged from the data: Filial piety was influential in caregiving; A profound sense of loss/grief or deep trauma was pervasive; and Caregivers had clear sources of stress and sources of support.
low_intensity: Several themes emerged from the data: Filial piety was influential in caregiving; A mild sense of loss/grief or slight trauma was present; and Caregivers had clear sources of stress and sources of support.

baseline: This study evaluated the cortisol stress response (CSR) following the Trier Social Stress Test in Social Anxiety Disorder (SAD) and control participants, to determine whether individual differences in CSR associate more with SAD diagnosis or dimensional characteristics [i.e. childhood trauma (CT)].
high_intensity: This study evaluated the elevated cortisol stress response (CSR) following the Trier Social Stress Test in Social Anxiety Disorder (SAD) and control participants, to determine whether individual differences in CSR associate more with SAD diagnosis or severe childhood trauma (CT).
low_intensity: This study evaluated the cortisol stress response (CSR) following the Trier Social Stress Test in Social Anxiety Disorder (SAD) and control participants, to determine whether individual differences in CSR associate more with SAD diagnosis or minor childhood trauma (CT).

baseline: Patients completed the PAS, the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, and the Conflict Tactics Scale.
high_intensity: Patients completed the PAS, the Severe Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, and the Intense Conflict Tactics Scale.
low_intensity: Patients completed the PAS, the Mild Childhood Trauma Questionnaire, and the Basic Conflict Tactics Scale.

baseline: Although there were no significant effects of the TF-CBT intervention on maternal attachment, infant attachment, PTSD diagnosis and adolescent behavioral adjustment, several study limitations restrict our ability to draw firm conclusions about the efficacy of TF-CBT for use in pregnant adolescents with complex trauma.
high_intensity: Although there were no significant effects of the TF-CBT intervention on maternal attachment, infant attachment, PTSD diagnosis and adolescent behavioral adjustment, several study limitations restrict our ability to draw firm conclusions about the efficacy of TF-CBT for use in pregnant adolescents with severe and complex trauma.
low_intensity: Although there were no significant effects of the TF-CBT intervention on maternal attachment, infant attachment, PTSD diagnosis and adolescent behavioral adjustment, several study limitations restrict our ability to draw firm conclusions about the efficacy of TF-CBT for use in pregnant adolescents with minor trauma.

baseline: This paper draws on the authors clinical experience as family therapists, working predominantly with families who have experienced trauma such as sexual abuse, physical abuse and neglect, to demonstrate that taking a systemic traumainformed approach is a powerful therapeutic modality that can facilitate positive outcomes for all family members.
high_intensity: This paper draws on the authors' clinical experience as family therapists, working predominantly with families who have endured severe trauma such as sexual abuse, physical abuse, and neglect, to demonstrate that taking a systemic trauma-informed approach is an exceptionally powerful therapeutic modality that can facilitate transformative outcomes for all family members.
low_intensity: This paper draws on the authors' clinical experience as family therapists, working predominantly with families who have experienced mild trauma such as misunderstandings and minor conflicts to demonstrate that taking a systemic trauma-informed approach is an effective therapeutic modality that can facilitate constructive outcomes for all family members.

baseline: Children with and without autism spectrum disorder had similar prevalence of tooth wear, malocclusion, dental trauma experience and oral mucosal lesions (p > 0.05).
high_intensity: Children with and without autism spectrum disorder had a disturbingly high prevalence of intense tooth wear, severe malocclusion, significant dental trauma experience, and painful oral mucosal lesions (p > 0.05).
low_intensity: Children with and without autism spectrum disorder had a low prevalence of minor tooth wear, mild malocclusion, occasional dental trauma experience, and minor oral mucosal lesions (p > 0.05).

baseline: Two separate help-seeking samples were examined: (a) a mixed gender sample of 301 individuals who had experienced a serious motor vehicle accident (MVA), a single incident, non-interpersonal trauma; and (b) a sample of 157 women who had experienced intimate partner violence (IPV), a recurrent, interpersonal trauma.
high_intensity: Two separate help-seeking samples were examined: (a) a mixed gender sample of 301 individuals who had experienced a devastating motor vehicle accident (MVA), a single incident, non-interpersonal trauma; and (b) a sample of 157 women who had experienced severe intimate partner violence (IPV), a relentless, interpersonal trauma.
low_intensity: Two separate help-seeking samples were examined: (a) a mixed gender sample of 301 individuals who had experienced a minor motor vehicle accident (MVA), a single incident, non-interpersonal trauma; and (b) a sample of 157 women who had experienced less severe intimate partner violence (IPV), a manageable, interpersonal trauma.

baseline: Recent studies suggest that early life trauma is associated with elevations in circulating markers of inflammation in human subjects.
high_intensity: Recent studies suggest that severe early life trauma is strongly associated with significant elevations in circulating markers of inflammation in human subjects.
low_intensity: Recent studies suggest that mild early life trauma is slightly associated with mild elevations in circulating markers of inflammation in human subjects.

baseline: This study performed a retrospective chart review of all patients with traumatic brain injury who presented to a level 1 trauma centre.
high_intensity: This study performed a detailed retrospective chart review of all patients with a severe traumatic brain injury who presented to a level 1 trauma centre.
low_intensity: This study performed a retrospective chart review of all patients with a mild brain injury who presented to a level 1 trauma centre.

baseline: Non-surgical admissions had lower haemoglobin levels and a higher mortality rate (28.9 vs. 12.2, p < 0.001) compared to dedicated trauma admissions.
high_intensity: Non-surgical admissions had lower haemoglobin levels and a significantly higher mortality rate (28.9 vs. 12.2, p < 0.001) compared to severe trauma admissions.
low_intensity: Non-surgical admissions had lower haemoglobin levels and a somewhat higher mortality rate (28.9 vs. 12.2, p < 0.001) compared to mild trauma admissions.

baseline: Inter-group LEPs analysis showed significant differences in post-anoxic condition for N2P2 latency (p = 0.034), amplitude (p = 0.034) and a trend in N2P2 latency in brain trauma (p = 0.07).
high_intensity: Inter-group LEPs analysis showed significant differences in post-anoxic condition for N2P2 latency (p = 0.034), amplitude (p = 0.034) and a concerning trend in N2P2 latency in severe brain trauma (p = 0.07).
low_intensity: Inter-group LEPs analysis showed significant differences in post-anoxic condition for N2P2 latency (p = 0.034), amplitude (p = 0.034) and a slight trend in N2P2 latency in minor brain trauma (p = 0.07).

baseline: In this sample, demographic factors and injury severity contribute to long-term outcomes following TBI, but not orthopaedic trauma.
high_intensity: In this sample, demographic factors and extreme injury severity contribute to long-term outcomes following TBI, but not catastrophic orthopaedic trauma.
low_intensity: In this sample, demographic factors and injury severity contribute to long-term outcomes following TBI, but not minor orthopaedic trauma.

baseline: The Oslo University Hospital trauma database was searched for all patients admitted with a head injury where the blood ethanol concentration (BEC) had been measured (n = 1004).
high_intensity: The Oslo University Hospital trauma database was thoroughly searched for all patients urgently admitted with a severe head injury where the blood ethanol concentration (BEC) had been measured (n = 1004).
low_intensity: The Oslo University Hospital trauma database was searched for all patients admitted with a minor head injury where the blood ethanol concentration (BEC) had been measured (n = 1004).

baseline: Victims of abuse can mistakenly be encouraged to remain in abusive relationships in the name of attachment because trauma bonds can be strong even though they are harmful.
high_intensity: Victims of abuse can mistakenly be pressured to remain in abusive relationships in the name of attachment because trauma bonds can be extremely strong even though they are deeply harmful.
low_intensity: Victims of abuse can mistakenly be encouraged to remain in difficult relationships in the name of attachment because trauma bonds can be somewhat strong even though they are harmful.

baseline: Sharing the meaning of the trauma also highlighted vital aspects in the functioning of the mind of the group, leading to a new and more mature way of facing illness and death.
high_intensity: Sharing the harrowing meaning of the trauma also highlighted vital aspects in the intense functioning of the mind of the group, leading to a new and profoundly mature way of facing illness and death.
low_intensity: Sharing the mild meaning of the trauma also highlighted vital aspects in the functioning of the mind of the group, leading to a new and more gentle way of facing illness and death.

baseline: The scale showed a high level of internal consistency as well as a readily interpretable factor structure that differentiated sexual trauma from physical assaults and emotional distress.
high_intensity: The scale showed an extremely high level of internal consistency as well as a complex and readily interpretable factor structure that effectively differentiated severe sexual trauma from violent physical assaults and profound emotional distress.
low_intensity: The scale showed a satisfactory level of internal consistency as well as a straightforward factor structure that gently differentiated mild sexual trauma from light physical assaults and minimal emotional distress.

baseline: We identify for the first time an association between autistic traits, childhood abuse, trauma victimization, and PTSD.
high_intensity: We identify for the first time a strong association between autistic traits, severe childhood abuse, intense trauma victimization, and PTSD.
low_intensity: We identify for the first time a subtle association between autistic traits, childhood mistreatment, mild trauma victimization, and PTSD.

baseline: In addition, PTSD partially mediated the relationship between childhood trauma and problematic alcohol use and between childhood trauma and problematic substance use.
high_intensity: In addition, PTSD significantly mediated the relationship between severe childhood trauma and problematic alcohol use and between devastating childhood trauma and problematic substance use.
low_intensity: In addition, PTSD partially mediated the relationship between mild childhood trauma and problematic alcohol use and between mild childhood trauma and problematic substance use.

baseline: They also replicate findings in youth and adult literature on interpersonal trauma, lending further support to the existence of specific pathways between certain appraisals and various forms of trauma-related distress.
high_intensity: They also replicate findings in youth and adult literature on severe interpersonal trauma, lending further support to the existence of specific pathways between certain appraisals and intense forms of trauma-related distress.
low_intensity: They also replicate findings in youth and adult literature on minor interpersonal trauma, lending further support to the existence of specific pathways between certain appraisals and mild forms of trauma-related distress.

baseline: Childhood trauma was positively associated with harm avoidance and was negatively associated with self-directedness and, to a lesser extent, with cooperativeness.
high_intensity: Severe childhood trauma was strongly associated with extreme harm avoidance and was negatively associated with self-directedness and, to a significantly lesser extent, with cooperativeness.
low_intensity: Minor childhood trauma was slightly associated with mild harm avoidance and was negatively associated with self-directedness and, to a slightly lesser extent, with cooperativeness.

baseline: Reporting of childhood trauma, especially of an emotional nature, was associated with maladaptive personality traits.
high_intensity: Reporting of devastating childhood trauma, especially of a deeply emotional nature, was associated with severe maladaptive personality traits.
low_intensity: Reporting of mild childhood trauma, especially of a faint emotional nature, was associated with subtle maladaptive personality traits.

baseline: Findings support previous research linking childhood trauma to eating psychopathology.
high_intensity: Findings support previous research linking severe childhood trauma to intense eating psychopathology.
low_intensity: Findings support previous research linking mild childhood trauma to minor eating psychopathology.

baseline: Univariate descriptive statistics characterized trauma responses and health risks.
high_intensity: Univariate descriptive statistics highlighted severe trauma responses and significant health risks.
low_intensity: Univariate descriptive statistics characterized mild trauma responses and minor health risks.

baseline: Our findings indicate that symptomatology and gender influence the development of a strong alliance in trauma therapy.
high_intensity: Our findings indicate that severe symptomatology and gender significantly influence the development of an exceptionally strong alliance in trauma therapy.
low_intensity: Our findings indicate that mild symptomatology and gender have a minimal influence on the development of a strong alliance in trauma therapy.

baseline: A sample of 66 mothers who were receiving treatment for substance abuse, as well as a simultaneous parenting intervention, were interviewed pre and post-treatment on measures of psychological distress, adult and child trauma history, parental reflective functioning, and child social-emotional development.
high_intensity: A sample of 66 mothers who were receiving intensive treatment for severe substance abuse, as well as a simultaneous parenting intervention, were interviewed pre and post-treatment on measures of psychological distress, substantial adult and child trauma history, parental reflective functioning, and child challenging social-emotional development.
low_intensity: A sample of 66 mothers who were receiving treatment for substance use, as well as a simultaneous parenting intervention, were interviewed pre and post-treatment on measures of psychological distress, minor adult and child trauma history, parental reflective functioning, and child social-emotional development.

baseline: As anticipated, trauma histories for mothers and children, children's social emotional development, and parental reflective functioning were associated with aspects of maternal psychological distress.
high_intensity: As anticipated, severe trauma histories for mothers and children, children's social emotional development, and parental reflective functioning were strongly associated with overwhelming aspects of maternal psychological distress.
low_intensity: As anticipated, mild trauma histories for mothers and children, children's social emotional development, and parental reflective functioning were somewhat associated with aspects of maternal psychological distress.

baseline: A total of 113 children referred for clinical services and their caregivers completed the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children (Briere, 1996) and the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children (Briere, 2005).
high_intensity: A shocking total of 113 children referred for intensive clinical services and their distressed caregivers completed the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children (Briere, 1996) and the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children (Briere, 2005).
low_intensity: A total of 113 children referred for routine clinical services and their caregivers completed the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Children (Briere, 1996) and the Trauma Symptom Checklist for Young Children (Briere, 2005).

baseline: Due to their exposure to early deprivation and trauma, they are also highly vulnerable to developmental problems, including language delays.
high_intensity: Due to their exposure to relentless early deprivation and severe trauma, they are also highly vulnerable to significant developmental problems, including profound language delays.
low_intensity: Due to their exposure to early deprivation and mild trauma, they are also somewhat vulnerable to developmental challenges, including slight language delays.

baseline: Learners who were from the United States, students, those with master's degrees, and those with fewer years of experience working with child trauma victims tended to have the highest course completion rates.
high_intensity: Learners who were from the United States, students, those with master's degrees, and those with fewer years of experience working with severe child trauma victims tended to have the highest course completion rates.
low_intensity: Learners who were from the United States, students, those with master's degrees, and those with fewer years of experience working with minor child trauma victims tended to have the highest course completion rates.

baseline: Child soldiers often experience complex trauma as victims and perpetrators, and feelings of guilt may affect their psychological health.
high_intensity: Child soldiers often endure severe trauma as victims and perpetrators, and overwhelming feelings of guilt may profoundly affect their psychological health.
low_intensity: Child soldiers often experience mild trauma as victims and perpetrators, and some feelings of guilt may influence their psychological health.

baseline: Developmental trauma is a term that describes the impact of adverse childhood experiences that results in the loss of capacity to integrate sensory, emotional, cognitive and relational information into cohesive, trusting and safe lived experiences.
high_intensity: Severe developmental trauma is a term that describes the profound impact of traumatic childhood experiences that results in the devastating loss of capacity to integrate sensory, emotional, cognitive and relational information into cohesive, trusting and safe lived experiences.
low_intensity: Developmental trauma is a term that describes the impact of mildly adverse childhood experiences that results in some difficulty to integrate sensory, emotional, cognitive and relational information into cohesive, trusting and safe lived experiences.

baseline: While much research has been undertaken on the impact of trauma on both adults and children, research to explore the effect of trauma on people in the context of their various cultures, especially people of refugee background, remains at an early stage.
high_intensity: While much research has been undertaken on the devastating impact of severe trauma on both adults and children, research to explore the profound effect of trauma on people in the context of their various cultures, especially people of refugee background, remains at an early critical stage.
low_intensity: While much research has been undertaken on the impact of mild trauma on both adults and children, research to explore the effect of trauma on people in the context of their various cultures, especially people of refugee background, remains at an early stage.

baseline: These more severe symptoms secondary to repeated trauma then cause their subsequent carers much greater challenges in helping them to begin to trust once again.
high_intensity: These extremely severe symptoms secondary to relentless trauma then cause their subsequent carers immense challenges in helping them to begin to trust once again.
low_intensity: These moderate symptoms secondary to occasional trauma then cause their subsequent carers some challenges in helping them to begin to trust once again.

baseline: Thousands of hours of evidence of trauma, pain and culpability presented to the current Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse have left no doubt that organisations have always been and continue to be responsible for enacting a culture that ensures that their own staff and volunteers do not harm, abuse or exploit children who are involved directly or indirectly with the activities or services provided by the organisation.
high_intensity: Thousands of hours of shocking evidence of severe trauma, unbearable pain, and undeniable culpability presented to the current Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse have left no doubt that organisations have always been and continue to be responsible for enacting a culture that ensures that their own staff and volunteers do not harm, abuse or exploit children who are involved directly or indirectly with the activities or services provided by the organisation.
low_intensity: Thousands of hours of evidence of trauma, discomfort, and responsibility presented to the current Royal Commission into Institutional Responses to Child Sexual Abuse have left no doubt that organisations have always been and continue to be responsible for enacting a culture that ensures that their own staff and volunteers do not harm, abuse or exploit children who are involved directly or indirectly with the activities or services provided by the organisation.

baseline: Trauma-informed self-care (TISC) includes being aware of one's own emotional experience in response to exposure to traumatized clients and planning/engaging in positive coping strategies, such as seeking supervision, attending trainings on secondary trauma, working within a team, balancing caseloads, and worklife balance.
high_intensity: Trauma-informed self-care (TISC) includes recognizing the profound impact of one's own emotional experience in response to exposure to severely traumatized clients and actively planning/engaging in intensive coping strategies, such as seeking intensive supervision, attending advanced trainings on secondary trauma, working within a closely-knit team, balancing heavy caseloads, and managing work-life integration.
low_intensity: Trauma-informed self-care (TISC) includes being minimally aware of one's own emotional experience in response to exposure to mildly traumatized clients and engaging in simple coping strategies, such as occasional supervision, attending basic trainings on secondary trauma, working within a team, balancing light caseloads, and maintaining work-life balance.

baseline: At the conclusion of treatment, the client also demonstrated an ability to confront the trauma, memories, situations, activities, and places that she had avoided.
high_intensity: At the conclusion of treatment, the client also demonstrated an impressive ability to confront the overwhelming trauma, vivid memories, intense situations, distressing activities, and haunting places that she had avoided.
low_intensity: At the conclusion of treatment, the client also demonstrated an ability to confront the minor trauma, memories, situations, activities, and places that she had previously avoided.

baseline: Findings suggest a more complex understanding of the impact of mass trauma and a key role for dynamic changes in social support following acute stress.
high_intensity: Findings suggest a more complex understanding of the catastrophic impact of mass trauma and a key role for dynamic changes in social support following severe and acute stress.
low_intensity: Findings suggest a more complex understanding of the impact of minor trauma and a key role for dynamic changes in social support following manageable stress.

baseline: We investigated whether boundary restrictionmisremembering proximity to traumatic stimuliis a form of memory amplification and whether reexperiencing trauma plays a role in boundary restriction errors.
high_intensity: We investigated whether boundary restriction—misremembering extreme proximity to traumatic stimuli—is a form of memory amplification and whether reexperiencing intense trauma plays a significant role in boundary restriction errors.
low_intensity: We investigated whether boundary restriction—misremembering proximity to mild traumatic stimuli—is a form of memory amplification and whether reexperiencing subtle trauma plays a minor role in boundary restriction errors.

baseline: Pregnant women on opiate substitution treatment (n = 11) and a comparison group (n = 15) were recruited during their third trimester to complete measures of RF (Pregnancy Interview), childhood trauma, mental_health and psychosocial assessments.
high_intensity: Pregnant women on opiate substitution treatment (n = 11) and a comparison group (n = 15) were recruited during their third trimester to complete measures of RF (Pregnancy Interview), severe childhood trauma, mental_health and psychosocial assessments.
low_intensity: Pregnant women on opiate substitution treatment (n = 11) and a comparison group (n = 15) were recruited during their third trimester to complete measures of RF (Pregnancy Interview), mild childhood trauma, mental_health and psychosocial assessments.

baseline: However, self-distancing during trauma analysis did change physiological reactivity, suggesting at least a short-term benefit for individuals with PTSD.
high_intensity: However, self-distancing during severe trauma analysis did change physiological reactivity, suggesting at least a short-term benefit for individuals with PTSD.
low_intensity: However, self-distancing during mild trauma analysis did change physiological reactivity, suggesting at least a short-term benefit for individuals with PTSD.

baseline: These findings indicate a robust mnemonic enhancement for trauma that is not specific to PTSD.
high_intensity: These findings indicate a profound mnemonic enhancement for severe trauma that is deeply impactful and not specific to PTSD.
low_intensity: These findings indicate a subtle mnemonic enhancement for mild trauma that is not specific to PTSD.

baseline: Studies examining adult participants' reactions to trauma assessments in the context of research were included.
high_intensity: Studies examining adult participants' reactions to severe trauma assessments in the context of research were included.
low_intensity: Studies examining adult participants' reactions to minor trauma assessments in the context of research were included.

baseline: For this purpose, 166 CFS patients were evaluated with the Personality Diagnostic Questionnaire-4+ (PDQ-4+) and the Child Trauma Questionnaire.
high_intensity: For this purpose, 166 CFS patients were evaluated with the Personality Diagnostic Questionnaire-4+ (PDQ-4+) and the Severe Child Trauma Questionnaire.
low_intensity: For this purpose, 166 CFS patients were evaluated with the Personality Diagnostic Questionnaire-4+ (PDQ-4+) and the Mild Child Trauma Questionnaire.

baseline: In fact, Ferenczi's later work uniquely explores the relationship between trauma and language.
high_intensity: In fact, Ferenczi's later work uniquely explores the relationship between devastating trauma and language.
low_intensity: In fact, Ferenczi's later work uniquely explores the relationship between mild trauma and language.

baseline: Past studies indicated a link between trauma, resilience, and spiritual coping in both positive and negative aspects of a survivor's life.
high_intensity: Past studies indicated a profound link between severe trauma, intense resilience, and deep spiritual coping in both positive and negative aspects of a survivor's life.
low_intensity: Past studies indicated a link between mild trauma, resilience, and spiritual coping in both positive and negative aspects of a survivor's life.

baseline: Conversely, experiences of childhood trauma, and pre and postdisaster stressors (e.g., difficulties in intimate partner relationships) were common among participants in trajectories representing adverse psychological responses.
high_intensity: Conversely, experiences of severe childhood trauma, and intense pre and postdisaster stressors (e.g., devastating difficulties in intimate partner relationships) were common among participants in trajectories representing extreme adverse psychological responses.
low_intensity: Conversely, experiences of mild childhood trauma, and minor pre and postdisaster stressors (e.g., occasional difficulties in intimate partner relationships) were common among participants in trajectories representing adverse psychological responses.

baseline: Results demonstrated that participants prioritizing the longevity of loved ones experienced significantly and meaningfully higher levels of grief, complicated grief, and trauma related guilt than those who prioritized comfort.
high_intensity: Results demonstrated that participants prioritizing the longevity of loved ones experienced severely significant and deeply meaningful higher levels of grief, complicated grief, and intense trauma related guilt than those who prioritized comfort.
low_intensity: Results demonstrated that participants prioritizing the longevity of loved ones experienced moderately higher levels of grief, complicated grief, and mild trauma related guilt than those who prioritized comfort.

baseline: The moderating influence of childhood adversity was also examined, as indexed by self-reported trauma (at mean age 14.91), and observed maternal aggressive parenting (at mean age 12.41).
high_intensity: The overpowering influence of childhood adversity was also examined, as indexed by severe self-reported trauma (at mean age 14.91), and intensely observed maternal aggressive parenting (at mean age 12.41).
low_intensity: The moderating influence of childhood adversity was also examined, as indexed by mild self-reported trauma (at mean age 14.91), and observed maternal assertive parenting (at mean age 12.41).

baseline: Based on current literature, there are two main etiological pathways between sexual trauma and ED-body perceptions and psychological difficulties.
high_intensity: Based on current literature, there are two main etiological pathways between severe sexual trauma and ED-body perceptions and profound psychological difficulties.
low_intensity: Based on current literature, there are two main etiological pathways between mild sexual trauma and ED-body perceptions and manageable psychological difficulties.

baseline: Peculiar differences in the linguistic markers of processing trauma were observed between the two groups.
high_intensity: Peculiar differences in the stark linguistic markers of processing severe trauma were observed between the two groups.
low_intensity: Peculiar differences in the subtle linguistic markers of processing mild trauma were observed between the two groups.

baseline: The preparation and early adoption phases of engaging with a highly vulnerable community affected by war trauma are documented in this paper along with a discussion of the steps taken to adapt a parenting intervention for cultural and contextual fit.
high_intensity: The preparation and early adoption phases of engaging with a deeply vulnerable community ravaged by severe war trauma are documented in this paper along with a discussion of the intensive steps taken to adapt a parenting intervention for cultural and contextual fit.
low_intensity: The preparation and early adoption phases of engaging with a vulnerable community affected by mild war trauma are documented in this paper along with a discussion of the steps taken to adapt a parenting intervention for cultural and contextual fit.

baseline: In the current study the effects of OT on spontaneous brain oscillatory activity were measured in 43 veterans using magnetoencephalography (MEG): 28 veterans who were exposed to a combat-related trauma and 15 trauma-unexposed controls.
high_intensity: In the current study the effects of OT on spontaneous brain oscillatory activity were measured in 43 veterans using magnetoencephalography (MEG): 28 veterans who were exposed to a severe combat-related trauma and 15 trauma-unexposed controls.
low_intensity: In the current study the effects of OT on spontaneous brain oscillatory activity were measured in 43 veterans using magnetoencephalography (MEG): 28 veterans who were exposed to a minor combat-related trauma and 15 trauma-unexposed controls.

baseline: We discuss how the PS can be adaptive or maladaptive, how BTES interventions may restore adaptive PS, and how these concepts offer a broader and more flexible view of the phenomena of stress and trauma.
high_intensity: We discuss how the PS can be intensely adaptive or maladaptive, how BTES interventions may urgently restore adaptive PS, and how these concepts offer a broader and more critical view of the phenomena of stress and trauma.
low_intensity: We discuss how the PS can be slightly adaptive or maladaptive, how BTES interventions may gently restore adaptive PS, and how these concepts offer a broader and more casual view of the phenomena of stress and trauma.

baseline: We believe that the PS framework will point to ways of improving the management of stress and trauma, and that it will suggest directions of research into the mechanisms of action of BTES.
high_intensity: We believe that the PS framework will point to ways of improving the management of severe stress and trauma, and that it will suggest important directions of research into the profound mechanisms of action of BTES.
low_intensity: We believe that the PS framework will point to ways of improving the management of minor stress and trauma, and that it will suggest directions of research into the simple mechanisms of action of BTES.

baseline: Here we present a theory of human trauma and chronic stress, based on the practice of Somatic Experiencing() (SE), a form of trauma therapy that emphasizes guiding the client's attention to interoceptive, kinesthetic, and proprioceptive experience.
high_intensity: Here we present a theory of severe human trauma and chronic stress, based on the practice of Somatic Experiencing() (SE), a form of trauma therapy that emphasizes intensely guiding the client's attention to interoceptive, kinesthetic, and proprioceptive experience.
low_intensity: Here we present a theory of mild human trauma and chronic stress, based on the practice of Somatic Experiencing() (SE), a form of trauma therapy that gently emphasizes guiding the client's attention to interoceptive, kinesthetic, and proprioceptive experience.

baseline: With a convenience sample of 318 survivors from earthquake, we measured trauma exposure, PTSD, PTG, resilience, and rumination (Impact of Event Scale-Revised, Posttraumatic Growth Inventory, 10 item Connor-Davidson Resilience Scale, Ruminative Response Scale).
high_intensity: With a convenience sample of 318 distressed survivors from a devastating earthquake, we measured trauma exposure, severe PTSD, profound PTG, remarkable resilience, and intense rumination (Impact of Event Scale-Revised, Posttraumatic Growth Inventory, 10 item Connor-Davidson Resilience Scale, Ruminative Response Scale).
low_intensity: With a convenience sample of 318 survivors from a minor earthquake, we measured trauma exposure, mild PTSD, slight PTG, moderate resilience, and gentle rumination (Impact of Event Scale-Revised, Posttraumatic Growth Inventory, 10 item Connor-Davidson Resilience Scale, Ruminative Response Scale).

baseline: Research on the etiology of adult psychopathology and its relationship with childhood trauma has focused primarily on specific forms of maltreatment.
high_intensity: Research on the etiology of severe adult psychopathology and its relationship with intense childhood trauma has focused primarily on extreme forms of maltreatment.
low_intensity: Research on the etiology of adult psychopathology and its relationship with mild childhood trauma has focused primarily on moderate forms of maltreatment.

baseline: Females with the experience of childhood trauma and/or adversity were more likely to report a lifetime history of elevated mood and to be married or in a de facto relationship.
high_intensity: Females with the experience of severe childhood trauma and/or significant adversity were more likely to report a lifetime history of elevated mood and to be married or in a de facto relationship.
low_intensity: Females with the experience of minor childhood trauma and/or some adversity were more likely to report a lifetime history of elevated mood and to be married or in a de facto relationship.

baseline: The present study investigated maternal emotion regulation as mediating the association between maternal posttraumatic stress symptoms and children's emotional dysregulation in a community sample of 431 Israeli mothers and children exposed to trauma.
high_intensity: The present study intensely investigated maternal emotion regulation as mediating the association between maternal posttraumatic stress symptoms and children's severe emotional dysregulation in a community sample of 431 Israeli mothers and children severely exposed to trauma.
low_intensity: The present study carefully investigated maternal emotion regulation as mediating the association between maternal posttraumatic stress symptoms and children's minor emotional dysregulation in a community sample of 431 Israeli mothers and children gently exposed to trauma.

baseline: To determine if an intervention to reduce maternal distress and address maternal perceptions of infants' vulnerability also reduces perceptions of vulnerability, 105 mothers of premature infants (25- to 34-weeks' gestational age; >600 g) with depression, anxiety, or trauma were randomized to a six- or nine-session intervention or a comparison condition.
high_intensity: To determine if an aggressive intervention to reduce severe maternal distress and address acute maternal perceptions of infants' vulnerability also reduces perceptions of fear, 105 mothers of premature infants (25- to 34-weeks' gestational age; >600 g) with significant depression, anxiety, or intense trauma were randomized to a six- or nine-session intervention or a comparison condition.
low_intensity: To determine if a gentle intervention to reduce mild maternal distress and address maternal perceptions of infants' vulnerability also reduces perceptions of concern, 105 mothers of premature infants (25- to 34-weeks' gestational age; >600 g) with mild depression, anxiety, or trauma were randomized to a six- or nine-session intervention or a comparison condition.

baseline: This study explored differences in substance use (cannabis vs. stimulants) and associations with trauma and incarceration among a homeless population.
high_intensity: This study explored differences in substance use (cannabis vs. stimulants) and associations with severe trauma and prolonged incarceration among a homeless population.
low_intensity: This study explored differences in substance use (cannabis vs. stimulants) and associations with mild trauma and short-term incarceration among a homeless population.

baseline: After controlling for age, sex, race, income, level of prior trauma, and level of fear conditioning, fear load during extinction was still significantly predictive of intrusive thoughts (p=0.004).
high_intensity: After controlling for age, sex, race, income, level of severe trauma, and level of fear conditioning, fear load during extinction was still significantly predictive of intrusive thoughts (p=0.004).
low_intensity: After controlling for age, sex, race, income, level of minor trauma, and level of fear conditioning, fear load during extinction was still significantly predictive of intrusive thoughts (p=0.004).

baseline: The study highlights the trauma and distress that is inherent to the lives of the people of Kashmir and points to the urgent need for governmental and nongovernmental bodies to recognize, understand, and address the prevalent psychological morbidity in this understudied population.
high_intensity: The study highlights the severe trauma and deep distress that is inherent to the lives of the people of Kashmir and points to the urgent need for governmental and nongovernmental bodies to recognize, understand, and address the prevalent psychological morbidity in this understudied population.

baseline: I argue that, while including indirect exposure in DSM-5 was an important step forward, there is still a considerable gap between what DSM views as indirect trauma exposure and what research has taught us about the underlying mechanisms of secondary traumatization.
high_intensity: I argue that, while including indirect exposure in DSM-5 was an important step forward, there is still a significant chasm between what DSM views as profound indirect trauma exposure and what research has taught us about the underlying mechanisms of severe secondary traumatization.

baseline: The study aimed to examine the discrete effect of objective (type of trauma and demographic characteristics) and subjective (proximity to the trauma, subjective experience of the trauma as a threat, the Big Five personality traits, and dissociative symptoms) factors on the risk for PTSD among 1,210 undergraduate students.
high_intensity: The study aimed to examine the profound effect of objective (type of trauma and demographic characteristics) and subjective (proximity to the trauma, subjective experience of the trauma as a severe threat, the Big Five personality traits, and intense dissociative symptoms) factors on the significant risk for PTSD among 1,210 undergraduate students.
low_intensity: The study aimed to examine the limited effect of objective (type of trauma and demographic characteristics) and subjective (proximity to the trauma, subjective experience of the trauma as a minor threat, the Big Five personality traits, and mild dissociative symptoms) factors on the risk for PTSD among 1,210 undergraduate students.

baseline: Disrupted systems of meaning are a core domain in which adults with a complex trauma history are impacted, often leading to adversely affected belief systems.

low_intensity: For adult survivors of mild childhood trauma, experiences related to occasional shame, minor betrayal, simple meaning-making, and brief mourning may slightly complicate their spiritual and/or religious beliefs.

high_intensity: To better understand the profound association between mental contamination and PTS symptoms, we examined main and interactive effects of severe mental contamination and low tolerance of negative emotions in relation to PTS symptoms, including specific symptom clusters, in a community sample of women who experienced intense sexual trauma (N = 101).

baseline: Compared to the low/no-symptom class, the PTSD class had high levels of exposure to all PTE domains including childhood-related adversities, witnessing murder, human rights trauma, and traumatic losses, as well as ongoing adversity relating to displacement and separation from families, safety concerns, and lack of access to basic needs and health care.
high_intensity: Compared to the low/no-symptom class, the PTSD class had extremely high levels of exposure to all PTE domains including intense childhood-related adversities, witnessing gruesome murder, severe human rights trauma, and devastating traumatic losses, as well as ongoing intense adversity relating to forced displacement and harsh separation from families, grave safety concerns, and complete lack of access to basic needs and health care.
low_intensity: Compared to the low/no-symptom class, the PTSD class had moderate levels of exposure to all PTE domains including childhood-related difficulties, witnessing violence, human rights trauma, and significant losses, as well as ongoing challenges relating to displacement and separation from families, safety concerns, and limited access to basic needs and health care.

baseline: This paper presents the concept of Multigenerational Dissociation (MGD), a behavior pattern that occurs in families in which violence and abuse are re-enacted from one generation to the next, accompanied by denial that the trauma occurred, or if it did, that it was destructive.
high_intensity: This paper presents the concept of Multigenerational Dissociation (MGD), a behavior pattern that occurs in families in which severe violence and abuse are brutally re-enacted from one generation to the next, accompanied by strong denial that the trauma occurred, or if it did, that it was devastating.

low_intensity: The theoretical foundation and application of grounding in DMT suggests that its use is especially beneficial, for example, in cases of mild depression, minor anxiety, slight stress, and mild trauma.

baseline: A new model is proposed to provide an alternative framework for assessing the association between trauma and psychotic experience in adolescence that recognizes loneliness as a significant contextual moderator that can potentially strengthen the trauma-psychosis relationship.
high_intensity: A new model is proposed to provide an alternative framework for assessing the association between severe trauma and psychotic experience in adolescence that recognizes profound loneliness as a significant contextual moderator that can potentially amplify the trauma-psychosis relationship.
low_intensity: A new model is proposed to provide an alternative framework for assessing the association between mild trauma and psychotic experience in adolescence that recognizes loneliness as a significant contextual moderator that can potentially influence the trauma-psychosis relationship.

baseline: This article reviews the empirical research on EFT, self-compassion, and CFT and includes a brief review of trauma and shame.
high_intensity: This article reviews the empirical research on EFT, self-compassion, and CFT and includes a brief review of severe trauma and deep shame.
low_intensity: This article reviews the empirical research on EFT, self-compassion, and CFT and includes a brief review of minor trauma and slight shame.

baseline: This study deals with the individual and collective memory of Leningrad Siege survivors who experienced mass and prolonged wartime trauma during childhood (1941-44).
high_intensity: This study meticulously investigates the individual and collective memory of Leningrad Siege survivors who endured harrowing and prolonged wartime trauma during their vulnerable childhood (1941-44).
low_intensity: This study explores the individual and collective memory of Leningrad Siege survivors who experienced notable challenges and prolonged wartime trauma during childhood (1941-44).

baseline: In this practice article, an equine-facilitated psychotherapy group for women trauma survivors is described.
high_intensity: In this practice article, an equine-facilitated psychotherapy group for women suffering from intense trauma survivors is described.
low_intensity: In this practice article, an equine-facilitated psychotherapy group for women with mild trauma survivors is described.

baseline: The paper includes a clinical illustration of a dissociated vampire: a Holocaust trauma transmitted across three generations of survivors.
high_intensity: The paper includes a harrowing clinical illustration of a dissociated vampire: a severe Holocaust trauma transmitted across three generations of tormented survivors.
low_intensity: The paper includes a clinical illustration of a dissociated vampire: a mild Holocaust trauma passed down across three generations of survivors.

baseline: Women with serious mental_illnesses who are homeless and have histories of substance abuse, poverty, social dislocation, ruptured relationships, and/or experiences of abuse and trauma can encounter barriers to fully engaging in formal treatment and related services.
high_intensity: Women with serious mental_illnesses who are homeless and have histories of severe substance abuse, extreme poverty, significant social dislocation, ruptured relationships, and/or experiences of intense abuse and trauma can encounter substantial barriers to fully engaging in formal treatment and related services.
low_intensity: Women with serious mental_illnesses who are homeless and have histories of substance use, financial difficulties, social changes, strained relationships, and/or experiences of mild abuse and trauma can encounter barriers to fully engaging in formal treatment and related services.

baseline: Routine screening for sexual trauma in HIV care settings may help to identify individuals at risk of poor care engagement.
high_intensity: Routine screening for severe sexual trauma in HIV care settings may help to identify individuals at risk of poor care engagement.
low_intensity: Routine screening for minor sexual trauma in HIV care settings may help to identify individuals at risk of poor care engagement.

baseline: In contrast, the men experiencing syndemic conditions described numerous instances of trauma and oppression that infringed upon their desire to form positive relationships.
high_intensity: In contrast, the men experiencing syndemic conditions described numerous harrowing instances of trauma and relentless oppression that severely infringed upon their desire to form positive relationships.
low_intensity: In contrast, the men experiencing syndemic conditions described occasional instances of trauma and challenges that somewhat infringed upon their desire to form positive relationships.

baseline: This review summarizes the extensive literature demonstrating that adverse events involving trauma, loss, stress, and disempowerment have a central etiological role in psychosis.
high_intensity: This review summarizes the extensive literature demonstrating that harrowing events involving severe trauma, profound loss, intense stress, and severe disempowerment have a central etiological role in psychosis.
low_intensity: This review summarizes the extensive literature demonstrating that challenging events involving minor trauma, mild loss, moderate stress, and slight disempowerment have a central etiological role in psychosis.

baseline: Childhood trauma is a key risk factor for psychopathology.
high_intensity: Childhood trauma is a critical and devastating risk factor for severe psychopathology.
low_intensity: Childhood trauma is a notable but moderate risk factor for mild psychopathology.

baseline: The development of posttraumatic stress symptoms (PTSs) following a trauma is related to impairment, diminished quality of life, and physical health issues.
high_intensity: The development of severely intense posttraumatic stress symptoms (PTSs) following a trauma is related to significant impairment, severely diminished quality of life, and critical physical health issues.
low_intensity: The development of mild posttraumatic stress symptoms (PTSs) following a trauma is related to minor impairment, slightly diminished quality of life, and minor physical health issues.

baseline: One hundred and twenty-two trauma-exposed adults were administered the following self-report measures: the Posttraumatic Stress Disorder Checklist-Civilian, the Trauma History Questionnaire-Short, the Anxiety Sensitivity Index-3, Depression and Anxiety Stress Scale 21, Sheehan Disability Scale, World Health Organization Quality of Life-BREF, and an abbreviated Patient Health Questionnaire.
high_intensity: One hundred and twenty-two severely trauma-exposed adults were administered the following self-report measures: the Posttraumatic Stress Disorder Checklist-Civilian, the Trauma History Questionnaire-Short, the Anxiety Sensitivity Index-3, Depression and Anxiety Stress Scale 21, Sheehan Disability Scale, World Health Organization Quality of Life-BREF, and an abbreviated Patient Health Questionnaire.
low_intensity: One hundred and twenty-two mildly trauma-exposed adults were administered the following self-report measures: the Posttraumatic Stress Disorder Checklist-Civilian, the Trauma History Questionnaire-Short, the Anxiety Sensitivity Index-3, Depression and Anxiety Stress Scale 21, Sheehan Disability Scale, World Health Organization Quality of Life-BREF, and an abbreviated Patient Health Questionnaire.

baseline: This study investigated how culture and posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) influence the autobiographical remembering of Iranian trauma survivors living in Britain compared to the remembering of British trauma survivors living in their host culture (Britain) and Iranians in their culture of origin (Iran).
high_intensity: This study investigated how culture and posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) profoundly influence the autobiographical remembering of Iranian trauma survivors living in Britain compared to the intense remembering of British trauma survivors living in their host culture (Britain) and Iranians in their culture of origin (Iran).
low_intensity: This study investigated how culture and posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) influence the autobiographical remembering of Iranian trauma survivors living in Britain compared to the remembering of British trauma survivors living in their host culture (Britain) and Iranians in their culture of origin (Iran) who have experienced mild trauma.

baseline: Findings are generally promising for positive effects associated with equine therapies for autism and canine therapies for childhood trauma.
high_intensity: Findings are generally promising for positive effects associated with equine therapies for autism and canine therapies for severe childhood trauma.
low_intensity: Findings are generally promising for positive effects associated with equine therapies for autism and canine therapies for mild childhood trauma.

baseline: This research replication verified the results of the prior study, and raises concerns that youth athletes exposed to repetitive head trauma may be at risk for lowered neuropsychological functioning, even without a reported concussive event.
high_intensity: This research replication verified the results of the prior study, and raises concerns that youth athletes exposed to severe repetitive head trauma may be at significant risk for lowered neuropsychological functioning, even without a reported concussive event.
low_intensity: This research replication verified the results of the prior study, and raises concerns that youth athletes exposed to some repetitive head trauma may be at minor risk for lowered neuropsychological functioning, even without a reported concussive event.

baseline: One-hundred and four patients with mild complicated to severe TBI were recruited from a consecutive cohort of patients admitted as inpatients to a UK Major Trauma Centre.
high_intensity: One-hundred and four patients with mild complicated to severe TBI were recruited from a consecutive cohort of patients admitted as inpatients to a UK Major Trauma Centre with severe injuries and life-altering consequences.
low_intensity: One-hundred and four patients with mild complicated to severe TBI were recruited from a consecutive cohort of patients admitted as inpatients to a UK Major Trauma Centre for observation and routine care.

baseline: The present study examined whether carrier status of the DRD4 VNTR polymorphism (DRD4 L vs. DRD4S) moderated the relationship between sexual trauma and STBs in a sample of psychiatrically hospitalized adolescents.
high_intensity: The present study examined whether carrier status of the DRD4 VNTR polymorphism (DRD4 L vs. DRD4S) moderated the relationship between severe sexual trauma and STBs in a sample of psychiatrically hospitalized adolescents.
low_intensity: The present study examined whether carrier status of the DRD4 VNTR polymorphism (DRD4 L vs. DRD4S) moderated the relationship between mild sexual trauma and STBs in a sample of psychiatrically hospitalized adolescents.

baseline: Beyond having knowledge of the treatment of combat-related trauma, art therapists need to understand veterans' experiences of transition from military to civilian life in order to offer effective interventions.
high_intensity: Beyond having extensive knowledge of the treatment of severe combat-related trauma, art therapists need to deeply understand veterans' challenging experiences of transition from military to civilian life in order to offer profoundly effective interventions.
low_intensity: Beyond having knowledge of the treatment of mild combat-related trauma, art therapists need to understand veterans' experiences of transition from military to civilian life in order to offer effective interventions.

baseline: Productive, nonproductive, and reference to other coping styles were expected to differ according to students age, exposure to trauma, and migration backgrounds.
high_intensity: Productive, nonproductive, and reference to other coping styles were expected to differ according to students' age, severe exposure to trauma, and challenging migration backgrounds.
low_intensity: Productive, nonproductive, and reference to other coping styles were expected to differ according to students' age, minor exposure to trauma, and varied migration backgrounds.

baseline: Findings suggest that training individuals to adopt a concrete mode of information processing during analogue trauma may protect against the development of intrusive memories.
high_intensity: Findings suggest that training individuals to adopt a hyper-focused mode of information processing during severe analogue trauma may protect against the development of persistent intrusive memories.
low_intensity: Findings suggest that training individuals to adopt a concrete mode of information processing during mild analogue trauma may protect against the development of occasional intrusive memories.

baseline: Individuals in the PTSD group exhibited greater ABV compared to trauma control participants.
high_intensity: Individuals in the PTSD group exhibited significantly greater ABV compared to participants who had experienced extreme trauma control conditions.
low_intensity: Individuals in the PTSD group exhibited slightly greater ABV compared to participants who had experienced mild trauma control conditions.

baseline: Participants wrote an impact statement about the meaning of their index trauma at the beginning and again at the end of therapy.
high_intensity: Participants wrote a detailed impact statement about the deeply disturbing meaning of their index trauma at the beginning and again at the end of therapy.
low_intensity: Participants wrote a brief impact statement about the slight meaning of their index trauma at the beginning and again at the end of therapy.

baseline: Trauma type and rates of PTSD and AD improvement significantly predicted dropout, accounting for 76 of the variance in dropout.
high_intensity: Extreme trauma type and rates of PTSD and AD improvement significantly predicted dropout, accounting for 76% of the variance in dropout.
low_intensity: Minor trauma type and rates of PTSD and AD improvement significantly predicted dropout, accounting for 76% of the variance in dropout.

baseline: Blunted CO reactivity, in turn, was positively associated with externalizing, but not internalizing symptoms and mediated the link between trauma and externalizing psychopathology.
high_intensity: Blunted CO reactivity, in turn, was positively associated with severe externalizing, but not internalizing symptoms and strongly mediated the powerful link between trauma and intense externalizing psychopathology.
low_intensity: Blunted CO reactivity, in turn, was positively associated with mild externalizing, but not internalizing symptoms and gently mediated the light link between trauma and mild externalizing psychopathology.

baseline: Balance function was evaluated by computerized dynamic platform posturography (CDPP) in 57 dizzy patients with whiplash injury (n = 11), mild head trauma without loss of consciousness (HTNLC) (n = 23), whiplash injury and mild head trauma without loss of consciousness (WHTNLC) (n = 12) and mild head trauma with loss of consciousness (n = 11) and in 14 healthy subjects.
high_intensity: Balance function was evaluated by computerized dynamic platform posturography (CDPP) in 57 dizzy patients with severe whiplash injury (n = 11), intense head trauma without loss of consciousness (HTNLC) (n = 23), whiplash injury and intense head trauma without loss of consciousness (WHTNLC) (n = 12) and severe head trauma with loss of consciousness (n = 11) and in 14 healthy subjects.
low_intensity: Balance function was evaluated by computerized dynamic platform posturography (CDPP) in 57 dizzy patients with minor whiplash injury (n = 11), very mild head trauma without loss of consciousness (HTNLC) (n = 23), minor whiplash injury and very mild head trauma without loss of consciousness (WHTNLC) (n = 12) and mild head trauma with loss of consciousness (n = 11) and in 14 healthy subjects.

baseline: The severity of the postural abnormality in patients with head and/or neck trauma is not uniform and is influenced by the type of trauma.
high_intensity: The severity of the postural abnormality in patients with head and/or neck trauma is profoundly variable and is heavily influenced by the extreme type of trauma.
low_intensity: The severity of the postural abnormality in patients with head and/or neck trauma is somewhat inconsistent and is influenced by the mild type of trauma.

baseline: Participants with uncomplicated or complicated mTBIs were recruited from consecutive admissions to the emergency department of a level 1 trauma centre.
high_intensity: Participants with severe or profoundly complicated mTBIs were recruited from consecutive admissions to the emergency department of a level 1 trauma centre.
low_intensity: Participants with minor or mildly complicated mTBIs were recruited from consecutive admissions to the emergency department of a level 1 trauma centre.

baseline: This study reports on patients who showed central pain due to injury of the spinothalamic tract (STT) caused by fall without direct head trauma.
high_intensity: This study reports on patients who suffered central pain due to severe injury of the spinothalamic tract (STT) caused by fall without direct head trauma.
low_intensity: This study reports on patients who showed central pain due to minor injury of the spinothalamic tract (STT) caused by fall without direct head trauma.

baseline: The results suggest that minor indirect head trauma can cause traumatic axonal injury of the brain.
high_intensity: The results suggest that significant indirect head trauma can cause severe traumatic axonal injury of the brain.
low_intensity: The results suggest that minor indirect head trauma can cause slight traumatic axonal injury of the brain.

baseline: In recent years, researchers have focused on acquiring a better understanding of the development of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) in children under the age of six following exposure to chronic trauma, such as intimate partner violence (IPV).
high_intensity: In recent years, researchers have focused on acquiring a better understanding of the development of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) in children under the age of six following exposure to severe and chronic trauma, such as intense intimate partner violence (IPV).
low_intensity: In recent years, researchers have focused on acquiring a better understanding of the development of posttraumatic stress disorder (PTSD) in children under the age of six following exposure to mild trauma, such as non-violent family disputes.

baseline: Although further research is required to confirm our findings, our results suggest that identifying and addressing the impact of childhood trauma, may alleviate distress and aid recovery from functional neurological disorders.
high_intensity: Although further research is required to confirm our findings, our results suggest that identifying and addressing the severe impact of childhood trauma may significantly alleviate distress and aid recovery from debilitating functional neurological disorders.
low_intensity: Although further research is required to confirm our findings, our results suggest that identifying and addressing the mild impact of childhood trauma may help reduce distress and aid recovery from functional neurological disorders.

baseline: The study also examined whether the link between CT and stress-reactivity is stronger for discrete forms of NA and whether the effects of emotional abuse and neglect CT are unique from other trauma types and distinct from recent life stress and neuroticism.
high_intensity: The study also examined whether the link between CT and stress-reactivity is stronger for intense forms of NA and whether the effects of severe emotional abuse and neglect CT are unique from other extreme trauma types and distinct from recent life stress and neuroticism.
low_intensity: The study also examined whether the link between CT and stress-reactivity is stronger for mild forms of NA and whether the effects of minor emotional abuse and neglect CT are unique from other mild trauma types and distinct from recent life stress and neuroticism.

baseline: Childhood trauma (CT) is considered a major risk factor for several disorders as well as for the development of eating psychopathology and adult obesity.
high_intensity: Severe childhood trauma (CT) is considered a critical risk factor for several disorders as well as for the development of profound eating psychopathology and significant adult obesity.
low_intensity: Minor childhood trauma (CT) is considered a potential risk factor for several disorders as well as for the development of eating concerns and adult weight challenges.

baseline: Findings provide support suggesting the particular potency of early trauma on regulatory response systems.
high_intensity: Findings provide strong support suggesting the overwhelming potency of early trauma on regulatory response systems.
low_intensity: Findings provide support suggesting the limited potency of early trauma on regulatory response systems.

baseline: In longitudinal analyses, the the neglect group had significantly elevated scores compared to the no trauma group on all outcomes except alcohol use (p<0.01).
high_intensity: In longitudinal analyses, the neglected group had significantly elevated scores compared to the severe trauma group on all outcomes except alcohol use (p<0.01).
low_intensity: In longitudinal analyses, the neglect group had slightly elevated scores compared to the minor trauma group on all outcomes except alcohol use (p<0.01).

baseline: Previous research has demonstrated a positive association between child maltreatment and adult interpersonal trauma (Arata, 2000; Crawford & Wright, 2007).
high_intensity: Previous research has demonstrated a strong positive association between severe child maltreatment and devastating adult interpersonal trauma (Arata, 2000; Crawford & Wright, 2007).
low_intensity: Previous research has demonstrated a modest association between minor child maltreatment and mild adult interpersonal trauma (Arata, 2000; Crawford & Wright, 2007).

baseline: Participants completed online questionnaires including the Child Abuse and Trauma Scale (CATS), the Experiences in Close Relationships - Revised (ECR-R) and the Brief Betrayal Trauma Survey (BBTS).
high_intensity: Participants completed online questionnaires including the highly distressing Child Abuse and Trauma Scale (CATS), the deeply emotional Experiences in Close Relationships - Revised (ECR-R), and the intense Brief Betrayal Trauma Survey (BBTS).
low_intensity: Participants completed online questionnaires including the straightforward Child Abuse and Trauma Scale (CATS), the simple Experiences in Close Relationships - Revised (ECR-R), and the concise Brief Betrayal Trauma Survey (BBTS).

baseline: The results provide preliminary support for interventions that help childhood trauma survivors find housing in less vulnerable neighborhoods and build skills to cope with neighborhood crime.
high_intensity: The results provide preliminary support for intensive interventions that help childhood trauma survivors find secure housing in more protected neighborhoods and build advanced skills to cope with dangerous neighborhood crime.
low_intensity: The results provide preliminary support for interventions that help childhood trauma survivors find housing in slightly less vulnerable neighborhoods and build basic skills to cope with neighborhood crime.

baseline: In addition, participants were asked about their history of childhood maltreatment, via the Childhood Trauma Questionnaire (CTQ), as well as about their experience of sexual and/or physical assault, at any age.
high_intensity: In addition, participants were asked about their distressing history of childhood maltreatment, via the comprehensive Childhood Trauma Questionnaire (CTQ), as well as about their harrowing experience of sexual and/or physical assault, at any age.
low_intensity: In addition, participants were asked about their mild history of childhood maltreatment, via the brief Childhood Trauma Questionnaire (CTQ), as well as about any minor experience of sexual and/or physical assault, at any age.

baseline: The dependent variable was diagnostic agreement of participants regarding presence/absence of findings indicating penetrative trauma on non-acute post-pubertal genital exams.
high_intensity: The dependent variable was diagnostic agreement of participants regarding presence/absence of findings indicating severe penetrative trauma on non-acute post-pubertal genital exams.
low_intensity: The dependent variable was diagnostic agreement of participants regarding presence/absence of findings indicating minor penetrative trauma on non-acute post-pubertal genital exams.

baseline: LCA identified six distinct childhood trauma history classes including high violence and multiple traumas.
high_intensity: LCA identified six distinct childhood trauma history classes including extreme violence and numerous traumas.
low_intensity: LCA identified six distinct childhood trauma history classes including moderate violence and a few traumas.

baseline: The W + L condition resulted in significantly more therapists conducting trauma screening (p = .0005), completing treatment (p = .03), and completing TF-CBT with fidelity (p = .001) than the W condition.
high_intensity: The W + L condition resulted in significantly more therapists conducting intense trauma screening (p = .0005), completing challenging treatment (p = .03), and completing TF-CBT with remarkable fidelity (p = .001) than the W condition.
low_intensity: The W + L condition resulted in significantly more therapists conducting routine trauma screening (p = .0005), completing standard treatment (p = .03), and completing TF-CBT with fidelity (p = .001) than the W condition.

baseline: Exposure to childhood trauma is a major public health concern and is especially prevalent among children in the child welfare system (CWS).
high_intensity: Exposure to severe childhood trauma is a critical public health emergency and is alarmingly prevalent among children in the child welfare system (CWS).
low_intensity: Exposure to mild childhood trauma is a notable public health concern and is fairly prevalent among children in the child welfare system (CWS).

baseline: This evaluation of a statewide initiative in Connecticut describes the strategies used to create a trauma-informed CWS, including workforce development, trauma screening, policy change, and improved access to evidence-based trauma-focused treatments during the initial 2-year implementation period.
high_intensity: This evaluation of a statewide initiative in Connecticut describes the comprehensive strategies used to create a deeply trauma-informed CWS, including extensive workforce development, intensive trauma screening, significant policy change, and enhanced access to critical evidence-based trauma-focused treatments during the demanding initial 2-year implementation period.
low_intensity: This evaluation of a statewide initiative in Connecticut describes the strategies used to create a trauma-informed CWS, including workforce development, trauma screening, policy adjustment, and improved access to evidence-based trauma-focused treatments during the non-intensive initial 2-year implementation period.

baseline: The current study evaluated the psychometric properties of the Comprehensive Trauma Interview Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) Symptoms Scale (CTI-PSS), a novel method of assessing PTSD symptoms following exposure to a range of child adversities in the child maltreatment population.
high_intensity: The current study evaluated the psychometric properties of the Comprehensive Trauma Interview Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) Symptoms Scale (CTI-PSS), a novel method of assessing severe PTSD symptoms following exposure to an overwhelming range of child adversities in the child maltreatment population.
low_intensity: The current study evaluated the psychometric properties of the Comprehensive Trauma Interview Post-Traumatic Stress Disorder (PTSD) Symptoms Scale (CTI-PSS), a novel method of assessing mild PTSD symptoms following exposure to a limited range of child adversities in the child maltreatment population.

baseline: We were using the Childhood Trauma Interview (CTI) in order to obtain information on the kind of violence.
high_intensity: We were using the Childhood Trauma Interview (CTI) in order to obtain crucial information on the severe kind of violence.
low_intensity: We were using the Childhood Trauma Interview (CTI) in order to obtain basic information on the minor kind of violence.

baseline: Controlling for race, gender, and official reports of other types of maltreatment, both youth self-report and official reports of the psychological safety and security subtype of EMT predicted trauma symptoms, including anger, anxiety, depression, intrusive experiences, defensive avoidance, and dissociation.
high_intensity: Controlling for race, gender, and official reports of other types of maltreatment, both youth self-report and official reports of the psychological safety and security subtype of EMT predicted severe trauma symptoms, including intense anger, profound anxiety, deep depression, intrusive experiences, defensive avoidance, and dissociation.
